reviews.text: This place is SICK! They allowed people to eat at their restaurant doing the NAZI salute! And when asked about it they had no answer!<br><br>And on top of that we found a bug in our food!<br><br>Don&#39;t patronize this place!!

I use to live this place, we&#39;d go there for any reason and I was so sad if they would go out of business for this situation but the first and last time I tried to get take out, to have a nice meal and support my favorite restaurant where has given us a lot of good memories,  we ended up with two meals, too old! Maybe from last week! And I can&#39;t even think about give it another try. <br>I&#39;m so sorry!

I used to love this location!  <br><br>SOOO 1) I turned 40 on June 6, (literally a week prior to my visit), and my Driver&#39;s license expired that day---A WEEK expired (at my time of visit)!  I was told, by the manager, and server, i would need online proof of renewal (do you work for the DMV, or the Cheesecake Factory?) to order a glass of wine!  <br><br>The manager proclaimed!  (my picture literally looks exactly like me too), &#34;be happy you look so young we don&#39;t believe you are 40&#34;<br><br>Great.<br><br>I had to ask for ranch, and brown bread (tough day needed wine and carbs despite being kind of called fat by a man I liked), like 3 times--guys the patio was empty, this is your signature, come on! <br><br>Then food came, NO roll up, or napkins---asked multiple times again! <br><br>I ordered the thai lettuce cups, which are what I usually always order----there was a sandy moment (not sure what that was, but being chefy myself, usually not well washed produce) AND i found a fly on my lettuce at the end!  YES i was sitting outside, but this fly looked like he had been chillin, and dead for some time, for sure--not a random guy that just flew over and died on my plate.  I never complain, and usually over tip, as I have been a server several times in my life and I know what a tough gig it is----I kindly pointed the fly out to the server.<br><br>The CHARMING manager came out again (all sarcasm intended) and proclaimed:  &#34;We wash our produce really well, I am sure that fly was not there when your plate was served. Do you want a free piece of cake?&#34;  NO BRO I don&#39;t.  I don&#39;t even like dessert.  I figured when i asked for the check SOME PORTION would have been discounted.<br><br>WELL GUESS WHAT.  IT WAS NOT DISCOUNTED WHATOSEVER!<br><br>SO SAD!  The only highlight was a super charming Asian man that was either another manager, or greeter or something....he was very courteous and checked in, on me just regarding my general visit (this was pre-fly in food, but post DMV collaboration)-- they should let him be the manager not the daft and lacking any sort of customer service dude they have doing the job on Saturday Afternoons now!

I really like this place. The service is nice, the portion sizes are pretty big which is good in my opinion! I really like the steaks they have, especially the rib-eye cut, that&#39;s my favorite. Really good place, I really enjoy eating here! Thank you!!!

I frequent this Cheesecake Factory often as I live in the area but today&#39;s experience was horrible! <br>For starters, when I got to the table the table was not cleaned properly! There was spilled coffee all over the table and it was sticky! I told the hostess to have it cleaned and after 15 minutes passed no one came by. I got up and told the incompetent hostess again and told her out server had not come by. After 5 minutes our sever appeared. I used hand sanitizer and a napkin to clean the table since it was not going to get cleaned! <br><br>We were a party of two. I ordered the spicy chicken chipotle pasta and my mom ordered gumbo! When the food came her gumbo was all oil and my pasta had no sauce. We sent the order back and the rude, argumentative, and condescending manager RICHARD came to the table his excuse was &#34;we are human and we make mistakes&#34;, &#34;I&#39;m just trying to make you happy&#34;! It&#39;s not about making me happy it&#39;s about giving me what i ordered!!!!!!<br>We then waited an additional 30 minutes and they brought our food out and it was the same thing! Dry pasta and greasy gumbo. I could understand if I had never been here before but I was just at this location two days ago and these menu items are what we always order. <br><br>We told the manager that we didn&#39;t want the food! He proceeded to boring us a bill for our lemonade! Really after I have been waiting for two hours for my food! You have to be kidding!
Customer service was terrible, placed a phone order came on time for my food but yet my hamburger was cold. Manager wasn&#39;t helpful at all

We did takeout here at the beginning of the safer-at-home mandate.  Things were fine.  Came back on June 21.  Father&#39;s Day dinner ruined.<br><br>I arrived to bring the food home before my 5:45pm pickup time.  Had to wait until almost 6pm to pay.  Note:  Standing circle on floor is next to door in/out to the patio so too much exposure and not safe.<br><br>Our dinner was misplaced, staff at register are not empowered to go looking for food.  Flagged down a manager who found it in the food delivery section.  No apology or even an offer of a piece of cheesecake.<br><br>At home, the food turned out to be a huge disappointment.  The TexMex egg rolls had congealed.  The Mediterranean Chicken was cold and the chicken rubbery and not edible.  The Club sandwich was missing the fries.<br><br>I called and spoke to the manager on the phone.  He was aware of the misplaced dinner order and said we would receive a gift card in 3-5 business  days for partial refund.  As of July 1, nothing.<br><br>Update:  We received an apology postmarked July 6, 2020 from the Sherman Oaks Manager.  Included was a gift card that is not enough to cover three pieces of cheesecake for the family.  Given the unaddressed safety issue as well as the virus spread in SCAL, we will not be returning anytime soon, and certainly not to Sherman Oaks.  Perhaps we may go to Pasadena and look for the gang from The Big Bang Theory.

Let me start by saying we love the Cheesecake Factory. We order at least once a week fir delivery through their partner DoorDash. Every week it&#39;s the same. I ask for extra bread...none. I ask for a pasta change...nothing done. I don&#39;t think they even look at the special instructions...ever. Last time we ordered we received a small bread (normally a bag has one brown and one white) with only one white piece that looked like a bite was taken out of it. I called door dash and they said to call the store. I did. We had 8 people in our order and one small loaf of bread, despite asking for extra bread on several entrees. The manager apologized but did nothing about it. <br>Almost every order we get is missing an entree or something on the order. We have been missing salads, chicken for the salads, and burgers. Yes door dash will credit you, but then we still are left with people with no food. They blamed it on being really busy a few times. Apparently, too busy for their customers?? Not cool. We placed an order a few weeks ago and none of the cheesecakes were in the order. Really? This time around the manager did have it resent to us which was nice! Overall, I am truly disappointed with the ToGo staff who prepares the orders and the overall management because they are ultimately responsible. From now on we will order only  from small local businesses who care about their customers. Maybe when COVID is over we will try them again but not likely until then. It&#39;s disappointing to be sure.

I ordered food here through the &#34;DoorDash&#34; app for my birthday. The food was warm and just yummy. I loved how I didn&#39;t have to leave the comfort of my home to enjoy the simple things in life- &#34;food&#34; Thanks cooks you made my birthday bearable during this pandemic.

The worse service EVER. The manager gave ZERO cares that her staff could not complete a simple task...like refilling our WATER....<br><br>Food was disgusting. I LOVE the CHEESECAKE factory...So, its a big deal that im EVEN writing this..bullshit. #veryunablefingcistomer ....

I am beyond disappointed in The Cheesecake Factory, granted due to COVID 19, I give them props with doing the best they can, BUT you can do better then this a chain that is as popular and recognized come on. So they only have curve side pick up, so I placed my order last night paid in full and designated a scheduled picked up time for 4:15, you figured no brainer- show up- tell them order #, pick up order and go. That would have been too easy, no I been standing here for the past 1 hour and a half, they couldn&#39;t find my order, they were able to finally find it- they said five minutes- and hour and 30 minutes later I am still here... no social distancing, no organization and no help whatsoever- I have asked multiple times on the status of my order they have no clue? Very disappointed!!!!!<br><br>Update: 7:00PM (order was placed for picked up at 4:15) I left without my order, I will disputing the $200 dollar bill! What a disappointment......
I didn&#39;t ask for rock chicken can&#39;t believe a pebble was in my chicken this is so disgusting my tooth hurts

Ordered takeout today and the salad is missing the chicken! I called to complain and they ask me to drive back to the restaurant to pick it up!!! I said absolutely not. They then transfer me to the manager who was unbelievably rude and unprofessional. She spoke over me and had no idea allegedly as to what had happened! So why did I hold for TEN MINUTES? Her response was you can either tell me what happened or don&#39;t! So I asked for her manager and she refused that as well. This restaurant has no hope if these are the type of people that are running it. Will not be going back.

I wouldn&#39;t come back here anymore, between seeing arguments between customers and managers just to start off, and to top it off rude hostess, and I haven&#39;t even touched upon the food, I&#39;m allergic to avocados and asked for none and of course they disregarded that, along with giving us food that could have been old and moldy. No thanks for me
I placed an order online and was told to pick it up at 9:34. When I go to pick up my order at 9:30, they tell me they trashed (in a happy voice)because they close at 9. Terrible management!

WORST experience I&#39;ve ever had at Cheesecake Factory. We waited nearly 2 hours when we were told the wait would be less than an hour. Then when we were finally sat at a table we were placed at a table with no heater (it was 45 degrees) . We asked to be moved to another table with a heater but was told by management we would have to be placed back on the waitlist after we just waited for nearly 2 HOURS!!!! <br><br>Our server McKenzie was INCREDIBLE! She&#39;s the only reason we even stayed the length we did. Once our food was served which took even longer EVERYTHING was cold. Even the HOT COCOC was cold. <br><br>Very unacceptable &amp; will not visit this location anymore.

This branch in the Sherman oaks galleria has way better service than other spots. Food wait was less than 20 mins. I&#39;ve waited over 30 minutes at other branches. The only downfall is you have to park in the mall parking to get in. Since the corona I have yet to go there I&#39;ve been ordering delivery! Love the food!!

Ordered three slices of cheesecake to go, got home and two of them were wrong. Everyone working the counter was super nice, my bad for not checking before I left. There are so many other restaurants and bakeries in town next time I&#39;ll spend my money elsewhere.

I&#39;ve been to this cheesecake factory so many times and it&#39;s always had amazing food and polite service. The wait times for the checks weren&#39;t great, but the food was always fast.<br><br>Tonight I ordered through doordash. My order went through twice. The glitch was probably on doordash&#39;s part, but as soon as I saw two receipts in my email I called and tried to clear it up. I&#39;ve worked in many restaurants and I&#39;ve even owned my own. When you get two of the same orders from the same person, you ALWAYS call the customer. That is customer service. My number is on the order. The only reason I called doordash first is because I thought they had only charged me twice, not sent it twice. By the time that doordash got to them, they were already making the food. They orders couldn&#39;t be canceled. I called the restaurant after doordash and the manager informed me that it is my problem and not theirs and that I can take it up with someone else. They&#39;ve lost two customers and doordash has lost us too. Postmates all the way. My food hasn&#39;t even arrived yet and I&#39;m not even hungry anymore. So much for $130.

My friend and I stopped here for lunch since I figure I would get him a Chessecake to brighten up his day. The restaurant is in the Sherman Oaks Galleria so just park in the structure, you can get your ticket validated for 2 hours. When we walked in, we got seated right away since they weren&#39;t busy. Chessecake is usually busy during the evening and weekends. When we got seated, our waitress took our order and told us the soup specials. Then the bread got delivered, I really like the brown bread with their butter. They used to give 3 different bread but now they only do 2. I got the lunch special of Fresh Grilled Salmon with a side of french fries and brocolli. I was surprise by how small the salmon was but I guess that&#39;s what they do for the lunch special. The salmon was okay, I enjoyed my French fries more. For dessert, I ordered the Chocolate Tower Truffle Cake. It was very chocolatey.

Worst cheesecake factory experience ever. <br><br>We came in for post movie deserts - with someone with allergies to eggs and nuts - they were lost.<br><br>No we don&#39;t have any allergy info.  I found the allergy info online. I was told not to trust the doc from their website that looked exactly like every other menu they used. <br><br>Staff and management here need so much more training, I&#39;d recommend other locations before going to this one that has a shambles of a management team and incomplete menus paperwork for the tables (no allergy booklet).
So disappointing, i get home all excited to eat after a long day and then I see this small size &#34;full entree&#34;

I went there with my son ,we waited about 40 minutes but it was worth it.   The waiter was super nice ,great costumer service.  Even with a mask ,He kept smiling and coming to check on us.  The food was great ,I just love that place ,once in a while , it is a little expensive.  But definitely recommend.  Thank you.

I always say the smaller the menu is at a restaurant, the better the food is. I fell like over the years cheesecake factory has taken a large downfall. The menu keeps geetting biggeer, the quality of food keeps getting lower and lower. I don&#39;t generally mind mediocre food... but when you charge high end prices... it is not worth it to me... food is just okay. I would rather go to a smaller high end place and spend as much, if not more, but get better food. <br><br>Only go in if you have to, if not.... don&#39;t do it!

I&#39;ve been to this location many times and my experience is always great. Due to covid, It&#39;s so convenient and easy to order for pick up on their website. They give you an estimated time when your order is ready and pick up area is easy to find. The staff was superb, friendly and very courteous. Food was delicious as always. My to go order wasn&#39;t perfect, they forgot one of my kids meal-- but I understand it happens. One of the managers reached out to me the next day and I was so appreciative of him to take the time to call me and talk with me. The fact that he acknowledged my complaint made me very happy. I didn&#39;t expect that. Overall amazing customer service and I definitely recommend!

I ordered delivery and the food was cold and disgusting. They didn&#39;t pay notice to my instructions on what I didn&#39;t want. The fries were stale. Waste of $<br><br>Update: it wasnt the delivery service that screwed up. The restaurant made sub par food and didn&#39;t pay attention to how I wanted my meal. YOU (cheesecake factory) screwed up

I love the food at Cheesecake, but man the service at this location is consistently bad. <br><br>We started off by being told that we couldn&#39;t order the artichoke, couldn&#39;t order the Brussels sprouts and the lettuce for spicy Caesar salad also was out; all three appetizers we wanted were 86ed. This is not the servers fault, but they really need to get it together with stuff that&#39;s out because this happens frequently.<br><br>We asked for no croutons on our salad, the salad came with croutons. We also asked to sub broccoli for mashed potatoes for our meal and we still got potatoes (and then had to wait almost 5 minutes to get the broccoli we ordered). <br><br>The waitress then disappeared for so long when we were ready to pay. We asked if we could pay for the dessert for a woman at table next to ours. Instead, the server ran our card FOR THAT TABLES WHOLE BILL. We specifically said, &#34;we want to buy her dessert&#34; not her whole tab. After the two CC receipts were dropped off, the server disappeared for another long while so we had to wait another 10 minutes to track her down and get her to void our charge for the second bill and change it to just the cheesecake. <br><br>Three strikes happened here and not once was a manager sent by. Allison, our server needs to be retrained or not serving. I am shocked because over the 10 years I&#39;ve been visiting CCF I&#39;ve never had such terrible service. The second star is only because the food is actually good, but I would definitely just order takeout from this one.
Great place to dine at, the food was delicious. My first time having the cheesecake here and it was amazing! The service was good very friendly server and got the food out quickly.

Fairly good Cheesecake Factory. It could use a bit of improvement though. For example, it was really hard to find parking so I had to walk for 10 minutes after finding street parking. At the restaurant they then told me that they validate. I wish I had known prior. Also, the wait staff didn&#39;t come by very often to fill up my drink. So, it wasn&#39;t terrible, but I&#39;ve had better experiences.

Went in today for my bday dinner with a friend, MIMI our waitress was absolutely FANTASTIC! She had great recommendations for not only cocktail but also dinner entrees since I couldn&#39;t decide. Mimi&#39;s  patient, sociable and approachable demeanor is what makes an individual valuable in any profession. Food portions (dinner) were huge and full of flavor, delicious food, great staff, wonderful bday experience. Thank you.

It&#39;s nice that restaurants do their very best to remain open to serve customers during the current pandemic, but I think I just had my last meal at Cheesecake Factory. I ordered online at 7:15 PM. With my meal scheduled to be ready at 7:45 PM, my meal was 30 minutes late. While waiting for my dinner to be ready, I saw, LITERALLY, 3 people walk in, order, pay for their meal, receive their meals and walk out the door. When I asked for a manager, he kept shifting the blame for our late meal to the cashiers (who are actually servers who don&#39;t know how to run the POS system), then blamed the pandemic (you know, the pandemic that started in March), then mentioned that it was such a &#34;big order to fill&#34; (1 appetizer and 3 entrees). <br>Since it was freshly cooked and swiftly packed, it would be piping hot when I got home. 12 minutes later, my Steak Diane was chewy and not medium rare and my jambalaya needed some microwave time to get hot. At least the chinese chicken salad was cold and delicious. Something is amiss here, but I won&#39;t experience that location anymore.

Came to dinner(9pm) with a group of 5. It was semi busy but not a prime dinner time rush. It started off great, our server gave us suggestions on what to order and came to refill our waters without asking. But we waited close to 40 mins for our order after having to ask any waiter the status because we couldn&#39;t seem to find our waiter. Once our food got there it was burnt and the waiter didn&#39;t want to have anything to do with us when we simply brought it to his attention. He just said okay. And went to grab a manager. The manager ended up comping off the pizza, which was nice. But would have rather no issues and paid for everything straight out.

This place is consistent. You know what you&#39;re getting every time. My go to is the factory burrito. I&#39;ll switch it up with the chinese chicken salad, bang bang chicken and shrimp (with only shrimp) and the tex mex egg rolls. The brown bread is also amazing- and make sure to get ranch to dip it in. Trust me.
A menu bigger than my heart! Love that long island iced tea too! Perfect date night hot spot too.<br>Live Laugh Love,<br>Karen

Ordered for delivery. Turned out to be pickup because they randomly stopped doing delivery. Asked them to cancel. They refused and charged me even though I wasn&#39;t coming. Said the order was ALREADY PREPARED. Yeah dude but it was THREE PIECES OF CAKE. Of course they were already prepared. Ya put them back. <br><br>Hope the employee that refused the order enjoyed their dessert. You guys suck.

Worst thing a hostess can tell you.  &#34;We are closing in 45 min, if we call you in 45 min you have a table, if we don&#39;t sorry we are closed&#34;.  So basically wait 45 we may seat you we may not

Ordered from here last week and got my orders cold.<br>2 of my orders was Salmon imagine how disgusting that feels eating cold cooked fish. I work a block away and have been eating there forever. Very disappointing

I&#39;m writing to share my disappoitnment with the cheescake factory. It first started when I tried to place my order online at the cheescake factory website. I was ready to purchase $200+ worth of food for a July 4th celebration lunch for my family. I tried to use my $50 e-gift card to pay a portion of it and the website was not accepting it. It gave me an error message saying it was unable to accept the giftcard and to make sure there was a balance and that the number was entered correctly. I tried to re-enter everything and it gave the same message. I called the phone # on the gift card to make sure the gift card was not used, and sure enough, the $50 balance was confirmed. I tried again on the website, and was again given the same message. I called the customer care # again and this time spoke to a representative. He too confirmed there was a $50 balance available. I asked him to wait on the line while I tried again, and again received the error message. The representative was blaiming the website for being down and to try and speak with customer service. At that point, it felt like he was just trying to pass the buck, so I decided to call in my order. <br><br>I called the restaurant several times, and there was no answer. I decided then to go to the restaurant to place my order in person to use my giftcard. When I went to the restaurant, there was a line of people that were frustrated because they had placed their online orders earlier that day, was told to come at a specific time to pick up their orders, and their order wasn&#39;t ready at the time they were told. I passed the line and went to the hostess asking to place my order now. She said that it wasn&#39;t possible and that I would need to get in line with all the people waiting for their online orders, in order to even place my order. I explained to her the frustration I just experienced to see if maybe she would take initiative and escalate the matter, or think outside the box and maybe write my order down and enter it in the register, maybe offer a free slice of cheescake for the inconvenience....just something to try and resolve the experience for the customer, but she acted like she could not do anything. She was not even regulating the guests in line making sure they were 6 feet apart from each other, or trying to get status&#39;s on anyones order... she was doing nothing. <br><br>What a horrendous experience in a place I once considered a top notch restaurant. I was being made to jump through hoops to spend aprox $250 in orders. I really hope the corporate office can do something to fix this unorganization, or to train staff better in handling customer concerns. I also hope there would be no issues in allowing people to pay with giftcards on the website when placing online orders. This experience was beyond frustrating.
Cheesecake factory used to be great now he&#39;s awful the food was horrible service service was even worse

Just dined here tonight with a few friends. Let me first say the food was good, the service, not at all. After about 20-25 min of waiting at the table for our server (after the usual 40 min for the table) I went to the host desk and let them know. I was told a manger would be sent over, along with our server. A server came about 5-10 min later and did not even bring any water or bread. The manager never came by. We got our food about 30 min later and 2 of the orders were missing a portion of the food. They told us it would be brought over but it was not, so we asked for it a little into our meal. <br><br>No one really gave a real apology or asked/offered to do anything about it. Of course or server said sorry, but it wasn&#39;t more than that. <br><br>I was not happy with the server of course, but also with the hostess who said a manager would be sent over. She obviously just said that to say it, no one seemed to care at all.<br><br>On our way out my wife told the hostess the night was bad, she just said I&#39;m sorry, and continued talking to a manager (who of course said nothing).<br><br>Pretty much they don&#39;t care about you there, find a better place to spend your money

We eat dinner at The Cheesecake Factory in Sherman Oaks a couple times a year.  Wonderful under the heaters in Winter.  The menu offerings are varied enough for large or small groups of friends and/or family.  Service is always great and the food is delicious.<br><br>Because of the COVID-19 pandemic, we decided to try and do a takeout on Sunday, March 29.  The on-line option was working perfectly with an estimate for pick-up.  Hubby waited in the car while the wife hopped out to pick up our order with BBQ Chicken Salad for the wife, Chicken Madeira for hubby, and a Club Sandwich with fries for our adult daughter (now living with us and working from home).  Wine from our grocery store completed our meal, although you can purchase CF house wine by the bottle.  And orders over $30 get a free piece of Cheesecake!<br><br>Stay home, stay safe, stay healthy.

Incredibly disappointed.. another order of oxidized avocado eggrolls. Crab cakes were also order and it looks as though someone took a bit out of 2 of them. Additionally, there was a ridiculously long wait line for take out, which adds to my regretful choice of restaurant for New Year&#39;s Eve. I arrived 5 minutes before my order was ready, yet had to wait in pure chaos to receive my order.  I also requested extra sauce in my order, which they forgot to give me, having to then come back and wait another 10 min to get it. This is starting to become a disconcerting pattern of service. I forgot to mention my paid for gift card of $25 showed up in their system as $.01 and I wasn&#39;t able to use it. BAD SERVICE all around.

4stars cause I&#39;ve always been a fan of this place but I&#39;ve noticed that the quality of food has decreased.  <br>Brunch on weekends now, this is a plus. I got blueberry pancakes with a side of bacon and wasn&#39;t impressed. The bacon was very greasy. <br>The menu has a LARGE selection and it makes it very hard to pick from. <br>I will be coming back but watch your step when you start walking on their floor, depending on what shoes you wear the floor is very slippery.
Very un profesional stop serving without informing and at 8:59 orderd a drink the close bar at 9pm. Just dont understand why they will not serve and get this bad review

I&#39;ve been here a couple times and the food is great, but the service can be hit or miss and it&#39;s really disheartening given it&#39;s a well known restaurant. <br><br>My most recent visit was Saturday night, I think it was the average wait time, about 30 minutes for 2, they sat us in the patio which is nice but our waiter took our drink and food order and came back once to ask if we were okay. He past by our table several times, not even a glance, maybe our seating was too isolated? Who knows, I don&#39;t, so yes I think service can be better.
cool place...would recommend people to try their food.
Affordable prices and amazing food, I love this restaurant!!! I always go there for special occasions and I am never disappointed.

I&#39;ve been coming here for 10 years I&#39;m finally giving 2 stars only because the food was good and our waiter sure as hell didn&#39;t make it. I didn&#39;t catch the sirs name but he was a bald or maybe balding African American with sass wearing black glasses. Kept asking if we were ready. We tipped and he wasn&#39;t our first waiter. My fiancé left her credit card and as she returned for it this mans attitude was absolutely disgusting. He assumed we were dining and dashing after leaving tip and on top of that my finance left another tip and he demanded more. Service was horrible I wish I caught his name just to show he wasn&#39;t even there. Service was truly horrible. Never returning.

I have always said that The Cheescake Factory is my favorite restaurant.  I bought stock in the late 80s when it went public. IN early March I saw what was coming with the Covid-19 and posted numerous messages for people to support their favorite restaurants.  To follow my own advice, I have continued to buy take out from TCF at least twice a week. <br>Last Friday I ordered 2 bowls of my favorite soup. When I picked up the soup the employee told me they made me 2 cups and charged me almost $18. When I got home my gf laughed at me and told me I was ripped off. She put the two tiny black containers and both together didn&#39;t even make one half bowl of soup. <br>I know times are rough for restaurants,  but to rip off their loyal customers is disgusting and greedy!

I was thr a week ago n the food was great. I just think the waiters need to be trained again because of the COVID He was very nice but we had ask for  more water n stead of bring a pitcher of water to the table or bring us new glasses fill with water he took the ones we had at our table inside the restaurant to filled them. I know it was the same ones because we had left our straws in them. I thought once something on our table the shouldn&#39;t take it or touch it unless were done we it. I just think it&#39;s unsafe made me think twice befor I go back again any time soon.
One my favorite restaurants to  eat food consistently good, customer service friendly,  busy at times but still worth it
We make a reservation I was take  in on time but food took over 40 minutes to be served. The whole staff was really nice and attentive. My only complaint will be the speed of food services.

I received several poorly prepared items tonight from the Sherman Oaks, CA location. Angel hair pasta that was overcooked to the point that it was a congealed mass on the plate, two orders of Nashville chicken that were overcooked and dry with only a drizzle of sauce on them, and a &#34;warm&#34; apple crisp that was ice cold! The manager shared that he was unable to refund my money, so I have to wait until the General Manager, Rebecca P, contacts me in a couple of days! I am incredibly disappointed in both the food and the onsite manager&#39;s response.

I gotta say I&#39;ve been ordering from this location since 2013 and almost every single time I order from here the food is great. Tonight I ordered the brick chicken meal and it was sooooo good. The chefs killed it.

The Cheesecake Factory is one of my favorite restaurants to dine at because of the many options of entrees you can choose from. They have everything from burgers, salads, asian, mexican, pasta and more. I usually try a different entree every time I dine here. But my favorite thing to eat at Cheesecake Factory is their brown bread with butter. I can probably just eat that alone. It is so good!<br><br>I have been to this location many times over the years and always received great service. Sometimes there is a long wait for table and sometimes you can just walk right in.

Always loved coming here but today was extremely disappointing. Waited 45 minutes for our appetizers which were good and the only reason I gave two stars. keep in mind that I came on a Tuesday afternoon and it wasn&#39;t full.
Very bad don&#39;t waist your time <br>Employees they don&#39;t care <br>Shame on this location, it&#39;s Ventura place this sorry

I have always been ok with their cheesecakes. <br>But this last time that I got one from their Sherman oaks location, was not only stale but runny and acidy. <br>They make wait outside so you don&#39;t see where it come from.  Definitely need t from their case. <br>When home, I was fortunate to eat only half a slice, but it got me sick for almost a week. <br>I think because of the pandemic they don&#39;t sell much but they rifriggerete them for longer that would be safe. <br>So please, don&#39;t sell if it&#39;s not fresh.  You don&#39;t want to ruin your reputation. <br>I for one will Never go there again. <br>Thank you.

I ordered food for takeout yesterday and asked if we were able to sit out to dine we were going to order more drinks and she said no because only people that walk in are able to able to get a table and she said you ordered food to go so no you can&#39;t. And she then again repeated you ordered your food to go! she was very rude about it and i asked to speak to a supervisor and she said i am the general manager i asked what&#39;s your name and she responded Rebeka and proceeded to walk away. i wasn&#39;t done speaking to her. It was very rude and unprofessional.

No wonder they have 3 stars!!<br>They getting worse and worse!<br>I been a client for many years for this location and I never complain I been satisfied with the service and food with some exceptions.<br>  I&#39;m not going in to specifics for those times, nothing is perfect.<br>However this past Sunday was very bad.<br>I ordered at 2 pm to pick up at 3 pm and when I got there my order wasn&#39;t ready ( I was surprised because usually they&#39;re on time) but since was a Mother&#39;s Day I told my self relax is understandable.<br>After 30 min waiting I saw like ten different people getting their orders.<br> I asked the cashier for my order and she didn&#39;t know what happen to it (by the way I didn&#39;t get a receipt)<br> she called a guy (Richard) he told me that my order wasn&#39;t ready that they still working on it, he found the dessert on the counter.<br>Then after another 15 min (45 min all ready and more people getting their orders)<br>I asked Richard again and he give me actitud for ask him at that moment I wasn&#39;t pleased with the service because any one can make mistakes and probably wasn&#39;t he&#39;s fault but he could approach with a different attitude.<br>My concern is actually is exactly that, he&#39;s  lack of professionalism to approach to the clients.<br>I asked again after another 10 min (pretty much an hour) he says He couldn&#39;t find my order rising he&#39;s voice and then I asked to get my money back and he was  yelling at me in front of everybody that is not refunds then I asked to talk to the  manager and he told me all sarcastic  that is not manager that I can talked to.<br>He finally found my order with door dash stickers on it!<br>He was like ok this is your order, no apologies no explanation just like that!<br>They misplaced the order!<br>Richard was very rude!<br>The food was cold!<br>No receipt! <br>You have a camera in front of the cashier so you can see I even tip the change for the order!<br>Hope the manager read this!
The salmon here is really good . The service is reallly Good and It helps that The theatre is nearby
Update: still leaving a one star review. They had me fill out a form/complaint on their website a month ago and no one has followed up on it.

I&#39;ve been to cheesecake factory and million times, especially at this location before or after the movie. It&#39;s perfectly located to do so, and despite the fact that it&#39;s always super crowded with usually a long wait, there are lots of options for almost every diet including my vegetarian.<br><br>This particular trip was Sunday, which means pizza night in my family so after the film we had downstairs confidently knowing that they serve pizza!<br><br>I had the margarita pizza which was good enough but the crust was a bit overcooked. Same thing with the similar pizza my kid ordered off the children&#39;s menu. The sauce and cheese were perfect for our tastes but the crust was over done which isn&#39;t great for artisan style pizzas (They were cooked perfectly on top, the right amount of brown spots - so many pizzas come out underdone...we wouldn&#39;t have liked it if it were less cooked on top but the crust was definitely overcooked so maybe they need to adjust their pizza cooking temperature to get the right balance).<br><br>Of course you can&#39;t go to cheesecake factory without getting a slice of cheesecake (well you can but really what are you thinking?) We had the mango Key Lime cheesecake at my nine-year-old&#39;s choice, which I would only describe it as &#34;oh yeah baby&#34;. You can quote me on that.<br><br>As I mentioned there is a lot to choose from if you&#39;re a vegetarian from a veggie burger, mushroom, sandwich, pastas, all kinds of sides, and small plates, but one of the stars of The Cheesecake Factory for us is always the bread service which comes with every meal. The sourdough baguette and the brown grains bread they serve are always perfect and super delicious with butter. I could come to The Cheesecake Factory just to eat the free bread. I&#39;m not sure they allow that.<br><br>I have no doubt will be back to this location, as there keep seeming to be movies that we want to see playing upstairs at the Arclight Cinemas. And please don&#39;t eat all the bread people, will be hungry.

Downright lacking hospitality. Management on board for the day was  Richard. Oh boy! What a treat. Maybe he didn&#39;t want to be on shift today?  I&#39;m hearing from other reviewers this is not a first time occasion for this stores management. This guy was rude and interruptive handled my visit today very poorly. Not only was sauce not correct today, was overly spicy. And I couldn&#39;t get a word in.  When I shared my concern and explained item was not edible. I was met with sarcasm and disrespect. This managers handling of my dining experience today ruined our business partnership. Not only will my company never order from here again. We are now also reminded of indecency and egotistical remarks made by someone that is the face of hospitality, completely unacceptable behavior. During such turbulent times. Was SO DISAPPOINTED. Shame on you Richard! Watch out and stay away &amp; humble yourself, Richard. Posi vibes!<br><br> I&#39;m thankful for the neighborng restaurants where customer service is proudly exhibited and RISE TO THE OCCASION ...thanks again for reading! Have a beautiful day to all. Happy Sunday

It&#39;s Cheesecake Factory so it&#39;s not bad or even notably good. It&#39;s just always okay whatever I get there. Whatever you do don&#39;t order the skinny salmon dish. The salmon is bland with no spice and over cooked/burnt. The veggies are bland and boiled. My favorite dish is jumbalya but replace the pasta with white rice. Last time I went I got a BBQ hamburger and it was pretty large and delicious. I also like the free fresh bread with the butter. The service is always decent here and good for large parties. The server even was okay with making 10 separate checks. As far as drinks, the mojito is yummy. 2h validation for parking in the lot.

Well, what can you say about Cheesecake? <br>It&#39;s a successful chain restaurant with lots of options that gives you free bread when you are seated.<br>This place has everything to meet a person&#39;s dietary needs. If you have a big party, this would be a safe bet of a place to go to. You pretty much know what you&#39;re gonna get. <br><br>Their portions are huge and they have a &#34;Skinnylicious&#34; menu for options with fewer calories.  <br>Their fire roasted artichoke is killer. That&#39;s my usual go-to. It must be that fire roasting because I cannot get mine to have that texture when I make em at home. <br>I used to get their veggie burger when they had beets in them, but for some reason, they took that out. Bummer. I thought it tasted a lot better then. <br><br>So, this is where we went for our co-workers last day lunch. Went with a big group and our server, Antwyon, was very attentive. Dude was on point with our orders, filling our glasses with refills, having take-out boxes ready for leftovers, and provided us with naps to clean our hands with after eating while reciting back our order. <br>&#34;Here is a wipe for your artichoke hands.&#34;<br> He even asked us if we wanted to take our drinks to go. Thanks, Antwyon for a stellar lunch dining experience.

Brance was our server. He was really sweet and our food was pretty yummy. Our food, however took one hour to come out. We were also waited about 45 minutes to get seated.<br><br>Our bread came out with the smallest amounts of butter. They gave us a 2 inch by 2 inch square of butter for all of the bread they put in front of us. We were a group of 8. It was hard to call Brance over to ask for more because we didn&#39;t come check up on us until he brought out a second round of bread and my avocado egg rolls. The second round of bread was hard to eats and lacked the softness that the first round had. The bread was very hard to rip apart although they extended their butter amount to 3x3 lol. My avocado egg rolls were great. I really liked it! Although the sauce that came with it seemed like pure honey. It was very sweet and I felt that it didn&#39;t really match the egg rolls. My friend liked it though.<br><br>I ordered the shrimp scampi and my boyfriend ordered the Steak Diane. Our food was great. My scampi was light and the cause was very minimal, which is how I like my pastas sometimes. In this case, it was a win. My boyfriend&#39;s steak was tender and had a really nice crunch on the outside.<br><br>For dessert, everyone at our table ordered different cheesecakes . My boyfriend and I ordered the celebration cake. It was very sweet but the cake layer in the middle and on the bottom balance it out a bit more. It was still pretty sweet though.<br><br>With validation, we had to pay $2.00, probably by the amount of time we spent waiting to be seated and to get out food. There is a parking structure. This location is situated in the Sherman Oaks Galleria.

First of all, I could close my eyes and choose a random item from the menu and it would be amazing  I mean, literally everything here is so good (except the Evelyn pasta ) I love the appetizers such as the lettuce wraps or spinach dip. <br><br>For entrees I&#39;d recommend the miso salmon or filet mignon if you&#39;re craving a solid tasty protein. I like the chicken piccata also or chicken costaletta if you like a rich sauce. Chinese chicken salad is always yummy too.<br><br>Ya this is definitely my favorite restaurant as I&#39;ve been coming for 20 years! <br><br>Shout out to Antwon, he was my server last time and he was so cool and attentive, it was much appreciated.

I have been coming to this place for years. I had great time each time I ate there.Today I got it to-go. I missing my green beans. The steak supposed to be well done and well. I won&#39;t able to tell if is well done or medium well by looking at it. I called them and try to explain. He wasn&#39;t having it. Obviously I am not gonna drive back  and forth because I am already home. Who knows if they going to do it correct again if I waste my another 1 hr on it. Simply sorry could have been better. I would definitely not recommend to-go from it. Are we supposed to cut in half and see it is correct before taking to home? It&#39;s so ridiculous. What a good way to taste 100 dollars right

If I could give this place zero stars I would but unfortunately yelp does not allow it. Worst customer service ever. I have never been to a restaurant who neglects their customers as this Cheesecake Factory does. The food came out piece by piece. either they were missing sauce or they brought out the wrong order. The waitress didn&#39;t even take our order normally. We saw her once and she disappeared. The cherry on top was we had to go inside the restaurant and ask the rude host  for plates and her answer was &#34;times are tough&#34;. I&#39;ve never ever seen such bad customer service, it&#39;s not like I was eating there for free. I was paying for the food and their horrible service. This restaurant does not provide plates for people to eat on. I still don&#39;t understand where I&#39;m supposed to eat? On the table maybe. <br>If you&#39;re in LA and are looking for a place to eat, look anywhere but here.

We reached 5 adults and 2 children.  The place looks sea and the waiters are courteous.  The food was delicious and the quantity was exceptionally large.  It bothers us that they do not offer any employment for children such as colors and coloring pages as is customary in some even lower level restaurants.  There is a paid parking lot but are refunded.

I ordered take out and it&#39;s horrible! Portions are not the same and taste is trash. I rather eat at McDonald&#39;s and pay way less. I use to love Cheesecake Factory, I just spend $50 on low quality  food

We came here for my sister in laws birthday and had a great time. I haven&#39;t been to a Cheesecake Factory in almost 6 years now I want to come back more frequently. We had a pretty big party (12 guests) the management was nothing but helpful and had us into our seating within minutes. It was hectic with all the guests ordering drinks, catching up with each other and deciding what to get to eat. Our waiter patiently waited and helped the people with questions without hesitation or attitude. I wish I got his name because he deserves a gold star. The food was hot and fresh and our waiter made sure our drinks were never empty. I highly recommend coming here if you are having a get together or just a nice dinner out. I came for the food but I will keep coming back for the service!

I&#39;ll start by saying the service was great. Paul is amazing and truly understanding. With that. The food was large. A cup of soup the size of a bowl most other places. So the negative- food was bland, dry and not worth the price at all. I could have gone to a fast food place for much cheaper for something with more taste. This location also doesn&#39;t have fans outside. It&#39;s 90+ degrees and they are mainly seating outside. The butter Paul brought for the bread melted in less then 15 mins (in the shade) <br><br>Seriously put in some fans

Their brunch is DELICIOUS! My hubs and I&#39;s fave go to for breakfast on weekends... I think I&#39;ve tried everything on the menu for brunch and everything is a hit every time.. service is great.. weekends and nights can be super busy. Expect to wait 1hr but that&#39;s normal for cheesecake... I only give it 4 because I feel like the waiting area is just waaaay too crowded and can&#39;t comfortably stand or sit for one hour. And we ordered to go one time.. we arrived when order was suppose to be ready and we waited an extra 45 minutes. For what? I don&#39;t know but our food definitely was cold by the time we made it home and I only live 2 miles away.. But food is always well worth the wait..

Poor customer service by the manager name Richard . I placed an order online because I got the email a free slice of cheese cake I told him my order was over 50 dollars and he said unfortunately I can&#39;t do anything for you . As manager I think you should go above and beyond for your guest . Specially because I am here supporting our local restaurants . Very disappointed!!!!! I don&#39;t think a slice of cheese cake would hurt the restaurant.

Had a great dinner &amp; service last night by Vinny. Anything you order off the menu will be delicious. We ordered the avocado egg rolls as a starter. We tried the hibachi steak, fish and chips and farfalle pasta. Left super full and satisfied. They will validate your parking but if your planning to watch a movie it&#39;s best you validate through the theatre as they will give you 4 hours free.  <br><br>I love the warm, soft bread they offer while you wait for your food.

Management is trash and to keep it 100 the servers are trash.  I Get here , order my food the server has no idea what she&#39;s doing and the food was horrible potatoes are trash better off going to the cheese cake factory in Woodland Hills either this one is racist or just has bad costumer service !!!! Not coming back here and I don&#39;t recommend anyone else here food was dry and it took hours for eggs and not even a full steak !!! Tricia the management was very big help but other then that they ruined my day I&#39;m behind on time can even enjoy a simple meal
Messed up my order again. I&#39;ve ordered take out twice from this location and they&#39;ve managed to mess up my order twice. Keep up the great work!!!
They never got back to me. To think I chewed someone else&#39;s gum here and no one ever said anything. I haven&#39;t been back here, vengeance is mine CF, just you wait and see.

Wish I could give this location of the Cheesecake Factory ZERO stars if that were an option. I had the WORST experience here with my sister and baby nephew. <br><br>My sister and I decided to head over to this restaurant with my baby nephew (about six months old at the time), and we were seated in what was already an inconvenient space, given that we had a stroller. There were plenty of spacious spots available, but for some reason we were seated at a booth table sandwiched between two other booths. We figured the more spacious tables were reserved for others, so we decided to just make it work.<br><br>Ten minutes into sitting down, a waitress comes to us and DEMANDS that we move to another table towards the back because she wants to seat other guests at our table because we are taking up too much space. We were shocked, but we said okay because we didn&#39;t want to bother anyone.<br><br>This is when it gets BAD. My nephew started crying because the waitress was practically shouting at us due to there being loud music in the restaurant, and he got scared. My sister now was concerned and was trying to calm down her baby. Meanwhile, the waitress stood over my sister and kept telling her she needs to move. <br><br>At that point, we were done putting up with this nonsense and just left. <br><br>I will never return here again and I highly suggest that any ladies thinking about coming here with your babies choose a more baby-friendly restaurant.

This is the second time I door dashed this place and they got the order wrong with instructions. What a joke. I truly am embarrassed to what the ccf has turned into no more customer service just tkle your money and run.   Update. Lol. Ccf does not read their doordash orders. Thanks for the confirmation.

Service was terrible! We (party of 6) were seated at 7:30pm. Shortly thereafter we ordered a large appetizer - Thai lettuce wraps. The appetizer never showed up! Finally the server came to take our dinner orders. We told her that we didn&#39;t want the appetizer as it would conflict with dinner. <br><br>Another 30 minutes transpired and my son talked to the manager. Funny, after the manager checked, the dinners showed up immediately. <br><br>All dinners were good tasting with the exception of my daughter&#39;s. She ordered medallions of beef which she said &#34;tasted like dog food&#34;. Only reason she didn&#39;t send it back was that it was already getting late. <br><br>When we were leaving I asked the hostess to get the manager. She disappeared and the manager never showed up. <br><br>We have eaten at Cheesecake Factories many times - but NEVER again in Sherman Oaks.<br><br>Just heard back from Cheesecake Factory guest services. Lot of crap about being &#34;so sorry&#34;. Looked at many other CF reviews and the poor service complaints were rife! No offers to comp meals, etc. <br><br>Get with it!

I came to have there brunch menu and when I ordered my breakfast the potatoes were crunchy and the bagel was burnt I did receive another bagel but it wasn&#39;t soft it was still kinda crunchy. But over all the service was great.

I understand it&#39;s Mother&#39;s Day &amp; they are extremely busy with all the orders that&#39;s why I&#39;m still giving 3 stars.<br>There are so many things on my order that are wrong: Pick up time is 12:30pm, we got it almost 1:15pm; Hibachi Steak is medium ware, I ordered medium; Asian Wrap no cucumber, there is one; Requested utensils, no single utensil. We are so hungry &amp; didn&#39;t get a chance to check what&#39;s in the bag, the low carb cheesecake with strawberries was not there :( and I got charged for it. Tried to call multiple phone was very busy. I sent email online hopefully they will get back to me.
My favorite restaurant!! My favorites are the avocado rolls, the stuffed mushrooms, their nachos and the Santa Fe chicken salad

We had phenomenal service when we went for dinner Wednesday night. Our server Mimie K was amazing.  She was very attentive, kind and gave us fast efficient service. She brought everything as requested and was spot on, she really blew our socks off. We would be returning because of the great experience we had that night.<br>Our server really made sure that we had a great dining in experience. She was very efficient, friendly and she made us feel very welcome. We had come to this location before but never encounter such great service.

Due to the pandemic, I feel that the quality of the food served from this location has definitely gone downhill. Not only do they always forget most of the ingredients in a salad I get when I just ask them to take out only the tomato&#39;s, which this happens every time, I felt that the lettuce in the most recent salad, tasted like bagged lettuce and the quality just wasn&#39;t as good as it used to be. For their pricing they charge on their items, you would hope the quality would be better.

Great Food  Great Atmosphere Staff Very Attentive .. NEVER A LONG WAIT ONLY ABOUT 5 -10 minutes no more than that .. CLEAN ABSOLUTELY NO COMPLAINTS *did I have a small incident but it was resolved * <br>they are very patient the manager and staff..

I would of normally given a one star based on the food, but I must admit the customer service was good. Sadly the food (&#34;cajun jambalaya&#34;) had absolutely no flavor, I mean NONE. We had been wanting to try this place and finally took the hour drive down to Santa Clarita, but things didn&#39;t turn out to be what we thought they would be. I&#39;ve always said give every place a second chance, but not sure if I&#39;d return.

OK so we went to the cheesecake factory to celebrate my mother 63 birthday The first word flag we should&#39;ve left the utensils was very dirty second red flag was The waitress was very I can&#39;t say Rude but maybe having a bad day The manager oh he need Maybe another job the food was disgusting they took like 30mins to bring us water and Bread customer service is super super super bad i&#39;m telling you guys need to upgrade  your night staff 100%<br><br>if you love the cheesecake factory please do not choose this one.

First time coming and it started off well. The environment was nice and I got a table in 5 minutes even when it was 6:30pm (dinner time) on a Friday. The waiter was friendly and she recommended some pastas that she said are the best.  But she was 100% wrong. I only saw her twice for my order and drinks, and because the pasta was so dry and bland I finished my water and almost choked. I had to ask another waiter for water and then I find out she was on lunch and this other waiter came to introduce himself right before we almost finished. <br>The only exciting experience about the restaurant was the earthquake.

It must have been this location, because we were seated immediately.  Our server was very polite and attentive.  Our food came out hot and appealing.  Beware the desserts.  My husband chose the strawberry shortcake that was easily enough for four people.

BUGS IN THEIR FOOD?! I have never been more disgusted in my life!!! I have had hair in my food before, I have had a piece of A broken plate in my food before and today I find a bug. All these things have happened to me at a cheesecake factory. Our waiter yesterday was very sweet and attentive, you can never go wrong with the service at cheesecake factory but the cleanliness of their food is just disgusting. I honestly thought it was a black bean but I was wrong...safe to say I can never look at their salads the same way ever again and I will definitely not be coming back to a restaurant that has bugs in their kitchen.

This has got to be the nastiest, dirtiest Cheesecake Factory restaurant I have EVER been to. EVER! <br><br>We sat on the patio and there was garbage everywhere! It was all over the floors all around and even under our table. I could probably excuse something like this if it was insanely busy. However, the overall wait for nearly everyone was 10-15 minutes on a Saturday. Everyone and their mother knows that if that&#39;s the wait at the Cheesecake Factory, it is certainly not busy. Then, I see a waiter drop a whole bunch of stuff on the ground (platters, napkins) and just walk away. Ummm ok. <br><br>Now, don&#39;t even let me get started on the restroom. It was filthy! Water all over the sinks (severely not just a few drops). Low paper towels. The toilet seat covers, the actual box, was thrown across the bathroom and was just on the floor. Does anyone clean these restrooms? I think not. Truly, I have never seen a CF in this condition. <br><br>The service also matched the restaurant. It was god awful. The waiter kept forgetting everything and walking up to other tables trying to serve the wrong food. Never asked if we needed more drinks, never brought any water, never mentioned any specialties for the day or soup, never even offered dessert.<br><br>Seriously, what&#39;s going on at this location?! I feel incredibly cheated of my money and my experience.

Great service and generous portion!<br><br>I came here for a holiday lunch with my coworkers and everyone had a great time there.<br><br>The menu selection is huge and I personally think it will be less confusing if the menu is more condensed. <br><br>As for the food, you can choose anything from tacos, pasta, seafood and salad. They also have a huge selection of cheesecake. I ordered the grilled fish taco and it came with very generous portion of 4 tacos and side of rice. There is also unlimited bread served before your meal. <br><br>My entree was around $16 and other entrees were between $15-$25. The generous serving size allows one to pack the leftover for a second meal. <br><br>Our waiter was also very friendly and attentive and the ambiance felt classy and family friendly. <br><br>Overall, a decent restaurant that caters to everyone.

We went to the Cheesecake Factory tonight to get 3 pieces of cheesecake from the cake counter (to go). It amounted to $28. Only after we paid did they inform us that in order to get the 50% off for national cheesecake day we had to &#34;dine in.&#34; <br>Thanks a bunch jerks! We would have eaten there if we would have known your rules! I didn&#39;t know it was also &#34;unknown terms and conditions day.&#34; The WEBSITE didn&#39;t say &#34;btw: dine in only.&#34; You know that feeling you get After you pay and are leaving and go back to ask &#34;why was it $28 for 3 slices of cheesecake on national cheesecake day,&#34; and an apathetic response from the employee reminds you you&#39;re just a dollar waiting to be theirs. Yep. 2 stars because the cheesecake is bomb but service is what brings people back.

Please first understand that I always eat at this location and love Cheesecake Factory. This last visit surprised me. I ordered the Thai Coconut Curry for takeout and ate about half of it and saved the rest. I felt sick later in the day and thought nothing of it being related to the food because I OFTEN eat at Cheesecake Factory at this location. I proceeded to heat up my food and noticed a completely RAW chunk of chicken covered in the Thai sauce. I did not notice this the day of because it looked like the rest of the chicken pieces until I put a fork in it. I now know that I felt sick because of the raw chicken placed into the rest of my dish and cannot accept this.

Seriously, YUM! Zero complaints about the food that was served up! Our waitress kind of seemed like she hated her life but I mean, if I were her I prob would hate waiting on people too... But any who, back to the food! <br><br>I was in FEAST MODE so I went for it with the expansive menu... Fried Brussels sprouts (minus the butter bacon sauce), the Skinny Salmon, a side of asparagus and a side of green beans... ALL STUPID DELICIOUS! And I now want to go back to CF pretty much on the daily! My husband totally would too but he claimed he would get FAT because he got the cheesecake to start (lol) and then got the spicy chicken pasta that has about 1250 calories - ha! So yeah, for his waste line and lack of will power, we probably won&#39;t make CF a staple restaurant, but that doesn&#39;t mean I can&#39;t drool over my meal, especially those damn Brussels sprouts! Maybe I can order just those for take out!?
i have been to cheesecake factory many times and really love the food. my favorite is their small plates appetizers, just enough food to curb your cravings. lettuce wraps are the best!

This was my first time going to The Cheesecake Factory and I was very satisfied!! I made a reservation on Yelp and as soon as I walked in, I was seated! I was craving something that was very similar to lasagna and they had just that! I ordered the plate that is called &#39;Pasta Campagna&#39; and it was absolutely delicious! They have two different sizes, they have the lunch size &amp; a bigger dinner one. I got the lunch size which was more than enough for me; it was great. I ended up taking half home because I got full LOL the price for this plate was $14 which was excellent. Overall, the food looked delicious, tasted delicious &amp; the price was fair. Will definitely be going back. Looking forward to trying new plates!!

Paul, our server, was OUTSTANDING!  He appeared to be the only one working in a crowded section, but was very attentive and checked on us frequently.<br><br>The food was decent (not spectacular, but not bad) - we had the gumbo - and the Cheesecake was, of course, DELICIOUS!

I came here with my girlfriend and received the worst service I&#39;ve ever gotten at a restaurant and for it to be cheesecake factory is really disappointing! Weren&#39;t greeted by the hostess properly, waited at least 20 minutes before any server attended us and the only reason they did is because we had to call for them, and we had asked one of the waiters for a manager and instead he called a server. To top if off as we left our waitress (Ashley P.) was slouching around chatting it up with other employees as if no customers were around, very unprofessional.

What happened to Cheesecake Factory? This used to be a nice restaurant with exceptional food and service. Since the pandemic, when other restaurants have adapted to the takeout business they have completely failed. It seems obvious they must have laid off their good chefs because the food quality is poor, and we&#39;ve had to just completely trash 1 out of 3 meals we&#39;ve ordered over the past few months. They used to be our usual spot. Not anymore. I&#39;m writing this not just to complain, but in the hopes they realize the dissatisfaction of their regular customers. Bad food is hard for a patron to overcome. They need to get on top of this or risk going under.

Cheesecake Factory Fails To Deliver (Literally) - Spoiling the 4th of July:  Shame on Them!<br>Last week, DoorDash and the Cheesecake Factory Sherman Oaks sent a notice of a &#34;7 for $20 special running through July 5 featuring two burgers, two fries, two drinks and a slice of Oreo cheesecake - all for $20.  So two days ago, I placed my order (confirmed by email) for 4:30 pm today.  I forgot to specify &#34;rare&#34; on the burgers, so I called the Cheesecake Factory around 11:30 this morning only to find out &#34;sorry, we ran out&#34; of that special yesterday afternoon at 2 p.m.   Apparently each location was &#34;allotted&#34; only a set number of those specials to make available.  The Cheesecake Factory doesn&#39;t just mean you can no longer order that special.  They also mean if you already have an order scheduled, too bad.  Not only that, no one - not the restaurant, not DoorDash - is bothering to notify customers expecting to receive their meals that they won&#39;t get them.  Not only is this bad - but today on the Fourth, some people may be counting on this burger deal as at home celebration of the Fourth of July since the State and the City still mandate no gatherings outside of the &#34;people you live with.&#34;<br>  It&#39;s amazing during this pandemic when shuttered restaurants are struggling to survive on outside tables, deliveries, and take outs, that they would alienate loyal customers this way.  Not so much as a notification or an apology or some attempt to make this right.  Both DoorDash and the Cheesecake Factory have plenty of competitors eager to take their business (and they have lost mine).<br><br>Update:  The Cheesecake Factory reached out to me after I posted my review, apologizing and directing me to their web site to give  them my information so they could contact me directly (presumably to &#34;make it right?&#34;).  I went to the web site and completed the information they requested.  Now almost a week later, silence.  Not only does the Cheesecake Factory apparently not give a darn (substitute another four-letter word), but in reading other customers&#39; reviews on several sites, management apparently follows this pattern all the time.  &#34;Buyer beware&#34; - do not trust the Cheesecake Factory to deliver, to follow through, or to provide the service you pay for and deserve - especially when you are counting on it for a holiday or special celebration.

I ordered the half chicken that is called brick chicken I believe, the chicken was tasty at first but after two bites I realized that the chicken or the sauce that was on the chicken was very salty way too salty! I didn&#39;t enjoy the meal at all , other then that the cheesecake that I had was pretty good

It&#39;s our go to when we want that great ambiance,  great food and for me, great salad, plus they&#39;ve got lunch special . The lunch special portion is as much as dinner for a little less. I love their bread especially, I can eat a lot!!!  Plus this location is closed to home, that&#39;s convenient!!

We waited almost an hour to be seated, other people who got there after us were seated first. Service is very bad specially the 2 woman at the front desk they were very rude and sarcastic when we asked what was going on with our table..

Service is a little slow and there&#39;s always a wait after 6 but I am never disappointed with the food. Food is always fresh, hot and yummy. They have varieties of everything, very large menu so you can come here with your picky eaters hehe

Horrible, horrible experience with terrible follow-up my &#34;management&#34;.  I took a seat on the outside patio( in April) with my dog.  As soon as the server saw him, she gave him a dirty look.  She barely smiled, barely made eye contact. I ordered the soup/salad lunch combo.  The onion soup was overly salted.  I asked to speak to a manager, she never requested a manager visit my table.  The salad consisted of lettuce and croutons.  I said &#34; Is this a garden salad&#34; and she said Yes, with tomatoes, but you don&#39;t want those.  I said oh, ok, I thought garden salads have cucumbers or carrots.  She said &#34; Nope&#34;.  Next thing I know, she literally drops a bowl of carrots and cucumbers on the table. No comments at all.  She was the WORST server I&#39;ve ever had at a cheesecake factory.   <br><br>I phone the next day, spoke to management who said they would send me a gift card.  Never received it.  Phone back 2 weeks later, given a promise of a card, never received it.  I give up.  Never going back here again.

Reviewing big chain restaurants is pretty boring but nevertheless these guys deserve a praise. This is a solid Cheesecake Factory location. The place gets extremely packed after 6 p.m. Furthermore I came up with a formula, the guide to going out in the valley. If you want to grab dinner, have a good time and avoid screaming kids, jumping on top of your head do it before 6 p.m. Exactly at 6pm the gates of hell open up and most families pour out to restaurants. This is the time I run home screaming, shut my doors, cover windows, turn the lights off and roll on the floor crying how unfair the world is. Zombies are real. They are after your brain, they drink milk, throw things and scream uncontrollably.<br>Favorites at cheesecake? Definitely the Thai wraps but I usually replace chicken with seafood. See ya.

This is a great restaurant with a wide food variety. I ordered the Bellagio Chicken accompany with mashed potatoes and veggies. If you like chicken,  I definitely recommend this plate. Great portion size, excellent taste.I also want to say thank you to our waiter Bobby he gave such excellent service, very attentive and friendly. Not many people offer his level of service! Thank you for the birthday cake!

This is probably one of the worst experiences I&#39;ve had at a restaurant. I hate writing bad reviews but i just can&#39;t believe how things were handled. <br><br>Firstly i arrived just before 7 on a Sunday, so of course i was expecting a busy restaurant and a bit of a wait. They told us it would be about a 20-30 minute wait. We waited for about 15-20min when we noticed another family come and get their buzzer. <br><br>About 5 minutes after we were seated that family was seated a few tables from us. <br>That family got their food, and finished it before we got ours.<br><br>We waited over an hour for our meals, when i finally told the waitress to just make our order to go. Still waiting for our food, we got our check. They didn&#39;t even offer a discount at all. I asked to speak to a manager, explained the situation politely and how i was unhappy, and he said &#34;let me go find out where your food is.&#34; He came back a few minutes later and said &#34;isn&#39;t your food on your table&#34;<br>I followed him to my table where my friend sat with our to go food. The manager, i think his name was Vincent, took my bill while i went to ask how long the food had been there. It had just arrived. He charged our cards without apologizing or offering to make things better. <br><br>We&#39;re finally home now, with our food and the quality is terrible. The noodles are all stuck together with minimal sauce for my friends dish and the shrimp isn&#39;t the correct shrimp for her dish (she got breaded shrimp which is very soggy now, she did not want breaded shrimp.)<br><br>The manager did not handle this situation well at all. If he had offered even the cheesecake for free i would have been ok with this whole experience, but he didn&#39;t even offer an apology.
I don&#39;t even know if it deserves one star becaue after 10 min waiting for a table then 10 more minutes at table being ignored I just left

Always friendly, attentive service. Consistent food. Crowded with tiny tables squished together (but I guess that&#39;s what happens when you&#39;re the only restaurant with good service and good in the immediate vicinity).

Overall it was good... it wasn&#39;t amazing. Service was good. I know this is going to sound strange but this cheesecake doesn&#39;t taste the same as others I&#39;ve been to.... our service was really good! She was super sweet to my grandma! I forgot her name...

I&#39;m really disappointed with the host this evening, i came to celebrate my moms birthday and asked for a booth i was given a table, i know it isn&#39;t a big deal but when i told the host she was rude and yelled saying i did not ask for a booth. I&#39;m honestly shocked and surprised with the customer service. I was then greeted by the manager who said we would be seated in 30 more minutes, i was disappointed that my mom decided not to celebrate her birthday here due to how rude the host were. I would think with the location cheesecake would be more professional in how they train their employees. Thanks for ruining my moms birthday.

Food was fine, wait staff was fine. My issue is the UNETHICAL PRACTICE OF PRINTING THE SUGGESTED 15, 18, 20% TIP ON THE BILL. The problem with this suggestion of tip is based on the total which includes the tax. UNCLE SAM did not wait on me! This raises the amount the wait staff is tipped. <br>When I pointed this out to my waitress she immediately got defensive and snapped at me saying, &#39;it&#39;s only a suggestion, you can tip what you want.&#39; her attitude was not appreciated. <br>And for all of those mathematically challenged out there, you are actually tipping more than you think by taking for granted the amount printed on the restaurant bill as a &#39;suggestion.&#39;<br><br>Wow!!!  Thanks for the general computer generated reply. If my review was so important to you then perhaps you should have an actual person reading the reviews and actually addressing the content written!
Late night dinner with my friend .. under 550 calories .. really good .. service was good ..

If I could give one star I would, I came in asking for a booth, after waiting 40 min we were given a table not a booth. I explained to the server that we asked for a booth he walked us back to the front where we were yelled at saying I never asked for a booth: supper rude!! Then the manager walked and said we needed to wait more . I find it really rude  and unprofessional. The host were extremely mean and I won&#39;t be coming back to this location. Please don&#39;t come here they are supper rude!

Have probably tried almost everything on the menu here but don&#39;t worry it took me over 10 years to do it. The food is always tasty and the menu is never ending. However the prices are somewhat ridiculous sometimes so that&#39;s why I&#39;m giving it 4 stars and not 5

Went on Saturday night and had an absolutely horrible experience.<br><br>To start off with, our number was called but then, something happened and we ended up having to wait an additional 15 minutes? Okay, that&#39;s fine...let&#39;s move on <br><br>Next, we get to the table and we are told bread will be right out....20 minutes later, no bread. We ask our server and she&#39;s says &#34;I forgot sorry&#34;. The bread comes and we place our orders.<br><br>30 minutes go by, all table around us (came after us) are served their food, ours isn&#39;t coming...we ask our server, she says she&#39;ll check. She comes back and says that, somehow, she forgot to hit the &#34;send button&#34; on our order and it never went to the kitchen...but that she pushes it through and it will be &#34;expedited&#34;...uh...25 minutes later, out comes our food.<br><br>And...well...the food was awful. I had a buffalo chicken sandwich that had the tiniest bit of buffalo I&#39;ve ever seen. The breading was foul and the chicken was so rubbery that I honestly didn&#39;t want to eat it because I felt like it may make me sick.<br><br>At this point, we confront our server, tell her we&#39;ve had an awful experience and, instead of getting a manager, or giving us some kind of discount, she credits us a free slice of cheesecake...which absolutely no one at our table wanted. <br><br>I appreciate that our server owned her mistake and didn&#39;t, say, blame the kitchen...but the whole experience was awful: from front of house to back, host to server to kitchen. <br><br>Will certainly NOT be coming back to this location. Ever.

This Santa Monica location was a good place to have lunch.. too bad that their patio is not big enough to accomodate more ppl. The workers were all so nice and attentive (8/7 lunch)..food was good  and clean dining area

I tried to call &amp; place an order.  You cannot  get through.  All you get is a busy signal.   Placed an order on the internet.  But there was no way to choose certain things.  They gave me a 25 minute wait time.  I pulled up in front &amp; no one came over to my car.  Again, you call &amp; you cannot get through on the phone. So I parked &amp; went inside.  I got in there &amp; my food was not ready for another 50 minutes.  At least they somehow could not find it in all that time.  It was 110 degrees outside &amp; the manager tells me I&#39;m not allowed to wait inside the restaurant.  As I&#39;m dying of heat stroke outside in frustration I&#39;ve seen 20 door dash people go in &amp; out. I go back inside &amp; I get a text.  The food is ready.  The woman tells me it&#39;s been sitting waiting for me to pull in through the drive up area this entire time!!! What&#39;s going on Cheesecake Factory!!!!?   Get it together!!  I spent 120.00 on take out to leave feeling so extremely frustrated!!

Came in around 9:30pm for wife bday food was good but man service sucks. We get way better service at Carl&#39;s Jr. Waited for refills, no joke maybe 15 min we asked her for a refill and still nothing. Wife order a water and it came with some debri inside. We just asked for the check. Might not come any more. Leaving and our waiter is talk to employee at the pastries. No wonder we never got serviced correct.

Maybe it was our service from James, and his hillarious jokes, but whatever it was, something has changed in This location. <br><br>The recipes seem to be better. Even the ribeye I had was actually done perfectly at medium-rare.  <br><br>The Alfredo was not too thickly done, so you could really taste the compliment to the pasta, and all flavors meshed in. <br><br>The Farfalle with chicken and roasted garlic was actually really good.<br><br>The calamari, actually had flavor, other than just oil.<br><br>I&#39;m giving a 5 star, even though they were out of bread, due to a strike with their delivery company, which is usually my favorite part of going here.

I go to Cheesecake Factory in Woodland Hills usually and have an amazing experience every time I go. Today, unfortunately I went to the Sherman oaks location and had an awful experience. I walked in and it was not busy at all so the mistreatment was completely uncalled for. I was thrown a menu when I politely asked to see a Togo menu. The host was a complete nightmare. So much attitude and disrespect I was shocked at the way she was treating me. I spoke with a manager and I truly hope they deal with her behavior because it was completely uncalled for, unprofessional and rude.
