My service was just awful.<br><br>From the time we walked in to the time we left.<br><br>I am not sure if they&#39;re going through some struggling with management or what&#39;s going on but it was just a very bad experience and I&#39;m trying to give them the benefit of the doubt and give them a chance but every time has been horrible.<br><br>1.  The servers are rude and they act like they don&#39;t care. <br>2. The food is cold. The cheesecake tasted stale. <br>3. We got drinks and It was just full of ice so you take five sips and it&#39;s gone. <br>4. We got seated and waited over 15 minutes for someone to finally come to our table. ( i&#39;d rather not say who helped us so I&#39;m not blasting her on here) Drinks took another 15 minutes then food was another 20 minutes. <br>5. They look like some of them are just standing around and doing nothing. <br>6. The hostesses are gossiping about other coworkers about what they do after work. ( I rather keep it clean) <br> <br>I am not sure what have to change but usually have to do with management. In the past year has gone down the drain... I hope something will change.

Expectations always met: great drinks and great big portions.  You can&#39;t beat it.  You know what you&#39;re going to get.  (PS.  As Yelp&#39;ers, we like a little mystery and tend to go to boutique places)<br><br>* Bread &amp; Butter: It&#39;s free!  Amazing and usually warm, a dark bread (like squaw) and a baguette.  More please!?!<br><br>* Large menu / large food: Pages and pages of selections, and always leftovers.  Each plate is 2-3 portions.  My favs: Chinese Chicken Salad, Cajun Jambalaya Pasta, Famous Factory Meatloaf, Chicken and Biscuits, Orange Chicken, Chicken Marsala and Mushrooms, and Chicken .  Ultimate favorite?  Bang Bang Chicken &amp; Shrimp.<br><br>* Great appetizers: I nearly like the apps more than the food. Try the Parmesan-Garlic Cheese Bread, Avocado Eggrolls, Tex Mex Eggrolls, Ahi Carpaccio, and the Fried Calamari.<br><br>* Cheesecake: galore!  My favs are: Carrot Cake Cheesecake, White Chocolate Raspberry Cheesecake, Peanut Butter Chocolate Cake Cheesecake , Adam&#39;s Peanut Butter Cup Fudge Ripple Cheesecake, Snickers Bar Chunks and Cheesecake, but my absolute fav, Dutch Apple Caramel Streusel Cheesecake.  (note: I repeated the word &#34;Cheesecake&#34;, because I can&#39;t get enough of it.  Cheesecake!)<br><br>===========================<br>What makes this location unique?<br>===========================<br><br>* Valet parking: available.<br><br>* Part of the Sherman Oaks Galleria.  Convenient for before/after a movie at the Arclight.<br><br>* Wonderful patio: A front and side patio.  Front has sun with umbrella shades (over most) and heat lamps and the side totally in the shade.<br><br>* The wait: Always, but a lot less at this location as compared to others.  Sometimes, a little as 10 mins.<br><br>* Service: always nice, always well-trained.

I don&#39;t want to be &#34;that person&#34; but I can&#39;t not say it. I&#39;ve been to this location many times before and never had the service been this poor. Not only were my friend and I not offered any bread for at least half an hour after being seated but the food and drinks also took quite a while to be delivered. Listen, I don&#39;t expect everything to be done in a snap, that is simply unrealistic and irrational. However, I would think that the waiters are supposed to be at least slightly attentive. Nobody asked if our food was okay, I asked for ketchup and never received it, and when I was forced to get someone&#39;s attention for the bill, was greeted with an attitude from one of the workers as if asking for a bill is not common practice in literally every restaurant in any place in the world ever. <br><br>The food itself was good, no complaints there. The one redeeming quality for our waiter was that he at least recommended me a good cheesecake.

Happy hour review.<br><br>Happy hour is M-F 4-6PM<br><br>They have select beer, wine, well drinks, and cocktails for $5.95. They also have a large number of appetizers for $5.95 as well.<br><br>I was not expecting much, but I was pleasantly surprised that their happy hour drinks and food were much better than anticipated. The HH burger comes with 2 thin patties but very tasty. You can add a side of fries for $1.55. The nachos is a large portion of crispy chips with fairly flavorless cheese, but refreshing guacamole, sour cream, and tomatoes.  <br><br>Bar service was attentive and friendly. The bar area has plenty of bar seating and multiple, surrounding tables. <br><br>parking - 2 hours free with validation in the Galleria garage
We went in for an early dinner.  Was greeted with a smile.  Our server was great.  Funny, great dessert recommendations.  Will be back next time we are in town!!

Last night my husband and I came here and found a spot on the bar. We ordered drinks from the happy hour menu. I just have to recommend the &#34;J.W&#39;s pink lemonade&#34;- it&#39;s super good and delicious. The guys at the bar took a good care of us. Every drink that came out from the bar looked great. I will try the mai-tai on my next visit!

We love this place. Everytime we can go there and enjoy their good food and service. Last time we were there was for my 64th birthdayfather&#39;s day and our 36th wedding anniversary June 2020. I wish this &#34;nightmare &#34;be over soonso we can go back to eat.

This rating is for SERVICE. <br><br>We had an amazing waitress. Krysti was so kind, attentive, and went above and beyond in her service. This made our visit so memorable. Unfortunately, we were sitting next to a group of teenagers that were being, well, teenagers. Loud, random friends coming up to their table without a seat, lots of rude remarks about teens they hated at their school and such. Despite this, Krysti worked diligently around the distraction. She made sure we had water often and even shared her concerns about the heat and how important it was to stay hydrated. Overall, she went above and beyond to make our visit pleasant. <br><br>Dinner: I had the orange chicken, wasn&#39;t a fan. Packed most of it to go for my brother to enjoy. I&#39;ve had better orange chicken at fast food restaurants. My sister had the lasagna verde and absolutely loved it. <br><br>We ended our visit with the raspberry white chocolate cheesecake and were pleasantly surprised. It was great! However, the 2 huge servings of whip cream on one slice were a little unnecessary. <br><br>All in all, I would return for the service and the cheesecake. Maybe have dinner elsewhere prior to my visit.

This is by far my worst experience at The Cheesecake Factory EVER. Tonight I ordered the Steak Diane and Shrimp Scampi Combination. The steak was extremely dry for &#34;medium-rare&#34;, and the Shrimp was half cooked! If I wanted Sushi I would have went over to Benihanas instead. The waitress Kathy was amazing ! Too bad the food wasn&#39;t on point tonight ...

I love the food at the Cheesecake Factory.  Not just the cheesecake, which is amazing, but the food as well.  I bought gift certificates on Black Friday and went there last night to use one.  Our server Asal (not sure on the spelling) was great.  Pleasant, present, nothing but good things to say.  I tried something new, Truffle-Honey Chicken.  It was good but not amazing.  I&#39;ll try something else next time.  I took two slices of cheesecake home using my Slices of Joy and I&#39;m definitely looking forward to devouring them this weekend.  It was a good dining experience.  My only complaint is those giant plants on the way to the restrooms!  You haven&#39;t gotten rid of those yet?  A blind person can see that they are in the way.  I would love to meet the person in authority who thinks those are a good idea.

We were pleasantly surprised by the impeccable service we received today. She was just the right amount of friendly, happy, attentive, and professional. We don&#39;t really write reviews on chain restaurants, but our service today was worth noting! Myriam G thabkny

This place is the beating heart of the Sherman Oaks Galleria.<br><br>We were told on a Saturday night it would be an hour wait at 7pm.  <br><br>We went around to the other restaurants in the galleria to see if we had a better chance at eating sooner. The earliest we were told by PF Changs was the same. <br><br>We struck a little bit of luck at Buffalo Wild Wings where it would only take 45 minutes. So we trekked it over that way. We were being seated when our buzzer went off for the Cheesecake Factory. <br><br>We got up and went over in a split second.<br><br>Besides the wait...our dining experience was superb to say the least. <br><br>I loved their skinilicious menu that gave a variety of options from cocktails, appetizers, salads, to entrees. <br><br>I ordered their salmon dish on that menu and it was the perfect meal that I was craving for. <br><br>It was served with a perfection of green beans, carrots, and a side of tartar sauce. <br><br>The Cheesecake Factory definitely knows how to satiate your soul even on a skinilicious menu.

Hi! I can&#39;t find any way to email a manager at this location. I&#39;m starting a Sherman Oaks Bar/restaurant softball league and wanted to invite the Cheesecake peeps to play. I&#39;m the Boss Lady over at The Oaks Tavern. The plan is to play Sundays starting in July. Most likely 5 &amp; 6:30pm games. I have The One up, The Woodman, Casa Vega and poor sky Springbok too (even thought they&#39;re not quite Sherman Oaks :) let me know if you&#39;re interested? <br><br>Camila <br><br>818-371-3477

I love the Cheesecake Factory! This particular location is fantastic! Quite busy most of the time, but that&#39;s a good thing for the most part! I think they should make it a little bigger, cause they really pack the people in I must say. I&#39;m somewhat claustrophobic! Service is great, but can be slow at times, I think that&#39;s mainly cause they pack people in! But I tend to harp. Anyway I want cheesecake now!

Worst service ever.I came for  cheesecake and was making what I though was the line since it&#39;s so unorganized I couldn&#39;t really tell.Twice I asked where was the line both times no response from the bakery even though they were not busy.Then I saw 2 people who showed up 20 minutes after me just go up to the counter order and grab there food and go.I asked the the person at the register and he said he didn&#39;t even know where the line began and that it wasn&#39;t his problem.I went to talk to the manager and it was like talking to high school student didn&#39;t give a fuck at all.He just said go and make line d sorry about the people cutting.By this time the bakery was total mess.Never again will I bring my money to this restaurant.I don&#39;t like to say it was a race thing but being Hispanic they seem to always overlook us.Maybe had I been white the manager would have done his job and organized it.

I recently came back and I am so happy that things have changed. I have always really enjoyed coming to cheesecake and I am happy to report that my experience this time around was great. Everyone&#39;s was very attentive and kind, and the food was actually really good! I had the lasagna a must try.

Worst customer service!!! the manager is the rude person, very unfriendly, don&#39;t care about the customers!!!Don&#39;t spend your money you will not enjoy your dinner or lunch, Specially now due to COVID-19 they are very aggressive!!! I am not recommending this place to anybody else,  it&#39;s not the same like it was before don&#39;t waste your time!!!

For starters the wait was much longer than promised, which isn&#39;t uncommon for the Cheesecake Factory but a more realistic time frame would allow the customer to decide if they should stay or goThe young lady at the front desk was friendly but seemed confused about the seating sign up sheet.  Once seated, our Server Amanda was mediocre.  She could use a lesson in customer service!  Towards the end of our dinner, Amanda was due for her break so Bobby filled in for her.  He was better to deal with than Amanda.  <br><br>If I were to sum up my overall experience, the young man that picked up our dishes at the end of dinner was the most pleasant.  He even asked if we needed our parking ticket validated.  Good food, Great desert, just OK service!

What a great chain restaurant! Every time I go there I have the best service and I go to different location for we had exceptional service at this location this week. We ate outside on the patio and we were a large group. Antoine was our server, he was such a good salesman that everyone picked what he had recommended and everyone was happy with his pick. He made sure we got our food in a timely manner since we were on work lunch, and then we brought special little chocolate with ice cream desserts for the table to celebrate their restaurant anniversary, super nice touch! He was super friendly and attentive. One of guest brought her service dog and he brought water for the doggie. The manager came to check on us and I told him that we could not have had a better server. The food, the outside heaters, the attention, everything was perfect! Thank you!

I ordered a Spicy chicken chipotle pasta really long time ago from door dash the pasta costs $18.50. I thought I was going to get the large box and get same size meal they give you when you eat in the restaurant. They gave me half of what you get at the restaurant I am not sure if this was the lunch portion but what a waste I would of rather dined in the restaurant. I want to order again because I can&#39;t drive right now and pick up the food but I don&#39;t want to order a pasta that costs me almost $20 and they only give me half of what you can get at a restaurant.
Came here with my family can never go wrong with Cheesecake Factory the food is delicious and the service is great

Came here yesterday for lunch with my family. We had a very nice meal. Though it tends to get a bit busy here, our wait to get a table was about 15 minutes for four people. Our waitress came over to us in less than 5 minutes. We got our drinks and waited for the rest of the family to come. Everything we ordered was delicious. Our waitress always made sure to check on us. Always made sure we had what we needed and our cups were always refilled. It got so busy, it was hard to even get out of our table because so many people were waiting. So even though it took some time to get our food, I appreciate how efficient the staff, receptionist and kitchen staff stayed.

We were so disappointed... ordered the bang bang and it was lame lame... tasted so bland please tell whoever made the sauce was not sweet at all... drinks we&#39;re watered down waiter acted as if she didn&#39;t even want to work , if you like this location you obviously never been to any other location I&#39;m a regular at the location at the grove and after my experience here I&#39;ll<br>Make sure I won&#39;t ever come back
Place is nice but food isn&#39;t worth the price or good at all very disappointed utensils weren&#39;t clean serves not that well eaither

This is my favorite Cheesecake Factory where you have a choice to sit indoor or outdoor today we had a beautiful experience special thanks to our  waitress Connie thank you for the wonderful service you have provided to us food tastes great only thing I want Cheesecake Factory to discuss during their training is why the hell did they take out beef ribs lolol  please put it back on the menu

Bad experience with this location, it used to be my favorite place, last two visits horrible experiences. I made a reservation 24 hours in advance for 9 people, I was informed over the phone that no more than 6 people per table but that they would try there best to sit us &#34;close&#34;. The moment I arrived the hostess repeatedly stated, &#34;we told you there was no guarantee we will sit you together&#34;, I totally understand, but she made a great effort to sit us apart and across the room from each other. The table next to us had just sat down and still had menu&#39;s in there hands. It was my son&#39;s birthday that sat apart from us, our bill was almost $500 dollars not cheap, the hostess attitude rubbed off on the waitress, what a horrible experience. My boys are such gentlemen and just made the best of it and comforted me and reassured me it&#39;s okay mom, lets just have dinner make the best of it, have a good time we will be fine, let&#39;s just have dinner and go home. <br>The food was good as usual!!!
Nice clean has always love the staff good times great food can&#39;t go wrong with the Mac n cheese

I am not yelping about quality or flavor but I am more concerned about people&#39;s health. Consumption of undercooked chicken can lead to salmonella. Please pay attention to your chicken prior to eating.

I mean what&#39;s there to really say about Cheesecake Factory? Everyone knows it and loves it. It&#39;s a crowd pleaser considering that there&#39;s something on the menu for everyone. My personal favorites? Chicken bellagio pasta and Cajun Jambalaya over rice instead of pasta. Also that brown bread <br><br>This location is most definitely busier than most. It&#39;s located in the Center of the valley. I&#39;m always surprised when we get seated right away. I&#39;ve had mixed experience from awesome service to being completely ignored. It varies so much so you&#39;ll never know. <br><br>As far as parking, it&#39;s in the mall but they do validate! Make sure to bring your parking ticket.

Stupidity thrives here..I said 4 adults and a newborn in a stroller and they chose a table that only sits 4 with no room for a stroller and cited the reason why is we didnt say 5 and a stroller. How stupid you gotta be? Wasted 15 mins of my life looking for another table SMH <br>Waiter service and food was good lol

Only one star down for the bad service. Granted, we did come on a super busy night and at peak hour. We were seated immediately, however it was really hard to get a waiter to help us with things we needed. <br><br>I feel like Cheesecake Factory is just Cheesecake Factory - they&#39;re pretty consistent around all locations with flavors. I love their skinnylicious option - helps me weed out the menu for healthier things. I got the turkey, bacon, and avocado sandwich with a side salad. The vinaigrette the salad came with was great and the bacon was so crunchy and good! I loved the brioche bun as well. My boyfriend got the pizza style Chicken Parmesan and omg was it HUGE!!! I even got to have a couple bites and he took basically half home. The linguini was a great taste and the chicken was perfectly breaded and fried. Nothing to complain about!

Food is good, girls at cheesecake counter are rude, sloppy, and lazy. Makes sense that they are behind the counter not waitressing. Clearly don&#39;t care about their job, actually seems like they are miserable. Ruined my whole experience. I have like 4 yelp reviews all good but these girls where so rude I felt like writing about it. <br><br>I sent an email to the Cheesecake Factory regarding bad service and flies on my food, the manger asked me to call him, all he did was apologize. Doesn&#39;t really do anything when you spent 200$ and had flies everywhere and bad service. Big waste of my time calling him back. Also got laughed at by the girl on the phone because she thought I was calling the wrong number. Super unprofessional and an apology is nice but I definitely will not be spending 200$ there again. Defiently not at this location at least.

First time visiting this location. I have always been a Cheesecake Factory fan! I got here around 3pm on a Sunday and it was still super busy, but I was able to snag a spot at the bar. Service was ok, didn&#39;t have anyone greet me for 10 minutes and I found it odd they bring our your check as soon as you place your order. Makes you feel rushed a little. I had the brown bread before my meal, I can never eat just a piece lol. I ordered the bbq chicken salad off the lunch menu for my entree, it was good as always. Knocking off 1 star for the service, overall it was still a good experience.

Busy location like all other Cheesecake factories. We waited over an hour for first available during the dinner rush, No shocker here...<br>So we pass the time by shopping across the way at Urban Home. <br><br>Dont forget to validate your ticket and pay prior to walking to your car.

We love to at The Cheesecake Factory  but this location is the worst we have been. Usually we eat at Topanga Westfield Mall or at Santa Monica Promenade.  They have the best customer service, the great servers and the food is delicious!! But at Sherman Oaks Gallery it&#39;s totally waist of time and disappointment... As soon we seat, our server took our orders and dissapeared for a 20 minutes. We haven&#39;t even received any bread &amp; butter while we were waiting for our dishes. I call to some other server and ask can we get at least a bread, we very hungry and it&#39;s take time to get our dishes.  He went to check and when he back he said &#34; Oh..there&#39;s no bread yet, it&#39;s not ready &#34; and walk away.  Seriously? our server couldn&#39;t say it to us earlier?  Then our server came back and said she&#39;s need to go on her break and introduced to us other server until she&#39;ll back. Thus server ask what bread we prefer like white or dark.  We replied &#34; Dark&#34; he said ni problem and brought us the White...interesting isn&#39;t?   <br>We continue to wait another 20 minutes and finally got our food. My daughter ordered dish  that&#39;s usually comes with chicken &amp; vegetables.  She ask exclude the chicken this time. <br>I ordered Fettuccine Alfredo pasta. At my daughter huge plate was only hardly any vegetables, even for the kids menu even comes more...and my pasta wasn&#39;t even ready to eat, half cooked, the pasta partially has sticky together and not even cooked.  We called to our server and said if they can replace this dish, it&#39;s impossible to eat. The server said ok and call his supervisor.  The supervisor lady was very nice at the beginning, she  apologized to us and took the plate by replace for a  new dish.  After 7 minutes they bring me a new plate. On this plate looks like less pasta and more creamy liquid dressing..well ok ..I start to eat and it&#39;s was  better then the first time..and when I tried to take another bite, again was same sticky uncooked pieces of pasta. So they didn&#39;t brought me a different dish...it was same dish, they just tried to remove uncooked pieces but missed of few of them..that&#39;s why it&#39;s looked like more less pasta and more like a soup. In this point I lost my appetite..we called to same lady supervisor and showed her same problem..I asked her to take it back and just remove it from my bill. This time she wasn&#39;t nice..make face and said &#34; I&#39;ll see what I can do..&#34; and walk away.  She never came back to us. Professional ..isn&#39;t? After 10 minutes we saw our previous server that back from her break and asked for the check.   <br>She brought us the check and walk away. The did removed the charges of my dish but before they removed it, on the check showed that&#39;s my dish has double charges, like I have been extra charge for the same dish. Unbelievable!! Sherman Oaks location, practically the center of Ventura Blvd and that&#39;s a staff that&#39;s working there??  For sure this the last time we ever go to eat here!

This is the only cheesecake factory ive been to that hasnt managed to mess up my experice, so im here to rave about it. Every time ive visited this location, they manage to sit us down in a decent amount of time, the food is good, and the waiters and overall service is good. Im gonna simply stop trying at other locations and continue coming here instead. Great service!

Cheesecake Factory is always good, and my favorite is the complimentary bread<br><br>They have a huge selection of food and cocktails. The pasta is always my go-to!!! I think I&#39;ve  gotten every pasta dish on the menu and I&#39;ve liked every single one. This time, I got the lunch portion Fettuccine Alfredo. It was delicious, of course. Even though it was a lunch portion I wasn&#39;t able to finish it and saved the rest for dinner. That&#39;s what normally happens since pasta is so heavy. <br><br>In my opinion, you can&#39;t go wrong with going to Cheesecake for lunch or dinner!

I used to love Evelyne&#34;s Favorite Pasta, created by one of the founders of Cheesecake Factory. Then it disappeared off the menu. Today I saw it had reappeared. Hooray! However, I was so disappointed. It was nothing like the original which was so full of vegetables set in an olive oil and pasta base. The one I got today had very few vegetable, no artichoke ( a very visible part of previous versions and still listed in the ingredients on-line), 1 pine nut 4 pieces of eggplant about a 1/2 inch square, and some broccoli. It was served with spaghetti (not the bow tie pasta of the original) in a tomato sauce base. It was yucky. I have made the original myself from on-line recipes and this was nothing like it. I will to go back if this is what they are serving.

How does this place have three stars? The drinks are mis proportioned, the cheesecakes are usually old leftovers, and 95% of the time the waiter or waitress has gotten my order wrong. Either there is little to no communication between the cooks and the servers or this is just a poorly run establishment. The food is horrendous here. Just because you give huge portions the food is not well made. It&#39;s a rip off and so sad to see the quality of this establishment go down. If you ask your server any questions regarding ingredients and vegan options they have no clue as I&#39;m pretty sure over half the staff is part time seasonal or uneducated on the menu.

I don&#39;t know what&#39;s going on with all these 1 star reviews in the month of December for service.  Seems a little odd to me.  Anyway, we were there on 12/7 for dinner with friends before a movie.  We made reservations and were seated on time. <br><br>Server came over and took drink orders and circled back in a reasonable time.  We weren&#39;t ready, however, and asked for him to come back and he did.  He was polite throughout.  <br><br>He was going on break and introduced us to the woman who was going to take over and our food came out hot and on time.  Everyone enjoyed their food.  I had the Branzino which was slightly disappointing as it was too heavy of a butter sauce and the fish was a tad fishy.  You can order it without anything on the Skinny menu but that&#39;s not exactly the way I get it either.  Maybe I&#39;ll order the skinny version next time and ask them to drizzle a little olive oil on it.  Hopefully they find a happy medium. (BTW - very happy they are offering some other type of seafood other than shrimp and salmon as that were the only real options until recently.)<br><br>We got our bill on time and made the movie on time.  So not sure if we were the exception or the rule, but we enjoy this Cheesecake Factory as it is consistently good and doesn&#39;t get in the way of our movie night.

I&#39;m a big fan of Cheesecake Factory.  Always have been.  But man, did this location let us down...and on Christmas Eve!  BAHUMBUG!<br><br>So many things went wrong that night.  We allotted 2 hours to eat before our movie because we figured everyone would be trying to do the same thing on Christmas Eve -- dinner and a movie.  First, we checked in with the hostess who offered us two options:  Get seated right away on the heated patio or 15-20 min wait for inside.  I wanted inside but got vetoed by my friends to sit outside with the heater because they were hungry.  Ok.  I ran to the bathroom but when I came back, our table was outside, but with NO HEATERS.  Huh?  There are only 2 little heaters, one on one side and one on the other, but none for the tables in between.  My friends wanted to brave the cold (like I said they were hungry), but I decided to ask the hostess.  So I went back and overheard her offering the same options to someone else so I chimed in and said &#34;there&#39;s no heaters on the patio, be prepared.&#34;  That person thanked me and opted for inside lol.  The hostess then informs me that we were seated on the &#34;side patio&#34; but the &#34;main patio&#34; has heaters.  Ummm, why weren&#39;t we seated there initially?  But ok, fine whatever we moved tables.  All seemed better now, right?  Well......<br><br>Our server was very nice but we are pretty sure he forgot to put in our order.  We didn&#39;t care, we didn&#39;t say anything because we had plenty of time before our movie, but then a manager came over and started apologizing for our meal delay.  Then, the server comes over and says he thinks the delay was because they didn&#39;t have any veggie burgers (which of course was my order).  I said if you had told me that I would have happily change to something else, but he said not to worry they fixed it now.  (Sounds suspicious, we still think he never put in the order).  Another 10 min go by, still no food and when they finally do deliver food, it&#39;s from another server and he delivers my veggie burger, my friend&#39;s turkey burger, but not my other friend&#39;s salmon.  Server #2 said he didn&#39;t realize there was more to the order.  HUH?  So again we wait longer while they try to come up with something.  Server #1 is nowhere to be found, as is the manager.  Finally the food arrived, ours was now not as warm, but whatever, it&#39;s Christmas, beggars can&#39;t be choosers.<br><br>After all that, nothing was comped on our bill, not even an offer of a free slice of cheesecake for all of the hassle.  We are not the types to try and get a free meal, but the fact that nothing was offered and no real apology was offered after all of that didn&#39;t sit well with us.<br><br>At the end of the day, the whole ordeal took exactly 2 hours so we made it to our movie juuuuust in time but I will never visit that location again.  I think P.F. Chang&#39;s is also open on Christmas Eve so we will try that instead next time.

RIP Cheesecake Factory :( <br><br>Came here for a quick bite. Ordered old classics, Buffalo Blast and Cesar Salad. Salad was drowning in dressing and the buffalo blast was so salty it turned bitter in the mouth. Sent the buffalo blast back incase just that round had been messed up, but no, the entire batch was ruined. Ordered a cheesecake with strawberries, and am I crazy or were their slices kinda generous before? I got a tiny slice like the kind you get from Vons. Shame shame shame.  <br><br>The server was friendly but what&#39;s the point of friendly servers in a restaurant when the food is garbage?

This review is regarding how baby friendly they are. I went in with my baby and I was told to put my car seat in the booth rather than keeping him in his stroller with his car seat attached so I can put my stroller away. I placed it between a window and a small hallway. Not to mention I was by myself so I had to leave my child unattended. Apparently I wasn&#39;t the only one there with a stroller as I placed my folded stroller next to another stroller. As I was leaving yet again I had to leave my child unattended and there was a handicap scooter and my stroller was all the way towards then end. It was very difficult for me to get to my stroller let alone get it out of there. No one offered to help me both times needless to say I won&#39;t be coming back!

I placed my name on the waiting list, they told me 30minute wait time and we stayed. After 30 minutes they called us and took us to a seat all the way to a corner kids running around the table felt like a play ground. before even sitting down i asked if they could change our seat. I was told you need to go back to the front dest so we did. At the front counter she tells me its either that table or you have to wait another 30minutes.<br><br>I waited just like everyone else. Why do i need to wait another 30minutes and be placed on the bottom of the list?!?!?<br>No thank you we gave the menus back and left. Thank you for waisting our time.

I usually know what I&#39;m getting myself into when it comes to The Cheesecake Factory and my standards are generally lowered when I walk into chain restaurants, but everything was a bit off the day I came in. The server was nowhere to be found on many occasions and the drinks weren&#39;t that good either. I had to send the El Diablo drink back because it honestly tasted like a torture device for the lowest levels of hell. <br><br>As for the food I can&#39;t say I was pleased either other than the bread. One thing that The Cheesecake Factory always does well is their bread. Seriously one of the best things about this place. <br><br>As appetizers we had the Buffalo Blast that was honestly way too oily and the worst part it wasn&#39;t too flavorful either. My entree was the Louisiana Chicken Pasta and it was so bland that I was pouring the buffalo sauce from the appetizer over it to give it any kind of flavor.

To start off mine and my wife service here  was AMAZING!!! The employees are very friendly here and the food was great as well. Me and my wife shared a pineapple upside down cheese cake and man on man that was like heaven on earth so delicious I had to take some to go... will be definitely coming back for date night

I have been an avid supporter of this franchise for nearly 30 yrs.  This location, Sherman Oaks, has the absolute worst service ever received.  Been waiting 1.5 hours for food, and my only reservation in speaking to management is that I don&#39;t want to ruin the family dinner.  Several tables were ready for closing adjusting them for 6, yet we waited and extra 30 minutes to be seated.<br><br>If you have time to waste, eat here, if your family is hungry after church, do not consider this establishment.  Shameful service.

I came here last week with my husband because we got a gift card and I absolutely love the cheese cake factory there food is really good! I had the skinny menu which I ordered the shrimp and garlic angel pasta only 500 calories and I loved it.. it was so good the bread is so delicious (love the brown bread so tasty) my waitress was really nice and so was my server. My husband had the jambalaya plate and it was so much food he enjoyed it! Very delicious too! And along with that he had 3 beers now when. My waitress left for the day the one that took over wasn&#39;t really all that great of a server. But what can I say it wasn&#39;t a busy day and we got served pretty fast!  Will be coming back again!
Me and my son went to BDay dinner last night. He love Stake and Mac&amp;cheese. I love ahi tuna tataki with wine. My son was enjoyed food there. They make us BDay dinner special. Thank you

We came here this past Friday night for dinner.  The restaurant itself was super packed full of people waiting to be seated so we opted to sit at the bar.  Luckily there were seats available.  The bartendar had warm bread brought over to our table while we looked over the menu.  Drinks ordered were the Chardonnay, and vodka/cranberry.  For our entrees I decided on the Chicken Medera-Sautéed Chicken Breast Topped with Fresh Asparagus and Melted Mozzarella Cheese. Covered with Fresh Mushroom Madeira Sauce and Served with Mashed Potatoes, this dish is really popular because it is OH SO GOOD!!!  I&#39;m getting hungry just typing this!  The Louisiana Chicken Pasta was also ordered-Parmesan Crusted Chicken Served Over Pasta with Mushrooms, Peppers and Onions in a Spicy New Orleans Sauce.  I should have asked for a bite but I was too busy with my face in my plate! lol  The feedback was that it was a tasty dish!

The chicken madera was a tad dry and the chicken could have used a more sauce or a tastier sauce,  grand lux chicken madera is way better tasting and cooked to perfection, the egg rolls were a little soft, it arrived later and the food was cold. But over all it&#39;s not best or worst place for a quick local bite

It&#39;s a nice American establishment well known for big tasty portions. Usually the service here is decent even though they are always busy/ super busy. <br><br>However today was the exception: the appetizers never came! We got the main dish after waiting for about half an hour. The girl who brought the food had no knowledge of our appetizers. When we were half way through our meal our waitress came over and asked if we got the appetizers, even though we already canceled those. She never even said sorry for the mess .... it&#39;s really disappointing to see that kind of careless attitude. <br><br>The food was nice :)

I rarely ever write reviews. So if I am going out of my way to write this review, it&#39;s because it was TERRIBLE. I wish I could give a zero star for their HORRIBLE customer service and unethical portions for the price they charge. This location SUCK! I am a frequent cheesecake buyer from Cheesecake Factory and I bought 2 slices of cheesecake and paid close to $19. One of them was extremely small and covered in a ton of whip cream to bypass the size that was given and when complained and brought to their attention the manager named Christie or Christine or whoever was extremely dismissive and said &#34;sorry can&#39;t do anything, it looks like you took a bite out of it.&#34; It was so obvious the slice was so small but the person in charge didn&#39;t care at all. I wonder how Cheesecake Factory hire people like this for customer service. As a frequent buyer, I am extremely disappointed and going to start either going to SusieCakes or Sweet Lady Jane for cake. Definitely not going back to this location and do not recommend anyone to go here. <br><br>I have been to this specific location 50+ times over the years. Never have I made a complaint despite their extremely bland food and the one time I did due to their unusual portion size of cheesecake, they didn&#39;t care at all. <br><br>I hope if they see this review, they really take into note to get rid of people like Christie who is extremely dismissive and rude as a person who handles customer service. VERY disappointed and I feel very bad the way she handled the situation. <br><br>Definitely lost a loyal customer.

Hibiscus martini for the win!! I came her cuz my friend had a gift card.. Not a big lover of the food but the drinks are awesome! I ordered the well mannered dirty martini #extradirty and the hibiscus martini.. <br>Well mannered was a lil too well mannered, when I say dirty thats what I mean! Not enough olive juice but the three blue cheese stuffed olives made up for the strong alcohol flavor.. Kinda rough but got the job done.. <br> Hibiscus martini was absolutely delicious!! It&#39;s on the sweeter spectrum if you like that, but it was by far the Star of the night! We couldn&#39;t get seats, so we had drinks while waiting and by the time we were done, 45 min later- there still weren&#39;t any available so we grabbed a slice of cheesecake to go and headed over to Public School!

This Cheesecake Factory location was my childhood favorite. The wait was 45-75 minutes, even back then, and we&#39;d walk around Tower Records to kill time. Side note: RIP, Tower Records. In addition to a sourdough bread binge, I would order the chicken potstickers, children&#39;s pasta (bowties with just butter!) and the chocolate mousse cheesecake... every time. Don&#39;t fix what isn&#39;t broken, amIright?<br><br>Well, years and years later, the Cheesecake Factory is still standing and still delivering delicious food. The wait is either terrible or nonexistent, and I haven&#39;t yet figured that part out. Sunday brunch isn&#39;t crowded, though, so there&#39;s that.<br><br>Nowadays, I&#39;m still binging on sourdough bread. I&#39;ve since moved on to the Pasta Da Vinci -- hold the onions, swap out the chicken for extra mushrooms. I&#39;ll also order an appetizer of some sort -- perhaps the chicken potstickers, quesadilla, avocado egg rolls(!) or fried calamari. <br><br>They didn&#39;t have the &#34;small plates&#34; section way back when, and those are delicious... but quite small. Loaded baked potato tots, crispy crab bites, and ahi tartare are my picks. They are small, though, and not quite worthy of sharing.<br><br>I always save room for dessert whenever possible, but I usually end up taking it home. The cheesecake varieties have boomed (as have the prices) and I&#39;ve fallen in love with something new every so often. I recommend the dulce de leche caramel, the caramel pecan turtle, the salted caramel, the white chocolate raspberry truffle, or the white chocolate caramel macadamia nut cheesecake... Notice a pattern? ;) <br><br>Note: The cheesecakes are VERY sweet and VERY rich. I can&#39;t take in that much sugar in one sitting, so I recommend sharing and taking the slice home.<br><br>The restaurant validates, so don&#39;t forget to turn over your ticket to the server. They don&#39;t have machines lying around for you to do it yourself.

The Cheesecake Factory is somewhere you want to go to dine on high end chain restaurant food. With literally pages and pages of options to choose from, you can always find something new to try. What&#39;s great is though their menu may be large, they certainly craft all items very well. <br><br>This afternoon I ordered the full-sized Fish and Chips with a side salad. I&#39;ve ordered the lunch size before, and I have to admit that I didn&#39;t notice much of a difference in portion size. If I were to order the same thing again, I may just go for the cheaper lunch option every time. Though I did enjoy my meal overall, I will say that the flavor was lacking a bit in the fish. I&#39;d rather it speak for itself than having to smother it with tartar sauce to get any flavor. For dessert I ordered the Adam&#39;s Peanut Butter Cup cheesecake. Coated with peanut butter cream, butterfingers, chocolate, and more, it was enough to send anyone into a diabetic coma. Delicious!<br><br>Our server was polite, friendly, and had several recommendations of his favorite dishes. He certainly made things easy and enjoyable. And they validate parking here, too, which is always great. The Cheesecake Factory always has a special place in our hearts. I would gladly return here again in the future.

Went here yesterday for a to go cheesecake. I walked end it was 11:30 pm. Not busy at all. Not one person greeted me. Then I stood there for 5 minutes trying to figure out if someone was going to help me. Eventually someone helped me. Once again it wasn&#39;t busy and I asked for no whipped cream and they still gave me whipped cream. The staff was so busy talking within themselves no one even paid attention to the guests.

I enjoy the menu and today noticed &#34;gluten free by request&#34; tags. I decided to indulge. Thanks Daniel for en exquisite service of the perfect combination of wit and efficiency! <br><br>Oh my goodness my friend&#39;s bun-less hamburger looked fantastic and my friend said it was one of their all time favorite burgers. Cheesecake burgers... who knew?<br><br>Can&#39;t wait to try it next time.

It is now Wednesday, the following week, and nothing has been done. I really hope this place gets shutdown. <br><br>DO NOT GO HERE! My daughter had her 12th birthday dinner here last night. A party of 14 people &amp; 14 people got sick. The service was absolutely awful. It took us 35 minutes to place a drink order. My brother ordered his favorite brown tequila &amp; the waitress brought out a clear shot in a shot glass. When brought to her attention that this was not the drink ordered, she first argued it was and that she confirmed with the bar, once explained the color difference she admitted she didn&#39;t know the type of alcohol and brought the one she figured would do. My brother had to walk to the bar and find the alcohol requested. The food tasted like a combination of left overs from other tables. Every guest at this dinner has gone to Urgent Care due to stomach issues. This is absurd to say the least. Check out CNBC&#39;s article about this restaurant. NEVER AGAIN! I wish I read the article first. It&#39;s bad enough it&#39;s the unhealthiest food in America, the service is sh*t, and the food takes like sh*t. I will make sure to let everyone and anyone know this place is not worth considering.

I love Cheesecake Factory..... unfortunately this place is not great. I ordered bistro pasta and  shepherds pie and mind you I asked what the difference in portions from the full plate said not big difference. That being said the pie was really like they made the order had it out for the day and literally took one order and split into two take out containers. On top of that the potatoes was already hard, beef was in mini meatballs and wasn&#39;t soft , which means someone ordered and never picked up? Awfully disappointed. Oh and they didn&#39;t even give me bread that&#39;s suppose to come with the meal. Food wasn&#39;t even hot and I picked up at estimated pick up 10 mins after. The desserts was great though. I&#39;ll make the extra drive to go to the Woodland Hills, which was my first choice but since this was closer ......<br>Should&#39;ve read the reviews before wasting this expensive lunch for my family.

I love The Cheesecake Factory but will never go back to this location. Yesterday was Mother&#39;s day and my husband tried making it special by ordering from here. Although we understand its hectic being Mothers day and going through Covid 19. It was a disaster. My order was wrong I got rice instead of mashed potatoes. When my husband went back to the waitress, she said it was because they had run out of the  mashed potatoes. It happens, I understand. However, it would have been common courtesy to give us a heads up. Or at least let us choose another side. She was rude to my husband. She him know that even if he ordered mashed potatoes there was nothing that could be done because the whole entire restaurant was out. That was unnecessary. At the end of it all I was embarrassed and felt guilty for asking my husband to buy food from there.

Still wondering why I keep coming to this location when I want to have something for take out.  <br><br>Just seems the customer service at the pick up counter is not kind and overworked.  Maybe some of these employees need to take an etiquette class. <br><br>It&#39;s been a couple of months and still get the same type of attitude, which there would be improvement

Do not come here if you expect the correct food. They constantly get the wrong order. Either it&#39;s a completely different dish, or a key ingredient is not included. If they have to remake it, that&#39;s another 10 minutes added to the 20 you already waited after ordering. The quality of food is not worth the wait. There are plenty of other places to eat. Bonus: attached is a photo of a water glass that is definitely not clean.

I love Cheesecake Factory in general! Everything was good. They even brought us more bread when we finished the first round. Everything tasted good and the service was good. Water refills more often would have been nice, but it wasn&#39;t too bad.

The single worst restaurant experience of my life. As someone who eats out for 99% of my meals, this says a lot. Truly a god awful horrible service by a mismanaged and highly untrained staff. Rude and petty is just the beginning of their shortcomings. The food was literally inedible and my entire party got violently sick from the cardboard they disguised as a meal. The &#34;waitress&#34; couldn&#39;t even string together a sentence as she tried to explain why she purposely brought out the wrong drinks because &#34;she didn&#39;t know the difference&#34; between vodka or tequila? A downright vile and awful experience all while trying to celebrate my 11 year olds birthday. All I can say is never again. And I will do my best to make sure no one makes the terrible decision to patronize this... restaurant? I&#39;m not even sure what to call it because it&#39;s definitely not food they are serving.

For a big chain restaurant they still keep it classy and delicious. I love their menu because they have a great selection. <br>I&#39;ve been here a couple of times and I&#39;m always happy. <br>Last time we were there Antoine was our server and he was very friendly and attentive. <br>Good food &amp; good service - you can&#39;t go wrong.

From classic favorites like Pizza and burgers, to specialty meat dishes- and inspired from cultures all across the board, it&#39;s hard to go wrong. <br><br>Food: Definitely go with the Avocado Rolls and Fried Calamari for your starters, and they also serve up two types of bread + butter for the table. Their main courses are usually very good, my favorite dish is definitely the Da Vinci Pasta because the sauce is SO tasty- the chicken is usually a little dry though so I recommend subbing for shrimp. My most recent trip I ordered the steak tacos- I was with a large party and I know they like to bring out food all together- but my steak was cold, like just made It out of the fridge, cold. Their Chinese Chicken Salad is really good too, big portion, I would ask for half the dressing or dressing on the side. <br><br> Service: I do think that the servers here are above par of a normal restaurant, as you&#39;d hope they be considering their locations are usually huge, to match their huge and probably very difficult to remember, menus. Our server took off my steak tacos and comp&#39;d us a dessert for the inconvenience. *PRO TIP- they won&#39;t sing happy birthday and make a scene if the BIRTHDAY person doesn&#39;t agree to it...*

Every single star is for the food. Service is 0 stars. <br><br>You have to give it to them. Service is slow and you won&#39;t feel relevant here. But the food is consistently good. And the huge variety makes it a good choice for a group that can&#39;t decide. <br><br>So if you can deal with really slow service (bordering on rude at times), then just go and enjoy the food.

I&#39;ve mentioned in other reviews that I&#39;m not a big chain restaurant fan this is one of the exceptions. all the locations I&#39;ve been to have had consistently good food. I&#39;m a huge fan of the cobb salad. Any place that makes a salad that I can&#39;t finish unless I&#39;ve been fasting for a month is fine by me. <br><br>The staff&#39;s always been attentive and friendly they seem generally happy to be there which is nice. The waiter made sure I carb loaded before the film I was seeing afterwards by keeping the bread, which is fantastic, coming. I would say this is my favorite of all the restaurants at the galleria

This place has gone down hill. One of the worst locations I&#39;ve ever been too. Ordered the appetizer pretzel bites and the pretzel were burnt and the cheese sauce was the consistency of soup. Our waiter called over the manager after I asked if the cheese was supposed to be runny (she didn&#39;t know). The manager came over and said that&#39;s the only cheese they had and the reason it was runny was because they only made one serving and not a big batch...umm, what? Why even serve me something if you can&#39;t prepare it correctly? Just tell me, hey we&#39;re sorry we don&#39;t have this prepared can I bring you something else? The manager also had an undertone of an additude when I told her I didn&#39;t want it. Will not be coming back to this location.
I just dropped a star. CF asked me to contact them so I did. I received a response apologizing for the Pretzel Bites not having been prepared correctly. We didn&#39;t order Pretzel Bites!!!!!!!!

Today is my 21st birthday, one of the most memorable ages of our lives. I come, greet the server, etc. My GF tells them it is my birthday after we order our drinks. He says, &#34;Oh Wow. Finally legal (very dry).&#34; Then he carries on. After that, I hear nothing from him, he zooms by us, my water was not refilled once by him. <br>So I try telling another nearby server about my birthday. She turns around and just says, &#34;Okay. Tell your server.&#34; No appreciation of the customer. I do not like this. However, the food was delicious, as expected! <br>Poor, poor customer service.

Great place to eat with family. Yelp is nuts there not filtering the right reviews. This place is awesome and they deserve 5 stars all year round. Everybody makes mistakes and it&#39;s our job to forgive and keep people happy.

I am not someone that really leaves reviews but this is a bit ridiculous. I ordered the shrimp scampi and I guess they forgot to add sauce to my pasta. The little bit of splattered sauce you see below is all of the sauce. There is absolutely none under the noodles. Just a pile of dried plain noodles.
Always good, sometimes great! Very busy. Wonderful  service. I love the Miso Salmon. My girl and I always enjoy their vast variety of tasty large salads. Really big menu. Well worth the wait.

I came here with my family for a late birthday party and had a great time! The service was phenomenal, I really liked our server Myriam G. She checked on us often and made sure we were pleased with everything which we were! I ordered the Chicken New Orleans Pasta which had a delicious creamy spicy sauce and it was topped with chicken Parmesan which was cooked well. My father loves their hamburgers here as well, the meat looks well cooked and delicious. I would definitely come here again!!

I went in tonight and ordered a gin mule before getting dinner the waitress VERONICA brought me a Moscow mule which wouldn&#39;t have been a big deal because I told her I tasted the vodka and asked her to change it she gives me attitude grabs my drink and comes back quickly with a &#34;new&#34; drink saying it&#39;s a gin mule the drink was the same exact one I could tell because I had taken a few sips to be sure it wasn&#39;t gin like I asked she comes up with some story saying sorry the bartender had made two and handed me one of them and she thought it was gin but this apparently was a different drink and it was clearly vodka but kept telling me it was a gin mule when we got our bill I got the proof that she put into the order Moscow mule how hard would it have been to get me the drink I asked for nicely rather than give me attitude for your mistake and lie to me about bringing me a &#34;new&#34; drink worst service I&#39;ve ever gotten to date don&#39;t go here! I also ordered evelynes favorite pasta because it was one of the only vegetarian options besides a salad which we had for an appetizer and it was dry undercook and tasteless never again will I go here This is why I haven&#39;t stepped foot in Cheesecake Factory for 5 years and should&#39;ve stayed away tonight but oh well..:::

I was very disappointed in the manager that was on duty for new year day! My boyfriend and I came to have a few things for Happy hour around 430, they told us the wait is going to be 40-45 mins, while we were waiting for our table we stood near the bar area until 4:55 bcuz it&#39;s first come first serve for high tops and bar only. <br><br>So we waited aside for a bit while a table got their check and realized some old couple was lingering at the bar with one chair.. but see the server said it&#39;s best to hang on the side so we are not havering.. as soon as those people left I&#39;m waking up and here comes this older white couple that were sooo f$&amp;@ing rude saying that this is their table.  I was like what how we are waiting on the side wayyyy before you even walked into the cheesecake and all the manager said was I&#39;m not going to argue who was here first but ill accommodate happy hour with a. Regular table (which wasn&#39;t the issue) how they just took the table without even noticing others were waiting.. honestly the couple was so disrespectful. We even asked the server and bus boy and the old man was like he doesn&#39;t even speak English.. racist prick and asshole.. honestly f$&amp;@ this cheesecake and that manager was wrong for not standing up for who was right. I&#39;m very disappointed  cuz the food wasn&#39;t even that great.

Everybody knows this place. Who doesn&#39;t love cheesecake. But just because you have cheesecake doesn&#39;t mean you score 5 stars, Ceesecake Factory!<br><br>When you are keeping people waiting in a crowded lobby for well over an hour with nothing to do but stare at a glass case full of salted caramel cheesecake, toasted marshmallow smores gallore cheesecake, lemon raspberry cheesecake, chocolate mousse cheesecake, and oreo dream deluxe cheesecake, that costs you a star. <br><br>When your meal is cold and dried out that costs you another star. <br><br>And when you have to rush your meal so that you can make it to your movie on time, you lose yet another star.<br><br>Yes the food is cheap and yes the portions are huge but let&#39;s be honest. The only reason for going here is for that wonderful, beautiful, cheesecake. The thing that cheeses me off the most is that we didn&#39;t have enough time for cheesecake.

great service, great cocktails and great deserts.  now the food...everything was too salty!!  appetizers pot stickers too salty, garlic shrimp salty but pasta was fine, skinnylicious asian chicken salad too damm salty.  i&#39;ve had their lentil soup here and too salty. such a beautiful morning place and location too bad their chefs are heavy handed with the salt instead of real fresh flavor.  you mean who has ever heard of a salty salad??

I don&#39;t know why this place smells so bad!! The tables smell like an old washcloth. Wash and change your table cloths please!! I was nauseas the whole time. And my food took 45+ min to come out. Bad experience

If i had to describe my experience at Cheesecake tonight it would be rude and not okay. I had a cheesecake mistake and when i went to the cheesecake bar area where they put the cheesecake on plates. I asked if i could please get my cheesecake so i can leave being that i had been waiting 5 minutes after my waitress had handed them the piece i didnt want and told them which piece i needed instead. When i went to ask about it i was greeted with rudness and hostility. As someone who works in food there is no reason for anyone to treat a customer that way. Even after i spoke to the manager in person to explain what had happen i had to wait a bit more for my cheesecake before actually leaving. After i left i called to speak the manager Richard so i could explain what happen in more detail and how i was treated. Another person picked up the phone even though i had asked specifically for the manager and only the manager. This person is the same person who was rude to me while i was there. While on the call all that was being said was that he was sorry and was going to coach them on it. He also proceeded to explain that had the person behind the counter gave me the cake i asked for without speaking to him first would be considered stealing and qualify for termination(this person was not at fault for this so i found this ridiculous). The call with the manager was to say the least not helpful in any way. For those who need to get cheesecake from the cheesecake bar area good luck.

Giving this place 5 Stars because of our server, Jack M. <br><br>He was really cool about our big table even when we went from 12 to 15 people which can be pretty tricky, but he accommodated us by adding another table next to us that was empty. <br><br>He was attentive af, always asking us for refills and taking care of our late arrivals when they got to their seats. Not only that, he bagged our leftovers quickly and literally took everyone&#39;s parking ticket to validate it at the host stand.<br><br>He&#39;s a really chill dude. Big parties are sometimes hard to deal with, but Jack was able to take care of everyone which is really an impressive task as a server!<br><br>He always made sure we got what we needed. Thanks, Jack!
I went for early lunch on Wednesday - the service was excellent and the Salmon salad was SO delicious.

It was my sister&#39;s Birthday I went in to get her favorite Cheesecake Strawberry.   Ashley G helped me and brought the frozen cheesecake from the back. She was not wearing gloves when she used her bear fingers to scoop it onto the counter to be decorated with whipped cream and strawberry&#39;s and also used her bare fingers to put in into the box.  I was scared if I said anything then that for sure she would do something to the next cheesecake behind the scenes like I hear restaurants do when people complain.  I called 15 minutes later and spoke with the manager.  All the manager said was thank you for telling us and they will address this with her.  No refund, no replacement and no apology.  Especially with all that is going on with this virus right now.

Me and my girl have been there dozens of times. Usually we grab a quick cocktail and a bite to eat before a movie and it&#39;s always pretty good. Tonight was different... Ashely behind the bar made us feel like it was our first time and took extraordinary care of us. I cannot tell you how much she made our night. Once we paid we had to ask her name and got to know her a little bit and she told us it was here THIRD DAY. I don&#39;t know who needs to hear this but she is a true pro and make sure she stays on your bar team!!!! We&#39;re coming back next Sunday 100000%

We come here maybe every other month it has not failed us <br>got the banana cream cheese cake for my bf&#39;s bday he loved it. I would say it might have been better, if not, as good as Coco&#39;s banana cream pie!<br><br>I come with my sister and boyfriend and we have not yet experience bad customer services.
Horrible service, terrible management, the lowest competency ever for any food establishment. People that work here are unqualified to be born, let alone work.

Actually writing this before the meal.  We have been waiting for 30 minutes already.  It makes no sense that they don&#39;t take reservations.  People are on their lunch breaks - normally 1 hour.  1/2 of that is burned already and we haven&#39;t even sat down yet...

Went here last Saturday and service was amazing. Zander (or Xander) was our server and he never disappointed- always attentive, friendly, suggestive, funny, caring. A perfect service. Menus huge. My entire family loved our meals and had a great time. Thank you Zander!
The Cheesecake Factory is the same everywhere. Big portions decent quality food, good service... The benefits of this location is validated parking, great meeting place and good service.
Mimi was our waitress. It was my husband&#39;s 90th bdy. She was very attentive, warm &amp; gracious, &amp; accommodating.

The food and service is always wonderful, but the process of getting a table is a problem. My party and I check in and were told it would be 20 minutes. We took the pager and relaxed outside. 40 minutes later we went inside to see if there was an update and they said it would be a little longer. 5 minutes later the pager buzzed but we didn&#39;t get a table for another 10 minutes. And that whole front area is a zoo. <br>Anyways, tonight our waiter was fabulous. I have zero complaints about him. I ordered an item I had never had and it was really good. As always, I recommend coming during the week when they aren&#39;t as busy.

I ordered pancakes and was served very watery syrup. The waiter said that he was not a fan of I, and he offered me sugar free syrup in a packet that he assured me was muck better. I was really surprised and disappointed.

Came here for breakfast with a couple of friends and it was delicious! I got the mushroom and bacon omelet with tomatoes on the side and a side order of avocados. It was a bit oily. Maybe from the mushrooms but it was delicious regardless. I believe there was spinach in it too. I didn&#39;t like our waitress. She wasn&#39;t friendly at all. When I was asking for stuff such as an order of coffee she made it seem like it was a hassle for her. Not very friendly at all.
It&#39;s ok there, but they are sure expensive. The ice tea is $3.75<br>I had a low carb chicken dish, ice tea and the smallest piece of dessert possible, it was $32.<br>Yes, one person.

All I can say is Denise!!! You Rock! We love this Cheesecake and come at least once or twice a month to eat before a movie and usually get good service but today was a exceptional experience, Denise was kind, funny and was quick with whatever we needed. We will definitely be asking fo her again!

So we had a business meeting in the area and we chose Cheesecake Factory again due to my last visit in Brea.  That was really good.  However, if this was my first visit to a Cheesecake Factory, it would be my last.<br><br>I was thinking to myself, &#39;how can this be part of the same chain&#39;?  Everything was so different.  The service was terrible, the food was bad, the overall experience was just plain dreadful.<br><br>We arrived upon opening to avoid the crowds.  Ordered the Fried Zucchini as an appetizer.  I was telling everyone that these would be the best they ever had.  This was based on my last visit in Brea.  Boy, was I wrong and embarrassed!  The Fried Zucchini was the blandest, plain undercooked Fried Zucchini I have ever had.  I had egg on my face and my friends let me know it.  Embarrassing to say the least.<br><br>The salad as ordered came out just the opposite and had to be sent back twice!  How difficult is it to order a salad and get it right the first time?<br><br>We ordered our Entree&#39;s and again, such a letdown.  The pasta was stone cold and the chicken was lukewarm at best.  Again, I raved about the Pesto Pasta and had it substituted for the normal item, again, I should not have done it.  It was just a terrible dish.<br><br>In regard to service, our waiter came to us and said he was taking his lunch and the place just opened up.  We were told another server would be helping him.  Guess what, I had to go get more napkins, I had to go ask for more water, I had to go get more silverware, I had to get more condiments.  This was the worst service I have ever experienced!!  People just dumped us and forgot about us.<br><br>How can two different establishments be so dramatically different?  It is called &#39;a lack of QA&#39; at the Sherman Oak&#39;s facility at all levels.  I really was embarrassed and had to eat crow all day from my friends for a poor choice.  I really would like to know how it was so bad and different.
Been going to the Cheesecake Factory for 35 years.   You always get a good meal.  Huge portions so good to share or save for the next day.

The Shiela&#39;s chicken and avocado salad was a bit boring and lacking avocado, my dining companion&#39;s filet mignon (don&#39;t order this cut at a cheesecake factory) was all tendon and chewy these are the only two complaints of the evening. <br>The gumbo was excellent and so was the bacon bacon burger.<br>The coffee and sexy cheesecakes delivered on all levels of sinful satisfaction!

So disappointed with this location. The Oreo cheesecake was practically frozen and the giant Oreo they placed on top was stale. The cheesecake is supposed to be on point!<br><br>The fries were cold upon receiving them (though even if they had been hot, they were low quality--definitely not homemade and the texture was as if they&#39;d been frozen then microwaved, though I&#39;m sure that wasn&#39;t the case). While we were excited to see the Impossible burger on the menu, it was over cooked. I should mention that it still tasted good, just that it wasn&#39;t cooked properly with a little pink on the inside.<br><br>The reason for two stars is because both times I&#39;ve dined here the service was great.
Although they deserve one star I give them two because of the overall experiences I&#39;ve had.

I usually don&#39;t write reviews but tonight was horrible. After we were seated, we waited 20 minutes hoping that our server would come to our table while the other tables who came after us were already greeted by their servers got their drinks and everything. We continued to wait. We had to go and call for a server ourselves. We were told that manager was going to come to our table. It didn&#39;t happen. We asked for water and drinks, we got the drinks only, no water... 2 of the dishes were supposed to come with vegetables, we were told that they were on the way. 45 minutes later, we had to remind the server again ask for the sides. We went there for an hour dinner, we couldn&#39;t leave in 2 and half hours. When we were leaving, we informed the hostess that we weren&#39;t happy with the experience; she didn&#39;t seem to care at all. Well, there are plenty of solid places in Sherman Oaks&amp;Encino.   I will take my business somewhere else.

The meal was delicious as usual. We had 4 glasses of wine between the two of us, 2 meals and an appetizer. Needless to say, we spent a good chunk of change in this establishment.  Everything was great but we were stuffed so we took a slice of strawberry cheesecake togo. Later that evening, my husband and I decided to try the cheesecake. I noticed the slices seem smaller for the price, I mean it&#39;s good but not to die for. The real kicker was halfway through when I dug my fork in and noticed a hair, not just a little wimpy hair but a long strand that I actually pulled and it broke within the cheesecake.  How can the professional cheesecake people not be wearing a hair net while making their specialty?  Ugh, life will never be the same again!

I never write yelp reviews, let alone bad ones. But my experience last night was extremely dangerous. After waiting quite some time for a beer due to them having to tap a new keg, the manager brought it out. More than half way through the beer I noticed PIECES OF GLASS SITTING AT THE BOTTOM OF THE PINT GLASS!!!!!!!! Of course I had that beer and a slice of cheesecake comped (even though it should have been my whole meal). I won&#39;t be eating at this location again. And ad<br><br>Always double check what you&#39;re eating/drinking, even if the manager brings it to you himself.

Cheesecake Factory is one of those restaurants that sounds good but once I&#39;m there, I remember why I almost never go. <br>I was at Cheesecake for almost 2 hours and 75% of the time I was either waiting for a table or waiting for our food. <br>I got the four cheese pasta and it honestly tasted like there was only one cheese...the big dollop of ricotta on top of the plate. I also tried the guacamole and it tasted like it came out of a container. There were bits of overripe avocado that was brown and mushy, definitely offputting. <br><br>I would&#39;ve given 2 stars if it wasn&#39;t for our waitress, Heather. As a family of 6, we&#39;re usually a handful but Heather was so attentive and so genuine!!<br><br>Also today was my lucky day cause Kanye West came waltzing in while I was waiting to be seated :)

They have very bad service with so rude manager named Serra we asked for a both for 4 people and we was waiting 30 minutes and until we finally got in they asked us to move to small table with 2 chairs and they moved us from are table to this small one we didn&#39;t wanted to move but then Serra showed up and said &#34;it&#39;s not a question you moving now or you will have to wait another 30 minutes outside&#34; that was so so rude <br>We definitely not recommend this place to nobody

Best customer service! I have been coming to this Cheesecake Factory for over 2 years now and I never walk out unsatisfied. The food I always good and tasty. The customer service here is the best. Whenever the food takes long or they mess up anything, they come apologize and bring us a complementary appetizer. Highly recommend!

Excellent food and excellent-er people!!! I bought three cheesecakes from this location for my wedding and the 2 people who helped me at the counter were SO nice!!! I forget the lovely lady&#39;s name but &#34;Utah&#34; was the server who helped out, too. These two were so friendly and sweet and even let me take a menu home with me so my Husband-to-be and I could choose flavors closer to the date.<br>The cakes were AMAZING, on time, easy to pick up and double-sliced just like we asked. PERFECT.<br>Awesome customer service. (And yes I totally returned the menu when we took our new In-Laws out for a delicious local meal!)

Its pretty much what you can expect from a cheesecake factory. Come by 5pm if you want to catch any kind of break on the wait. Outside seating is available and really nice on good weather days. The glass partitions help any wind on cooler days. <br><br>Menu is just like the rest, a million options making it so hard to select what to eat. Never had any real issues with the food. As always poritins are massive and that honey wheat bread is the absolute best.

This place is a regular haunt for me and my girlfriends. Whenever I&#39;m in town, if we&#39;re celebrating something, or just a get together we&#39;re usually here. It&#39;s a great place that has something for everyone. They are one of a few restaurants that done make a big fuss if you want to add something or a dish or take something away - there might be a slight charge for adding things but its not a lot. They always have yummy drinks - alcoholic and non-alcoholic. One of my current favorites is the cucumber lemonade (I ask for a little mint to be added). We can and have made meals just out of their apps - chicken pot stickers, avocado egg rolls etc. They have a good array of small bites where you can try some fun things. Their beet and goat cheese salad is a favorite along with their bang bang chicken and shrimp, thai curry dish. I will say that sometimes the dishes (especially some new ones) can be a hit or miss, however, 9/10 times you&#39;ll leave stuffed and satisfied (portions are HUGE). Of course, the dessert is amazing! They have other things besides cheesecake but with so many cheesecake options alone, you can never go wrong!

Cheesecake Factory is a great place to go with family or a group because it has a huge menu with a variety of foods and flavors. However, be prepared for a long wait because they are usually busy (the reason I rated it 4 stars and not 5). <br><br>When it comes to the food, you can never go wrong with their avocado eggrolls as an appetizer. Also, I recently tried their tuna tartare, which had great flavor for a small portion. For my entree I like to get the tuna tataki salad, which is light and healthy but also flavorful. If I&#39;m really hungry, I sometimes go for the Hibachi steak with mashed potatoes, which is a huge portion, or other times I get the Jambalaya which is spicy and delicious. <br><br>Overall, I recommend the Cheesecake Factory because of their large variety of flavorful foods.
Ordered food from Postmates it was delicious.  Food arrived hot and as ordered, thank you Lacey at Cheesecake for making sure the order was correct!<br><br>:)

I don&#39;t eat cheese cake factory, I&#39;m not too much of a fan. I walked in with some friends to the bar to get some drinks. They took care of us very well, I don&#39;t really have much else to say about this place besides it&#39;s a little too crowded, kinda messy, tables left dirty and unattended by serves/busses. Yeah, fast food at its finest..

Last Saturday evening I came to have dinner and specifically requested to be sat at a booth. I was told by the kind girl at the desk that the wait would be around 5-10min. My family and I waited but for some reason another gentleman sat other customers that arrived after us at the booth I requested. I ended up having to wait and extra 10min but the nice girl at the desk apologized for the inconvenience and I was assured that I would be sat as soon as possible!

I been to this cheesecake location and it&#39;s pretty good the food is always yummy the first server we got was super nice and  friendly the second one was in a rush rarely came to our table. Maybe because we were in the patio but still we didn&#39;t see him much. The bread is always delicious and spinach dip the best! I will come here again if I&#39;m ever close or invited.

This was one of my worst experiences at a cheese cake factory !! The waiter burped while serving us or plates that took over an hour to come. Then we just needed up asking for new plates because my steak was very uncooked and my mash potatoes were too runny it felt discusting !! And my waiter was rude to me once I complained about the steak and made me feel uncomfortable because I was black and she was white

This place sucks !! They took 1 hour to bring the food and there was mold on my butter that came with my steak that was uncooked !! Worst place ever and there was a hair in my drink, to top it off the waiter was rude and I do not recommend anybody coming to this location.

This is like every other Cheesecake Factory you&#39;ve probably been to. The bread , of course, is a draw for most people including myself. Drinks (alcoholic) are good, refreshing and fairly priced. Food is consistent across locations and it&#39;s a nice place to go to catch up with friends; there&#39;s something for everybody. Our waitress tonight wasn&#39;t the best, but I don&#39;t let poor service bother me . she basically ignored us for one hour lol; I&#39;m unsure if she was just waiting for the other member of our party to arrive (3/4 present) or if she just didn&#39;t care. No biggie because we just picked up our drinks and went to the bar (self-seating) and got served immediately. Hostess didn&#39;t care that we switched .

My boyfriend and I came here on a Saturday night during the dinner rush and we really wanted some cheesecake, so we decided to endure the 45 minute wait. Let me start off by saying that I commend the hostesses and hosts that handle the front line of the chaos of this restaurant. They were all extremely pleasant and had smiles on their faces, even when the mob of hungry angry customers asked when their tables would be ready every 10 minutes. <br><br>Since we had a lot of time to decide what we wanted to eat, we asked our waitress if we could order as soon as we were seated. The four cheese pasta and BBQ burger w sweet potato fries were delicious. My boyfriend and I agreed that the fries were the best that we ever had because they were cooked just right and tasted hot &amp; fresh (I forgot to take pictures of our food because we were so hungry and dug in as soon as the food came haha). We also ordered the Hazlenut Crunch and Cherry cheesecakes to go and those were delicious (as always). <br><br>Our server, Elisabeth, was excellent! She was so sweet and very attentive. She always made sure our water glasses were full and asked if we were doing okay. The quality of the food and service was well worth the wait!
Sat on the patio and had great service with Joseph! Will definitely be back! Thanks again!
Worst service EVER by Edgar!  He tended to tables around us. They were seated AFTER us. Their food arrived before ours. They received their bills o

This place always seems hectic once you walk-in the door. Everyone standing around right in front of the door really seems like your going to wait there for hours! My friend and I walked up to the hostess and put down my name for four. Wait time was 30-35 minutes. As we waited for our other two friends to arrive, they called us to be seated.<br><br>Our waiter was...well he did attend to us pretty decent. Although he was not having it with my friends jokes, I guess because we know him we thought he was funny.
