Our waiter did not, he kinda snapped back at him with a smart ass answer, but I get it lol.<br><br>Food? I ordered the spaghetti &amp; meatballs ($16.50). Now usually when I go to Cheesecake Factory I only go for the Chicken Costoletta ($16.95), but since I wanted some pasta, I ordered the spaghetti. It had flavor, however the meatballs were pretty darn tough. Either the cooks over worked the meatballs OR they were frozen meatballs. Either way the meatballs were tough, not even a knife was able to cut through them.<br>My friends ordered the Almond Crusted Salmon Salad (one gluten-free) and that damn salad was delicious!<br>Not to mention the Pineapple Moscow Mule ($11) and the Godiva Flourless Cake...yum!<br><br>Next time I go i&#39;ll make sure to avoid the spaghetti and meatballs and either stick to my Chicken Costoletta or that delicious salmon salad.
This place has turned into a joke. Bad service. Bad management. It&#39;s all gone way downhill

That thai chicken wrap is my jam.  Omg. I feel so light and satisfied when i leave.  I always get the same thing.  Never room for dessert but im fine with that.  Kind wait staff fast service.  Yum. I forgot how much i love it till i have it!

We have eaten at this Cheesecake Factory multiple times. The food is consistently good. On this occasion we ate outside on the larger patio nearest to Ventura Blvd. It was very dirty. Lots of spilled food and stains on the surface of the pavement. It badly needs a strong power wash to get rid of all the stained food and at least should be swept up between customers. It seemed to be attracting a lot of flies. There did not seem to be any supervision of this area and no one was doing anything to sweep up the spilled food on the ground.
Favorite place to eat this location is cool but the waiters or always in a rush and don&#39;t give you time to even order.. wait times aren&#39;t that bad just not relaxing

I&#39;m a fan of dining in at any other Cheesecake Factory, but unfortunately this Sherman Oaks location is absolutely horrible! For the 4th time in a short period they got my order wrong and then frantically tried to blame the delivery service. I made my custom instructions SO easy to follow &amp; fool-proof each time, yet they still messed up the order. And the manager of this location tried to erroneously blame the delivery service when it was clearly his staff&#39;s fault. He kept saying it was an issue with DoorDash. No, it&#39;s an issue - consistently - ONLY with your restaurant. Will never order again from this ridiculous place and suggest you don&#39;t either.

So great to come for lunch hungry and be greeted with a smile from the moment we walked in. Our server Paul and Rolando were both attentive and had a great attitude. The food was superb. I had the Lunch special Herb Crusted Salmon with mashed potatoes and green asparagus and my daughter had the spicy chicken sandwich which looked fit to feed two! Oh! And the fried Zucchini and bread were perfect. Thank you for the lovely meal and hospitality. Happy guests!

It was my first time trying this place, very pretty view when i arrived. They have seating inside and outside. But indeed it was packed!! <br>My date and i waited about 10-15 mins to be seated, they texted us when our table was ready. Waiter brought us menus and brought us our drinks promptly. Staff was really nice, but didn&#39;t really check in with us... probably because it was so busy. <br>But overall i loved the location, our table was really small, our plates barely even fit lol. I ordered the fettucini alfredo, and it was AMAZING to DIE FOR!!! nice and creamy... chicken was really good too! <br>my margarita wasnt the greatest, maybe next time ill remember to ask for it blended and not just with ice cubes.

Just your standard Cheesecake Factory. Menu is huge and they have a lot of healthier options on their skinny menu, which is really the only menu I order from... everything on the regular menu is 1,000+ calories.  Their cheesecakes are amazing if that&#39;s your thing.  Overall though,  the experience is always mediocre and is the food.

This my be one of my favorite places to eat. I love the food, the taste of it and the selection. The have a huge menu and a skinny menu to give healthier options. <br><br>Recently we went here for my birthday and we sat outside. I love sitting on the patio under the heaters. The food was delicious as always. I like the appetizers, a lot of them. The macaroni and cheese balls, lake salad, corn fritters just to name a few.  The cheesecake  I ordered was so good. It was the new s&#39;mores  one. It had chocolate, marshmallows, and graham cracker crust. <br><br>My one complaint about this place is they don&#39;t take reservations at night time. When I ask the manager why he said because we don&#39;t have to. I thought that really sucked for customers. That night we waited almost 2 hours for a table because we couldn&#39;t make reservations. It was my birthday and we were a big group.  And &#34;they don&#39;t need to&#34;...that&#39;s why they make people wait around for hours! It&#39;s kind of a bummer because I think the food here is exceptional.

I had never been to the Cheesecake Factory before last night. I&#39;d always wanted to eat here though. NEVER AGAIN!<br><br>You have been warned! It&#39;s really &#39;not&#39; worth it! At...all! I never ever want to go back! <br><br>The prices are astronomically high for the less than mediocre food you&#39;ll receive. Even for lemonade. Yeeeeah. The cooks there don&#39;t know how to use seasoning of ANY kind. Prepare yourself to eat the blandest food of your life...even with the mashed potatoes, and especially with the seafood Caribbean dishes. So bring your own spices sampler with you. Your food will not have any. <br><br>But that&#39;s not even the worst part...you will get the privilege of spending over $80 for a meal for two people AND get food poisoning for your troubles!! <br><br>I don&#39;t want a pregenerated message from whoever mans this yelp page that they&#39;re sorry I didn&#39;t have a wonderful experience! I want my money back! My $80! And in the future, I&#39;ll take my business elsewhere! Who do I talk about getting a refund?!<br><br>I will say, the only pleasant was our waiter. Wonderful young man. And the cheesecake was also delicious. But that&#39;s it. You&#39;re better off going to Outback Steakhouse or the like.
Best spaghetti meatballs ever !!! <br>Trying to get different dishes every time and in the end I keep ordering the same thing :) <br>And the service here is always great!

I used to love the Cheesecake Factory... but ever since they got rid of the endive salad and corn fritters, it has never been the same. The food, in general, is just average. It is also such a pain waiting for a table because you are not able to make a reservation in advance. <br><br>We came here last night and the service was incredibly slow!! It was crazy. It took forever for us to get our drinks and then even longer to get our appetizer. They didn&#39;t even seem very busy but everything was slow. Also, my pasta (the simplest dish) was, by far, the last to come out. The bus boy who served me the dish handed it to me and said &#34;I&#39;m sure this will be right&#34; because it was so simple. It was missing a key ingredient from the menu!<br><br>The Cheesecake Factory is a staple at the Galleria, which is probably why it is usually crowded. However, the food is just meh and I&#39;m never impressed. On a positive note, they do tend to give giant portions!
Greg B is the best!!  Awesome service. Good conversation. He was in on it! Definitely the server to have!

Take out order so no way to fix. Awful! I&#39;d like to give no stars. 3 pieces of chicken, couple pieces of avocado and a ton of lettuce. Yes, I should eat like a rabbit but not for this price and not what I expected.

The Cheesecake Factory has lost its flavor. <br>By flavor, I mean customer service.<br><br>I have had multiple undesirable experiences at this location. The manager tried to make up for one with a gift card. That was all well and good. But just because you throw a piece of plastic in someone&#39;s direction that they can return back to you for a tasty morsel, doesn&#39;t mean the problem is fixed.<br><br>Clearly the rude meter has not changed here. <br><br>I went in for a Cheesecake for my sisters 21st birthday. Walked up to the register and had to pull the girl away from a personal conversation with another employee to help me. She rang me up. No hello, no smiles. Asked me to sign a receipt.<br><br>Then silence.<br><br>I stood, waiting for the finish of the transaction (i.e. the receipt and a goodbye), but no! <br>Instead she turns back to her coworker and continues the conversation. <br>I stood there awkwardly staring at her. Then finally popped into the conversation asking if there was anything else she needed from me and if I could get my receipt. The snippy girl replied &#34;sure, and he will be back in a minute with your food.&#34; Hmm... not so good so far.<br><br>When the Cheesecake arrived, I asked for utensils and plates. I didn&#39;t know they didn&#39;t have plates, but she sure let me know!<br><br>The manager on duty wasn&#39;t any better. Her response to my issue was &#34;that&#39;s awful! I&#39;ll talk to her&#34; very much resembling a southern &#34;well bless your heart&#34;. <br><br>So. Went in pepped and ready to party. Left like I had been slapped in the face with a wet blanket.

I go to this Cheesecake Factory and I like it.I like there Buffalo Wings and Brown Bread and more foods that taste good for my mom,and dad and some others also like Cheesecake Factory admits a good restraunt too!

If you want really bland food and aren&#39;t expecting any flavor from your food then you found the place. I&#39;ve been here a few times. The veggie burger is disgusting. Soggy and flavorless and any Mexican food you order here is so watered down it is unrecognizable. Tonight I ordered huevos rancheros and got two tostadas on cold beans with eggs on top. Maybe they should shorten their menu and focus more on quality.

BEWARE!<br>We dine at the Cheesecake Factory in Sherman Oaks frequently on the weekends. Something strange happened a couple of weeks ago. My husband asked for the check, the waitress brought the folder with the check inside. The bill came to around $35 or so. He put in 2 $20 bills. A few minutes later she returned, empty handed and asked &#34;Oh would you like your change?&#34; My husband always leaves over a 20% tip when the folder is returned with the change. He just said no, so she got a $3 tip. Then last weekend the same thing happened with a different server. She returned with the parking ticket and asked, &#34;Would you like your change&#34; with nothing in her hands. <br>I called the restaurant and asked to speak to the Manager. I was told I would not be able to speak to, or email the manager they did not give out that information. YOU HAVE A PROBLEM AND YOU DON&#39;T WANT TO KNOW? Yes that is their position, they rudely told me to call Corporate. I did and spoke to Kim in Guest Services. She didn&#39;t seem at all surprised by my comments. As I finished, she asked me to provide ALL of my personal contact information, the days we were there, the ticket number of the check....Soooooo you won&#39;t even let a customer know if there IS a manager at the restaurant, let alone speak to them, but you want all my info. BEWARE they know they have big problems at this restaurant.

I normally don&#39;t have a problem when going to The Cheesecake Factory. But this certain location I do not care for. Once we sat down, the table and booth was pretty dirty with crumbs. The fork was also dirty. Thankfully we had a wonderful waiter who was really nice and cleaned it up for us. He was really friendly and the service was great. However, I got the jambalaya pasta and the taste was okay. But the one thing that threw me off was the shells of the shrimp mixed in with the pasta. I wouldn&#39;t mind if these were shrimp with the tails still in tack but they were completely peeled off. It wasn&#39;t enjoyable chewing my food and then biting into these shells.

I go fairly often to Cheesecake Factory but now I am going to complain.  I called all the local Valley ones and were told they no longer have rooms to host small parties.  So  I couldn&#39;t do a Wedding Shower there.  <br><br>This past week I asked if I could please use an area in the restaurant to host 16 people on a Monday night for dinner in May.  A graduation dinner.  I was told they could put a few tables together for me which was fine. But then I was told they absolutely would take NO reservations. They were honest that there would be a long wait to get a bunch of tables together.  I offered to put a deposit down on a credit card.  They said no.  They really made me feel like they didn&#39;t want my business.  I will go elsewhere. <br><br>And by the way, I wrote their corporate office and have heard nothing back.  I have been always like Cheesecake Factory but now I do t feel appreciated as a customer are at all.

They don&#39;t take reservation. Saturday 12 noon... not over crowded. Got seated immediately.<br><br>The Service: Our server is SUPER attentive. Took great care of us. The food is served in less than 3 minutes!!! Unbelievable~ <br><br>The Food: Their menu is so big... look like a &#34;book&#34;. Now they  have separate menu called &#34;SkinnyLicious Menu&#34;!! Super super  healthy. <br><br>Skinnylicious Fresh Vegetable Salad - tons of different kinds of vegetable. The dressing is so light but still very flavorful. As usually, the portion is huge! Sharing will be perfect. <br><br>The Parking: Parking structure (Sherman Oaks Galleria). With restaurant validation, 2 hours FREE then $1 per additional hour.

First time at this location; never coming back. <br><br>Asked for first available party of two today. Writing this as we&#39;re leaving because we waited for about 15 mins and watched a party of three walked in well after us and were promptly seated. Even saw the ticket que completely empty after everyone else except for us and a larger party were seated.<br><br>Complete lack of organization it seems, but even that&#39;s too generous an excuse when I was speaking directly to the hostess.

Frankly, ordered to go the cashew nut chicken, and they missed the cashews and the chicken.. .well, jesus, so uninspiring. To charge 20 dollars for that is kinda offensive. The manager, to top it off, was asking me if i just wanted to leave feedback. How about some customer service. <br>I hope they get someone more experienced running the operations. Highly dissatisfied with everything. I paid 20 dollars for chicken and rice.

Choices of dining are surprisingly limited in this area, especially if you&#39;re going to the Galleria to watch a movie! The calories on the enormous menu are pretty concerning, so I went with the Skinnylicious Lemon Garlic Shrimp - Sauteed shrimp, basil, tomato and lemon garlic sauce, served with asparagus and angel hair. It was the perfect amount of food, and I felt better about it too.<br><br>My fiance had the factory grande burrito. Literally the most enormous burrito, with chicken, cheese, cilantro rice, onions and peppers, served with guac, sour cream, salsa, and black beans. I literally could have made it into 3 meals. Again, very tasty, but it was like 2200 calories.

It was my first time ever in this restaurant, mainly to please my significant other. And it left me as I expected, underwhelmed. <br><br>To start, I am not a fan of throwing a hundred of different design styles in 1 room, it&#39;s too over the top and confusing. <br><br>As I was told the portions were huge, we shared the spring rolls and the wasabi beef. <br><br>The spring rolls were OK, lacking of any specific flavor. <br><br>The beef was a real let down. Yes the portion was ridiculous huge, but the quality of the ingredients took a great expense for it. The mashed potatoes did taste like they were from a ready mix, there was cold spots, like they were cooked in the microwave. <br><br>The peppermint cheesecake was nice and plentiful. <br><br>Service wise, very present, our drinks were always kept full and the wait staff was pleasant and polite. <br><br>I assume it is a hit for families has the menu has just about everything in it, but I would prefer more precision in execution.

I&#39;ve done take out twice from this location being that I live up the street.<br><br>The first time it was a ridiculously long wait, my food was cold.<br><br>I decided to give it another try and got it a second time. I got the fettuccini. I got home ready to eat as I was starving, there were no utensils in the bag, as they had assured me everything was inside. <br><br>My bad, I should&#39;ve of checked as I usually do.<br><br>Oh yeah the cucumber lemonade was ALL ICE.<br><br>Good meal for $50, NOT!

Came in with some friends about a week ago. Like other reviewers I was underwhelmed by the front counter/ hostess area. Generally blasé  and not particularly interested in the patrons. Food  and service were okay but the women&#39;s restrooms were filthy and of three stalls: one was out of service, the disabled restroom did not lock, and only one stall was functional. In a business this large that is unacceptable.

The review is specifically on take out orders. <br>This is my go to place whenever I am within the area, I called within an hour before closing time so that would give them time to prepare the food and saves me from the stress of thinking that they are gonna spit on my food. Why would they do that right? its cheesecake factory?!! Apparently that is not the case, you cant expect someone to be sympathetic towards another human being. We picked up the order and started eating, after dipping the cuban rolls on its sauce we found a rubber band bigger than the container!!! I never thought that a restaurant with this caliber would have a setback like this.

Receptionist need more training in customer service, 2 parties were seated before us that arrived after we did, when my wife went up because our number was called she was ignored and another was helped before us again.
Good for average dining &amp; dessert.<br>Overpriced in my opinion.<br>No flare eatery.<br>Wide selection of cheesecake.

I&#39;m writing this review for a friend who won&#39;t complain. She ordered two items to go. When she arrived, the order was incorrect. Instead of offering the incorrect order as a consolation, they took it away and then charged her for their mistake. Upon opening the order, half of the order that they did get right were stale and cold. So not only did they get the order incorrect, they charged her for their mistake, gave cold food, and offered nothing for the time that she waited for her food. Then for the bread...gave no butter. None. Then we asked for butter and got ONE. For two orders of bread. Shameful.

Service was great ...no complaints there!!<br>But the food was a different story...<br>My wife order hamburger that was ok.<br>I ordered fettuccine Alfredo with mushrooms...... what a mistake the sauce was very blend , barely had mushrooms and they charge me extra 2 $ for mushrooms! But the worst part was the fettuccine I couldn&#39;t touch it maybe ate 3 bites, all the fettuccine were stuck together it was look like I order fettuccine balls.... my son is 7 can do a better pasta ,very disappointed with the meal waste of 19$... never will order pasta there.<br>5 stars for service.
Dirty water, dirty cups, dirty silverware, slow service, and bad attitudes.<br><br>Dont bother.

Went with my wife monday 5/20/19 they did not have a line and sat us at the bar which was crowded. I asked for another table to crowded outside was fine. Had to wait 15 mins, when ready another small table asked for bigger &#34;and another 10-15 minutes-asked about outside they said it was closed. Wait but I asked for outside before it was closed.  I left.

The cheesecake factory never seems to meet any amazing standards. Their food for the price isn&#39;t worth it, and isn&#39;t that great. I think by far the best thing I&#39;ve ever had here is their complimentary bread- the wheat bread is amazing. This place just does the job if you&#39;re hungry and can&#39;t find anywhere else to go. However, their actual restaurant is nice and well decorated.

I was inclined to give it a 2 stars if it weren&#39;t for my daughter&#39;s and wife&#39;s orders that turned out pretty well. Mine was blecch! <br><br>I ordered the fettuccini Alfredo with shrimp. The béchamel sauce was good, no complaints there but it was the way they cooked the shrimp and noodles that was so horrible. The noodles were parts undercooked and parts overlooked (didn&#39;t realize you can do that but they managed, what I thought was an incredible feat of bad cooking)The shrimp was over cooked as well. <br><br>I asked for a replacement and they gladly did. Unfortunately the replacement noodles were marginally better which made me decide to just stop complaining and eat my meal quietly.<br><br>I was so disappointed in my meal that I made a mental note to never eat here again. <br><br>Odd thing is the Cheesecake Factory in Victoria Gardens in Rancho Cucamonga is so much better than this one. The food 3x better.  So sometimes it&#39;s the chef at a location that is incapable of cooking a simple meal and in another, they do a great job effortlessly. <br><br>So that&#39;s why I give this place a 4 stars. Just don&#39;t choose the fettuccine. It&#39;s depressing.
Ordered some food from here to go. Didn&#39;t expect that to be ready that fast. What we got. 2 orders of buffalo strips, sode fries and lemon cake. Came to about 50 dollars. So delicious!!

To begin with, the service here is horrible. As I got seated, I began looking at the menu. I was there for almost 30 minutes. I&#39;m a very patient person and I waited. Waiters kept passing by looking at me without offering bread or water. Finally, I called a waiter and asked him to bring the manager. I was very upset that I waited so long without being assisted. He instead calls another waiter to take my order. I was ANGRY! I wanted to speak to the manager but the manager was no where to be found. Ashley P was our waiter and she gave me the worse service I have ever had at The Cheesecake Factory. She took a while to bring my drinks, took a while to bring bread, and rarely checked up on my table. As I finished my meal, I waited there for my check. Again, my waiter Ashley P. was no where to be found. I finally got my check, paid, and automatically left. As I was walkIng out my waiter Ashley P. was busy slouching on the counter (in the front) and talking/laughing with other employees. No wonder it took her forever to bring everything. Cheesecake please  check on your workers, they&#39;re too busy having the time of their lives and not doing their jobs. I don&#39;t recommend this place, please go somewhere else. I couldn&#39;t get a manager after receiving this horrible service. I definitely did not enjoy my food!!!

I went there for cafe &amp; cake with friend yesterday. The waitress forgot to give us spoon and sugar, but the most disappointed thing was that although she took our parking ticked for validation, she didn&#39;t validate them !! We ended up paying full price for the parking :/  Definitely not a good service.

Cheesecake Factory is seriously one of my favorite restaurants. I come here often for special dinners with the family. The food is always top quality and excellent (although pricey...but I mean, it&#39;s not surprising). Chicken farfalle, steak Dianne and Thai glazed salmon are some of my favorites! And omg the cheesecake varieties are awesome! I always stick to the white chocolate raspberry cheesecake! <br><br>This particular location always has a wait (but cheesecake is my fave so it&#39;s worth it to me). Expect to wait at least 30 min. There&#39;s not much waiting room space so people just crowd the hostess stand and the waiting benches. They have a parking lot on the other side of the galleria, and cheesecake  factory validates for two hours. <br><br>I think it&#39;s a hit or miss with the host staff. Some of them can be really nice but other ones can be a bit rude. The waiters are very polite, but expect to flag them down when it gets busy. It can get a little hectic.

It&#39;s been a while, but the food is still good. I had the huevos rancheros for breakfast/brunch and it was good. I would have it again, even though the majority of the dish is lined with black beans on the bottom. That&#39;s the one thing you can say about the Cheesecake Factory, that the food always tastes good. The only reason why I haven&#39;t been in a while is because they are always busy, too. It was pretty empty when we sat down, but was super crowded by the time we left.

Actual review 2.5<br><br>We went here after the recommendation from our friend who is a regular here. <br>We ordered appetizers and were gonna wait for them to come before we ordered the mains, this was a mistake since it took like 30 minutes. But we though its okay since it was busy, the food took a while too. <br>The food was ordered as medium well, and even though in the middle it was medium well the outer layer of the meat was char burned on almost all of the dishes, making the meat taste super dry. Our friend that&#39;s a regular always orders the same thing and said his food tasted off as well as the appetizers. He talked to the manager and he said that they got new chefs so that might have been the problem.<br><br>The waiters were pretty apologetic and said they got a lot of complaints that&#39;s day. <br>The bathrooms were pretty clean as well. <br>I&#39;m giving it a 3 since our friend said usually they are much better!
Typical Cheesecake Factory deal. You wait. then you wait some more. Nice decor. Great before the movies. Miss the three fish taco order. Go for cheesecake with four forks.

Came here on a Tuesday. It was very chill. Not too many people, just perfect. The waitress was very nice and explained the menu. The reason I give it a four star is because we ordered mac and cheese and they didn&#39;t have it - not like I ordered sturgeon. <br><br>I ordered grilled salmon. Very juicy and very tender. Would come again.

Very nice place, nice waiters, excellent food. Thanks to Rebecca. She&#39;s the nice lady served us in the restaurant. Since I worked in a restaurant before for one year, I can understand who&#39;s good in that. She&#39;s a professional waiter who treated us absolutely well. We enjoyed her service as well as chatting with her. We really good time there. Thank you guys!

First time at this location . This is the worst Cheesecake Factory I have ever, ever been to! The wait on a Saturday was ridiculously long. The food tasted like crap. Everything came out cold and tasted pre made. Servers are okay but that doesn&#39;t justify anything if everything else is bad here. I won&#39;t be back to this location.

Normally we order from here for office lunch.  Horrible this time.  Normally 2 pieces of chicken in Honey/Truffle.  This time only one.  Normally stuffed mushrooms are excellent.  This time dried and horrible.  AND we didn&#39;t get some of our huge office order as well!   So, Nope.  Won&#39;t be choosing this place again. So very disappointing.

Thumbs up for the SkinnyLicious menu! The peeps at Chesscake Factory are most definitely looking out for the health freaks! So nice to be able to enjoy a meal somewhere where the menu accommodates everyone&#39;s taste buds. I LOVE the Tuscan Chicken plate. A generous amount of grilled chicken breast with tomato, mushroom, asparagus with a light vinaigrette and farro. So amazingly delicious!  The SkinnyLicious menu has everything from chicken, seafood, pasta, salads, flat bread, appetizers even alcoholic beverages! Cant wait to try the low carb chesscake! Staff is always friendly and attentive.<br><br>FITNESS FANATIC APPROVED!

1 Star because yelp does not Allow 0 Star! <br>Every-time i come here and leave i always tell myself i am going to Write a review! <br>Here it goes - STAY AWAY-<br>I cant tell you how many times i have been here , especially after opening a kids play place next door i come here even more often then i would like. (Convenient) <br>sorry for the language but i am so done with this locations BS! <br>Last and Final time i will ever dine in this location &amp; here is why! <br><br>The past 1 year &amp;+ my husband and i made this location our prime location to dine with the baby. Very convenient location to home and has an area to walk and just enjoy the outdoor, however i am so sorry for the detail but after ANY meal we have  AT THIS location my husband and i get very very very bad stomach issue. <br>I mean i kept saying maybe its not the food this and that but how is it possible that this past year all the time we come we get somewhat the similar thing we always get stomach sick and end up so Bloated, not to mention stuck in the bathroom for hours. <br>This last visit was Friday 08/17 I believe, my husband and i decided to go for lunch super hungry , surprisingly no wait time ( always no wait when we go, so 5 Star for that) and we were craving the egg rolls, Shanghai noodles (witch they removed from the menu) and ofcourse brown bread ! <br>Our server was just a mess, 2 star because she was trying to be nice. Maybe she had a bad day that day and was trying extra hard but it was very clear and obvious she hated the job and could care less how people though. <br>So , after being told the noodles were removed we were bummed out but still had other favorite dish, the server said &#34;complain to corporate we dont make the choice of removing the food HUN&#34; so unprofessional who says that???? <br><br>Anyway we got the chipotle pasta with french fries, chicken strips, mixture of tex mix and avocado egg roll and said Please bring warm bread . We got Cold bread where the butter was not spreading she kept going away so fast we couldn&#39;t fully tell her what we needed , she came back and every-time annoyed that i asked for something. <br>Anyway. Might i say my husband and i got 1 dish (share)  Of chipotle pasta because we were afraid what would happen after - and we were correct my husband didn&#39;t come out of the restroom for a good 30 min, and i felt so bloated and heart burn, it just horrible i had enough of what they put in the food. How can it be possible to not get sick from other locations and get sick this location!???<br>The taste is okay but after words you are dead. <br><br>So, in short- never will i come here, even for drinks. Definitely will make sure my family also knows, horrible service , pasta is filled with something that just makes you go and not to mention constant menu change!!!! <br>Invest in the $60 or more you spend for a quick lunch or dinner!!!!<br>Sad to see a place i have been going for 10+ years constantly turn into a place like this so disappointed... but ohh well int he LA world we live its a variety of great food and customer service to try. <br><br>I hope this can be changed and somehow they can change the thing they put in the food and i might come back.  Till then

FOOD POISONING!!!!!!!<br>So I ate here last night and when I woke up this morning I had the worst stomach pain ever. Keep in mind that this was my only meal yesterday other than bananas I had throughout the day. I&#39;m not sure what was up with my chicken that made me feel this way. It&#39;s been 24 hours and I feel horrible. I&#39;m literally borderline considering going to the ER from how bad this pain is. I have been in and out of the restroom all day. Thanks for ruining me spending time with my mom on Mother&#39;s Day!!

The Cheesecake Factory has it&#39;s &#34;ups and downs&#34;. While the food itself is fantastic (I have yet to try anything here that I don&#39;t find absolutely delicious), the cheesecakes, shockingly, are just &#34;mediocre at its best&#34;. <br><br>      I have tried the &#34;Chocolate Mousse&#34;, it was &#34;ok&#34;. I have tried the &#34;Snicker Bar Cheesecake&#34;, also just &#34;ok&#34;. &#34;Hershey&#39;s&#34;, just ok, you get the idea... The cheesecakes are just generic in taste. Maybe I am just a dessert snob, but something is definitely lacking in the flavor. Sometimes they&#39;re passable, and sometimes they altogether disappoint. From my experience, I deem the downfall to be the cheesecake base itself. I can never taste the cheesecake creaminess of these desserts, even though they are cheesecakes. The consistency is just lacking, unfortunately. Oh well, can&#39;t win them all.<br><br>      I will give praise where it&#39;s deserved though; the Caramel Pecan Turtle Cheesecake is a sweet lover&#39;s dream. From the chocolate truffle topping, to the caramel pecan coating, and the brownie crust, this one is meant for the books. Also, any of the other &#34;specialty desserts&#34; are pretty spot on. Linda&#39;s Fudge Cake, Chocolate Tower Cake, and any chocolate cake in general will put you in a gut busting, sugar coma for hours.<br><br>    Now, for the food. I have ventured out from something as &#34;health oriented&#34; as &#34;The Glam Veggie Burger&#34; to the heartier entrees like, yes, you know it...the pastas! All great, especially the ones drowning in rich, cheeses sauces (to my recollection as it has been years since my last, cheese heavy pasta here).<br>Recently, I tried the &#34;Cajun Jambalaya Pasta&#34; and was blown away. The flavors, the variety of crisp veggies, the sauce itself, will have you wanting to finish the entire plate bite after bite, but you won&#39;t be able to. No need to mention this as it is &#34;The Cheesecake Factory&#34;, but you definitely get your buck&#39;s worth in food. So much food! Leftovers!<br><br>   Service is great considering how mainstream and packed this place gets on weekends and even some weeknights. So, all in all, I recommend The Cheesecake Factory for a nice meal out with friends whether you&#39;re looking to socialize, get your drink and greasy munch on, or even for something more formal like a birthday dinner or what not. My recommendation; come early or make reservations (assuming this is an option) if you want to avoid the daunt of waiting (another well known down side to this chain). You&#39;ll most likely have a pleasant time.

Just had my dad&#39;s birthday lunch here and it was an  overall amazing experience. At this location, the evening can get quite busy and a little overwhelming; so a late afternoon lunch was perfect timing. Our server Elaina was so sweet &amp; helpful when it came to picking out vegan options. She helped me pick out the vegan Cobb salad which was so delicious and filling, there was plenty left over! Elaina was so delightful to be around and she had a plethora of knowledge on the items served as well. I hope you&#39;re lucky enough to have her as your server!

I love the Cheesecake here, especially the Banana Cream Cheesecake. A great selection of other cheesecakes and cakes to fit anyone&#39;s pallet. The food selection is also good, and often a calorie overload.

I gave it one star because we were seated immediately on a Saturday night. The bathroom has 3 stalls and one of the stall locks was out of order, another stall was pissed all over, so basically there was only one stall to use and there was a line of women in there. I ordered the chicken scampi and the sauce was not thick at all, it was almost like water and the chicken was bland and chewy, some of the bacon was not cooked thoroughly and other bits were burned. For the price, I will definitely be exploring other pasta places near me. The service was pretty much nonexistent because the waiter was working so many tables. I will not be coming back here.

I&#39;ve been going to Cheesecake Factory since I was 12 and have always loved eating there. Which is why it saddens me that I have to give them one star. I&#39;m writing this review out of principle because I was very disappointed with how my situation was handled by the manager, Patrick, when I received a counterfeit bill from their location. Last night, Wednesday Oct. 16, I ordered a strawberry cheesecake and a strawberry lemonade to go. I handed the woman a 50 dollar bill that she ran through the machine to make sure it was real which is ironic considering she then handed me a counterfeit 20 for change. I didn&#39;t realize it was fake because it was dark and I was in a hurry. It wasn&#39;t until the next day when doing a coffee run did I realize my bill was fake and I wasn&#39;t able to make the purchase. It was then that I called Cheesecake Factory and spoke to Patrick about the discrepancy and how inconvenienced I was and although he apologized was not very sympathetic to my situation which I felt was very poor customer service and unacceptable for such an established  restaurant chain. I would&#39;ve felt better had he offered some type of courtesy for the inconvenience.
I&#39;m leaving this rating for the most incredible service! My waiter Kerri made my whole night and made dining at cheesecake such a memorable experience! Full of laughter, fun and excitement!!

We only came here because we had a gift card sitting around for about a year. We&#39;ve been to this location before, and it&#39;s always good-tasting food, but trying to get healthy options can be super-loaded with sodium. Service was okay, there was a bit of mayhem at the front hostess station, and they didn&#39;t seem to have a handle on the waiting crowd. We ordered a lot of small plates and the spicy buffalo chicken sandwich. The stuffed mushrooms were okay. There was a beef broth style of sauce at the bottom of the pan, and it was mostly salt-based. The avocado egg rolls were very mediocre. I was hoping for a bit more seasoning or a textural difference inside, but it was pretty much just bland avocado. I did see small bits of red onion, but there was no taste evidence of it. The crunchy chicken samosas were probably the most unexpectedly tasty option out of all the small plates. The grilled cheese strips are not worth it. Save your money and make it at home. Literally, it&#39;s just a grilled cheese sandwich (no fancy cheese or anything) with bacon in it. The spicy buffalo chicken sandwich rocked! The buffalo sauce was a bit sporadic, but the piece of fried chicken was huge and gorgeously crispy. We were getting a bit full when we dove into the sandwich, so we opted to take off the bun, and honestly, it was better with the bun off! The bread added nothing to the sandwich. Overall, if you&#39;re in the area, and the other &#34;higher end&#34; eatery in the area (used to be one chain of Mexican cuisine, but as of last weekend, a new place was going in), this might be something for you. But of course, they&#39;re known for their cheesecakes.
Great food . <br>Do NOT recommend the strawberry shortcake !<br>Was just ice cream and biscuits, very disappointed .
The hostess is so rude!!! What&#39;s bad customer service. This manager needs to better train their staff, ugh!!

We had a lovely dinner at this very insanely busy location. My partner checked us in and while the wait was not long before our paging contraption started vibrating, we still waited about an additional 10 minutes inside after returning the device. So their logic is, you go inside, return he device and then they generate a little tag that is put in order for a hostess to then take and seat you. I think it just would make better sense to call you in when the hostess is ready to seat you. <br><br>Anyways, once we were seated our waitress took our drink and splitter order relatively quickly. First she brought out their amazingly delicious bread, then brought our our spinach artichoke dip and drinks. So, I am not a huge fan of this dip in general and found this one to be fine. My two monsters and partner loved it, so there you go. We ordered a steak and salmon combo plate, blackened chicken and shrimp and for the monsters chicken Alfredo and grilled veggies. All the food was tasty and as always we only got through 1/3 of our plates. We ended up taking most of it home, which was perfect next day. <br><br>It was nice. Nothing too exciting or exceptional. Just an overall good experience. Bon appétit
Their workers always give good customer service their food is amazing and affordable I love going to eat their with my family ..

Super date night here using up Christmas gift cards. We walked in on a busy Saturday night but didn&#39;t have to wait too long since we opted to sit outside. Started with an order of buffalo wings which were cooked to perfection. Large wings that were extra crunchy and served with some potent blue cheese dressing. Next we ordered the bacon bacon cheeseburgers and asked for them to be lettuce wrapped and had cesar salads instead of french fries. This burger is hands down the best thing at The Cheesecake Factory. Thick pork belly, crispy bacon and a huge burger loaded with cheese. The burger was so filling that we didn&#39;t even have room for the salad.<br><br>Service was great, nice and attentive. Tons of refills too.

Best Happy Hour in the Valley. We visit almost every week. Great drinks, really good Happy Hour food selection, and the bartenders, Jason, Des and Brian rock. Great guys, great service and a lot of fun.

The food was great and all. I ordered the herb crusted filet salmon and my boyfriend ordered some herb crusted parmesan chicken plate and he seemed to enjoy it but not giving 5 stars because the service was horrible.<br>Our server never checked in with us once and she disappeared every time. We had to wait about 15 minutes for something we needed because she just didn&#39;t seem to be around.... it was a bummer and she wasn&#39;t very enthusiastic either while serving us

They truly do need to improve their quality of food. The shrimp scampi I ordered was drenched in oil and not even eatable. Furthermore, the cheesecake was extremely dry and tasted aged. I am not sure why my daughter likes coming here for her birthday as I am never impressed.
Long wait when not busy. Server ignored us for 25 minutes, we only ordered dessert and coffee my coffee had a fruit fly in it . I had to ask the server to remove it from my check.

We haven&#39;t been to a Cheesecake Factory in quite some time. Have to say we were very impressed with the Sherman Oaks location.  Customer service was fantastic. We didn&#39;t have to wait. I bunk our server was running late but the manager came to take care of us. No wait. <br><br>Loved that they had a great selection for kids menu. And loved their healthy menu options. Food was delicious. Drinks were great too. The hubby and I ordered the Long Island ice teas. Really yummy.<br><br>Enjoyed our visit and will be back!

Have tried to order Dinner to be delivered via Door Dash.  2nd time in 3 days my order was cancelled because the restaurant was closed when the drivers arrived.  The delivery service wasn&#39;t notified the restaurant was closed.<br><br>Signed into Yelp to find that this CF location had recent issues with a rat in the bar area.<br><br>Oops!<br><br>Hope their able to get it resolved soon!!

I really don&#39;t understand the mediocre reviews. All cheesecake factory restaurants are consistent with great food and service and the delicious bread.  This one is the same.  One of my favorite is the Thai chicken lettuce wrap appetizer, I love all their salads. The chicken Taquito appetizer and the avocado rolls are yummy. Any one of their cheesecakes are amazing. This location is a little bit trickier because you need to park in the structure and walk to it.  But it&#39;s not a problem.

First off let&#39;s start with prices lord Jesus do they have high prices. Mind you I don&#39;t mind paying for food That&#39;s great well this food was horrible . We am went to celebrate a friends birthday and 6 out for 8 people disliked their food . All sauces weren&#39;t real cheese sauce more like fucking flour . I ordered Mac and cheese for my daughter , steak sandwich for me boy was the bread hard and steak was nothin but fat so super chewy . I also ordered an appetizer the pretzel bites and those fuckers were hard too and the cheese which I thought was going to be melted cheese not some fake ass shit it was made of nothing but flour to thicken it up . Mind you it was to thick the pretzel bites were dipped in and no cheese were on them it left a damn dent in the fake ass cheese . My wife got her shrimp plate which she enjoyed but damn worst $70 ever spent this was my first and laasssstttt time going to this place please stop making pastas as giving fake ass sauces and cheese I could taste the damn flour
It was my first experience,  really I&#39;m happy<br>The cheese cake and coffee was fresh<br>My waitress I think her name was Miriam <br>She is very nice and professional

Worst customer service ever ! My friend and I had to wait half an hour to get a table while there were plenty of empty tables , then took for ever to get our order and then food was so cold !!! The waiter didn&#39;t even stop by to see if we need anything. When we were paying, he made us to wait another 10 mins to we get our cards. The general customer service was awful !!!

ZERO STARS. I went here some time back. The food was terrible. I was willing to suffer through my bone dry, (obviously) previously frozen chicken tenders, but when I noticed my boyfriend was also hating his pizza, I asked him if it was as bad as my meal. He said it was pretty bad so I tried a bite. Yeah, it was terrible. <br><br>So we told the waiter that the food was bad and he INSTANTLY took the food away and called a manager. Oh boy, what a piece of work this lady was. She IMMEDIATELY started trying act like we were some kind of moochers looking for a free meal. She kept saying over and over again (very loudly): &#34;WELL IF IT WAS SO BAD, WHY DID YOU EAT SO MUCH OF IT?&#34; Mind you, we had barely touched the food, and the waiter had already taken it away so that we could not point out the fact that it was barely touched (I bet this was intentional).<br><br>This manager was looking for an Oscar for her performance or something because holy crap was this woman chewing up the scenery with her over the top acting. It was easily one of the most bizarre things we had ever experienced in a restaurant. She asked us what was wrong with the food, and after every point we made, she exclaimed (practically yelling): &#34;UNBELIEVABLE!!!! I&#39;VE NEVER HEARD THIS BEFORE!!&#34;. &#34;WELL IF IT WAS SO BAD, WHY DID YOU EAT SO MUCH OF IT?!!!&#34;.<br><br>She was clearly trying to save face in front of the rest of the patrons (probably largely tourists), as well as trying to embarrass us by making a giant scene out of it. Well, she certainly succeeded in making it into a giant scene. Just about everyone in the place started looking over at our table to see what this lunatic was yelling about.<br><br>After she went through her whole routine, which I swear she had been practicing in a mirror for these occasions (It seemed so rehearsed), she asked us if we wanted a &#34;to go&#34; bag. A &#34;to go&#34; bag???? For the food we just told you was terrible and we didn&#39;t want? Are you high on crack?<br><br>I imagine she wanted us to say yes so she could be like: &#34;ah HAH!, SO IT WASN&#39;T BAD AFTER ALL!!!&#34;<br><br>But it really was terrible, and we really didn&#39;t want it. We left vowing to never return (still very hungry) as everyone in the place stared at us. We made a quick stop at In N&#39; Out Burger for something actually edible. FAIL ON EVERY POSSIBLE LEVEL. AVOID THIS PLACE LIKE THE PLAGUE. HORRIBLE FOOD, AND EVEN WORSE MANAGEMENT. <br><br>And for the record, if you are reading this, Miss wanna-be over the top actress, we weren&#39;t embarrassed by your insane behavior. Just disgusted. Find a different line of work.

I&#39;ve been to this location before and the food was not good had to send it back!! After a long break, I went back on Sunday, early evening!! <br>FOOD DISGUSTING, I ordered Chicken Madera( supposedly there best dish).. <br>when the food came I noticed how nice the asparagus looked! I also noticed a red (sauce) all over the dish, started eating the Mashed potatoes which were really good, then cut the chicken and noticed the breading which was all soggy and not even attached to the chicken, took a bite and tasted egg and cheese but very bland, since I was enjoying my company I tried to not focus on what I didn&#39;t like about the food, took another bite and same thing, but this red sauce was actually grease all over the plate- I asked the waitress&#34; is this grease all over? &#34; she said well it could be the grease from the cheese, but I can take it back and I said no, because I didn&#39;t want to wait for something else to be cooked and my company be done with their food. But I couldn&#39;t take another bite, I did finish the mashed potatoes! But I felt sick to my stomach! - we didn&#39;t even get desert and we left- so I paid $28 for mashed potatoes!!<br>I was so disgusted, the food looked like a heated up TV dinner  with no flavor and added grease- GROSS!!!! No wonder why they seat you where there&#39;s barely any light- so you won&#39;t see what your eating!!<br><br>On my receipt it said  please let us know how we&#39;re doing-  so I went on line took their survey and asked to be contacted- NEVER heard from them!! Food inedible PLEASE DO NOT go to this restaurant EVER

I&#39;ve been here multiple times and I have never had a bad experience. The only one thing that happened was a long wait, about two hours but it was on a special occasion which is expected. Either way, the food is always fresh and tasteful. A must for all the locals.

My only &#34;complaint&#34; is for the hostess/hosts to be clear when they call that our table was ready. Apparently someone else was seated instead of my party (group of 5). But after the mix up, another table was ready for us so we only waited just a few more minutes. <br>I enjoy coming to cheesecake factory and I&#39;m glad my party wasn&#39;t too hangry or the extra wait time would have made the experience unpleasant. <br>Good food and ambience for casual/semi-formal dining.

Update for 6/16/16 visit:<br><br>I really like this place.  I often go here to celebrate birthdays in my family.  This time it was my mom&#39;s first visit and it was her birthday.  Our experience was ok not so great and it wasn&#39;t awful.  However, my to-go cakes (leftovers), weren&#39;t packed well.  They were just dumped upside down.  So when I got home, looking forward to eating it at midnight, I opened it and found it all unappetizing.  Such poor service...  Probably management can do something about this.  Thank goodness I didn&#39;t order additional cakes....<br><br>******<br>Love this place and the food.  The cakes are to die for... Hehehehe...

I love this location! Very convenient for me since I live in Northridge. They validate parking so that&#39;s good. There food is delicious and their drinks are great. The service there is really good. Today when I went we got a waiter named Oscar, very nice guy ! When you go I recommend you ask for him. I will definitely be going back to this location !

My boyfriend &amp; I have been coming to this establishment for years. We usually visit about once a week and sit in the bar, however tonight when we came in all the seats in the bar were full so we grabbed a booth in the restaurant. Antwyon was our server and his service was unbelievable! He was attentive, considerate, made us laugh, &amp; went above &amp; beyond with his customer service! We go out to eat for all of our meals on a daily basis &amp; he provided better customer service then we have received at any other restaurant! This guy deserves a promotion! You guys have a true gem here in your company! Antwyon thank you very much! We will be requesting you from here on out!

Had a pretty bad experience with customer service here. Anytime I needed something I&#39;d be ignored or felt rushed. I had the stuffed burger with a side Caesar salad. The burger felt like I was eating a pure ball of grease and the salads crutons were harder than a rock. My friend shared a steak Diane plate with me which tasted a lot better than what I had but it seemed like it wasn&#39;t enough for even one person. The best thing we had was the spinach dip. I still left a tip but I most likely won&#39;t be coming back to this location as I definitely prefer the Marina Del Rey location by far. Also I like to point out the fact after we went to this location I looked at Yelp reviews and saw the video where they had a rat crawling above the ceiling. Yeah but no thank you on coming back not even for a lifetime of free meals.

I always love cheesecake factories.  Their menus are AWESOME, with so many options, even the pickiest eater can find something. That lactose intolerant, gluten sensitive, vegan Auntie that doesn&#39;t like cheese or pepper- even SHE can have a 4 course meal at the Cheesecake Factory!<br><br>Their prices range from ridiculously cheap to &#34;not cheap but worth it&#34; so eating out doesn&#39;t have to break the bank.<br><br>The atmosphere ranges well too; feel like having a drink with the girls? The loungey bar area is nice and the bartender still knows how to open a bottle of champagne or make a slippery nipple shot.  On the flip side, if you&#39;re looking for a restaurant that&#39;s baby friendly, they always seem to have a stroller friendly table in an area where other kids are louder than yours... so no one even notices when your kid starts singing Elmo songs.<br><br>The food is great.  I think out of the last 100 times I&#39;ve eaten here, only 1.5 times have I had to send my food back for a correction.  <br><br>The cheesecake....oh the cheesecake.  So many to choose from!!! I am seriously infatuated with the Reese&#39;s cheesecake here, that their carrot cheesecake...and the red velvet...and the crazy chocolate cake....and the....list goes on.  So good!<br><br>Most people don&#39;t even know they have happy hour at Cheesecake factory&#39;s- drinks and appetizers on special.  What a deal!

Food was delicious and wait was okay. Worst was the front hostess stand. They take your name and give you a buzzer. Then when the buzzer goes off they take it and have you stand there while they wait for the hostess or seated to take you to a table. Our wait was essentially doubled. I have to think they&#39;re probably playing the system there. Oh look the system says we sat them in less than ten minutes by in actuality it was double that. It&#39;s the only explanation I can come up with and that was a bit frustrating. Otherwise not bad.
I have frequented this establishment for years and have always had good service. The service today by or server Marcia S. was outstanding! The food was delicious too.

The long wait is almost as famous as the cheesecake which I have to admit I have still yet to try.<br>With the portions they serve, who has room for dessert?<br>Best bet is to come at off times, we went right when they opened and that worked out well.<br>Service is a hit or miss, this time our server was nice and the food came out quickly.<br>The menu is way too much, but that also makes this a place you can take anyone to.<br>Prices are a bit high, but given the portion size its justified.<br>Wouldn&#39;t go out of my way to come back, but the food was fine all around.

So, I was there the other day for the weekend. We had such a pleasant experience there.<br>We met the host Malakai and the waitress Elizabeth. They were both exceptionally great and friendly. They both went out their way to helped and served us very well.<br>There&#39;s no need to more about the food. The food was consistently awesome.<br>We will definitely go back whenever we are in the neighborhood. Great job guys!<br>Keep up with your great work! I wish all the other locations were as good as this location. :)

Been here a couple of times and the service and mindset of wait service is horrible.  They are always understaffed and it shows in the attitude.   Today was the worst of all when after waiting 30 minutes and people were being seated after we arrived. Checked in wait time and lady snapped I told you it was going to be an hour and half.  Yes we were a party of ten, who tried to get reservation but received call they don&#39;t accept.  So we arrived early and expected a small wait - but to be treated so rudely was too much.  Walked to Frieda&#39;s and they were so nice and seated us within minutes even though they were just as busy.  The wait servers were exceptional nice and attentive.  Thank you cheese factory I would never had a wonderful birthday dinner if it wasn&#39;t for the rudeness.

I been to cheesecake many many times over the years. the menu is extensive and the portions large. Food is good, but sometimes it&#39;s better and on this visit not only was the food good, but our server (Brance) was exceptional. What a pleasure he was. We needed nothing because he was on top of everything. Had no problem editing our order to make it to our specifications. We enjoyed sitting at his station and now we always ask in case he&#39;s working

Came in with a party of 10. Hostess said she would let us know how long of a wait. After more than 10 minutes I followed up with her and she &#34;snapped, I told you it would be 40 to 50 minutes!&#34; I then informed her that no one had informed us of the wait. I understand that they were getting busy, but when we arrived there were only 2 groups of 2 ahead of us. In a matter of 10 to 15 minutes several groups of 3 to 4 people came in and were seated. So it would seem that based upon the number of tables seated during our wait, that she either forgot about us or just folded under the pressure. Based upon her rudeness, we went next door to Frida&#39;s next door and spent $408 on a great dinner. No

The family desired &#34;just regular American food&#34; for a Father&#39;s day celebration and since we were in Sherman Oaks The Cheesecake Factory was the place. The menu is so comprehensive that there is a large ranged of offerings - &#34;regular American&#34; as well as dishes inspired by Italy, Mexico, and Asia. Something for everyone!<br><br>There are aspects of The Cheesecake Factory that seem to open them to ridicule often, and those are true at this outlet too: no reservations, long and uncomfortable wait, very odd &#34;secondary wait&#34; after the buzzer buzzes, and spotty service when first seated.<br><br>Fortunately our wait was not long.<br><br>Once getting past that we had a nice table on the front patio. Our waitress was sweet and efficient. The food was good... actually, very good... as always.<br><br>But I almost didn&#39;t stay past the first two minutes at the table. My eating utensils, nicely wrapped in a cloth napkin, still had food from the previous user. So did the replacement set... and so did my bread dish. I as totally grossed out at that point. Then I started noticing the significant number of waiters/bus staff with out-of-control hair - both head hair and facial hair. Eeeewwww... and combined with dirty shirts on two of the gentlemen it made me wonder why the management would have them wearing white polo shirts, or didn&#39;t ask them to change into clean ones.<br><br>This Cheesecake Factory seems to have some problems with sanitation... and, yes, I do believe that the water is so hot and the sanitizer is so effective that the utensils/dishes are sanitary.. but residual food on them is still disgusting.<br><br>For me that transformed a nice family celebration into an hour of trying to repress retching while also trying to enjoy the otherwise decent food.  Had it not been for the sanitation issues, this would have been a 4-star review.

The Cheesecake Factory happy hour is one of my favorites. Great selection an awesome wine. The four of them in the local area is excellent. One of my favorites is the one at the Grove overlooking the festivities. There are several items on the appetizer menu that is just incredible. And don&#39;t forget the bread and butter is irresistible.

I am absolutely astounded by people lining up to wait for a cramped seat in the over crowded noisy Cheesecake Factory. The food is a 1 on a scale of 5 and the noise and atmosphere are a negative 5.<br><br>The menu is 500 items too long and nothing is appealing. I read the menu 4 times last night and found nothing and I do that each time I&#39;ve been to the Cheesecake Factory. Except for the burgers (why order a burger at Cheesecake Factory??) and the discontinued caramel chicken, I&#39;ve never had a single dish that I would order again.<br><br>If you like to wait to sit in cramped tables, eat really uninspired overpriced food then get in line to join the throngs of people who completely disagree with me.

I love this spot!<br>Whenever my family and I plan on going to the movies , we go to the Cheesecake Factory before or after the movie.<br>There&#39;s a parking lot<br>Great service <br><br>Must haves <br>Tex mex or avacado egg roll<br>Factory burrito<br>chicken madera <br>Louisiana pasta<br>And I could name many more!<br><br>They also have a low calorie menu

I just took my team there to celebrate together and didn&#39;t have the best experience. Server Gillian was extremely rude and unprofessional. Working in customer service myself, I was extremely disappointed and left feeling that it&#39;s important for the management team to be aware of the lack of respect her staff had. My entire team noticed Gillian&#39;s rude attitude and mentioned that it should be addressed.

Have eaten at several Cheesecake Factories, however my first time at this location. Was not very impressed. Our waitress seemed very distracted every time she talked to us and did not remember to bring what we had requested. My friends salad came out with no dressing as she had asked for it on the side, but no dressing came and when she requested it, attitude was given. I got the cheese omelette that had spinach and mushrooms. Omelette had NO cheese...I also had coffee and asked the server for sugar, after waiting for over 10 minutes and her walking by us twice I asked again...she then blamed my no sugar on someone else...not cool.

***Not a pre-Arclight dinner - horrible with time***<br><br>Honestly, the food can be great but when the service is awful that&#39;s the take away. <br><br>Our waitress barely bothered with us and management was no help. We had to ask for a clean napkin, for water, for appetizer plates - literally everything. <br><br>It took her nearly 30 minutes to even bother asking if we would like to order an appetizer and no matter how hard we tried to flag her down she just was not coming back to our table. <br><br>Finally I asked a manager for help and he was so busy laughing it up with the other guy in a tie that I honestly don&#39;t think he bothered doing a thing. <br><br>The last person to order got her food first and sat there with it while the rest of us hadn&#39;t even gotten an appetizer yet. Then everything else came at once. <br><br>By then we had about 15 minutes to eat and we had told her our movie time. And it was my friend&#39;s birthday. <br><br>They were just all around a miserable choice.

Monday my friends and I went to see beauty and the beast and we&#39;re hungry after. We decided to go to cheese cake factory. We had a party of 9 and they sat us quickly. It was towards the end of the night but we were seated in about 10min. Are waiter was a young gentleman. I wish I remember his name but he gave us excellent service. We got our water and breads immediately. Then we order avocado egg rolls to start. My favorite!! Then we all ordered. See pictures for entrees. I got the chicken bellagio. That was a nice healty tasty plate. Nice check and basil noodles. With an amazing Arugula salad topping. Needed a sauce on top because it was a bit dry. But still really good. Great meal and great service. I&#39;m a happy diner. Thanks!

I needed to just write a review about our waiter Christian, He was so great. He was very kind, I had an issue with a salad and he was so wonderfully accommodating and happily replaced the salad and with a smile. I just felt like he needed a bit of recognition. Really great service!

After waiting to be seated they took the buzzer and asked for us to wait against the wall so our server could take us to the table . I was getting extremely irritated because people who were waiting after us were being seated before us . So, I approached the girl at the front desk and asked her why we were still waiting and she replied with &#34;do you have your buzzer &#34; .. I clearly told her at least 3 times that they took it from us and asked us to wait on the side . We finally got to our &#34;table &#34; and the floor beneath me was just disgusting . If you&#39;re going to make me wait this long , why don&#39;t you at least clean up the area where ill be sitting.Corporate really needs to figure their issues here.. <br><br>Well , the only good thing at this place is our server Freddy !! He&#39;s very attentive , knows the menu like the back of his hand and he kept coming back and refilling our drinks . He also passed by a couple of times to ask us how our food was . Thank you Freddy !!

Cheesecake Factory is most likely one of my favorite places to stop for a faster dinner but not fast food. This location is quite busy and very dark. Anna our server was very good considering how extremely busy they were. I had the orange chicken with brown rice. It wasn&#39;t as good as it normally is however it wasn&#39;t bad. Again fridays are SO BUSY HERE! Overall I do suggest this place. I wasn&#39;t totally blown away with how the hosts run the front but hey everyone has good and bad days. The bathroom was disgusting though.
This institution is losing its juice. Ordered take out and they got everything wrong... The food was processed and nasty.
Chicken Madeira was delicious!! And Ryan G made our experience very pleasant. I would recommend his table. I&#39;m definitely coming back again.

Ok, this is my 2nd time going to this particular cheesecake factory. My first experience was rather uncomfortable and unmemorable because of the company I&#39;d gone with. I was so miserable, I actually ordered a Caesar salad, without chicken and didn&#39;t order a drink or dessert. I was that desperate to get away! So, I was really looking forward to giving Cheesecake Factory a second try with my family. <br>We&#39;d arrived around 4:00 and got told we had a 30 minute wait. That wasn&#39;t a problem for us because there were a few stores us ladies wanted to peak in. So, we left the men to wait for us to return. After looking in a few stores, we returned and we were still waiting. However, it was only a few minutes, we were seated and they found us a nice spot away from the crowd.<br>Our server was very patient with us, the menu was so huge and unfamiliar that it took time for us to find the drinks. My dad, as always ordered the coffee and my brother just wanted water. I ordered the pineapple cherry limeade non-alcoholic specialty and my sister ordered the strawberry martini. My mother, doesn&#39;t drink caffeinated coffee, but my Dad&#39;s coffee was so good that she kept drinking out of his.<br> Dad ordered the bacon-bacon cheeseburger. My brother ordered the Factory Burrito, which was HUGE! I mean, he surprised our server that he was able to finish the whole burrito. (My brother has a stomach like Joey Tribbiani.) After some pressure from me, my mother caved and ordered the white chicken chili and my younger sister followed suit. I stepped out of my comfort zone of and ordered chicken bellagio. Now, I DO NOT like pasta, but the description assured me that it was something I&#39;d like. And that gamble paid off, everything was delicious and the portions were rather large. My mother and I wound up taking half of our meals home. Again, our server was on point, he offered to box up our food for us before we even asked. He also took our dessert orders and get them ready to go as well.<br>So, my brother, dad and sister ordered the Reese&#39;s peanut butter chocolate cake cheesecake, white chocolate raspberry truffle cheesecake, chocolate chip cookie dough and cheesecake. Now, my mother and I can&#39;t really eat cheesecake because it&#39;s so rich, we ordered the chocolate tower truffle cake. We had dessert at home several hours later. Now, that is one gorgeous cake and they box the desserts as if they&#39;ve been plated to be presented for Gordon Ramsay! My mother and I split it, but we still put half of it back and we&#39;ll be having it tomorrow. My dad was the only one who could polish off his cheesecake.<br>Now, the atmosphere is nice, the servers are friendly and professional. It is a little expensive for us, the total came up to $175! However, we&#39;d been given two $50 gift cards, so that took it down a bit. But for that kind of food quality, great atmosphere and friendly service, I&#39;d say it was worth it. We&#39;ll definitely be popping back in on occasion, but definitely skipping dessert and drinks to keep it a bit more within our budget.

I don&#39;t even know where to start. I was having dinner and drinks with my friend and noticed on the second drink that was handed to me by the manager named Vincent it had a crack in the glass so once the waitress came around I let her know and she happily took the drink for me. Well when the manager was told he came up to the table and had asked what had happened to the glass as if I had purposely put the crack in it myself. I asked if he inspects every single glass that was served and he said he inspects everything. Keep in mind the glass was still somewhat filled, I only had a few sips and he came off to me as if I had put the crack on the glass myself. Then after I had said something he apologized for it but the way he came off from the start was extremely rude.

This place is trash. The food is decent but the service is worse. Every time I order lunch to go no one EVER acknowledges that you&#39;ve walked in or that you&#39;re even at the counter to pick up food. I&#39;ve literally been at the counter to grab my to go food and the woman will be behind the counter plating cheesecake, doesn&#39;t acknowledge you, sees you and then proceeds to keep doing whatever without seeing what you need. I&#39;ve been given my soup with a non secured lid twice and had it spill all over my food. The hosts aren&#39;t any better and who knows the fuck management is half the time. Subpar experience on a daily basis, how?!

Terrible, really terrible.<br>There was a time that Cheese cake was a good place to get good food. After what they served me, I&#39;ll never go back. They took my money and gave me inedible garbage.<br>I ordered the Evelyn&#39;s best pasta and the pasta was NOT even close to cooked ENOUGH. The broccoli was rubbery and chewy. The rest of the dish had this strange overly bitter taste. Inedible. Definitely a waste of money.
Wars customer service horrible food And bad management I wouldn&#39;t recommend anybody going there

I find it this place pricey that&#39;s why I hardly come here. Friends from out of town wanted to try so we went for lunch. We spent $20 average for meal &amp; soda which is on the lunch menu. Food is good. Loud place. Server is very nice. <br>We enjoyed the wheat bread and it&#39;s comp!
always come here on my bday. delicious food, staff are very friendly, nice place to celebrate any occution, definitely will<br>come back again

My friend and I love Cheesecake Factory.  Every time I come here I tell myself that I need to try something new since their menu is about 50 pages long.  However I get my usual Chicken Romano and depending on my mood, I would get the Chicken Masala or the Chinese Chicken Salad. <br><br>My Chicken Romano as usual was very good.  The chicken is tender and juicy and the pasta is cooked perfectly.  The wait staff always so friendly and we never have a problem.

The food is pretty good, I mean it is Cheesecake Factory. Only three stars this visit because of the complete lack of attention by the bar. After we ordered, we were offered bread. 10 minutes later, our food comes. Then the bread comes in last minute. Gee, thanks. <br><br>We were sitting there waiting for attention, attempting to make eye contact because we wanted to box up our food. However a former (or current) employee in street clothes walked up to the bar and received all the attention. Two bartenders and a barback, servers walking by and chatting it up while he was getting free bread. Seriously? I get that they&#39;re your friend, but we&#39;re paying customers and we were ignored for a bit. If we come back to the theater, we&#39;ll pop in here if there is no/a short wait. If you want Cheesecake Factory, I suggest you go to any of the other locations in the Valley, the odds of their service being better are higher.

Cheesecake Factory, then there is &#34;<br>Cheesecake Factory, Sherman Oaks Galleria &#34; this location with its open air dining is very special. Same eight known as menu but with a upscale attitude and atmosphere.The service is spotty as always for a cheesecake factory. With the added amenities I will not take away a star for that. They also have this waitress by the name of Dianne makes every body feels at home, She is a star alone.

We are here visiting for my wifes haircut appt at Paul Mitchell. And my father in-law and son decided to have some lunch here. We were first greeted by Juliana the front host, And she greeted us with a smile and offered to put our stroller away. Wich to be honest was the start of a great lunch. Sat us down immediately and Brance.S took over and gave us the best customer service and attention in a long time from this Restaurant. We live in Anaheim and been to the Anaheim,Brea,Irvine and never had a good experience like we did almost 2 hrs away!! Keep up the great job guys . Managers please recognize these 2 individuals and give them a raise because they can be working at a top 5 star restaurant no problem!!!!!

I love this CF ! Food is always yummier here for some reason ! I took my mom on a late dinner date the other night we enjoyed the Chipotle Chicken Pasta , so Yummy . The location for this one is pretty awesome , it&#39;s at the Sherman Oaks Galleria so you have some cool stuff around like the Arclight Cinema and cute shops . I must mention The happy hour at this place is awesome 4-6PM on weekdays . Restaurant is clean and cool dim romantic lighting and a wonderful Staff! P.S Leave room for desert Kiddies !

I&#39;m giving a 1 star after many years of being a loyal customer! Since Cheesecake has always been a favorite place, a group of friends decided to celebrate our BF birthday. All was going well, food good and all happy. When our bill came we split it amongst ourselves with our cards. Evidently, we made a mistake and didn&#39;t give enough gratuity. The sever made sure to call us out and insult our group! First of all, we ALWAYS tip well and were so embarrassed!! Of course we apologized profusely for our error and she stayed at the table until we paid more!  I understand servers work VERY hard for their tips. However, mistakes happen!  The next day called the manager and she said she would contact my friend regarding giving her a refund, no word or phone call. Never going back to this place!

4 stars for food quality and large menu selection but 2 stars for service.  Simply awful hostess team.  But we had a fantastic server who helped make up for it.<br><br>3 hostesses were working the reception area last night at about 7:45PM when we exited ArcLight Sherman Oaks and made our way to the restaurant to grab a bit to eat.  THREE.  We waited for them to help the two parties ahead of us and then stepped up to the counter to ask for a table for two.  We waited almost 5 minutes for even ONE of the THREE hostesses to say hello, welcome us to the restaurant and tell us it would be a moment.  No acknowledgment whatsoever.  I was a hostess for several years at various establishments.  The number one rule:  make guests feel welcome.  Even if it&#39;s just to say &#34;Hi, give us a few moments and we&#39;ll take care of you.&#34;  We didn&#39;t even get a simple &#34;hello&#34;.  When the girl finally acknowledged our presence (she was wearing a necklace that said something like &#34;Marcela&#34;), she simply said &#34;How many?&#34;  Again, no hello or greeting or &#34;sorry for the wait&#34;, just &#34;how many?&#34;.  We said &#34;2 please&#34; and she responded &#34;inside or outside.&#34;  We said we&#39;d take the first available and she said &#34;then we can seat you now.&#34;  Great!  Without a word to us, she handed two menus to another hostess and said something so we thought we were going to the table.  She said &#34;not you - another party.&#34;  This girl was like the Terminator - barely spoke full sentences.  OK, so we stepped back.  Sorry, we thought when she said &#34;we can seat you now&#34; that actually meant &#34;now&#34;.  Nope.  Waited only a few moments or so and then a hostess called our name.  We approached and this girl who had previously been behind the reception desk not acknowledging our presence for five minutes upon arrival flashes a lovely smile and says &#34;Hi there, let me show you to your table.&#34;  It was like a totally different person.  That lovely smile would have gone a long way when we arrived.<br><br>This is a teaching moment folks -- if you work in the customer service industry, how about saying hello and welcoming your customers to your business?  It&#39;s a nice way to make them feel good and even if there&#39;s a wait to be seated, just give some kind of acknowledgment.  Even a friendly smile and holing your finger up to indicate &#34;one moment&#34; would be sufficient.  We felt like we were bothering them by even being there.  <br><br>At the end of the day it&#39;s not that big of a deal in the whole scheme of life so I&#39;m wondering why I just wrote three paragraphs about it.  LOL!  I guess it&#39;s just a small, simple thing that would go a long way towards making guests feel welcome in your establishment.  If anyone&#39;s reading this - maybe teach your hostess team some basic manners and the fundamentals of human interaction.  It would make coming to your restaurant so much more pleasurable.<br><br>BTW, the food was great as always and our server was OUTSTANDING.  I wish I remembered his name.  He had a wonderful personality, knew the menu inside and out and was helpful, kind and fun.  So good job on the server staff!!

The cheesecakes are to die for! Just cant decide which one to get because they are so many and looking delicious!<br>To go save you can always eat the classic one and may put some extra topping if you want.<br><br>The avocado egg rolls are indeed delicious, great for a starter and if you plan to have a main course after, they will be just enough for 2-3 people to try.<br><br>The burrito grande is a great surprise and its really huge. Unless you didn&#39;t eat for a day, I don&#39;t think a woman can eat it all, so you will have lunch for the next say too :)<br><br>Great service and good price wise.

I am too tired and still too hungry to write a full review about the rude, overly emotional, dramatic yet oscar worthy phone performance the manager named Justin gave tonight.
