He shifted the issue of an item missing off of a pick up order completely to stuff I wasnt even talking about..smh.  People really do too much nowadays. Hanging up on a customer that wasn&#39;t even cussing you out or disrespecting you isn&#39;t normal. Getting angry so quickly because you may be a little frustrated with your day isn&#39;t cool either. I will go over him then update this with all the details. Just be aware that the manager named Justin is unprofessional with a bad temper ( going off of my customer service experience with him alone) representing everyone&#39;s favorite comfort food spot.

We had a bit of a shocking experience at the bar area on a recent Sunday afternoon. Planning on having some drinks and appetizers we were excited to find two empty seats at the bar. It looked like others at the bar had already been served. Two menus had been left at the bar and we started looking over them. Two people were working at the bar. Not once did either of them acknowledge our presence in any way! There was no greeting. Not a nod. Not even a &#34;I&#39;ll be with you in a moment.&#34; Nothing. After being so thoroughly ignored we left.

First time here and had a great experience. Noise friendly and kind staff. I ordered the Louisiana chicken pasta and it was delicious. Thanks to the server that recommended it <br><br>Oh! And the best part, they serve bread with butter

Out of all the places to eat on Ventura Blvd I always pick The Cheesecake Factory. Yeah I know you dumb foodies hate chain restaurants but this one in particular rocks you can&#39;t go wrong. The waiter I always ask for is Eric because out of a great staff he&#39;s the best. There&#39;s only two reasons I come to this horrible mall one is the Archlight theatre and a close second is The Cheesecake Factory. If one these two wasn&#39;t here I don&#39;t know if I&#39;d come back. It&#39;s a perfect combo to take my wife (BFF) for brunch, lunch or just a simple date to loosen her up. I love it here

The food here is just ok.. not great not bad either.. For the prices they charge you&#39;d think it was a fine dining establishment.. the  restaurant is always crowded and the service is a hit or miss.. Definitely a good place for your lunch break, but nothing else...

Favorite restaurant ever. Cheesecake Factory never disappoints. Perfect place for a splurge meal. The food presentation is flawless and the flavors are incredible. <br><br>For 2 people to have dinner and dessert, you will spend about $60-75, but it is so worth it!

Just felt like sharing this with others to see if it&#39;s normal or am I having a long day.  So they wipe/ clean tables with a towel / cloth and place silverware on the table , there is no way that cloth is sanitized every single time.  It&#39;s gotta have germs and then to place all of your silverware on the table ?? Not sure how hygienic is that.   Other than that server was good and good was okay.  Chicken samosas were a little salty.  They are open till 11 on weekdays so it&#39;s pretty busy at nights.  Not lot of choices at that hour of the day . Cheers <br>This response from Cheesecake Factory guest services seems like a computer generated reply.   They didn&#39;t see two stars ?? Or my concern ?? No mention of any of that.  Don&#39;t know what to make of it.

I called in an order for 7:45, I arrived around 7:50 to a very chaotic restaurant. As I was getting in line to pay/get my order I saw a women take a take out bag full of food and leave (without paying). This turned out to be my order. When I went to go pay for my food I was told that it would be ready in a few minutes. After waiting for about 15 minutes I still had not received my food so I went to go check in with one of the cashiers. They told me that they didn&#39;t know where my order was multiple times without actually addressing how they would fix the issue. They paid little to no attention to the problem for about five minutes until I spoke up. I finally got a hold of the manager who said he would have my meal remade and offered me a free piece of cheesecake. I never received an apology of any kind and the cashier were very rude and short with me. I don&#39;t think that I can ever give my money to this chain ever again. Also when we got home our food was cold (we live literally 5 min away) If I could give them no stars I would.

Met a friend here for lunch.  Ordered the skinnylicious Asian chicken salad.  What came was more than 97% lettuce, and very little chicken.  This was the full order.  Utterly ridiculous for $14.95.  I would have gotten way more chicken at Sharkey&#39;s and for half the price.  Moreover, the lettuce they gave was old, wilted and of inferior quality.  Not nutritious at all.  I came back to the office to eat a protein bar to compensate.  I will not be coming back here.

I will start with I LOVE the cheese cake factory!<br>But yesterday was the first time I asked them for a pick up. Ordered the Sheila&#39;s Chicken and Avocado salad which usually you get it with guacamole, lots of avocado and dressing. <br>What I got was not it at all!<br>I got lots of leaves, just a bit of carrots and maybe 2 small pieces of avocado, without dressing at all! <br>I was so looking forward to eating the salad on my lunch break but discovered I can&#39;t eat dry leaves. <br>I also asked for only dark bread but got white bread instead. <br>I usually love eating at cheese cake but was so disappointed from their lack of attention when it comes to pick up delivery.

This location is ideally located and caters well to the crowd there. I have been here many times, and while it is always busy they know how to make it work. I came here on father&#39;s day. It was crazy busy, but the staff took it in stride. I was there with a party of 5, and it w a going to be a 45 min wait. It made sense because it was father&#39;s day. My parents decided they wanted to pass the time by eating appetizers at the bat area. I got a long island ice tea, which was pretty good. That was my favorite 3rd choice as they didn&#39;t have the ingredients for the first 2 drinks I had originally chosen : passion fruit Margarita and Ruby red sunrise. It was fine though as the drinks were good and popular.<br><br>As a table, we decided to order the calamari and the Thai lettuce wraps as appetizers. Both were made really quickly and prepared nicely.<br><br>I decided to order the skinnylicious salmon, which comes wait it vegetables instead of the the mashed potatoes that the original version comes with. <br><br>My sister ordered the lunch portion chicken marshala, which is a pretty good size for a lunch portion. It was also cooked really well. <br><br>Lastly for dessert,  my sister and I ordered the sundae which was more than big enough to share between the two of us. <br><br>Overall, it was a pretty good experience.  I don&#39;t think you can ever go wrong with the cheesecake factory. :)
In the Galleria, in Sherman Oaks, 2017 prices and a hugh hole in my seat!!!! I am a little,no,a lot out done!

For the first time ever, I find that there is no line at the cheesecake factory, With joy me and my friends go in and get an immediate table for 3.  Took a little while for the waitress to come but once she came, she was on it. <br><br>Ordered Alfredo, Spinach dip, Crab Wontons, Fried Mac and Cheese and Louisiana chicken. order went smooth then I ask the waitress for more bread.  She brought back 5 loafs of bread and I said &#34;wow thats a lot of bread&#34; then she replied &#34; You look like  you are very hungry&#34; Not sure if she was referring to my extra sized body or if she just meant I was hungry.   <br><br>After this point I never saw that waitress again. <br><br>We got our food and we finished eating.  Waited for 30 minutes for someone to pass by so I can get the check and no one came. So I decided to call the resturant.<br><br>I dialed the number and I can see the girl at the front desk looking at the ringing phone. Had to call her twice so she can answer and she picked up on the last ring. I informed her about my table needing a check and there is no waitress, she said &#34;She will get there&#34; <br><br>10 minutes went by and no one came, So I called her again, she did it again and didn&#39;t answer till the last ring, looking at the phone doing nothing else the whole time. <br><br>She again stated that the waitress will be coming. I told her I had been watching her and that she did not make any calls or pick up a walkie talkie and I asked her for her manager. <br><br>At this point I hang up and go to the front, ask for my check in person.<br><br>My Waitress comes out of no where with the check. <br><br>I pay $100 including tip and I leave, and most likely will never go there again.

Only cheese cake factory that gets it right. They always have good service and food is great. They expedite your order when you need to leave for a movie. I&#39;ve been to multiple locations this one is the best.

The waitress&#39; attitude was nasty!! So bad I am completely in shock! <br><br>We had a big farewell party and was just trying to enjoy each other&#39;s accompany until the waitress decided it was appropriate for her to say &#34; THE PLATE IS HOT, CAN YOU GUYS HURRY UP?&#34; <br><br>Okay, perhaps we were too absorbed in our moments BUT you definitely could have been more POLITE and PROFESSIONAL with your CUSTOMER. I wish I knew the girl&#39;s name to call her out on here... if you had handled the situation appropriately we would have apologized.<br><br>I&#39;ve been a waitress and a sales associate  before and I know how under appreciated these positions can be but that doesn&#39;t give you the right to treat your customer with this kind of attitude. Greatly disappointed in Cheesecake Factory for hiring people with this kind of manner. She deserves a verbal warning at least.

I like this location because it gets a lot less crowded than Woodland Hills. I ordered the cashew chicken. It was fabulous like always. I also found out that the chain is excellent at substituting anything on the menu or even custom building an entree. This is so important for my daughter and her food allergies.

went here last night &amp; our server GABRIEL saved our experience from being horrific! the food was off last night ... we ordered avocado toast to start which was so salty we each took one bite &amp; were almost sent into cardiac arrest! then our entrees came out cold!!!!! to our pleasant surprise the manager CAMERON was sent over without our asking for him &amp; he did his best to improve our dining experience by offering the have the dishes remade. of course we did not have to pay for all of the entrees &amp; appetizer but had to pay a portion of our bill - that coupled with the fact that we were able to try a piece of the PUMPKIN PECAN CHEESECAKE saved this review from a single star. <br><br>wonderful service, awful food!

By far the worst service from this cheesecake factory they constantly seem to be ignoring their customers went in a few weeks ago around 3 pm, not busy what so ever had to wait about 5 minutes for a table first which was fine. <br><br>We get seated quickly, and then we waited around 30 mins for someone to come by and at least acknowledge us. It wasn&#39;t until I went and said something that we got a waiter but I was pissed off and left. <br><br>My mom spoke with the manager and she seemed so incompetent to even be running the store, she could care less about the customers. So not cool and I will not be coming back anymore to any cheesecake factory.

The food is good, the cheesecake is amazing, if you enjoy being abandoned by your waiter for 30 minutes at a time, dark light with loud music leaving you somewhere between a romantic evening and a metal concert then this is the place for you!!! Enjoy, your two hour stay.....

I wish I could give this place 0, but I can&#39;t. Don&#39;t come to this Chesecake Factory. The quality of the food is the worst, very sloppy and effortless. I have been here a few times before, but today was the last day. I ordered a kale and quinoa salad with salmon for pick up, and it looked nothing like the description. I called and made a complaint, they offered to give me another one, which had the same exact issues from before. No quinoa, small dry salmon, and dry kale. Total for that salad: $19. Never again!

Waited over an hour for my food to be ready, 20 mins was just waiting on order of sweet potato fries that they managed to burn.<br><br>This place used to be good- but sadly it has been going down hill.

Came here yesterday just for cheesecake ... you cant go wrong with a cheesecake at &#39; Cheesecake Factory&#39; . As for the food, most of their dishes are not special at all and I was disappointed more then 3 times. I rather try a new place then come here for lunch or dinner. <br>Our server was very patient (his name was Mark) and we got excellent service. We changed our mind 2 times regarding choosing the cake hahaha it was hard to choose. But at the end he helped us to chose and the &#39;Vanilla Been &#39; was very light and delicious. <br>Always a line in front, I am sure this is the most popular restaurant in the area of Sherman Oaks.

My review isn&#39;t about service, as it was great, and it&#39;s not about the food which was ok. It&#39;s about the cleanliness of the table and the utensils. I hope the branch managers see my photo.

I absolutely love Cheesecake Factory! Their bread just melts in your mouth, their food is great, and of course their cheesecake!<br><br>My favorite entree is the Lemon herb chicken, it&#39;s just delicious! My favorite cheesecake is the banana cream cheesecake! It&#39;s just absolutely amazing!!

Service was great food was made to perfection. Nice place to have a dinner date. My wife ate the Louisiana Blackened chicken pasta. I consumed the seafood / chicken jambalaya.  Both tasted great, plates were portioned very good. Can&#39;t complain

I came in to treat myself to dinner, I was greeted quickly by Elizabeth (at the bar) she was very sweet and very welcoming she is by far the BEST server I had in all the times I&#39;ve been here and mind you I come in at least 3x a week for lunch. Little hiccups in my order were fixed quickly and she was so sweet!!!!<br><br>Also Martin  L (bidder) I believe his name is was also very nice made sure I had water and was good at pre bussing the area.

I went for my very first time to a cheesecake factory the first week of May. It was so so good! We went during lunch hour so the wait was only about 5 or 10 mins. Not bad at all. We were sat at a cozy booth which had sort of barrier walls to give you a bit more privacy from the booth behind you which I thought was really cool. They had a ton of staff on and each one was equally busy. We were given our bread promptly and was checked on often by our server until we were ready to order. I am gluten intolerant and got the lettuce wrapped tacos. They were amazing! And no reaction whatsoever which is always a major plus. My boyfriend had a burger and said it was one of the best burgers he had ever had. We were so impressed by the food we came back about 2 days later for another late lunch. Same sort of experience..little to no wait to be seated. Very prompt and friendly waiter..and the highlight of my experience was they offer gluten free hamburger buns! So i was able to get a hamburger! It was juicy and flavorful and just perfect. Excellent food!

I&#39;ve not been happy with this location for a long time. Today we found ourselves in this area so gave it a try again. We were pleasantly surprised when we walked in a the horses smiled at us and actually looked at us while speaking with us.  We were seated quickly and our waiter was great. I had the mushroom soup which was very good and my husband the gumbo which he loved

My orange chicken was amazing &amp; we had a very nice waitress. She was very attentive! <br>Place was very clean. Only thing I had an issue is that the cheesecake I asked for was not cold. Other than that great time @ this location.
The service was great but I forget how highly priced the food is for such small portions. At least the carrot cheesecake I had was delicious though.

I love Cheesecake Factory! All locations have amazing food that is perfect at any time of the day! I love Spinach and Artichoke Dip the most and the Avocado Egg Rolls. It&#39;s the best food to go to when you want a lot of options and have no clue on what you might be liking at that day. I absolutely love how they give you bread and butter as well!

Having frequented this location numerous times we wanted to introduce a friend to Cheesecake Factory...<br><br>Food was good as always. Our server could not have been any nicer. <br>After our meal I realized I left my wallet at home and our friend and I waited at the restaurant while  my husband drove back to get wallet to pay for check.<br>I explained this in detail and asked if it would be ok to step across the way to Urban Home until he returned to which I was told &#34;no problem&#34;.<br>We entered Urban Home and within seconds 2 - two men approached our guest and began questioning him. I immediately joined the inquisition sharing with &#34;both&#34; what was going on and how we were told it was ok.<br>They said they needed a form of collateral to which I said we would return to the restaurant so they would not feel we were walking in the check.<br>Both &#34;men&#34;  sarcastically responded and escorted us back in.<br>Last visit.

I think cheesecake factory is an excellent restaurant to go to with family. They have an array of options to satisfy anyone&#39;s cravings and dietary restrictions. I&#39;ve come here numerous times with family and friends for dinner and lunch. Some of my favorites are the Santa Fe salad and the miso Salmon.  The avocado eggrolls are a must! Last week my friends and I were looking for a spot to cut to go to for dessert. Cheesecake factory showed up on yelp and I had never thought about that before for just dessert. We came here for tea and cheesecake. We were very happy with our choice!!!  I am usually so full after I eat here that I forget how great their desserts are. We got the classic strawberry cheesecake and the new Nutella crunch cheesecake. Loved it! Posted a pic too :)

Save yourself a trip down disappointment memory lane.<br>By far the most awful customer service received. This isn&#39;t the first time my friend and I were treated so poorly here, we gave it a second chance, which confirmed us never returning to this location again.<br><br>We came here at 9:20 pm with ample time to order and eat comfortably, our waitress was rude, full of attitude, why even bother taking our order? It&#39;s not like we ordered appetizers.... Our bill was close to $80. We were done eating and she never bothered to remove our empty dishes from the table, (no big deal, I get it, she&#39;s busy helping and clearing everyone else&#39;s table), clearly nor busy enough to bring our tab, but still leaves all our dishes in front of us. <br><br>My friend and I are looking over our bill, the waitress returns wanting the check (it&#39;s 10:21 pm now), we apologize and say we&#39;re not ready yet. At 10:25 pm she sends a different waiter to our table asking for the check, my friend asks him why he was asking for the check and his words were &#34;the waitress is leaving and she wants the check back&#34; <br> My friend just signs quickly and hands him the check. <br><br>Should you not offer to validate parking like every other Cheesecake Factory does? Wow! <br>Why be rude?  Why send someone else to do your job? <br><br>Really? The restaurant is still full of people and you are kicking us out? Poor customer service Clearly, we won&#39;t be returning here again. Not worth the money for such awful experience. Lesson learned.

I had the amazing opportunity to be served by Jason the bartender. His attitude towards his job is impeccable! He makes you feel right at home and is fast and swift on his feet... i feel like I&#39;m lucky just to have met such an incredible human being! Good job Cheesecake Factory on the hiring of Jason! You are one great establishment!

I love the food at The Cheesecake Factory. <br>I love the fact that they have the skinny menu.<br> I have tried the BBQ chicken salad, Salmon Salad and the Seared Tuna Takiti Salad. <br>The food was great and dessert was even better. <br><br>The only thing I really DON&#39;T like is the service. One of the times I came here with my bf&#39;s family (we&#39;re Mexican) they made us and another Hispanic family wait over 30 mins while other parties that had gotten there after us with the same amount of people kept getting seated. I don&#39;t like to be judgemental and think that the host made our party and the other  Hispanic party wait a long time simply because didn&#39;t  look wealthy or like we would spend a lot. But that what it seemed like. Its also funny that they sent us a Hispanic waiter to serve us once we got seated like maybe we didn&#39;t understand English. <br><br>The other time I have gone the waitresses have been rude and very stand offish. When i have asked for recommendations or opinions they always look bugged.

We have few favorite dishes that we occasionally crave, so we will pay a visit. However, the service is so poor that it&#39;s no longer worth spending your time and money. I wish people would take more pride in their work &amp; strive to be better than mediocre.
This is awful!!!i needed to wait my table 30min BUT lady in front desk SAID that I needed to wait couple minutes!!!!!<br>I never went on this AWFUL place!!!<br>Do not recommended anyone!!!

This place is nice, because it seems to me they have anything you want on the menu;) Everything I tried I really liked- starting from pasta finishing with chicken tenders- love those. The only thing that does annoy a bit is the line- it&#39;s always so so long. Very crowded place, so don&#39;t wait to be seated fast

I went into the cheesecake factory yesterday and the hostesses we&#39;re not very kind or welcoming.<br>I told her how many were in my party and she looked at me rudely and told me to stand somewhere to the left...<br>There was absolutely no wait and no other customers waiting and plenty of open seating.<br> When I was brought to the table I realized it wasn&#39;t a comfortable seat and I wanted to move to a booth.<br>So I kindly apologized to the host and asked if there was a booth we could sit at instead.<br>She rolled her eyes at me and told me that I would have to wait 15 minutes.<br>This was so ridiculous to me because the restaurant was not busy at all. <br>So uncomfortable I just walked out the door and left instead of waiting. Nobody cared or try to make me feel better about the situation.<br>I eat at the cheesecake factory all the time and I don&#39;t think I want to go to the one in Sherman Oaks Galleria ever again.

I come here about once a month. Good location. Great staff. The dine in area is huge. Outside seating is available. The bar is spacious with Booth, tables and high chairs tables. The happy hour here is great 4pm-6pm. I usually get the Buffalo Blast and chicken sliders but just about everything here is delicious.

It was a Wednesday, @4pm, a party of 10, including 3 toddlers &amp; we wanted to eat outside.  <br>Hostess #1, says that she will have to check with manager to see if we can be seated outside.  Hostess #2, says that it is not a problem, &amp; to give them a few minutes.  Hostess #3, walks us to a table inside.  Then I ask to speak with the Manager, who says we can wait for a table outside for 20 minutes but the service may not be good.<br><br>Needless to say, we went to eat right across the way to El Torito Grill &amp; not only were we seated right away, to an outside table, but our waiter and the food was exceptional!<br><br>Now I remember why I have only frequented The Cheesecake Factory two times, in the 11 years, that I have lived in CA.
They forgot to add an item I had ordered and paid for. Took me 30 min on the phone with managers to get my $ back for that item. Terrible support and management.

My wife and I eat here about once a month.<br>Last night it was dinner from hell. After waiting an hour for food to come, waiter apologized for the slowness from kitchen. The manager came over and said food should come shortly.  Was thinking he could at least offer dessert on the house, but no. 15 minutes later food arrived luke warm. Just wanted to eat and get out. <br>My wife and I took half our meal home. At least we thought so. This morning opened the leftovers and found we got someone else&#39;s leftovers. Into the trash., and out to breakfast.<br>I will be contacting management and see what they say

Where do I even start after today&#39;s experience!?<br>My friends and I were seated having an early lunch, the food isn&#39;t the greatest but it was in the area so we decided to stop by. But I&#39;m not here because of the food I&#39;m here for the lack of customer service. While we were seating my friends drink had finished so she had asked a waitress for more, the waitress looked us in the eye and mumbled something and walked away. She took her time and we were all thirsty by then so I saw her and said &#34;excuse me?&#34; She screamed in the rudest tone possible &#34;ONE MINUTE&#34; then after a good 2 minutes she decided to come and said &#34;what did you want?&#34; Are you kidding me? HOW RUDE. About that time I didn&#39;t want her to help us nor did we want anything done by her so I simply said &#34;never mind we&#39;re fine.&#34; She rudely commented &#34;that&#39;s GREAT&#34; and stormed off. She was giving us the RUDEST stares and kept mumbling stuff. The only reason why I&#39;m even giving it 2 stars is because of our extremely nice waitress and the manager. I wish I had gotten that rude lady&#39;s name!

My girlfriend and I had food ordered for pick-up and allowed ample time for the food to be ready. However, when we arrived, the restaurant was extremely understaffed in the pick-up section and the food was back logged. I understand the stress of the workers on a weekend when backed-up, but, when asking if the food is ready one staff member replied &#34;well I don&#39;t know&#34; in an annoyed tone and proceeded to walk away. Normally I don&#39;t write reviews but the total disregard for respect of a customer and the tension of the restaurant drove me to this forum.. I&#39;m not discouraging you from eating at this establishment but take in account how busy it is.
I had a very great dining experience. The lunch special was very good as well as the dynamite shrimp.
Typical cheesecake factory..all the waitstaff are attentive and cheery... food fresh and quick.

Friday night I came to this location for dinner, as it was Friday it was quite busy but we only had to wait about a half hour for our buzzer to be paged...however once paged, we were told to wait by the entry for an additional half hour until out name was called, which was fine. <br><br>I ordered the chicken parm &#34;pizza style&#34; and when it arrived to the table, there was no sign of cheese on it. Upon asking the waiter, he informs me it &#34;wasn&#39;t supposed to come with any&#34; so I asked to see a menu. Sure enough the menu says &#34;covered in melted cheese&#34; in the description. The waiter tells me I am indeed correct, but then says that the cheese is there, it&#39;s just under the sauce. I scoured the dish....no cheese at all. So I showed him and he asked if I wanted to wait for another to be made. By the time I had convinced them it was supposed to have, and did not have any cheese, I was just going to settle because it wasn&#39;t worth the time to wait for another. Unfortunately, &#34;policy&#34; states if you don&#39;t want another made, they still take the one they messed up from you, forcing you to watch your date eat. I spoke to the manager Matt, he didn&#39;t seem to have any managerial skills though as he expected me to determine the proper solution for the situation, instead of offering helpful solutions himself as to what could be done. His only explanation for my dissatisfaction of them taking back my incorrectly made dish was &#34;it&#39;s policy&#34;. With them providing an unhappy dead-end to their service, after incorrectly making my dish, the most I was able to do was actually ask them for a cheese cake to go for when I was hungry later that night after I had to sit and watch my date eat alone. <br><br>Terrible approach to resolving customer complaints and issues, especially one which was clearly the cause of establishment issues. I suggest next time the management is taught to offer solutions rather than put the customer in an uncomfortable position where they need to come up with solutions themselves. This should be a proper solution which compensates people accordingly to their troubled time spent, and meal missed because of it....not just to even the situation out to pretending it never happened.

It&#39;s my girlfriend&#39;s 21st birthday. We waited an hour to get seated after they told us it would be 20 minutes. Then an hour to receive our food. Only for it to come out WRONG! <br><br>Server kept apologizing for her mess ups but doesn&#39;t help the fact that nothing was going right. Good didn&#39;t even come out that great once it was finally corrected. <br><br>This place needs to get it together
We love this place. We were celebrating a birthday. It was a Saturday night. We called to see if they accepted reservations and they said NO, first come first served. We waited over an hour,.

We had the best Waitress today, Marcia was always smiling! She gave us very timely service, we came in hungry, she brought out the kids meals first.. never had to ask for anything, she asked us if we needed more bread, our water was never empty.<br>Great service!<br>The foods were all good!! From my Burger to Chicken Parmesan, White Bean Chili, Thai Chicken,<br>To the Mac &amp; Cheese, and kids Pizza.. Yum!!<br>Oh, yes we had their latest cheesecake!! Winna!<br>This was my first visit to a Cheesecake Factory..<br>I like it!!

How&#39;s the food?  I dunno. Listened to the hostess speak with the customer in front of me.  The person was very specific orders about where they wanted to sit, they were a party of six.  They were told 30 minutes.  I asked for a party of 3, first available -- I was willing to sit out at the patio, despite being a cold night.  So the hostess told me to check back in 5 minutes. I checked in 5 minutes later, then they told me to check in after 10 additional minutes.  I checked in 10 minutes later. They handed me a pager and told me 20-40 minutes from the time they handed me the pager.  I handed them back the pager and told them to be more upfront about the wait.  All I ask is that they be honest about their wait times.  I ended up eating at the Hana Grill cuz we had a movie to catch.
Haven&#39;t been here in awhile. This time I had the Steak Diane w/ their mash. AND... It was really good. Temp was perfect. The mash was ok. Worth trying it if you haven&#39;t already.
No reservations! Not even for a party of 25 PEOPLE! <br>We all showed up on a Wednesday night, and we waited Two hours to sit. Never again.
Had the Pasta Napolitano for a second time and it does not disappoint! Also decided to have the 30th Anniversary Cheesecake, it has chocolate fudge brownie layers. Yum!

We took my son here to celebrate his birthday and we were able to get a table for all 10 of us very quickly! The waiter was friendly and did a great job! The bread we were served while waiting was delicious and the food came quickly! Everyone was happy with their meal except for my dad who wasn&#39;t impressed at all with the fish tacos. Everyone else got pasta and salads and enjoyed it and we shared with my dad so he was satisfied. I brought a cake (can you believe my son loves this place for the fettuccine alfredo and not the cheesecake?!?!) and the servers kept it in the fridge for me, put the candles on and brought it to him singing after dinner. It was great! Of course we had to get some cheesecake so we chose the hazelnut one and it was truly a slice of heaven! Made my visit enjoyable!! The ambience was nice and they had outdoor seating as well. The parking is a short walk away in the huge parking lot and CF validates so we didn&#39;t have to pay. I&#39;d recommend this place especially if you love cheesecake!!!

I never leave yep review, but I had to since the service was so excellent.  Daniel H is the best server I&#39;ve ever had. So wonderful and on top of everything.  His menu knowledge was great and he was so accommodating.  Thanks Daniel

Who doesn&#39;t love the famous Cheesecake Factory.  Great place to have dinner with family and/or friends.  The outdoor patio seating is great when the weather permits. Inside is pretty loud and busy but usually the wait is much shorter inside than outside. The bread here is always fresh and warm. Ask for ranch and crushed red pepper. I add the crushed pepper to the ranch and dip my bread.  Trust me this will become and addiction. By far my favorite dish here is the miso salmon with brown rice, simply amazing!!!

Please, I want put to your managerial attention.  We are your regular customer since you guys 1st Day at Canoga then moved to Topanga Mall.  Some of your staff does provide an outstanding service don&#39;t get me wrong.  Specially, our server that night he is superb and hope he will be recognized. And the one at the front desk. actually, I took the picture of him on my CP due to my frustration .  Hope he won&#39;t do it again.  Maybe, he is new and needs more proper training and do deserve another chance because I do believe there&#39;re always a room for improvement.

Cheesecake Factory is somewhere you can always mention and a friend will have a hard time not saying yes. Best assortment of foods and cheesecake hands down. The service is hit or miss, I have had some horrible experiences and I have had good ones. Good luck trying to get seated quickly on weekends but weekdays are quite pleasant. The bar is nearly never available, but if it is you&#39;re lucky. People like to sit there for a long time.

I came in with my family on a Saturday night for dinner it took 40 minutes just to get the table. Our server came to us 10 minutes after we sat down we placed her order it took another 30 minutes just to get to us we just kept on stuff in our self with a free bread and drinks when our food arrived we started to eat it right away the food was great greatest position of it great taste.

I hoped this day would never come but it has ..... the food Is so not the same . Ordered Jambalaya and it was horrible . I was so excited for that hot yummy spicy dish and it was bland and cold and noodles were soggy . I have been ordering this for more then 20 years and it&#39;s always Delish ! Same with the Chinese chicken salad .<br>They used to chop the iceberg so thin , this time it was huge pcs .... toppings requested on the side never even made it in the bag . Basically paid 14 bucks for ice berg !! <br>Oh I hope they get back to cooking and preparing like they used to ..... they are one  restaurant that prides themselves on good food and excellent services.  What is happening . ? Willing to try it again hoping it was just one bad expensive dinner .

Haven&#39;t been here in years.  I had the most delicious veggie burger. Didn&#39;t need ketchup or mayo or mustard.  Wonderful on its own. Only one of us got cheesecake. Wait till you see the picture. It&#39;s a devine Chocolate Cheesecake.  Very calming to sit outside

As usual , perfect. <br>Come on man. It&#39;s cheese cake factory. <br>We ordered spicy chicken chipotle pasta and four cheese with chicken pasta. Both were fresh , tasty and of course delicious .<br>The price was reasonable too.

Service is always top notch at any Cheesecake Factory. Menu is long and cab be confusing. <br><br>Dont eat too much bread before your food comes!<br><br>Every item on the menu is great, except philly cheese steak. <br><br>Do try the Vietnamese Summer Rolls, they are very tasty and come with 2 great sauces. I always get a salad every time. One of the best chains.

I had dinner here last night. Although I love coming to this place, last night seemed a little off. When we came in to get seated, there were 2 girls at the receiving area, 1 of them was nice she had a smile on her face when she greeted us. 1 of them had no smile and was a little bitchy, she asked me what my name was and told me to wait to the side until my name gets called so i can be seated with her little smirk and attitude. Then another girl came and called my name and she looked like she was not happy to be working there either. My waiter was very pleasant, very nice.  He took care of us.<br><br>Now, the food. The food is always great, but last night, for some reason, it took FOREVER. They weren&#39;t even that busy.

We got a bad piece of cheese cake (sour) and let the waiter know....<br>He told the management and they said trade it out for them so at least they didn&#39;t say that we&#39;re out of luck. Took a long time but food was good and service was good too.

They were not having a very good day today, at least in the patio. There were four of us celebrating Bosses&#39; Day, albeit two days late. First of all, the waiter didn&#39;t write down our orders, which resulted in a bacon-bacon &#34;cheeseless&#34; cheeseburger and a side of fries instead of the salad as ordered, I remember her specifically telling the waiter &#34;hold the American cheese.&#34; But where&#39;s the cheddar?  The mushroom burger also arrived cheeseless. Again, she told the waiter, &#34;no fontina cheese, Swiss cheese only.&#34;  Both burgers were reportedly cold and had to be sent back and fixed.<br><br>Not surprising, the order took almost an hour. First two of us got our food, then Person 3 (bacon-bacon cheeseburger) and finally Person 4 (mushroom burger). Sorry, but should you not serve everyone at approximately the same time? Don&#39;t let people sit there and let their food get cold(er), politely waiting for the rest of the group to be served!  Maybe part of the problem was that we seemed to have about 4 servers. <br><br>My chopped salad from the Skinny-licious menu was nearly tasteless. I guess you can&#39;t have great taste with only 590 calories. In fairness, the beginning bread was delicious, the guest of honor&#39;s chicken piccata looked good, and my Coke Zero was perfect. <br><br>Rather than skimp too much on the tip, we decided I&#39;d write the less-than stellar review on behalf of the group. Sorry, Cheesecake Factory, you&#39;re usually four stars at least.

They have a huge menu, very possible that there are books smaller than their menu. This is cool but my problem is that nothing on the menu is really good. Everything I&#39;ve tried here is pretty plain. From my experience the staff has been friendly and helpful. My wife is a much bigger fan than I am. So we recently order from here thru DoorDash. They didn&#39;t read any of the notes or requests. Other places we&#39;ve ordered from thru DoorDash definitely saw our notes so I know it&#39;s not a DoorDash issue. Personally I&#39;ll never eat here unless the wife wants it again. In house service is good but I feel that they should decrease the menu and work on improving the meals.

The wait around 7:30 on the weekend is 1 hour long, no bar seating available and parking is $3 the moment you enter the sherman oaks galleria....<br><br>Staff is totally mismanaged, they are super slow at turning around tables so there is unnecessary waiting when there are tons of open tables. The guys at the register don&#39;t answer the phone so you have no idea the estimated wait time till you arrive and make the effort to go all the way there<br><br>Totally not worth it and would never ever return

Ordered take out at 7pm on a Friday. Was told it would be ready in 15-20 minutes. I requested that it be ready at 7:45 since I was driving home from work. Got there around 8, and it wasn&#39;t ready. Finally received at 8:20...I should&#39;ve gone with the 15-20 minutes. Also my food was an appetizer and cheesecake. So it shouldn&#39;t have been that long compared to what a steak would take. Fries were limp and the Cuban Rolls I got were under cooked. Was not $20 worth of experience.

Patrick the condescending manager has no customer service skills. Too busy to come to the phone . I think this place is great but every time they give you dessert to go it doesn&#39;t fit in their container. The top and sides  gets stuck to the container and you are stuck with the inside of the dessert. This place is called the cheesecake factory you would think they would care to make their name not stick to the sides of the container. It&#39;s a joke. I drove 20 minutes to and from the cheesecake factory and the manager said bring the cake back and show it to me and I&#39;ll give you a new piece lol - this is the fifth time on a row so I needed to put it out there! Get new packaging and be courtious to your consistent customers PATRICK YOU SHOULD GO BACK TO TRAINING

I tried this place for the first time just the other day and had a pretty good experience. My wife and brother both had the Mac and Cheese burger - they loved it! I had the Chinese Chicken Salad, it was pretty dam good and really big. <br><br>The service was great and the waiter checked in several times making sure we had enough water. The food was tasty and the service was great, I definitely felt I got my moneys worth. <br><br>The only thing I did not like was the parking set up. Since they share a parking garage  with several other business&#39;s it is kind of a hassle to find a good parking spot. Their food and service however makes up for it.

I love Cheesecake. They have so many options and every time I try something new it&#39;s even better than the last. Sometimes the wait time is long but that&#39;s just because they&#39;re unsurprisingly busy. I recommend!

I Love this place, my friend &amp; I came in a few days ago &amp; *Kerri* was our server &amp; she was so friendly &amp; helpful. she was so fast when we got our drinks &amp; bread. then when we ordered we weren&#39;t sure on what to get &amp; she took her time to help us with the menu. it was just nice because we could see she was clearly busy but she was just awesome.
Good Food... so so wine list... great place to hang out before or after a movie.  It is not my first choice but I am never dissapointed either.

What a horrible experience we had last night. It was a 2 hour wait yes i said 2 hour wait. And the Manger only wanted to give a free appetizer I had no problem dealing with it but the fact we had 4 Lil kids with us made it that bad. I literally seen people come eat and leave.

If I could give this place no stars I would but unfortunately I can&#39;t. I&#39;m so disappointed with this establishment . First of all my server Ashley was incredibly rude! We were sitting down in the dining area and we had asked about being able to order from the happy hour menu and we were told yes. She came to us arguing that we couldn&#39;t order from their without a manager being okay with it after they had told us we could. Great way for putting the customer first. We decided just to move because she had a disgusting attitude. Management really needs to speak to her in regards to her behavior, consumers come to Cheesecake Factory to have a good meal and a good time not to feel harassed. If I wanted this kind of service I would have ate at McDonald&#39;s.

We were celebrating my nephew&#39;s B-day yesterday. We were happy to meet waitress Suzie. She is so friendly, always smiles, works very fast and professional. I loved this place because of her. She is brilliant. Thank you for everything. Our event was amazing =)

Come on people! Don&#39;t call something gumbo when it clearly isn&#39;t! I got the gumbo for lunch and what I received was sausage and shrimp in a broth with white rice. No okra, no roux, and hardly any holy trinity. It didn&#39;t even have any spice. Very bland. To be fair, I make my own gumbo and I think it&#39;s awesome so I may be a tough critic but I am not excusing this bland counterfeit Cajun dish. I swear, I&#39;ve been to Cheesecake Factory numerous times and I&#39;ve yet to find anything on their menu that knocks me out. Their entrees all are forgettable. I like their cheesecakes though. I had the hazelnut crunch cheesecake that had Nutella and whipped cream and it was so good. That was the salvation of this meal.

If I could give negative stars, I would. My friend and I were having a lovely lunch here and she pulled a worm out of her clam chowder. A WORM. They gave her a refund and $25 credit. Posting picture of said worm.

Sat at table for 15 min no one came to even ask for drinks. When I asked a waitress passing by she said it&#39;s not my section but I will get your waiter. 10 min have gone by no one still had come by. Time to leave and never come back. With all the Resturant options this will never be one again

We had a very nice meal. The place was packed even at 2:00pm. The server was nice and as always the food didn&#39;t disappoint. Everyone was happy with their meal and conversation. Then we noticed a ladder in the middle of the bar and no one sitting there. There were also people standing their with their cell phones which was weird. We didn&#39;t know what was happening; and a guy climbed up the ladder and pulled a giant rat by the tail. I get it, you are a restaurant and can&#39;t control, but I just lost my appetite, and was glad I had already eaten. Not sure how else this could have been handled, I&#39;m sure no one in the other part of the restaurant even knew until people started cheering, but ew

They are my happy place for post-long-run meals. I can always order something allergen-friendly, which matters greatly when you are living with auto-immune disease and the wrong food can ruin your week!<br><br>The menu diversity is a bonus for groups, too.<br><br>Server quality is hit and miss. Sometimes you get terrific service, sometimes you have to wait looong periods before servers remember you&#39;re there, BUT the consistency of the food quality (GO KITCHEN STAFF!!) makes it always worth the trip.

Don&#39;t order a burger and fries to go.<br><br>I ordered online and received an email to pick up my food at 10:53.  <br><br>After waiting until 11:03 the food came up and the fries were cold and burger was  mildly warm.<br><br>Waited until 11:13 to get hot fries and a warm burger.<br><br>They are understaffed and don&#39;t seem to care.<br><br>Won&#39;t order for pick up again.

It&#39;s located in the Sherman Oaks Galleria next to Urban Home and one floor below the Arclight Theaters. I tend to stay away from big restaurant chains, but Cheesecake Factory is pretty solid and consistent. <br><br>Drinks: 4 Stars****<br>The Mojito here is pretty good! Its sweetness wasn&#39;t overwhelming, but it was enough to give it flavor as well as a good buzz.<br><br>Food: 4 Stars****<br>Consistent good food. I always like the avocado egg rolls and the ahi tuna tartare. As you probably already heard, the portions here very generous.<br><a href="http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-cheesecake-factory-sherman-oaks?userid=0f_0XfO2qcgNwSJAHwfR9g#aGhbGfNdtMn4ReM7ptZc1w">yelp.com/biz_photos/the-…</a><br><a href="http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-cheesecake-factory-sherman-oaks?userid=0f_0XfO2qcgNwSJAHwfR9g#V4RwPRHJx3RLB7JHis06Yg">yelp.com/biz_photos/the-…</a><br><br>Service: 3 Stars***<br>Needed a little improvement. The server admitted that it wasn&#39;t his finest moment and apologized. <br><br>Parking:<br>2 hours free with validation. The parking structure is pretty far from the restaurant. You&#39;ll need to go on a journey to reach your destination. You can also valet if you don&#39;t feel like walking.

Enjoyed a nice lunch today with my son and his girlfriend. It was her first time eating at the restaurant so my son ordered a lot of food! All of it was delicious, served hot and with a smile. The server was kind, personable and very attentive. We ordered, crab cakes, calamari, avocado things (sorry I missed the name) and fried chicken sliders to start. All arrived at the table the same time. They ordered four cheese pasta and chicken and shrimp pasta. I ordered my regular miso salmon with mashed potatoes but I changed it to brown rice later and it was a non issue. We were so full from the appetizers, we had all our food packed to go. Of course we ordered cheesecake! Lemon meringue for me and white chocolate raspberry for her. The best!!!! No matter what flavor you choose. This location is always busy but we were seated right away and there was no delay in taking our order or bringing bread and water to the table. Kudos to the server!

I don&#39;t know where and how to start my review.<br><br>I haven&#39;t been to Cheesecake Factory in almost a year and a half. I used to go there quite often in the past with family and friends. Due to financial reasons I stopped eating out most of the time.  On May the 2nd 2016, I happened to be in the area and I was starving. I decided to go there since I was close to the shopping center. I walked in and there was no wait, there usually is a long wait, but since it was kind of late on a Monday, no holidays or special events....so I was seated within 5 minutes. There comes a cheerful lady....my server Marisela with a confident, pleasant, nice, professional, and knowledge attitude to take my order. I kid you not, I thought she has been working there for years. That&#39;s how good she knew her job, but yet, I found out that she has been there for only 2 months. WOW!!! Shout out to Marisela:))<br><br>I ordered their Steak Diane Salmon Combo that came with asparagus and a little House Salad with ranch dressing. My meal tasted DELICIOUS!! DIVINE!! Not to mention that I was hungry the whole entire day.  I was taking small bites, because I didn&#39;t want my food to finish:) that&#39;s how good it tasted. Marisela kept checking back with me to find out how I was doing and refilled my soft drink twice and asked if I needed any more bread and butter. She was just WONDERFUL in every way and made my dining experience EXCEPTIONAL! I wish almost all restaurants can have great service like Cheesecake Factory does. After I was done with my meal, she asked if I wanted to have dessert, but I refused her offer since I was soooo full. Now, people whoever has had their cheesecake you know how goooooood it is, but I had no room for it. I paid my tab and left her more than 20% tip, because she deserved it!! <br><br>I left to go to the bathroom and I didn&#39;t like what I saw, the bathroom was not very clean and they had a small roll of toilet paper. However I am NOT going to take down one of my stars, just because of that. I hope the staff will be more on top of their maintenance in the restroom. <br><br>Beautiful restaurant, comfortable, setting/lighting, good food, nice music, clean atmosphere and that is all I can say for now. <br><br>Will definitely be back soon and I hope to get the same server....Marisela.

Came here to celebrate a friends birthday. Unfortunately it did not end up being a happy one. As soon as we walked in we were seated promptly. I was really happy about that considering it was packed. Why wouldn&#39;t this place be packed the food is delish! So I thought-<br>Our waitress noticed the balloons that we had walked in with. Instead of saying happy birthday she asked if we could just move it out of the way. She seemed like she was annoyed or maybe having a bad day, who knows. I tried to not let her attitude bother me. <br>We ordered a chocolate milkshake for the birthday gal. Also who could go wrong with the southwestern eggrolls, chicken pasta and the buffalo blasts. We got out food all at  separate times. After having had worked ok the restaurant service, you learn to bring out everyone&#39;s food together unless otherwise specified. My chicken pasta was the last to be brought out. One night and it tasted extremely overcooked! I tried to eat it but I couldn&#39;t and I let the waitress know about the problem. She seemed extremely annoyed and just picked up the plate and walked off. I didn&#39;t know if she was going to replace it or what. I was angry at this point but I didn&#39;t want to make a scene. After some time had passed, another waiter brought my plate. Since they took so long and the birthday gal was done I decided to just ask for a box. I didn&#39;t pay $13.00 to take it home. Our waitress didn&#39;t come around to ask if we wanted to order dessert. We asked for the check and had dessert over at Crave. Thanks for the bad service and for taking so long that I had to take my food to go and pay extra because we were over our time limit at the parking lot.
First time at this location, quick seating, quick service. Celebrated a birthday and our waiter was great.

2014 YELP 100 CHALLENGE - 21/100<br><br>Dined here twice so far. Once was just a few nights ago. I met a group of my friends here on a Monday evening. I always assume the Cheesecake Factory to be packed, but surprisingly it wasn&#39;t busy at all! Lots of empty tables and we were one of the only taken tables outside on the patio. It was a little chilly outside, but they had the heaters on which made it actually pretty toasty! It was really nice :)<br><br>Our waitress was kind and polite even when I joined the table (I came late and my friends all had their entrees by the time I arrived), AND when another one of my friends showed up late. I didn&#39;t want anything other than a strawberry lemonade and she brought it out to me quickly! She also validated my parking which was awesome!<br><br>My friends said all of their dishes were very good and had no complaints about them.<br><br>Overall I&#39;d give this Cheesecake Factory 4 stars for great service and not being super busy or dreadful during a weekday evening!<br><br>TIP: Parking is free for two hours with validation from the restaurant :)

We have eaten at Cheesecake Factory for 20 plus years and I&#39;ve come to the conclusion that this place is completely sub par, with terrible and non existent service with low quality food. <br><br>1) I don&#39;t know who the managers are and who they are hiring but everyone is rude and no one smiles. You wait forever only to be greeted by an annoyed server with zero personality. This has been our experience frequently. Tonight was the last straw. Our server messed up our order, gave an attitude, threw an incorrect replacement at us and proceeded to talk shit about us at the server station so loud my 9 year old said &#34;mommy she&#39;s talking about us.&#34; The manager was completely useless, insincere, and made a sad apology to make up for the humiliation- um sorry that did not cut it. The restaurant is so busy that the staff doesn&#39;t have to try to be nice or keep customers. No one cares. <br><br>2) You can never find anyone- if you are missing something from your meal or even need a glass of water, good luck flagging down a server even though there are 100s of staff whizzing by.<br><br>3) I find all the food to be mediocre at best. And the cheesecake in my opinion is disgusting. It&#39;s so cloyingly sweet, and mixed with so many ingredients it&#39;s hard to even call it cheesecake. Blech. <br><br>It will be a long time before we go back.

Awful don&#39;t come my pasta had no sauce, my BF plate was half tomatoes instead of pasta ridiculous for the price we paid! In addition the silverware was sticky and dirty! The bread as hard and we had to ask for more sauce because the pasta was stuck together due to how dry it was!!! Please don&#39;t waste ur hard earned money on this garbage!!

Very disappointed. The food came lukewarm, the waiter was nowhere to be found. In fact, the food here has gone downhill, the quality is nowhere near the level of a few years ago. Additionally, they have discontinued some of my favorite cheesecake flavors. Overall, no reason to come back. Their menu is huge, but they can&#39;t get the basics right.

I order the Sheila&#39;s chicken and avacado salad to go for lunch at least once a week. It&#39;s delicious. Today, I was upset to find they changed their takeout packaging so you get half the salad for the same price. Pretty bogus! Takeout customers beware.

Typical Cheesecake Factory. I have been to maybe all locations in the Los Angeles area and I never had any issues at this location. Unlike other locations, this one has staff that is attentive and fast and I appreciate that. It is located at a mall and the parking structure is far away so that is the only problem I have. Red Velvet cheesecake is the best!

I love The Cheesecake Factory.  Yes.  I love it.  Their giant portions make for plentiful and delicious leftovers.  Their lemon drop martinis are strong and better than most.  The decor is consistent and comforting.  And the brown/wheat bread before the meal is addictive.  That is my review of The Cheesecake Factory chain as a whole.  <br><br>As far as the Sherman Oaks location goes, it&#39;s pretty decent I guess.  It doesn&#39;t have the scenery that Marina Del Rey and Redondo Beach have.  But it has convenience if you are coupling your meal with a trip to the movies at the Arclight or to DSW for a new pair of shoes.  <br><br>I&#39;m not a fan at all of the Galleria.  The layout is stupid, and you have to walk through a wind tunnel and a journey to get from your car to the stores (unless you pay $20 to valet your car, which is almost actually worth it).   This isn&#39;t The Cheesecake Factory&#39;s fault though so I won&#39;t remove stars for that.  <br><br>I do need to deduct a star for their bar though.  As mentioned, the lemon drop martinis are bomb.  Everything else is inconsistent at this location, depending on who is bartending.  On a good day they make a strong and flavorful mai tai.  On a couple of occasions it has been quite weak though, and when I asked them to strengthen it up a bit, they charged me $10 for an additional shot.  An extra $10 to make it the way you were supposed to make it in the first place.   Same experience with their Cadillac Margaritas.  <br><br>Overall, I&#39;m a fan. I like comfort food and Cheesecake Factory does it quite well!<br><br>Pro tip - ask to sit in Eric&#39;s section.  He&#39;s the best!
Amazing service and food! Our waitress was very helpful and kind. Definitely recommend.

I ordered the Spicy chicken chipotle pasta when it came I took two bits and realized that it was missing the chicken the waiter then apologize and bought me chicken on the size but it looked and tasted nasty. I won&#39;t be going back.

This review is only for my drink.  There was a 1 1/2 hour wait to sit (@ the bar) so I just grabbed my usual well mannered dirty, dirty with extra olives &amp; stood and drank &amp; drank and stood.  It never lets me down! Decided to go for round 2 &amp; had a strawberry martini (friend had a hibiscus martini) both are very good but the strawberry one is diabolically strong.  Oh well, someone has to drink it, might as well be me! ;)

Gave this place 4 stars because of the food. I ordered the skinnylicious shrimp pasta and it was the best! I am not usually ordering shrimp at restaurants but my friends convinced me that it was really good. We also ordered the spinach and artichoke dip and it was so tasty! The food was amazing but the service was 2 stars. Our server Michelle was not the kindest. If you do decide to come, try the shrimp pasta!

While I still love the food here, I must say that the experience of dining here just keeps getting worse and worse. They have a terrible seating system. You check in and they give you a pager. Then you wait forever. Then it goes off and you turn it in. They don&#39;t take you right to your table, you then have to wait longer while other people are taken to their tables. Then someone finally calls your name and you go to a table. Tonight we waited 10 minutes between the time we turned in our pager to the time we went to our table. For people who have never been here, it&#39;s very confusing. You think when your pager goes off, you&#39;re going to be taken to your table, not wait in another line! The foyer area is very poorly designed and you have waiters rudely plowing their way through because there&#39;s nowhere for the double lines of people waiting to really stand. <br><br>Our waiter tonight, while very nice was S - L - O - W. Took our drink order and said he&#39;d bring us bread right away. Took about 5 minutes to get our drinks even though we were right next to the drink station. It took 10 minutes to get bread. Other waiters were bringing bread within minutes of people sitting down. Took a good long while to get our food, but it was very crowded. Then we ordered dessert and it took another 19 minutes for that to come. We were actually in the restaurant for over 2 hours. Then to top it off, we had to pay for parking because we were there so long. We got one refill on our drinks and no refills on bread (I would have loved some more sourdough bread to go with my pasta. <br><br>So I&#39;m lowering my review from 5 stars to 2 stars because the problems in how the restaurant doesn&#39;t work, overshadows how good the food is.

Overall I really enjoy The Cheesecake Factory. What I don&#39;t enjoy is having to tell the receptionists at the front that there is no soap in the women&#39;s restroom. When I went back 45 minutes later, there is still NO soap. When I complained again at the front I was told,&#34;Well, I just got here.&#34; So meanwhile, there is no soap for the customers or the WORKERS to use to wash their hands with but let&#39;s just pass the buck. <br><br>The scary part is that the same thing happened a couple years ago at this same Cheesecake Factory so it&#39;s now a pattern. Gross.

Portions are huge! <br>I was able to split the Luau salad. We requested to have the salad split into two plates. This portion was perfect for me and my friend. <br><br>Cheesecakes are an absolute must... the smores cheesecake and the vanilla bean cheesecake are highly recommended! <br><br>Don&#39;t forget to get your parking validated!

Horrible customer service, over crowded unorganized. I&#39;ve been to this cheesecake location more then I would say 20 times over the years and I&#39;ve noticed it&#39;s gone bad thru the years from service to staff members. Our last visit did it for me, and I will never return to this location again. <br>I checked in for Party of 4 they told us about 35-40 minutes. They don&#39;t take your phone number to text you, so when we asked for a buzzer she mentioned she out of it. <br><br>We return back after waiting 35 minutes to check on our table status, she advise us to wait another 20 minutes. Then they couldn&#39;t find my name, horrible service unorganized I ask for the manager he finally was able to get us a sit after an hour of waiting.<br><br>Took 25 minutes to bring our appetizer, within few minutes they brought our entrées we didn&#39;t even have a chance to eat our appetizer a manager approached us to apologize for the late food arrival. But a apology don&#39;t solve a bad service. Don&#39;t waste your time going here!!!

I was all riled up to write this review after the first transgression listed below, but after the third - well, at this point, I&#39;m just too tired. <br><br>So.... I will leave you with the following:<br><br>1. There was a milky white garlicky substance in my water (later to find out, due to a dirty cup). <br><br>2. After being promised a piece of free cheesecake for the mishap, I asked for a piece of their popular wheat bread to get the taste of garlic out of my mouth. I asked my waiter, the manager, and a bus boy. The bus boy eventually brought<br> it. <br><br>3. Shortly after receiving my bread, the umbrella touching the heat lamp caught on fire. Another waiter promptly put it out.<br><br>4. About an hour after the cup mishap (hey, waiter, are you avoiding us?) we finally receive our food. Hey, how come the cheese in my Mac and Cheese balls isn&#39;t even melted? Oh, because it wasn&#39;t cooked. <br><br>5. The waiter finally comes back over to us and I get another cup of Coke. Lo and behold, there is rice in it. <br><br>At this point just get us a couple of boxes to go and I&#39;ll heat this crap up at home.

ALWAYS!!!!!!! Suzanne served us tonight and she was on it!!!! Super friendly and attentive to us! Food was amazing as always... Problem is so many delicious options its hard to choose one... Went with steak diane and shrimp scampi... AMAZING!!!! Blueberry mojitos, avocado egg rolls, ahi carpaccio , bruschetta adn for the grand finale, Caramel salted cheesecake!!!!! TO DIE FOR!!!!!!! <br><br>HEY Cheesecake Factory! When are you going to open up in Valencia???

Ordered Cheesecake from DoorDash and everything was great however, this is the 3rd time I have ordered Tex Mex egg rolls and it is disgusting. 1 egg roll out of the bunch is probably an actual tex mex with beans,corn, and chicken and whatever else comes in there, but the rest of the egg rolls are chunks of meat shoved in there nothing else and you can&#39;t even tell if it&#39;s chicken it looks like ground beef clumped together and stuffed in there. I bit into one without looking and I couldn&#39;t even chew it it. I cringe just thinking about it. They packed bread in there with no butter and they only packed white bread. I asked for extra dressing with my Caesar salad and no extra dressing. Also ordered their Nashville chicken tenders, those were gross as well not crispy and they literally had no sauce on them not good at all. I recommend they teach their chefs how to make the Tex mex properly it truly is disgusting I wish I took a picture of the insides of them but they are in the trash already, what a waste. Debating if I will ever return, even the thought of what else they are putting in my food or the cleanliness of their kitchen makes me sad just thinking about it. Sigh
I absolutely love this place . The food is always well prepared. Our sever was not only helpful but engaging . I will come back for years to come.

Horrendously terrible Take-Out experience here today.<br><br>The Cheesecake Factory always seems like a fun option with good food and great variety, so we thought it would be a great choice to celebrate an office birthday.  We were wrong.<br><br>Our order was placed at 11:20 a.m.  We were told it would be ready at 11:45.  At 11:55 it was still not ready. After asking 3 different people for assistance and being ignored/brushed off by all of them, the order was finally received at 12:25.  ONE HOUR after being placed. FORTY minutes of waiting later.<br><br>When I called to speak to a manager to let them know about our experience, I hung up after being placed on hold for over 3 minutes.  We&#39;ve wasted enough collective time on the Cheesecake Factory today.  I write this review in the hopes that you will not meet the same fate.<br><br>Unbelievable lack of organization, efficiency, attention or care.

We went to dinner with family and really enjoyed the atmosphere, the food was yummy. We ordered and got our food within a reasonable time. I ordered the orange chicken and gave to say I was impressed by the quality. Very pleased. The server was on his game. Would definitely go back again.

Very disappointed at how Sherman Oaks handled my delivery order. My co-worker and I ordered separately online. Both our orders were cancelled with no explanation given. We both attempted to re-order. Doordash delivered her food. My new order did not even go through. So much for lunch plans. It sucks that I have to watch her eat her Cheesecake Factory order, and I have nothing.

Most of us know what Cheesecake Factory has to offer so this is a review for the service at this particular Cheesecake Factory. <br><br>I&#39;ve been to this location plenty of times and their service seems on and off, really depending more on whether you get a good server/zone or not. The last time I went with my husband and daughter, it was for an early dinner/very late lunch, aound 4-ish in a Friday. As you might imagine, it wasn&#39;t exactly busy at this time. <br><br>They sat us in a weird corner booth by the corner end of the bar where the servers were having their breaks! The first thing we over hear from some servers are, &#34;OMG you&#39;re such a slut.&#34; &#34;So? I flirt with everyone. Men, women, that&#39;s just me. I even kissed that one dude.&#34; And it went on. My daughter&#39;s 3. Call me crazy but we typically don&#39;t like to be surrounded by conversations about &#34;sluts&#34; when we&#39;re out having a family meal with her. <br><br>Then the servers got back on the floor and we thought, trying to avoid the inconvenienc of having to move, we&#39;d stay because maybe it&#39;ll be OK now. Well, another server came to the designated break table and promptly started complaining about how she did not want to be at work anymore. She&#39;s tired, bullshit at work, she wants to go home, etc. Don&#39;t know about you but I LOVE Debbie Downers! I don&#39;t get enough free complaints and tired, annoyed sighs at work so, of course, soon as I get home I want to go to a restaurant with my family and pay to hear people complain some more!<br><br>We finally asked to be moved. A very pleasant server took our order. Never saw her again. Another came by our new table and asked if we had been moved and who was our original server. This person was also never seen again. A third person brought out our food, after a much longer wait than we anticipated for such a slow time, and this person really couldn&#39;t be bothered. Did not smile, was not pleasant, was very abrupt during all points of interaction with us. Our meal was +$60. I could have gotten this treatment at a $10 per plate restaurant.

I&#39;ve been coming here my whole life. And today I had the best waiter of all time. His name is Andrew. I think from now on I&#39;ll call ahead and make sure I get seated in his section. Haha <br>Thanks for the great food &amp; service! I appreciate you guys.

Waited at the bar for service the bartender completely ignored me, I had to get my own menu, no polite conversation just yelling across the bar what are you drinking! I waited 20 minutes with menu closed to place my order why he completely ignored me! I ended up walking out, they need to hire better people at this location!
The food was very good, the waitress was also polite. I ordered a chicken sandwich with fries and it was as good as ever! The only negative thing was that I had to wait 50 minutes to be seated.

I cannot understand why people come here when there are so many amazing places nearby in the same price range. The service was incredibly slow. The plates were dirty. The food was mediocre at best. The table next to us were in the middle of their meal, went to the restroom, and had their entire table cleared while they were gone. Quite amateur for such a large chain.

My Girlfriend loves this place! Good and friendly customer service! <br><br>We always start with the guacamole and avocado egg rolls!!<br>Margarita is a must!!! Specially the strawberry one.<br><br>Try it! many plates to choose from and is not expensive at all! Good quality of food.<br>Expect delays while waiting for food if restaurant is busy :) good customer service.

I was on the galleria watching a movie at the arc light and right after some friends and I decided to grab a quick bite. We wanted el Torito grill but found out is been closed for a few months so we went for cheesecake. The service is not too bad but the waiting for a seat was not fun, even less so if you&#39;re starving. We finally get seated outside and the service was actually pretty good, got a bunch of appetizers but the only ones worth noting were the salmon and another one which had avocado. Both really delicious. Portion on main dishes are really generous since we all took leftover boxes. Overall a good experience just wish they had more staff and sit people faster.

Sunday brunch was ruined.  The &#34;chef&#34; was inept at cooking eggs.  I ordered Jambalaya Hash and Eggs over medium.   Instead I got fried hard.  The replacement eggs  were a disaster as well, fried hard.   My friend had Eggs Benedict.  The eggs were poached hard.   What is going on at Cheesecake Factory in Sherman Oaks Galleria???<br>Do I have to go to Denny&#39;s to get eggs over medium???<br>Very disappointed.  Regretted my brunch experience.

No Los Angeles Dodger&#39;s Games shown here.  They have Direct TV because they are CHEAP.<br>Every other place at the Galleria is showing the Dodgers.<br>I asked the woman bartender, and with this rude crappy voice she said,<br>&#34;Who CARES about the Dodgers?&#34;<br>Not a good place to watch sports, the bartenders are also jerks to the customers.<br>AVOID THIS PLACE, IT&#39;S NO FUN.

Hi there first of all this 1 star rating is not about the food what so ever i have never been to this place to eat i could imagine it is great this rating goes out on customer service skills to the white girls with the glasses i dont know there names they look like sisters they work on the pick up counter on the bakery side they are very rude to most customers that come in to pick up food i had been observing them while i was there 2 weeks ago on a Saturday and i noticed that customer skills are very poorly in talking to customers and when some one like myself asks politely for plastic ware or napkins or for a xtra bag for a dessert that needs to be bagged in separate from hot or cold they give out attitudes and say this is going to your home dont need that they dont know if this was going out to a hotel room or to a hospital or to an office were there are no plastic ware also when they hand out your bag of food they dont even bother in asking &#34;Anything else can i get you &#34; or even the simple thing in saying thank you nothing like that after you get your order handed to you its like ok get out next there is no cistomer skills there what so ever i see there are more reviews here than i thought about the same thing i went through this is a call out to management. To focus on not only what happens in the dining room area but also what there crew members that work in front of the house talking and engaging with customers that are doing there job correctly  i am not happy what so ever for the visit i had there again the 20 minutes i was there in waiting for my food i had alot to see and also what i had to experience one on one with these young ladys is not by they are having a bad day its in everyday part of life for these crew members that probably are not happy working there i think they should be moved from that part of the restaurant if they are trying to move up to be waiters that will be a nightmare totally i hope there are more people that post visits like mine so corporate or franchise can address these people that are working in the front of the restaurant are giving THE CHEESECAKE FACTORY A BAD NAME !!!!!!! Hope to hear from management soon !!!!!!

Our server was great, no problems there.  However, the hosts sat us at a dirty table and reassured us they would have it cleaned immediately.  They took about 10 minutes to clean our table while they sat other customers.  When we asked about our dirty table, they asked us to wait longer.  When they did clean our table, one of our spoon&#39;s still had chocolate cheesecake from the last customer.  <br><br>The food was good, but they were certainly stingy with the chicken.
This gambalaya is so delicious they made sure they put extra chicken and shrimp, oscar was my server n he is the best n the sexiest he was super nice to us, we just loved him

We came here because Sweet Butter was too crowded. I like that they have a light &#34;SkinnyLicious&#34; menu now with plenty of choices. Curiously the original menu doesn&#39;t list caloric content. <br><br>If it&#39;s your first time, be prepared to sift through all the menu chapters, as they serve American fare to Americanized versions of international cuisine. I&#39;d say the best food are the appetizers. The Thai lettuce wraps are really good (3 delicious sauces) and fill me up even though they&#39;re an appetizer.<br><br>Tuna tartare - delicious. good size for 3<br><br>Sausage ricotta flat bread (off the light menu) with few kinds of cheeses. Good but a little salty. <br><br>My friend&#39;s veggie salad - big but forgettable. Too much vinegar in the dressing.<br><br>The fish taco entree was a huge, delicious serving. 4 tacos, big pieces of salmon (I think she requested salmon). However the white cilantro-seasoned rice was oily.<br> <br>Of course it&#39;s hard to pass up on cheesecake here. We devoured my personal favorite, white chocolate raspberry. Others sound tempting. I want to try the pumpkin pecan next fall (Must pumpkin be seasonal everywhere? :/ )  The banana slice is light, almost mousse-like. For me the blueberry white chocolate is disappointing.<br><br>Service usually is good but today was terrible. Among other things, we had to ask for bread.  At least they compensated with 3 loaves. Isn&#39;t the warm brown bread the best? <br><br>Parking is free for the first 2 hours free and this location is convenient, right where the 405 and 101 intersect.  It&#39;s mainly restaurants here and feels like a ghost town before noon on weekends. I just wish they serve brunch all day Saturday as well as Sunday because I was really craving pancakes.

Came here with my boyfriend and his little sister. We got to have john and brance as servers, and they were amazingly accommadating. They will make excellent servers! On top of that, they gave us free wings on the house, Elizabeth I&#39;m assuming was the manager was very sweet and made our meal pleasant!

I come here for business lunches all the time because it&#39;s close to my office and there is a 24 hour fitness in the same building - that way I can workout just before I eat. I usually get a salad and my favorite is the vegetarian with grilled chicken. I ask the server to put half in a to go box and I eat the other half at the restaurant, that way I have a meal for later too. They validate parking and the prices are reasonable. My only gripe is the long wait all the time.

Food was ordered to go<br>BBQ ranch salad <br>Kids slider <br>Cheesecake <br>Gir home the food was cold <br>Gave one piece of cold bread <br>Salad was brown <br>Sliders n fries were cold cold <br>Paid about 45 dollars n wound up throwing all of it out except the cheesecake

I usually come to this cheesecake location. Not a bad location TBH nothing has really ever thrown me off to never come back. The only thing was that when I went this last time, my knife was dirty and my cousins menu had food on it. I think they should be a little bit more clean. I&#39;m really big on the whole sanitary issue so this was really disgusting to me. Service is usually good I&#39;ve never really had an issue. food is always good, no doubt. Overall, okay.
So happy they have new management and was told they got ride off alote of chefs .<br>Definitely amazing now food has been fresh tasty staff super friendly. This is how I remember this place .

HORRIBLE SERVICE! <br>I can&#39;t believe the amount of time they make you wait, and then on top of that we got no waiter for 20min, then they sit a family of four down, waiter comes with in second doesn&#39;t even take a chance too look over at us!
