Then they sit a couple down literally right next to us waiter turn her back to us and take their order after she just walks away, then we decided to leave cause we still got no service it&#39;s been 20min now!!! We walk out some guy goes oh have you guys been helped yet and I was like we been waiting no one has even attempted offer us water, and he goes oh ok! So rude! Very poor service there! Use to love coming to this location, but I guess we will stick to the topanga location! There pretty nice and sweet! Waiters are awesome! F this one!
Years later in Cheese cake factory great experience. Happy hour not just price great tasted food and our cocktails with excellent service at the bar with Alan. Thanks Alan. Hope to back soon.
Love this place. Always fresh and tasty.<br>Huge selection. Menu is so big you can have anything you desire.<br>I&#39;m here once a week and sure keep coming

After coming to this location for such a long time. Th experience my fiancee received by staff from the front desk has been terrible. I came in the evening time for a meeting and had sat by the bar. 30minutes before close, my phone battery had died, luckily I had a phone charger on me. My fiancée worried had called to ask front desk to announce my name. First staff member refused and shut the phone on her face. Second staff member answered, refused and had hung up on her face. At least teach your staff to be respectful and have manners when speaking to customers. Never coming here again.

This branch in the Sherman oaks galleria has way better service than other spots. Food wait was less than 20 mins. I&#39;ve waited over 30 minutes at other branches. The only downfall is you have to park in the mall parking to get in.

Have eaten from here a few times and each time I always regret it. The food is horrendous. Today was the last straw the chicken in the chicken club was undercooked!! I had eaten most of it before I realized it and now I&#39;m fearing food poising. Whhhhyyyy do yourself a favor and stay away!!!

The Cheesecake Factory is one of my favorite restaurant, I alway come here specially for the Chicken Madeira And Steak. The food quality is always good and amazing. Love the stuff and the managers. Today my steak wasn&#39;t as usual but the manager took care of me and removed 50% of my dish and he even offered me Cheese cake . 5 stars all the way

This is a great place for dinner and a movie. You can park in the mall parking structure (relatively cheap), and then grab food here, and walk right next door to the theatre. The experience was a typical Cheesecake Factory experience. Good food and good service. <br><br>FOOD = A<br><br>We ordered the fried zucchini ($4.95) as an appetizer. I absolutely love it!! I always get this when I visit a Cheesecake Factory. <br><br>My boyfriend ordered the gumbo ($16.95), which was very good! I ordered the Chicken Di Pana (breaded chicken with mashed potatoes and broccoli for $14.95). It was soooo good!! The chicken was perfectly breaded and the mashed potatoes were perfectly garlicy! <br><br>I haven&#39;t had anything on the menu that I didn&#39;t enjoy. <br><br>SERVICE = B+<br><br>The first time I came here the service was actually pretty bad, but I think my waitress was new, so I give her some slack. The second time I came here for dinner, and it was delicious and the service was perfect. I haven&#39;t visited on a weekend night. <br><br>PARKING: Parking Structure. Free up to two hours with validation

Food is always amazing, you can close your eyes and put your finger on anything from the menu and you will be happy.   Wait is always long.  Upper management needs to know who they have in charge, who are the frontline employees and their managers that deal with the public.  You cannot have an incapable person lead, such was the case in my experience yesterday when an incapable frontline person called in reinforcement  manager Vincent L., (unable cause any able manager will ask the customer questions, first) perhaps they do not care about customer service or are stressed out, but customer service is what brings the customers back.   This may or may not go on def ears cause CF is doing so well and may not even care about one customer&#39;s opinion....<br>Word of advise if anyone in management is reviewing these, tell the employees to stay off their phone and not text, they cannot bring person problems to work.

Meh<br>That about sums up my experience.<br>Ordered a Margarita, only tasted Tequila and premade margarita mix, had one sip, then pushed it away, server never asked if it was good.<br>Fried mac and cheese was tasteful, spicy jumbo chicken wasn&#39;t spicy in the least but flavourful, server came back the usual 2 times, is everything ok blah blah, very production line, no sense of personality or honest care. left a spoon on the floor right outside the table, very very visable, not one of the 4 servers, 2 bussers, 2 hosts or managers that walked past the table noticed. <br>won&#39;t be going back

I love coming here for good quality food and great service! I also like that the waiters recommend the specials and tell you in detail what they are. It does get busy but everytime I come and there is a wait they seat us in a timely manner. I recommend The Cheesecake Factory to all my family and friends!

Usually the service and the food is Great! Last time I went I tried to chnage up my usual witch is the Cubano sandwich and the sald with personal pizza and its delicious!<br><br>I tried the burrito and it was HORRIBLE! It looks good from outside but honestly it was bad. It was all dry rice and a few pieces of chicken. I barely ate any of it and it made me sick!!! The only time this happened is when I had the salmon and for sure will never get anything different again.

I am a regular at the restaurant in Woodland Hills. For once I came to the one in Sherman Oaks and it was my last time. The hostess was snob and rude. Took my name without ever looking at me. I wasn&#39;t given a beeper or asked for my number or anything. She just said she&#39;s going to call my name. So I had to stand next to the door for 45 Minutes. I finally get called for my party of 5 as we want to celebrate my son&#39;s 18th birthday and we go towards a table where a couple with an infant is seated. So the hostess just makes us wait there for another 10 Minutes to tell us the other family took my name to get a table ahead of me. She doesn&#39;t ask them to move. So we wait. Finally the manager Patrick shows up to take us to a table that seems to be the worst in the entire place. I had asked for a booth. I want a booth. So AGAIN we wait. Finally we get a table. We wait 30 Minutes to place our order and the waitress goes on a break and is replaced by a dirty looking and rude waiter. The food was good but the service was terrible. The hostess said she would make it up to us and my cousin brings it up. The manager, for a table of 5 offers to give us ONE slice of cake. We had all ordered coffee and tea so I told them it would make more sense to offer the hot beverages. So they said ok after 15 Minutes of what seemed like a government briefing right next to us. My coffee was cold. Really just cold like it had sat there for 30 Minutes. The manager rudely said &#34;see you soon&#34;. This place is to be avoided if you want to have a nice night out. They should be shut down.
I come here ALL the time and the service is always so great! The wait time for the food is never long i usually get the four cheese pasta with chicken and it&#39;s so amazing

4* Cheesecake Factory<br>Sherman Oaks<br>Located in shopping mall, office complex<br>Parking is a good walk<br>Totally packed<br>Nice happy hour<br>Tasty nachos and sliders<br>Great Blackout chocolate cake a la mode<br>Good food service by Audrey

Had lunch here with a friend yesterday. We chose to sit outside, which was a mistake, as it was very hot. I had assumed that they would have had misters on in the heat, but...no. <br><br>The service was very good, not intrusive, and gave us plenty of time to choose from the vast menu options. <br><br>We both ordered off the &#34;Skinny&#34; menu. <br><br>Me: Asian chicken salad ($13.95). The lettuce was very wilted, the dressing was way too heavy, and it seemed oddly salty. I would not recommend this. I had three bites, and did not eat the rest<br><br>My friend had a salad too...but dang it I can&#39;t remember what it was, other than it had chicken and beets ($13.95). She seemed to love it, and ate the entire salad.<br><br>Parking was easy, and they validated the ticket.

One of my favorite Cheesecake Factory locations! Super easy to get to even from the Westside which is great. The staff here is quite friendly. The hostesses work hard to get you seated and the servers all seem very knowledgeable about the menu (that is forever changing) which I appreciate. I enjoy the bar area here if I don&#39;t feel like waiting for a regular table.<br><br>There is ALWAYS a wait here 24/7 and booth seating is hard to come by (I hate that stupid half table/half booth seating you&#39;re sharing with strangers) so I have to knock off 1 star for both of those things. However, overall, dining here is yummy &amp; convenient.
That Oreo cheesecake is to die for. Waiters are super nice and attentive. The only reason I gave them a three is because they took off the shrimp sandwich which was also to die for.

I&#39;ve placed 4 take out orders over the last few months. Each one was incorrect. They make no effort to make amends.<br><br>The food is fine. But not worth the headache. There are lots of other much better places. Go across the street to Public School. The food, drinks and service are all much better.

I&#39;ve always liked The Cheesecake Factory especially when they had the shrimp BLT on the menu. We were going to the movies on Sunday, so we decided to grab a bite before I was craving protein, so I ordered the ribeye, my husband had a salad. Everything tasted great the service was good, my only complaint was the steak was extremely thin. Just a tad bit thinner and I could use it to make carne asada. No joke.

I&#39;m a serial Cheesecake Factory chain visitor, so I find myself coming to this location quite often. This location is exactly what you would expect from any of the other CF chains, but it&#39;s especially good because the food (especially the bread) seems superior here compared to all other locations and especially bad because the traffic/parking can get pretty horrendous. My favorite part about this location is the enclosed outdoor patio, which gives you a great view of the inside of the Galleria, as well as bustling Ventura Blvd!

A disaster!  We were celebrating a friend&#39;s birthday and had a very disappointing experience and it was early before the crowds.  It took 45 minutes for them to brings our beverages... the. They brought them wrong!!! They took another 45 minutes to Bri g the food and they couldn&#39;t bring things together and we had to ask for part of our order that they forgot and is suppose to be part of what I ordered.  We asked for the manager and he came over and was actually rude!!!  Instead of being apologetic for the mess we were experiencing he made excuses that were unacceptable and really ridiculous- like he had no experience at all in management.  This all happened around 2 pm!!! Imagine how messed up they are during dinner or regular lunch hours!!!  If you go here be ready for something to go wrong with your experience there!
Doordash had nothing to do with your food being terrible<br>Doordash was excellent you guys provided inferior quality food<br>Own up to it and don&#39;t blame the delivery service

Love this place.  Service is amazing and every item I&#39;ve ordered has been excellent!  My boyfriend and I have also ordered take out and their food travels well! Their Honey Truffle Chicken stays CRISPY even after an hour or sitting in room temperature.  Every dish is spectacular!

This review is for our wonderful server we had this past Sat 11/3/18.... We had originally gotten a female waitress which was not friendly at all and gave us cold bread. Once our food came she did not offer us cheese but did give us a refill on our bread. Well im assuming she either went in break or went home cayse we never saw her again and she didnt give us the heads up. So this 5 star review goes to the server who took over for her and gave us outstanding service. His name was Antwyon. He refilled our drinks made sure we were good. Asked if i needed boxes for to go and actually boxed the leftovers for me. (I have been here many times and have never been boxed by the server before so this was amazing) he then offered us cheesecake but we declined and without me asking he asked for my validation ticket took it and came back with to go cups for our lemonades which he aslo packed for us. He went above and beyond and deserves to be acknowledged for his good work.

This was my first time at The Cheesecake Factory and let me tell you i don&#39;t know why it took me  so long to try their food! My girlfriend and I went on a Saturday night so i was thinking the wait was going to be an hour when it was really thirty minutes. <br><br>We were seated on the patio and ordered the fried calamari. It was crispy,  mouth watering and scrumptious! not as good as the calamari I tried in San Fransisco but it was a close second.  <br><br>I also ordered a  long Island Iced Tea. I don&#39;t know if It was me or I was feeling like a light weight that day, but It was much stronger than the other long island iced teas I had tried at other restaurants. My girlfriend ordered the Factory Peach Bellini. I was surprised she ordered a drink, because she doesn&#39;t drink often and she is an extreme light weight. I was thinking I might have to carry her back to my car, but luckily that didn&#39;t  happen. <br><br>On to the Entree&#39;s! I had the chicken piccata pasta. I was told this was the best pasta on the menu. I was not disappointed with it. The sauce was on point. Creamy, flavorful and a hint of lemon made the angel hair pasta taste like I was at some high up scale Italian restaurant. My girlfriend got the Alfredo Fettuccine Pasta. She enjoyed it. I&#39;ll be honest she is picky about her food too. ( I mean i consider myself a good cook, but sometimes she doesn&#39;t eat what I make her, like wtf) so she ended up finishing the whole plate. Yup we were that hungry. <br><br>Finally we ordered tiramisu. The presentation was remarkable. It looked like a $100 dessert . I was feeling a little fancy after the it arrived on the table. The taste didn&#39;t match the presentation, but overall it was still a good dessert. Frankly I am not a big fan of tiramisu anyways so I wasn&#39;t disappointed with the taste.<br><br>Overall I would love to eat out here again. The environment was great, Service was fast and friendly. The bill was a little high but that was because of our drinks. Other than that I don&#39;t have any complaints about the Cheese Cake Factory.

This place is usually a hit or miss. Still came cause the menu is great. The host who sat us was rude as hell! Moved tables ourselves. Lol. Then come to find out that they got rid of my favorite martini. Uugghhh........ but then Elisabeth L. happened. A waitress from heaven. On her game and as sweet as pie. She is the best here! Going above and beyond. She is the only reason why I gave 5 stars. Thank you Elisabeth for making us feel at home. Kudos

Had a wonderful dinner last night. For years I had burned out of this place growing up in Orange county. It was always busy and nothing was GREAT, in my opinion. I gave it another try last night and it was a very good experience. We had a salmon salad and meatloaf with wontons as an appetizer. Everything was wonderful including the service.<br>Maybe Im a fan again...

This is our first ever visit to The Cheesecake Factory and our experience was amazing!!  Our server Stephen C was phenomenal (ask for his section!!) He was amazing and attentive and suggested dishes, which were delicious!! <br>He made our celebration of Molly&#39;s 16th birthday continue in a very special time!<br><br>If we lived here, we&#39;d be back and ask for his section every time!

My daughter is in town from college and  I had a event in Canoga Park and despite all the rain we decided to stop here for some grub. <br><br>First, yes we were a party of  two but that doesn&#39;t mean I want to eat my lunch in the bar area. Listen here hostess there is clearly space in the dining room we will sit there thanks.<br><br>Secondly, we&#39;re ordered the Louisiana Chicken Pasta no mushrooms and....it showed up with Mushrooms. The pasta was average. <br><br>We also shared the beef burger which was actually flavorful and I requested the meat well done. <br><br>Our waitress was really nice and accomadating. Even so, I must say I won&#39;t be making any special trips to grub here.

I&#39;ve been here many times. Food is good, waiters are (most of the time) friendly, and the hosts/hostesses are nice. My only problem is the seating. This seems to be a thing in every cheesecake location. Most of the time when we ask the waitress or host for a booth or more private seating, they cater to our needs. Today though, the girl gave us no choice and told us to sit in those terrible (no personal space) seats that are in the middle. We asked for a booth and she said &#34;no that&#39;s for parties of 4&#34;. The booths were clearly suitable for 2 people rather than 4. I didn&#39;t want to get into it with her so I told her to &#34;forget it&#34; &amp; left. <br><br>Look Cheesecake Factory, no one likes those terrible middle tables. I went to the one in the grove few days before and they sat my cousin &amp; I in those same horrible seats. However ! That one I understood because they were having a busy night. Today in Sherman oaks though, it wasn&#39;t overboard busy and that booth was a perfect fit for 2 PEOPLE ! <br><br>Idk what you guys were thinking when you made those middle aisle tables but I think they work best for the parties of 4 or more rather than putting parties 2 there. I mean you awkwardly sit there &amp; you can&#39;t have much of a conversation cos the people at the other table are at VERY close proximity to you are listening or they start judging what you ordered or THEY&#39;RE JUST AS UNCOMFORTABLE AS YOU ! <br><br>If you seat only big groups there &amp; not small ones then we can all have a happy dining experience (:<br><br>TL;DR ? : Middle/ Crowded/ Uncomfortable seats are not for parties of 2 ! <br><br>P.S. : Easy on the salt !

I&#39;ve Been To 3 Locations: The Americana, Pasadena, And Now This One. Hands Down The Best Customer Service. Right Away, I Could Tell This Place Is Customer Service Oriented. Our Server *Jacquelyn P* Was Amazing From The Get Go. Would Always Check On Us, Offer Refill And When We Had An Order Mix Up, Everyone That Was Involved Acted With Such Professionalism. The Issue Was Resolved Right Away And The Staff Was All Around Very Personable.  This Location Will Be My Go To From Now On!
The tables are way too bunched up, even for a Cheesecake Factory. The service is corporate as expected, and the food is subpar. I&#39;m not sure why this chain is always busy.

Great food. Great atmosphere. Nice Shopping area around. Recommend coming here with groups or just family and friends. Parking is cool first 2hrs free .    Yummy bread and cheesecake. Mmmmmmmm<br>Starbucks riteby and 24hour fitness<br>. Only fkdup up part was we ended up paying $17 for parking, God our meal didnt even cost that much! And we Had validation. Wack

I had a lunch meeting here and will unfortunately have to come out this way more due to the logistics of senior management people. Our server was great and took care of us even though some of my coworkers were annoying. One was allergic to dairy the other to shrimp. I ordered the white chicken chili off the skinny menu and it was yum! I don&#39;t want to be skinny but I&#39;m watching my diet. It was chilly that day and perfect for cooler weather. They validate for parking but still had to pay $6 because I was there for a long time.

I had a great time at dinner with friends and family. Our waitress took our order and was very polite. She also explained what came in each course of each plate. I also didn&#39;t know the name of a plate I had recently had. I showed the waitress a picture of the plate I had before and she knew exactly what I was talking about. In no time she took our order. The downside was that the wait was over an hour and there was no seating available to sit and wait. Once it was my turn to be seated I went to the cashier and the lady took the device that was given to me once I signed in the front and she took it and told me to stand on the side. I stood where she told me and it took about another 35 minutes to be seated.Another downside was that the food took about 45 minutes to be served. Overall it was an ok experience.

Reasonable wait for a Friday night at 7:30 (30 min for two people) Our server, Brittney was awesome and gave great service :) Brought more bread right away when asked and kept refilling the ridiculous amounts of water we were drinking. She got us out in time for our 9:30 movie. One little complaint would be that the brown bread was burnt both times. We still ate it because even burnt that stuff is delicious! Get the fried macaroni and thank me later :D

Poor service at this location this was my second visit both times had horrible experiences with the waitress. On the way out I decided to buy a cheesecake and ask for raspberry sauce for an extra $1 not a problem. got home to find that the raspberry sauce was less than 1/2 a ramekin.... Wow I never realized that raspberry sauce was like gold. I will never go back to this location again.

Super Super annoyed by the Staff here. This place is a MISS when it comes to SERVICE.<br><br>HOWEVER, my loyalty to The Cheesecake Factory REMAINS! Over the years I have had great experiences at the Multiple locations of Cheesecake Factory: (Beverly Hills, Irvine, Marina Del Rey, Pasadena, Sherman Oaks, Cerritos, Santa Monica, Canoga Park) .... and I&#39;ve always noticed the same thing... THE SERVICE CAN REALLY BRING DOWN YOUR EXPERIENCE HERE to the point you don&#39;t want to go back for several months, which can be great by going out to more non-chain restaurants to explore what ELSE is really out there :) <br><br>The food here will always be consistent, so if you find that one dish you love, that is what you will continue to get :) The cheesecakes are great and each with its own intense flavor.<br><br>This place has to-go service, but if you get cheesecakes to go you may not get all the extra toppings or extra decorative chocolate slashes that goes with it when you dine in. <br><br>If you have a complaint, the managers are usually accommodating unless you get that one manager who&#39;s going to be RUDE and try to make it like you&#39;re the problem.<br><br>This place is good for huge parties, if it&#39;s your birthday the staff will come out and Sing Happy Birthday!....and this is usually the place I get invited to when family or friends are having a Birthday Party Dinner. <br><br>Alls I got I say it SHAPE UP YOUR SERVICE And show how awesome your chain restaurants are!!!!
Dirty silverware and filthy menu.the table is dirty too... Hope I don&#39;t get sick.dang how long do they want my review to be?
Come here often absolutely love this place. From the food to the drinks and who can forget about the cheesecake. So many to choose from !!! Great staff always nice and friendly.
So I ate a bomb ass steak Diane last night and got a food coma!!! First time trying it with a salmon and it wasn&#39;t bad at all.. I always can&#39;t complain about Cheesecake Factory!!!
one star because they got rid of the best cheesecake flavor ever invented!!! bring back snickers cheesecake!!!!!!

It was ok but comparing to great resteraunt that I have been it&#39;s not that great. It&#39;s a good family quick, i don&#39;t know where to go kinda place. However,  I always loved the ambience here.  the drinks are okay, nothing spectacular but I did like the dirty martini with the blue cheese olive. The Mahi mahi from the skinny menu was okay.. Just ok..... after all it is healthy food menu lol. ;)<br><br>Tessiyah   <br>food review  for you!

I&#39;ve been to this location plenty of times and for the most part my visits have been positive. <br><br>Last night (Jan 10th) my sister in-law decides she wants the whole family to have dinner there on her birthday. That would make 17 of us, total. After informing the hostess, she has a puzzled look on her face and tells me that there are 50 guests ahead of us and it would be a 2 and a half hour wait... We decide to wait.<br><br>Not only did they have us seated in exactly half that time, but Christian was an absolute delight. Even after we told him that we had 5 separate checks, he didn&#39;t bat an eyelash.<br><br>Our visit was a blast, the food was on point and as patrons, we were never left wanted more. <br><br>Thank you to The Cheesecake Factory staff and especially Christian for the phenomenal visit.

I&#39;m not sure why I&#39;m even reviewing Cheesecake Factory-- by now, most people have visited it before? I remember when the chain first opened and I loved coming here, but now it&#39;s just alright. There are certainly better options, but Cheesecake Factory is always a safe choice. They have a huge menu, with pastas, burritos, burgers-- you name it. The cheesecake selection is also extensive, as you could probably tell by the name-- so this place is great for cheesecake lovers.<br><br>I came to this Sherman Oaks Galleria location about a week ago with my coworker and a mutual friend for dinner. I just parked in the shopping plaza&#39;s parking structure.... make sure to validate your ticket! It cost $1 with validation. <br><br>We came on Wednesday night around 6:30pm and didn&#39;t have to wait. It definitely gets more packed throughout the night. I ordered my usual -- the Farfalle with Chicken and Garlic (Bow-Tie Pasta, Chicken, Mushrooms, Tomato, Pancetta, Peas and Caramelized Onions in a Roasted Garlic-Parmesan Cream Sauce). The entrees are pretty pricey (I think mine was $16-17) but the portions are huge and I had enough for my dinner and 2 lunches. The pasta is tasty, but definitely on the fattier/heavy side. It&#39;s also super garlic-y. This is my go-to item, but I probably will try something else next time. The pasta was drenched in oil after I reheated the leftovers..yuck. <br><br>I also got the banana cream cheesecake to-go, which was about $8. So expensive!! I could buy an entire pie at Marie Callendar&#39;s for that price. Lol. But it was pretty good... tasted like banana cream pie but in cheesecake form.<br><br>Overall, Cheesecake Factory is okay. I like this chain better than most, but it&#39;s still not my favorite restaurant to eat at.

Weekday lunch - not busy. Food didn&#39;t arrive until 45 minutes after ordering. (We had asked about the delay multiple times.)<br><br>They said &#34;the computer&#34; lost the order. The &#34;manager&#34; said sorry. No make-good. No discount. No follow-up.<br><br>This is a factory in the worse way. Managers don&#39;t want to report problems to higher-ups and they don&#39;t care about customer churn.<br><br>PS: The appetizer never arrived - just the main courses.

The food is great, the atmosphere depends on the time of day, host/hostesses and waiters/waitresses are friendly (yes, you come across the occasional person that has a bad day). My overall experience is satisfactory. Oh, yeah parking is validated and easy.<br><br>I have Eaten at this restaurant numerous w/ family, friends, and once alone, the  issue with this location  is seating it always appears to be overcrowded (understandable however frustrating). The entryway needs more attention because people gather there a lot(it&#39;s a small space). Some advice would be to try and call ahead if you have a large party with you other then that never go when you are super hungry because it will feel like forever to be seated and order.

Average, run-of-the-mill Cheesecake Factory. Plenty of parking in the mall (and they validate), but lines can be atrocious on the weekends. <br><br>Pro tip: ask them to go easy on the salt.. seems like the big trend over the last few years has been to dump excessive amounts of it on all the dishes.

I have been a Cheescake Factory regular, usually go to the one near my work in Arcadia.  Yesterday i dropped by the Sherman Oaks one for early dinner.  We arrived at 6pm and was a party of six.  Our server, Michelle (mid-20&#39;s, heavy set), provided us with very poor service.  First, she double-ordered one of the pasta dishes.  Second, she never came by to refill our water and my coffee.  If we needed anything, we had to wait, spot, and wave her down.  Even that did not work half of the time, she would simply pass by without making any eye contact.  What a disappointing experience!  I know Cheesechae Factory can do better than that.

So I just experienced the Cheesecake Factory. Schoolteacher and I had an adventure that landed us somewhat kind of around this area. Remembering that I had been given a gift certificate from my father, I suggested we visit for lunch. We parked in the nearby structure, and walked through the mall over to the place.<br>    After giving the hostess our name, I stuffed the vibrating buzzer thingy into my back pocket, and we discussed our adventures. The place was quite noisy, and the cacophony of the crowds of people waiting for entry into the restaurant, as well as nearby diners made it quite difficult to hear the buzzers alert. However, after some time, I jumped as my left ass-cheek felt the vibrating buzzer informing us that our table was ready. Excited, I returned to the hostess stand, and hostess girl took the buzzer, and said somebody will get you . There we waited for another ten or so minutes. Standing awkwardly in front of the hostess booth before somebody eventually came to get us.<br>     We were led by somebody around the crowded labyrinthian pathways through the throng of tables and eventually seated at a table of our own. I was reminded of those people who work at county fair parking lots, fitting one car right next to another, doing their best to save as much space as possible so they can cram as many cars as they can into a field. We had a couple about a foot our left, and a mother and young daughter about a foot to our right. As we sat down, both couples looked up at us, smiled and politely nodded to us before returning to their personal devices. <br>     Another lengthy wait, and another person came over with menus, introduced himself and took our beverage orders. Person took off and disappeared for some time. Knowing that there would probably be a desert round, I eventually settled upon the Renee&#39;s Special, which had some soup, some salad and some sandwich. Schoolteacher went with the Eggplant Parmesan for the same reason. <br>     Eventually, order guy came back with our drinks, and breads. He then took our orders, and left. Presumably the bread was there to keep us busy while he went off for another break or something.  It was quite some time before somebody completely different delivered our food.  Schoolteacher and I chatted about our future plans while we waited for our food.<br>     When the food arrived nearly an hour after ordering, I was quite surprised by the soup. Mainly because order person had neglected to inform what kind of soup came with the special. Turns out it was a baked potato kinda soup. It was quite good though. The salad was also crisp and fresh. The turkey sandwich used a baguette fragment for the bread. With it&#39;s rough and super hard exterior crust, it&#39;s not a bread I&#39;d have personally made a sandwich from. I was reminded of this several times during the meal when a jagged ridge of crust painfully dug into the roof of my mouth. I&#39;ll agree with the other reviewers, the serving sizes are indeed quite large.  I was full before too long. Schoolteacher was also slowing down on her Eggplant Parm. We decided to get everything wrapped up, and order some cheesecake for later.<br>     I asked a random employee passing by for a to-go box, and one was quickly handed too me. We packed up the remainder of bread, and the eggplant and then waited for order guy to arrive. Who showed up eventually. At that point, I asked him for boxes, some to-go cheesecake, as well as the bill. I had hoped to mitigate the excessive time between visits by getting everything all at once.<br>    Packed up foods and bill arrived after another excessive wait. Thankfully, my total was just ninety cents over the gift certificate. I held onto the bill until the cheesecake arrived. I then packed up my to-go items, and left him a nominal tip. Probably more than I should have, but sometimes I&#39;m far too nice for my own good.<br>     We got our parking stub validated, and returned to the structure to leave.  Later on that evening, after our bellies had cleared room, the cheesecake was in fact, quite delicious.  <br><br> So overall, the food was simply ok. The cheesecake (and I from what I&#39;ve heard the drinks) is quite wonderful. The service however was as slow as molasses in January.  I didn&#39;t know who to complain about because I had fifty different people during the course of the nearly two hour meal. The place is crazy crowded, and as a result, it is super noisy. While here, I somewhat understand why couples don&#39;t talk to each other over the table, over the noise and simply stare transfixed by their phones. I did my best to converse with Schoolteacher, and it was quite the challenge. I honestly don&#39;t think I&#39;ll be back. Unless it&#39;s to order cheesecake to go from the cheesecake to go counter.

This place used to be a regular quick stop to enjoy a variety of cuisine and dessert options. Food still tastes good. The desserts are amazing. Although the service is not great. They lack in direction and timing.  On several different occasions, one meal will be brought out and we would have to wait a good 10- 15min until the next. Sauces we would ask for would either be forgotten or brought out when meal was already finished.

I just landed from Canada and brought 12 people to this CF and i need to charge my phone but they will not do anything to help. I need to do business but they do not care. So im pretty upset. Foods good but they really dont care much about my issue now. So i give them a 1 for that. As well i will have to leave my 11 family members to go get my phone charges. Im bummed!
the food here was so good i will recommend this place the only reason why i didnt give it a 5 star is because it took too long for the food
Went one Sunday nite since we had a sitter for the boy. No wait. Great service. Gets 5stars!

Wait time 1 hour with 3 hungry kids. The empty table they eventually sat us in was available the entire time. We waited ANOTHER 45 minutes for food. <br>Apparently they are too cheap to hire more servers. If tables are sitting empty and there are people waiting an hour to get in, that&#39;s just bad management. At least let people wait at the empty table where it&#39;s warm, instead of making them wait outside in the cold. <br>Cheesecake has always been known for long wait times, but apparently they are getting too comfortable with the idea. Let people wait at the empty tables where it&#39;s warm and hire more servers to handle the workload. We won&#39;t go back to this location. The one in Thousand Oaks is better managed.

If I had to have a favorite CC Factory, this is the one. Never had problems finding parking in the structure.<br><br>** I love to eat OUTSIDE, it&#39;s not as noisy but not the street side, I LOVE the comfy seating on the other side of the restaurant.<br><br>Love the tropical iced tea. They also carry COKE ZERO<br>Don&#39;t forget to leave room for dessert.<br>Currently loving the skinny menu options(soft tacos or flatbread pizza)<br>Food:<br>++ chicken wrap App- I get it as a meal sometimes<br>++ garlic chicken farfalle<br>+factory burrito<br>+ bagel with lox<br>+ mushroom burger<br>+build your own omelet<br>++Bbq chicken salad - love the onion tanglers on top<br><br>DESSERT and DRINKS<br>ALWAYS order pumpkin pecan cheesecake only around OCT-end of year<br>++ apple strudel cheesecake<br>++ lemon raspberry CC<br>++chocolate coconut CC<br>++ Chris&#39; outrageous CC<br>+ peach Bellini<br>++Georgia peach

If you need to stick to a gluten free diet for medical reasons, do not order any of the gluten free pasta dishes at The Cheesecake Factory. They boil the gf pasta in the same water as all the other pastas (in a steamer container in one big vat of salted water). Talk about risky false advertising! I just got glutened and found out all about this after talking to the manager after finding a few non-gf pasta in my supposedly gf pasta dish. Seriously, don&#39;t claim on your menu that you offer gluten-free options if you can&#39;t actually do so. They do have a tiny disclaimer saying that they aren&#39;t a completely gf free environment but that is quite different from disclosing that they cook all the pasta in the same pot!
I&#39;m a huge fan, the food was amazing with a great customer service ,<br>You should try the Oreo cheesecake

I really want to like this place because in general I do like Cheesecake Factory. There are better locations and I will just say this in short - the General Manager and Manager DO NOT CARE about you or your concerns. They will ignore and not address. This has happened to my friends as well especially when an issue arises. There is no ownership and accountability and that&#39;s why this gets a one-star. The food itself, I will rate as a 2-3 star max.

Haven&#39;t set foot in this place for dinner in years but hibachi steak was good. Light on the taste buds american cuisine with japanese eastern flavor.<br><br>Only main concern is the washcloth used to wipe the tables are used to wipe other tables after dining and utensils are placed on the table &amp; utensils  not on top of napkins.

Yay! I&#39;m a fan of Cheesecake Factory&#39;s happy hour!  Monday to Friday from 4-6pm.  You do have to find a seat at the bar, and it is only during the week, and yes, it would be nice if it was a 5-7 happy hour, but I get it.  <br>This particular Cheesecake Factory is usually very busy, but it has a generous sized bar area and they validate your parking.  If you need to wait for your buzz to wear off, you can always head up to DSW or Urban Home and walk it off.

Okay. I have to say, that this place is probably one of the most over-hyped places in all of Southern California. <br><br>I have to start with the wait. Everyone waits over 20 minutes for a table whether you have a reservation not. I mean if you&#39;re someone who constantly eats out like me, you learn to just accept that some places will have waiting period no matter what. <br><br>The thing is, you wait on average 20+ minutes, and the food isn&#39;t that great. It&#39;s not bad, but it&#39;s definitely not something to die for either. Basically, the food doesn&#39;t justify the waiting period you have. You wait 20+ minutes for your buzzer to go off, and then you wait another 15 minutes inside for a table to clear. It&#39;s quite ridiculous at times. However, the service has always been incredible no matter how busy it is, and the decor is pretty. <br><br>The valet is nice, but I do trust my personal parking more than handing the keys to one of the random guys. I have seen some crazy shit over the past many years I have been returning to the Sherman Oaks Galleria. Plus, ou save almost $30 bucks on valet and the self-park is almost always empty from the 2nd floor up. A great parking spot is always certain to awaiting.<br><br>It&#39;s a definite must-try, and I will be occasionally returning.<br><br>P.S. I do suggest sitting outside. People watching is fantastic for those who do so, and the heaters make the atmosphere the warm-chilly weather that leaves the air nice and crisp. It&#39;s less noisy, and less &#39;traffic&#39;. Plus, the waiting period is typically cut in half.

On Sunday afternoon. we had *hitty/rude waiter who has an attitude ( name was Oscar T) i believe.  He never checked our table until we asked other waiter for out cold food... our dish was not even warm.. so cold... i assume they let the food seat for a while....<br>Waiter never greeted at us at all. no smile. seems like he is not happy working at cheese cake  factory... another bad experience with server&#39;s manner...<br>not sure if i need to go to Groove Cheese Cake or not... Mostly Cheese Cake Factory at Groove has great service all the time..

I am a huge fan....always have been.  I love their Chinese chicken salad, but I substitute the chicken for salmon.<br><br>We also had the crab cheese wantons which were delicious.<br><br>We had great service at this particular location and would go back.  Consider eating early otherwise expect to wait.

I would return for the cheesecake ... We&#39;ve been there a few times and the food  was very good in June &#39;16 then  a few months later all the dishes were disappointing. Watery tomato sauce, where was the cheese in Alfredo sauce? Maybe there was new cook staff ? I make better pasta at home !

Went for dinner. It&#39;s by far one of my favorite chain restaurants! <br>Our waitress was great! Awesome, attentive and had a real charm. She was definitely the reason we left happy!<br><br>The food however was below average this time, unfortunately. The garlic bread was too burned and the rest of the food was just not as tasty as normal. For the most of the time it&#39;s a HIT and not a MISS. Today everything but the Salmon, and the cheesecake was a miss. <br>I don&#39;t know if the bar staff was new, because the drinks tasted like water with ice. <br>Maybe it had been a long week. Anyways; I&#39;ve got to repeat how great the waitress was. I can&#39;t wait to go back and write a review next time, when the kitchen and the bar are on top of their jobs the same way as our great waitress. We&#39;ll be back!
Service was awesome and the celebration Cheesecake was tah die but the food is always underwhelming. Def will be back to get multiple slices of cheesecake and no food.

1 hour wait just to be seated. While the server was phenomenal, the food wasn&#39;t. We ordered clam chowder, calamari, Cajun pasta, &amp; orange chicken. Both of us left with FOOD POISONING. I felt sick immediately after eating, while s/o got sick on the way back to hotel. Completely disappointing considering the money we spent and the rep that Cheesecake Factory has.

Worst breakfast experience of my life!!!!!! <br>Usually enjoy dinner here.. but after my experience with Rebecca the manager on shift this morning, I will never ever be back! Had to change my order twice on request from my sever, on the 3rd attempt got my meal and had to send it back as it wasn&#39;t as I&#39;d requested. Food was bland. Ate some of it as I&#39;d waited almost 1.5hours for it! Left 70% on the plate. After everything they still charged me for it and refused to take it off the menu!!!! <br>So disappointed and upset !!!
Very nice place! I love cheese cake here! Original cheese! It&#39;s fantastic really! Here is very good atmosphere:)

Quality food, excellent service, and beautiful ambience.  Came here tonight for my brothers 34th bday and it couldn&#39;t of gone better. Our server was very attentive to our needs and even made great drink and food suggestions. Food and drinks came out at a timely fashion even though my husband and I came late 15 minutes and ordered after everyone. Everyone enjoyed themselves!!!. <br><br>This is my favorite spot to celebrate birthdays for the reason that they have the space and tables to fit a party of any size. The Cheesecake Factory is good for any occasion.

I ordered 2 Skinny Steak Plates for pick up and it looked horrible. It looked like someone else&#39;s left overs.... I called to ask if it was actually the meals and the said it was preparations to the set calories of the skinnilious menu. But I still feel like the presentation could have been different. This is what we got.
Bar staff is awesome, but management can&#39;t figure out how to fix satalite dish after 8 months...really!!!!!

I stopped coming here along time ago for a reason. Poor customer service and crappy food. Ordered the fire roasted Artichokes and they tasted dry and old..... my waitress cant get it togather and the whole visit is just off. <br> <br>Ordered a Lemon drop and was hoping to get another one but the waitress never came back to the table to ask if I wanted another cocktail. Showed the aritchokes to the Manager who agreed that they were old (he took them off the bill which I appreciate). Asked for my bill which was $33.00, however my waitress rang up another tables order on my card and charged me $65.00 (I think she was on Meth).... just the worst dining experience ever. If I could give Zero stars I would.<br><br> Last time coming here. Should have followed my first mind and went to Roys!

This place always seems to be crowded. It&#39;s very convenient especially if you are going to see a movie and you can eat right after. The food is decently priced and good. The cheesecake is good, but the portions are big that you can&#39;t even finish your food let alone save room for dessert. <br><br>The servers are really nice, but the hostess taking down orders could be nicer. When are buzzer went off she didn&#39;t tell us our name would be called. She just said wait over there.<br><br>If you happen to sit outside and it&#39;s cold they have warmers that work really well. It goes quicker if you don&#39;t mind where you are being seated.

I think i have said it before but I&#39;ll say it again anyway, Cheesecake Factory is probably the only major chain restaurant out there where you know what to expect and what you will get no matter what location you dine at. Consistency is key and that is the only way they are able to pull off their huge menu so well. <br><br>Tonight I had something old and something new. <br>Something old: Crispy Orange Chicken. The presentation was different from what I remembered but it tasted the same as it did when I had it probably over 5 years ago. Chicken was crispy and juicy. Rice was steamed perfectly. Veggies were fresh and crispy and cooked just as perfect as the rice. Orange sauce was zesty and sweet and there was just the right amount of it. <br><br>Something new was the Mini Corn Dogs for $4.95 off their new Small Plates menu. Being Cheesecake Factory, the only thing small or mini about this Corn Dog dish was the price. Sweeetttt!<br><br>Jes ordered the Four Cheese Pasta and I stole a few bites and it was quite yummy. I like how the use the tiny small penne noodles instead of the standard size ones. <br><br>Jeremy was our server and he was great. Water glasses were kept filled through our whole meal and we didn&#39;t even have to ask or look around for him to do so once. Did a great job at trying to sell us his personal fav Dutch Apple Cheesecake but we had to pass since we already had milk on the mind.<br><br>They validate parking so bring your ticket in and remember to stop by the host stand before you leave.

The service is awful. We came at a party of 12 and waited more then 30 mins. The manager said that our table will be ready in 5 minutes. Instead we waited for a whole hour. After all we got a broken table. The waitress didn&#39;t like the fact that we noticed that the table was broken. And she didn&#39;t even want to serve us. If I could I wouldn&#39;t even rate it one star.<br>P.S. We were there with kids. <br>I have never recommend this place to anyone!!!!!

Stopped by to grab some cheesecake I didnt know they were closing in 15 minutes so had to grab it to go the wait wasn&#39;t so bad no more than 10 minutes for 3 slices and it looked pretty busy. I had the tiramisu cheesecake and it is SO DELICIOUS very happy with my visit I will be back for dinner sooner than later
Great service! Awesome food! Huge portions! What is not to love. The chicken madera is amazing! I always have leftovers to take home!

I can&#39;t understand what happened to this restaurant. I have never thought that I could disappoint with their service. When we came there the restaurant was almost empty. And manager asked to wait us 5 minutes but after 30 minutes he needed 5 minutes more. Overall we waited for the table 1 hour. We wanted to fit 12 people at the table for 10 people. After 10 minutes more they brought a broken table. We asked waitress to change it. And she was disappeared for the next 15 minutes. <br>Unfortunately our kids were so hungry, that we had to leave . <br>P.S. The manager ignored us in purpose while we leaving the restaurant. <br>I would recommend to go to another Cheesecake Factory instead of this one.

Ordered three takeout items: chicken madeira, white chicken chili and almond crusted salmon salad.  Both the chicken/mashed potatoes were dry and the chili was cold.  They didn&#39;t include any napkins and two slices of bread.  Very disappointing.

Let me just say first they have always had the best cheese cake ever! <br>BUT...<br>The service has gone way down hill. We had to ask for bread. The drinks took too long to come out. There were 4 of us and ALL four dishes came out at different times. The dishes were not correct. That didn&#39;t help start off the dining experience. I ordered the Chicken and Biscuts, not sure what happened to that delicious dish. But it was all sorts of wrong. The biscuts were corn muffins, the gravy, well that was just not gravy. It used to be a really yummy dish. Not so anymore. Completely missed it. <br>What happened to you guys???

Came here the other night with a big party. With past experiences at other restaurants, when you go with a big party the waiter doesn&#39;t treat you as good, because typically the party is loud and annoying. This time my experience was different. The waiter we had really did her job. She took everyone&#39;s orders, gave everyone excellent tips on what to order, knew exactly who ordered what, and she even kept coming and asking if everything is okay and if we need anything else. She asked us if each of us want to get our own checks and we said yes. She went ahead and conveniently split each one of our orders onto our own individual checks, down to the tip and the tax.<br><br>The food at The Cheesecake Factory has always been great for me. You can&#39;t go wrong with anything that your order. I usually try a different burger each time I go, as I love burgers. This time I got the mushroom burger cooked medium well and it was delicious. I had read a review on yelp while waiting for the food and I was told to ask for the ranch, the review had said that the ranch was amazing and to die for. Well, long story short I found the ranch to be really really good. <br><br>I personally would recommend The Cheesecake Factory to anyone. They have a wide selection on their menu which is great for large parties.<br><br>Thank You to The Cheesecake Factory for the fabulous experience and the great food!

Long wait on wnkds, but acceptable because both the service and the food/drinks were amazing. They should have a kids-free area because being kicked on the superior leg by the neighbor&#39;s bad behaved kid sucks! And note: I love kids! Just can&#39;t stand in such things. Kids running on the booth and kicking other clients? Common! End of story, best passion fruit mojito ever!! Love!

So Cheesecake Factory all over the world is usually an experience that you can count on. But the Cheesecake on Ventura in Sherman Oaks not so much. I called in and asked for my regular Chicken and Biscuits but I was persuaded by the intake employee to try the honey truffle  chicken. When I got home I tasted the most dry bland chicken that I have ever been served. It was like someone had just tried to make fried chicken for the first time. My friends ate their delicious meals at my house while we watched movies. I told them how this chicken tasted and two of them said no way and tasted it they said that it was the worst chicken that they have ever had. They told me that I should get my money back or another order. So I called I didn&#39;t want my money back I just wanted to have the tasty experience that I was used to from Cheesecake Factory all over the Country. I explained the situation to the manager RICHARD and he said if I wanted to come back they would get me a new meal. It was 10:30pm so I thought I&#39;d just get food another day. RICHARD asked me for a picture of the food. I then sent him a picture and he called me back explaining that he would not replace my order because half of the food was eaten. This was a blatant lie. When I received my food at first I thought to myself these portions are pretty small. I took two bites of chicken and mashed potatoes and my friend took one. But in actuality the customer should be able to eat the whole meal and if he/she is not satisfied should be able to have their meal replaced. It was not as if I had ever done this before at the Sherman Oaks Cheesecake Factory. Any way this Cheesecake Factory takes their customer service as seriously as their fried chicken (not at all). When you pay $90 at a restaurant for take out you expect them to be decent and if not, try to get it right.

If you know me, you know I don&#39;t frequent chain restaurants. That being said, I loves me some Cheesecake Factory. Everything is always well prepared, the service is always great and the food is always on point. <br>That being said ( I say that a lot in reviews!) I&#39;ve been ordering the same thing from every CF since 1997- the portabella mushroom sandwich. It has always been on point and always delicious. Well, they took it off the menu a few years back, but you can still ask for it. That&#39;s what I love about the CF!!! I see why folks do go to chain restaurants, although this is like a gourmet chain restaurant, with good food that is consistent. When I&#39;m back in Cali, I&#39;ll be back, or wherever I go!
Horrible food and service. Bad management. I will not return. 5 customers lost forever. Compelte fail. I would give zero stars if it were an option.

I have been to other Cheesecake Factory locations before and have had very mediocre service. But this location in the Sherman oaks galleria was a different story and it was all because of the very nice server Alex D. He really made our experience worth while. He tended to our every need and even made sure our cups were never empty. He is the epitome of great customer service!

Went with the fam for a belated Mothers Day Brunch. None of us had been to Cheescake Factory in years so we were excited to go. Katelyn was our server, very friendly and attentive. The food was not so good. Nothing wow&#39;d us and for the price, we all agreed that we won&#39;t be back. Let me get down to the nitty gritty of my review. The only good food item we ordered was the spinach &amp; cheese dip appetizer, this was delish!. And thank God for THAT because it took our food over 30 minutes to come out. My Omelette and potatoes were very sub par, I picked out the veggies and cheese and left the rest. I could have got the same or better at Denny&#39;s. Matter of fact, IHOP is better and portions are the same size!. No seasoning whatsoever! I felt like I was at the Seniors Buffet. Potatoes, bland and over cooked. My niece ordered french toast. The server that brought it to her, just handed it to her and didn&#39;t warn her, it was scalding hot! It burned her hands! She had to hold onto her glass of cold of iced tea to get the burning to stop. They have a weird system here. Your waitress takes the orders and checks in on you and a whole team (like 4 to 5 others, come out and deliver food) I&#39;ve never seen such a display....it was literally a piece of sourdough bread loaf, sliced off, fried up and served. She said it tasted just like it looked, like a hunk of bread. Who makes french toast out of sourdough??? So basically, very bland, sub par, EXPENSIVE food. I can safely say that none of us will be back anytime soon and I will not recommend. Maybe just stick to what they are famous for, the cheesecakes and appetizers.

I usually don&#39;t complain but here I am complaining... Went in for dinner and drinks this past Sunday night and came out completely disgusted on how management handled a situation. I ordered a cucumber martini and a few sips into the drink I noticed there was a crack in the glass and I had mentioned it to my friend. We waited for our waitress to come around to let her know and she graciously apologized and took it back. Was waiting for it to come back around until the manager Vincent came up to our table and looked at me and asked me somewhat defensively &#34;what happened to the glass?&#34; Almost as if he was accusing me of putting the crack into the glass myself. I explained to him that I noticed the crack while drinking it and asked if he inspected every glass that goes out and with him saying that he absolutely does. Keep in mind the glass was still somewhat full. His apology seemed forced and his demeanor with the whole incident was incredibly rude. What kind of management is that? I can understand if there was nothing in the glass and then I complained, but for him to come up to my table and question what happened as if I had did it was extremely unprofessional and was his approach to the situation was defensive. I would never go to this location again and really hope they consider better ways on how to handle certain customer service situations.

Everyone knows I love the CCF, it&#39;s my McDonald&#39;s. Anyway we hit up the Sherman Oaks Galleria to work out, relax and eat. It just so happened to be happy hour once we arrived to dine.  We easily received a bar table it was Monday about 5pm. Server was eye candy and really nice. We ordered 2 salads, 3 appetizers, 2 beers and 2 club sodas. The bill was only $40 and of course everything was delicious because it was CCF. $5.50 appetizers and kept at regular hour portions which are huge. May I suggest the nachos and buffalo blast!!!! $4 draft beers, Blue Moon, Sam Adams and a few others (16 ounce) worth it! Of course I&#39;ll be back.  It&#39;s right next to the Burke Williams I like! ! That review is coming next hahahaha .

A lot of Food and a lot of People waiting to be seated.<br>There is nothing new to write<br>Every body know What is cheesecake all about.<br>Good restaurant with any kind of cuisine and a lot of food.

The food here is normally pretty decent at this location but for some reason I always seem to get a waitress who&#39;s in a snappy mood every single time I come here. This location is convenient for me to go to but if I want to bring my boyfriend or friends here, I have to keep in mind to not pay attention to the dine-in service because it always puts a damper on our eating experience. By the way, the to-go service in the bakery is always way better so I&#39;ve just been ordering to-go instead.

2 stars for the amazing appetizer, it was chicken Mexican egg rolls, so good and flavorful. But my rib-eye, I ordered medium and verified with waitress that medium is pink. I got a well done steak (grey), and returned it immediately. I would like to also say, we visited on Thursday, not even a weekend, the place was crowded, you could see on the waitresses faces that they are exhausted already. I think Cheesecake Factory should open another branch in Encino. I will not come back again. I think the branch in Topanga mall is better, food is better and the place is less occupied. The guy that welcomed us, Malaki his name, was awesome! We love to come and have small talks with him, he is a sweet guy.

First of all, it is FREEZING in here!!!! The wait was 45 minutes and they still sat us at the bar section. The service was awful!!! We would ask for utensils and receive unnecessary attitude. The manager is the worse part of this whole experience. He was very unapologetic. So we have now been here for almost three hours and have just gotten food. At least the cheesecake is delicious! ;)
I&#39;m very disappointed my wife  went so bad to go there today and we drove all the way and it was close !!!!!! For no reason I&#39;m very disappointed

I just had a great meal at the Cheesecake Factory in Sherman Oaks.  The restaurant was very crowded, as usual, so we ended up eating at the bar.  The service was GREAT!  The restaurant inside is quite loud, but sitting at the bar you could actually have a conversation without yelling.<br><br>The rib eye steak was perfectly done and the Caesar salad is the best. Portions are plentiful and all the bread you can eat.

If I can rate it a zero I would!<br><br>Cameron Pugh<br><br>Cameron Pugh<br><br>Cameron Pugh<br><br>Cameron Pugh<br><br>I ordered my old fashion and it took them 10 minutes.  When I asked to speak to the manager .....<br><br>Cameron Pugh came and before I even explained my situation he already started making excuses for his bartenders.   I&#39;ve been to plenty of Cheesecake Factory&#39;s and more importantly a lot more bar/lounges.  No one has ever made me wait for 10 minutes when 5 out of the 14 seats are being occupied.   It was insulting when every time I plead my case he already knew the excuse to answer.  Not good manager and am really disappointed in CCF on this one.  I hope you make a note of it and rectify this problem.  Btw, I was in my golf attire and I don&#39;t know if this had anything to do with my treatment.   <br><br>Thank you.

I like coming to The Cheesecake Factory. They have a large menu with many items. I often have trouble figuring out what to order.  I have tried many dishes varying from their steaks, salads, soups, pastas and their yummy desserts. I also like eating the fresh bread they bring out while you wait for your food. If you&#39;re looking for a nice ambiance to dine in with good food, Cheesecake Factory is always a safe bet.
Great restaurant really good food and the menu is with plenty of options also great for kids and romantic bar at night basically everything in one restaurant

Came here for lunch with the coworkers, they validate for parking in the structure. This was not my first time but it&#39;s been awhile. Lunch time is really busy so come early or you&#39;ll be stuck outside in the heat.<br><br>Bread - unlimited bread, get the brown looking bread, delicious!<br>Fried Macaroni And Cheese - Pretty tasty, nothing special though.<br>Hot Spinach And Cheese Dip - spinach was pretty good, tasty, would definitely order<br><br>Spicy Chicken Chipotle Pasta - AMAZING! the sauce blended perfectly and was so delicious. I would have finished everything had I not ate so much bread.<br><br>Strawberry Cheesecake - Pretty good but just a typical cheese cake<br><br>Service was great and this place is always consistent. Haven&#39;t had a bad experience.

I used to enjoy Cheesecake Factory so much! The food was always tasty and fresh, we all know the giant portions, I have complemented waiters there many times for being wonderful and very accommodating....<br>Well, lately I have had 2 very below average experiences... Last one was today at lunch. 3 of us went to celebrate a coworker birthday. My Caesar salad had almost no dressing and when I asked for some extra it took 15 min to bring that by and I could see that waitress was lost and went from table to table asking if the dressing was ordered... The same was happening when my coworker asked for an extra plate so that she can share her salad....<br>Overall experience was not good, food was just ok...<br>I guess it is time to move on....

I don&#39;t normally complain about customer service....but this review mainly goes out to the HORRENDOUS service I received!!!<br><br>First we were seated in a timely fashion...plus for that...but as soon as our server came..he took all the experience out of dining here. <br><br>A. He took our orders and didn&#39;t offer us bread. Hmmmm maybe he&#39;s new?<br><br>B. He set our waters down and every server knows...serve the furthest person first...what did this guy do? Serve the closest person so that when he reached over the table to put the rest of the waters down, HIS TIE WENT INTO MY CUP. Yes he knew, because he straightened his tie right after...and didn&#39;t offer to replace my water...oh and still didn&#39;t offer bread. But eh i ordered a sangria so I figured I could just drink that....<br><br>C. We place our orders. I asked for a strawberry shortcake &#34;for here&#34; and a few other cheesecakes to-go for after the meal. When dessert comes he brings me a strawberry cheesecake that I originally wanted to go, not the strawberry shortcake, so that gets sent back. THEN I was able to finally ask for some bread. <br><br>D. We pay for the meal. Get the cheesecakes to go. And he didn&#39;t offer validation...again we had to flag him down and ask for it. <br><br>E. The strawberry cheesecake we took home was MELTED. I paid $8 for a blob of crap!!! Totally unacceptable!! We had a few drinks and appetizers with the desserts so we were at the restaurant for at least an hour. That strawberry cheesecake never had a chance!!! <br><br>Absolutely disappointed. I wish I could give a negative tip bc this guy just plain SUCKED like this worthless strawberry cheesecake!!!

I&#39;ve only been to cheesecake factory one time before this time, and I believe that was in 2006, and I&#39;ve never had a chance to step foot into this place again. (Not this same place, but a different one!)<br><br>So me and 3 of my friends decided to drive up to Sherman Oaks, because one of our friends lives over in Van Nuys, and we decided to check out the eating areas around there. <br><br>It was either this or PF Chang&#39;s. And PF Chang&#39;s had a wait of 45 minutes to an hour so we decided to skip it, and just head over to Cheesecake factory. The wait here was about 40 minutes or so, which isn&#39;t bad but it wasn&#39;t great. But it was alright because by the time we sat down it was around 9ish. By the time we got our food it was around 9:30. So we made good time. <br><br>I got the pasta cabanara. It was pretty good. I only ate like 1/4 of my food though. I don&#39;t eat that much! <br><br>The service was pretty good, but the waitress didn&#39;t come and refill my glass of strawberry lemonade at the end, which was a slight bummer. But other than that, I would come back here next time, but I&#39;m definitely going to try something different!

The food was delicious but this location has HORRIBLE customer service!<br><br>Our waitress was definitely having a bad day and showed it.  She blamed it on being sick, which is kinda nasty seeing that she&#39;s serving us food.<br><br>We barely saw her throughout our entire time there.  When we were done eating we flagged her down for a dessert menu and then didn&#39;t see her again for a good 25-30 minutes.  By then we decided that we were just going to get some cheesecake to go.  But then it took another 30 min to get our check and pay our bill.  <br><br>THEN, we go to the cheesecake to go area and there are at least 5 girls/waitresses there.  Four of them are talking stories and completely ignoring us.  There was one poor girl working behind the counter preparing the cheesecake for dining in orders and after standing there for 15 min, she finally was able to help us.  We felt so bad for her that she had to work so hard while the other 4 girls just stood there gossiping about their boyfriends (apparently one of them is back with their bf AGAIN, gasp).  Then a guy worker even came behind the cheesecake bar place and was like, &#34;what are you doing ladies, it isn&#39;t story time&#34; and they just ignored him and kept talking.  Finally one of them rang us up and we finally got to go home, cheesecake in tow.<br><br>One of the worst customer service experiences we&#39;ve ever had.

My favorite Cheesecake Factory. <br><br>Service is fast and friendly.  The menu is constantly changing but the favorites are always there. I usually order the fettuccine with chicken and sun dried tomatoes but I thought I&#39;d try something new instead. <br><br>I ordered the New Orleans shrimp from their special lunch menu and it was good. Served over a bed of rice it had lots of flavor without being too spicy or salty. I liked the tiny pieces of sausage and bell peppers that were mixed in the shrimp. The Arnold Palmer was perfect with my meal. <br><br>Parking was easy and free with validation. Oh, don&#39;t forget to order a slice of the always delicious cheesecake.

Had dinner here last night with my boyfriend. Our server was okay. She checked on us twice during our whole visit. But never asked my boyfriend for refills on his iced tea, I get it was busy but she also walked by a couple times without acknowledging us. Maybe because he wasn&#39;t drinking any alcohol since he had to drive, she felt like she didn&#39;t need to. <br><br>Food was great as usual, everything came out perfect. Nothing wrong there.<br><br>Decided to use the restroom before I left, and let me tell you, do not, and I repeat DO NOT use the women&#39;s restroom at this Cheesecake Factory. It is DISGUSTING! There were random stains on the toilet seats, tampon wrappers everywhere, toilet paper everywhere, some of it was wet too, paper towels were overflowing from the trash can. And the handicap bathroom was horrific. I didn&#39;t even use the restroom there anymore, that&#39;s how disgusting it was. <br>I let the manager at the host stand know about her little problem, she was a blond lady, really rude as well. All she said was &#34;thanks for letting me know&#34; and didn&#39;t even said anyone to clean it! <br>DISGUSTING!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! <br><br>I probably won&#39;t return here, just because of that. I&#39;m a clean freak. I can&#39;t handle how nasty that was. <br><br>I&#39;ll stick to the Cheesecake Factory that I know is clean at all times, and the staff is really friendly at the one I usually go to. Sherman oaks CCF left a bad taste in my mouth.

I came here for a client event and the food and drinks were delicious! This was the pre-party to Spa Night at Burke Williams. What a treat for the clients! <br><br>We got here for Happy Hour (4pm - 6pm) and got a few drinks and appetizers. They had pretty gourmet appetizers for $5, including crab and artichoke dip. The margaritas and mojitos were also $5. The service was amazing and she was very friendly and attentive to the group. Everyone made it to Burke Williams on time. <br><br>As soon as we left around 6pm, the restaurant became packed! I don&#39;t come here often, but I can see it&#39;s a population location in the Galleria.

I wanted to give it 4.5 stars but....Since I moved to Sherman oaks me and the wife come to this cheese cake factory once or twice a month and sometimes we order to go..when we eat there service and food is good but...but...but when we order take out there is always something missing and that sucks cause you think your getting all you ordered and there is always something missing and nobody want to drive back for one thing...hope they fix that problem...plus when u call for take out you&#39;re on hold for about 5-10 min..

I got a weird compliment from someone on yelp asking why I still continue to go even when I gave this place 2 stars. I actually haven&#39;t been going back. They also have raised their soup price and made the cup size smaller. I would be crazy to waste $8 on a few tablespoons of soup. Again, only<br>reason anyone at our office goes back is because Tina is so nice.

Last night, my boyfriend and I were originally going to go to El Torito Grill, but to our surprise, it was closed and gone forever (we were genuinely surprised :0). So, then we opted to come here because we were both very hungry. We waited possibly 10 minutes to be seated, which is really good for dinner time. When we sat down, our waiter promptly asked for our drink order and if we wanted any bread. Of course we said YES to bread, but we requested only the wheat bread which is our favorite. I also ordered the loaded tots as an appetizer and our entrees, which were the lemon herb chicken and the BBQ Ranch Chicken salad. The loaded tots came out first and it was something nice to munch one while waiting for our food. Unfortunately, we waited close to 40 minutes for our food and it wasn&#39;t even super busy or the weekend BUT when we finally did get our food the portion of my salad was HUGE and my boyfriend&#39;s chicken entree was very flavorful. So, yes I will be back BUT hopefully next time we don&#39;t have to wait that long for our food to come out.

Certain people truly love The Cheesecake Factory, and I really just don&#39;t get it. The decor is gaudy (though I guess it matches a large percentage of the clientele), the menu and servings are bloated, and the food is mediocre at best. Sure the cheesecakes are decent, but when you stuff 1,000+ calories into a single slice of anything, the odds are it will probably satisfy. <br><br>Living in Los Angeles - a major city with what is probably one of the most culturally and culinarily diverse, yet grossly underrated (internationally) food scenes - I can&#39;t fathom why one would decide to venture here. If you visit one in a smaller city with limited offerings, it makes sense, but not LA.<br><br>Sure, I&#39;ve never experienced any bad service, and I guess that bloated menu will cater to any unadventurous eaters looking for a decent meal, but I&#39;d like to think with a simple Yelp search and some pre-planning you can find better.

Awesome service followed by awesome food and again awesome service! Kids ordered the cheese pizza which was wow and mini corndogs which where awesome. Adults order pot pie, classic burger and crispy chicken something lol all great!

Never disappointed since the menu is so big and variety is good but I ordered a veggie salad and main protein was black beans but my entire salad had like no black beans and I had to ask for more and it took forever to get until I was ready to leave and asked for it to go... the waiter was very apologetic for it but not really his fault the cooks should add more when making especially since no meat on my salad ...

I made a single order &#34;to go&#34; and was given a 15 min wait time. After 30 mins of waiting I asked the status of my order and the person behind the counter told me someone is going to get my order. She didn&#39;t even look at my receipt to know what my order was. Once i spoke with the manager. She wasn&#39;t to apologetic for my situation. She came back a few mins later with my order and asked if i needed anything else. She didn&#39;t try to make my inconvenience better. I asked for ranch instead of honey mustard with my order and guess what I found when I opened my order..... honey mustard. Sad to say I&#39;m a fan of Cheesecake Factory but the lack of customer service or care has turned me off to this location. By the time I got to eat I wasn&#39;t even hungry due to my saddening experience. Smh

So, to stat out with, I&#39;m a big fan of the Cheesecake Factory. I&#39;ve had great meals / experiences, but this was not one of them.<br><br>Two problems, and how management handled them are at issue here.<br><br>First, my family I were taken by the host to be seated, only to find that the table was not ready. No biggie, except the restaurant was very crowded and we were asked to wait at an awkward drink station in the middle of the room, with servers rushing all around us while we waited.<br><br>Well, after about four or five minutes, they finally get the table cleared. As we&#39;re being led back by the host to the table, the manager steps in and seats another couple. Our host tried to explain that we&#39;d been on our way to being seated for the past six or seven minutes, but this manager refused to here it. Instead, he yelled at a bus boy to quickly clear another table for us.<br><br>Now the manager didn&#39;t acknowledge us. He could have apologized of the inconvenience, but he didn&#39;t. We were led to another spot to stand, this time by the bathrooms.<br><br>Here&#39;s were the first problem intersects the second. As we&#39;re waiting outside the bathrooms, in an awkward placement that basically puts us in front of another family table, we begin to smell something AWFUL. My wife looks down, and sees that the floor is covered in feces. And the trail of sh*t leads back to the men&#39;s bathroom.<br><br>So someone lets the servers know, and they get a guy to come and start cleaning the floors. Of course, we&#39;re checking our shoes, trying to dodge around the &#34;brown footprints&#34;, when another server shows up and seats ANOTHER couple at the table we&#39;ve been waiting for - AGAIN!<br><br>At this point, we&#39;ve had our table delayed or given away three times, we&#39;ve been standing in the restaurant over 12 minutes, and there&#39;s sh*t all over our shoes.<br><br>Luckily, our host this time demands we be seated, and we are - right next to the bathrooms.<br><br>Somebody arrived and sprayed air freshener on the floor, so the odor went from poop, to vanilla and poop.<br><br>Look, I&#39;m understanding, and didn&#39;t raise a ruckus though I could have. We ate our meal and left, but I am disappointed in the manner the management treated us. They should have taken us back to the waiting area instead of standing us in various spots. He (the manager who took our first table away) should have apologized instead of ignoring us. They (the staff) should have done a better job cleaning the floors and offering guests near the smell (it wasn&#39;t just us who were suffering) accommodations or the chance to sit somewhere else.<br><br>If any supervisors from the Cheesecake Factory read this, please train your managers and employees to handle these situations better. This will be the final time we visit your Sherman Oaks location.<br><br>edit: Our visit took place on Saturday, March 4th, 2017, around 6pm.

My experience here wasn&#39;t pleasant, my girlfriend and I were excited to come eat here together. We always order our chicken biscuit and share a plate. (Cause honestly who can finish a big plate on their own) anyway... first they ran out of biscuits, but we still ordered it. I asked for more bread, and the waiter OSCAR T. made a comment saying &#34;Too much bread can get you full&#34; that ruined my appetite. That was rude, and unnecessary. I am a PAYING CUSTOMER. So if I wanted 3 rounds of bread, that shouldn&#39;t matter to him. I felt personally attacked about my weight. Also he hasn&#39;t given us refills. Then when I ordered my cheesecake, my girlfriend had asked for the check. Until that moment, he didn&#39;t acknowledge her. When the cheesecake arrived, he placed it in front of her instead of myself. We left really upset, and disappointed with the service and the food.
I don&#39;t know why take out from here takes soo long. Plus all the staff seem angry every time we come in  maybe they don&#39;t pay them enough

I don&#39;t know why this Cheesecake Factory has 3.5 stars, because out of the all the ones I have been to in Los Angeles, which include Pasadena, Woodland Hills, Marina del Rey, and Beverly Hills this location is the best. <br><br>The food is always amazing, and they give you huge portions for what you pay for.
