My favorites here are: Crab Wontons, Macaroni and Cheese Balls, Chinese Chicken Salad, Chicken Madeira, and my all time favorite is the Chicken Costoletta. I&#39;ve also had the breakfast dishes as well and they were really good. <br><br>Favorite Cheesecakes: Strawberry, Dulce de Leche, Pineapple Upside Down, and I just tried the Salted Caramel cheesecake and it was delicious! If you don&#39;t like it too rich I wouldn&#39;t recommend it.<br><br>The service here majority of the time is amazing. Last night my family went out for my parent&#39;s anniversary dinner and the waiter we got was amazing, his name was Joseph G., so if you happen to get him you&#39;re in good hands. If you come during a busy time or on weeknight or on the weekend, there might be a possibility of getting bad service because of how crazy it is, but I think 99% of the time I come here I always get amazing, if not exceptional service. If you&#39;re in a small party of 2-4 people and don&#39;t want to wait, I&#39;d recommend looking for a seat in the bar area, you might be able to snag something if it&#39;s not too busy and they serve everything the restaurant serves. <br><br>My recommendations for people who come here is to get here at least by 5pm, or before especially on a Friday, or a weekend. This location does get busy and you could be waiting 45+ minutes or more. They do not take reservations. The walk from the parking lot is about 5 minutes, or so. Also, Cheesecake factory validates parking for 2 hours, if you&#39;re planning to go to see a movie at the Arclight later, I would validate there since the theater validates for 4 hours.
I am a fan; however, I&#39;ve recently started feeling like the cake and cheesecake portions have gotten considerably smaller.  Anyone else?

It hurts to write a less than stellar review because I LOVE the Cheesecake Factory, however this restaurant is not up to the standards all the others I&#39;ve dined at are. <br><br>Every time I use the ladies room I regret not going before getting to restaurant. It seems that no one attends to it; there is more toilet paper on the floors than on the holders they belong in. The same goes for the paper towels. Usually the trash is so full that the floor and counters are coated with used papers. It amazes me how messy women can be-my boyfriend said the men&#39;s room is not nearly this bad!! Hopefully this will draw attention to the lack of cleanliness.<br><br>The food is amazing-most times. Twice I have left unsatisfied and both times have been here. One time was a Cobb salad, which seems hard to mess up... I asked for no tomato so they seemed to overcompensate with eggs, the chicken and avocado both had right portions, but under the eggs I went on a scavenger hunt for a few bits of bacon, and even less blue cheese. It was end of the night so I think I got what scraps were left.<br><br>The worst experience, however was when my entree didn&#39;t arrive until my boyfriend had finished his. We ordered an appetizer, and when it arrived placed our entree order. The appetizer came out without the dressing we asked for, and our server seemed annoyed she had to make another trip. Boyfriend got Jambalaya and I went with my favorite-the Chicken Madeira with no mushrooms. Someone different brought the entrees and my plate had mushrooms. I politely mentioned that I told our server no mushrooms and this server took it back. About 6-8 minutes later I convinced my boyfriend to eat so his doesn&#39;t get cold. Our server returned to try and correct me by saying I told her no onions-yes, she came to tell me I had said no onions on a meal that doesn&#39;t have onions. Pretty appalling she felt the need to argue with a customer (and she was not just unprofessional, also wrong).  My boyfriend finished every last bite before my entree arrived (in the hands of someone else mind you). I asked for a to go box and the manager. He seemed a little embarrassed and apologized for the mishap as well as the unprofessional comments from server. Not the most pleasant experience...<br><br>Most recent time was a delivery, and was missing bread and cheesecake. Not the end of the world about the bread (although we did request it) but we paid for the cake. The manager was cold when I asked for a solution. I wasn&#39;t trying to get anything free, I just wanted what I paid for to be fixed!<br><br>Go to the Woodland Hills location-you will not be disappointed!! Giving 2 stars because the other locations all have great standards.

Let me start by saying this is my 3rd fav restaurant this review is based on this location<br>In a nut shell the server was just to large for the outside patio space as a result he keep bumping my table every single time he passed by. Once i understood there was no earthquake i moved my belongings and the table as far over out the way as i could this guy still manages the waste the melted butter onto a laptop keys i had just purchased the night before see this was a business lunch that was now ruined by the careless staff. And ontop of that he shared what he had done with another female staff and they thought it was harlarious when i was  confronted by management yup u read it (confronted) it was hostile Even though i had not yet pressed one key ohhh except to try and remove butter.  I was told i could go get it repaired but they will not be replacing it WTF???<br>SHAME ON YOU CHEESECAKE FACTORY
Oscar was our server for lunch. He was simply amazing! Best service I&#39;ve ever had at this location hands downs!

Food was fantastic as usual at this location, however another usual is the slow service. <br><br>We only ordered two salads and we waited nearly 40 minutes, we literally went through 4 baskets of bread we were so hungry lol!  Salads are giant as they are at all Cheescake Fatory locations, they&#39;re piled like 7 inches above the top of the bowl so they&#39;re definitely a large entree by themselves or generous serving of appetizer salad for two. <br><br>I usually order the BBQ salad or the Chinese chicken salad. Both are among the best and most flavorful salads I&#39;ve ever had.
Disappointed in their food. Used to be better . Quality has definitely gone down. Service was decent

Would give less than one star if I could!  Had lunch for 4 people and bill came to $104+$20 tip.  Noticed that waitress charged for a refill of cranberry juice.  My boneless lemon chicken was very dry but I didn&#39;t have time to return it.   Then we gave them the parking validation ticket and when we went to leave they said it wasn&#39;t validated and we needed to pay $3.  I didn&#39;t have a problem with the cost of the meal at all, but when they nickel and dime you on little things it&#39;s very irritating.  I called the manager, Richard, and he said his servers are not supposed to mention there is a charge for refills on juices or milk.  What???  Then he said the validation was not his problem.  I asked him to email me a copy of my receipt and he was so rude when he didn&#39;t hear my email address.  I repeated it 3 times and then he hung up on me.  He was the rudest person ever and never emailed me the receipt.  I already wrote to the corporate office about Richard and we will never be back to that location because of him! Oh my gosh I just checked my credit card statement and was charged an additional $100.47 on my credit card. I have been trying to reach a general manager at the restaurant for 2 days with no luck.  I am calling the corporate office now.

This branch is always solid with food and service. Rigatoni with sausage and shrimp had a nice spicy taste . Pork chop dinner was a good value with some solid sides. Service was excellent and we had a gift card..cant beat that! Good job CF!

Not changing my rating just yet, but wanted to share that after sending my Yelp review to the corporate offices, I was contacted in a timely manner by the General Manager of the Sherman Oaks restaurant.  He did what the manager at the time should have done and validate  my feelings.  He was extremely apologetic and offered me a gift card to come back (or any other Cheesecake Factory... which I intend to do) and try them again.  Along with the gift card he included a personal letter and that made me feel good that they understand the importance of customers.  <br><br>Good job on the follow up.  I will update my star rating when I can get back to that establishment.  Thanks.  :)
Just bad all the way from the hostesses to plain customer service 101. Not a good place to come and spend money here. You might as well go to jack and a box.

My first time ever giving a negative review.  I was going to complain about the manager on duty this evening but it dawned on me that his attitude must be that of the Cheesecake Factory. If he worked for me he would have been fired. But his negative interaction with customers must be acceptable to this Cheesecake Factory. We were a part of 10, place was close to empty.  Now there are 10 people able to share our experience. This should generate at least 200 people hearing about going anywhere else but Sherman Oaks Cheesecake Factory.
Hands down the best happy hour in the valley! Reasonably priced, large portions, and a nice huge bar with friendly bartenders. A great place to go before or  after a movie.
Great customer service , very friendly! They came to check up if everything was okay. Food was amazing! I&#39;ll make sure I have my monthly visits here.

Our server Lindsay was hilarious. Love her will definitely be back because of her. We had a high maintenance person in our party and she put up with him and made the dinner fun. Thanks again we will be back to see her next June 13th!

I went to the Cheesecake Factory this afternoon with my boyfriend and our server Alex was the best!  He was very friendly and had a good conversation about New Orleans and Thibodeaux, LA. He was attentive and took note of things with out us even asking.  We love the brown bread and he noticed that and brought more, and when our meals were taking a long time to come out with out us saying anything he told the manager who in turn compensated us with free cheesecake.   Awesome service! Awesome food!<br>Thank you Alex!<br>Who Dat! <br>Go Saints!

This location is hit and miss. Today, although I ordered the Thai Glazed Salmon cooked medium, It was so well done and crispy that I needed to dip it in extra sauce on the side just to be able to eat it. Had the server stopped by to find out how our food was, I would have asked her for another one. I love The Cheesecake Factory; however, the food and service definitely missed the mark today.

The bartender is a complete jerk. Someone bumped into me and spilled their drink last night who was a &#34;REGULAR&#34; and drunk but the main bartender...  Short brown hair...  Took his side and blamed it on me. I&#39;ve seen the guy make questionable calls in the past but this one was next level. Food came out extremely cold right before this. Not a fan unless they make some changes

First, this location is definitely better than the one at Topanga. The food is always better, but is still sometimes hit or miss. Tonight was an off night for them, but our service was impeccable. Alex was our waiter and he did such an amazing job. We ordered the beet and goat cheese salad and received a plate of water cress and arugula stems. When Alex noticed, he of course offered us something else and tried to make the moment right. Without our knowledge, he let the manager know and she came to our table to personally apologize and comp the dish. Alex brought us our entree and continued to check on us and making wonderful conversation. He was welcoming, personable, and generous. Loved him and would come back just to see him again!

The wait time is ok, the way they make you wait has 2 phases, phase one, is when you check in and they give you a buzzer and tell you the wait time, which was 15 mins for us. When the buzzer went off, they made us wait in the corner, again! For another 15-20 mins. Ridiculous! If they told us that the air time was 45 mins, we could have just left ! Never again would I believe their wait time .

I could have easily gone to The Cheesecake Factory in Glendale, but I&#39;ve always liked this one better... I like that I can easily park in valet, take the escalator up and there&#39;s the factory. We came on a crowded Saturday afternoon, but our wait wasn&#39;t as nearly long as I thought, the max was about 25 minutes. We where seated and quickly greeted by our server who was very attentive. As I looked over the menu everything sounded delicious and I finally decided on the angle hair pasta with shrimp sans garlic. It was a very nice portion that I couldn&#39;t even finish it but when our server asked to take my plate there was some miscommunication that I wanted to take it home and instead it was tossed... We looked over the dessert menu of course and we opted to take home two slices, one classic and one Reese&#39;s peanut butter cup ( both sooo good) for our dessert there, I had a cafe mocha which was served in a glass cup which I wasn&#39;t use too and I had a few sips of a banana peach smoothie like drink.... Okay when the bill came I was whoa.. close to $80.00 but I had a $45.00 gift card so that helped the wallet alittle.. the food is good and it was a very enjoyable evening but $80.00 not including tip and no alcoholic beverages consumed is not worth it to me. <br><br>I think for the most part when we come back  it will be strictly for an evening snack of coffee and dessert.

UPDATE: the french fries were cold by the time I got to my car and the toothpicks were not put in far enough to hold the sandwich together, so it&#39;s all over the box. Very disappointed. <br><br>Seems like a great restaurant but the woman taking to-go orders was very rude and unfriendly. When I approached her to ask about the status of my order (since she gave me no number/pager and didn&#39;t ask my name), she just shook her head at me and said &#34;Nope. No. No.&#34;<br><br>While waiting, I witnessed her being rude to several other customers as well. Bummer. <br><br>*No reflection on the food...because I&#39;m still waiting for my order.

The food is what everyone knows. Same old same old. But it is about the host who did not ask us where we would like to seat (inside or outside) when she asked to all other people. And she sat us to the very corner of the restaurant...well at least our server was nice and food is good I still give 2 more stars. Otherwise it would have been just 1. :(

Only restaurant chain that I know that has a menu the size of a book with so much selection and variety of food.  Everything is so epically delicious from appetizers to entree and of course dessert.  Prices are reasonable and good portions.<br><br>Nice location cause its located in the Sherman Oaks Galleria which has plenty of parking, next to Arclight theatre and shops.<br><br>I like to come here on weekdays for their happy hour. Great deals on appetizers and mixed drinks for $5.  Also, it&#39;s not as crowded like weekends and we usually get a table within 10-15 minutes.  Good service.<br><br>If you never been to cheesecake and wanted to try something out, but weren&#39;t sure. Here are some my favorites dishes that I&#39;ve ordered in the past. Incredibly good and recommend:<br><br>Appetizers:<br>Thai lettuce wraps<br>Spicy ahi tempura rolls<br>Avocado egg rolls<br><br>Salads:<br>Chinese Chicken Salad<br>BBQ Ranch Chicken<br><br>Entree:<br>Bistro Shrimp pasta<br>Miso Salmon<br>Cajun Jambalaya pasta<br>Chicken Bellagio<br><br>Dessert:<br>Red velvet cheesecake - a must!!<br>Pineapple upside down - cheesecake - awesome!<br>Oreo Cheesecake - new obsession<br><br>Chicken and biscuit - no longer on the menu <br><br>Make sure to take home leftovers. Alway delicious the next day.

This review is purely for the take out section. I arrived at this location before the doors opened at 11:30 to place my take-out order. One person ordered before me. I ordered my salad and they told me it would take 12 to 15 minutes. I paid and sat down. 30 minutes later, the person who ordered his salad right before me had already been given his food and left, the 10 or so people who came in with phone orders were given their food and sent away, even though their orders were clearly large and complicated.  I stood up to see if maybe I missed something when the girl behind the counter said to me &#34;yours isn&#39;t ready yet&#34;. I sat back down and watched as more people came in and got bags and bags of food. Finally, a full 40 minutes after I had ordered, I stood up again and the girl at the counter asked a different girl if there was a Chinese chicken salad ready. She looked out a bag on the counter and said yes, and they gave me my food. I asked what time Phone order start getting taken, because I thought next time I should just call it in since clearly they prioritize phone orders. She was clearly aggravated when she told me &#34;no food orders go in before 1130&#34;.<br><br>If that&#39;s the case, I do not understand why my order took so long, I do not understand why the attitude towards me was hostile rather than apologetic when I waited almost three times as long as the estimate was on how long my food would take.  I get that it&#39;s a very busy time of day, but I didn&#39;t order anything complicated, and I wasn&#39;t rude at any point, despite having to wait for so long. The least they could have done was apologize for the long wait.<br><br>My advice is never place a to go order inside the restaurant. Even if you have to stand outside and call it in, you&#39;ll be better off than doing it at the counter. And don&#39;t bother to tip them.<br><br>Edit: Took the salad to my (not picky) 97 year old grandma for our weekly lunch and without me even saying anything about how disappointed I was in the service she started complaining about her salad. It looked like something from Applebees.  No color, bland, barely any chicken, all iceberg lettuce, few mandarins, few &#34;crunchies&#34;. It was the dinner portion but it looked like nothing. What the heck did I do to piss someone off???

Get it together. We ordered desserts through doordash. Last time we ordered the sundae, they forgot the ice cream. THE ICE CREAM, PEOPLE. This time we ordered the sundae, instead of their &#34;famous hot fudge&#34; that justifies paying that much money for a sundae, it came with a gross side of Hershey&#39;s syrup instead. I called and spoke with the manager and he basically just said &#34;oh gosh, sorry.&#34; I work in the restaurant industry. The cheesecake factory has an entire staff dedicated to to go orders. No excuse.

I went in on Saturday for my birthday. We were a group of 8 people so our wait time was 1 Hour. The reason they don&#39;t get 5 stars is because of the wait time and the amount of time to bring out the food. Arrived at 7:45 and left at 10 <a href="/redir?url=http%3A%2F%2Fpm.it&amp;s=6043da99fd2419604e459775ff2ae95261518c757e6a4e5ea57d56b4c717db15" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">pm.it</a> was also upsetting they did not have my favorite dish on the menu anymore... Bring back the Eggplant Parmesan!!!!!!

If I can give this place a 0 I would. This is my first time ever trying Cheesecake Factory and I will never come back due to the service and food. The pasta was hard my husband fish and chip fish was good but fries where soooooooo bad they twist like they have been sitting for hours! I don&#39;t complain I don&#39;t even do a lot of review but for this I will post one. We asked for the bread and he said its in the oven it will be right out. 15min later no server so I called him over and asked if the bread out of the oven. Why???? Should I have to ask. I will never come back again.

I called ahead for cheesecake and ice cream. I was told it would take 25 minutes. Then I was told it will actually be done sooner but she has to quote 25 minutes. I then ask how soon? She says 25 minutes. I say okay so if I come in 25 minutes I won&#39;t wait and my ice cream will not be melted? She says I&#39;m quoting you. Then hung up. Needless to say I went next door to wholefoods for cheesecake and ice cream. Don&#39;t call ahead. The order takers are not trained. Horrible customer service.

I usually eat at cheesecake a few times a week, Since I work across the street. Today will be the last time. I always order for pick up and the usual girl in the bakery is amazing. Today I get JP apparently he is the manager? Really this guy? Not that competent. I show to get my food the girls in the bakery are scratching there heads they do not know anything about my order..  they go to the manager who took my order... I then have to wait 10 minutes while the guy transfers my check to the bakery and then something was wrong with my food she had to get new fries... seriously get it together. I will be taking a break from the cheesecake.
My Pasta   was ok but the service was horrible we have to wait 15 minutes for Coke refill

Food was fine, service was slow and inattentive. Considering the price, I expected better. Feels like a chain past their prime and in decline. <br><br>Cheesecake for dessert was still great. <br><br>For the money, there are much better choices in this city.

Be prepared to wait 30-40 min on the weekend we went at 7 ! Food was awesome as always and cheesecake is a must!! The galleria shopping area is very nice to browse while you are waiting and movie theater was awesome right next door !

I was really disappointed about the service/food at the Cheesecake Factory. First of all you cannot reserve a table by phone. This is just stupid! You need to wait 40 minutes on a Friday night to get a table. <br>The service was terrible, they sent me twice the wrong pastas. The manager came to apologize and we got 50% off. I don&#39;t think i will ever come back there. Sorry....

Now I know why I shouldn&#39;t eat here or don&#39;t eat here as often as I did when I was in high school and college. <br><br>Horrible service. <br><br>Not once did our server check on us or refill our drinks. I&#39;m not coming back again. <br><br>I watched him serve three tables beside us, check up on them and completely ignored us. <br><br>Discrimination maybe? <br><br>Our server tonight, Dylan, probably thinks that Asians are bad tippers because he obviously didn&#39;t to refill our drinks. I watched him go to the tables near ours several times to check on them.<br><br>This is the first time ever that I didn&#39;t leave a tip for bad service and it feels good to finally not reward this kind of behavior.  <br><br>Why leave a tip when you&#39;re unhappy?

The Cheesecake Factory is very hit or miss. There are a few items on the menu that I&#39;ve tried and actually really enjoyed, but a lot more that wasn&#39;t so great. Their menu is HUUUUUGE so I&#39;m always tempted to try something different; and they never really hit it out of the ball park for me.. except for a couple items.<br><br>The Good Stuff: The ahi tartare is my favorite. They just do it so right w/ delicious tuna, fresh avocado and the crispy wontons. The spicy crispy chicken sandwich is also surprisingly good, as are their flatbreads.<br><br>The Meh: So they&#39;re supposed to be known for their fried mac and cheese balls.. and I love my mac... but these are awful! Way too fried and nasty and greasy. Just gross. Their pastas are okay and same with the pizza... but if you want pasta or pizza, I would definitely go somewhere else. <br><br>This is a good place to meet friends because the menu is so freaking large, you&#39;re both bound to be satisfied with something. And of course, the portions are huge too.

The wife and I and a couple of friends went to see the Avengers (Awesome flick by the way), and had to get some grub before hand. Its been awhile since we have been been to this location so we decided on this place. <br><br>I love the menu options they have. The have a SkinnyLicious menu, that has a wide range of options ranging from Santorini Farro Salad, Beets With Goat Cheese,Endive Salad,Arugula Salad,Little House Salad, to a Skinnylicious Pasta. I went to their Glamburger &amp; Sandwiches options. I decided on their Smokehouse B.B.Q. Burger which is Smoked Bacon and Melted Cheddar with Crispy Onion Rings and B.B.Q. Ranch Sauce.  This is a filler. The portion sizes are huge, and you will definitely leave full. For drink,  I had to wash it down with a blue moon. <br><br>The service was great. Natasha did a great job taking care of us. <br><br>Parking is in the garage below, just redeem if your seeing a movie at the Arc Light.

So this is a very nice location for dinner but the good is what counts. Well it could have been better. The service was pretty good but the salmon was under cooked and the salads were soggy  and wet.  Wouldn&#39;t recommend it.

What can I say. Cheesecake Factory is always a sure thing. I&#39;ve been to lots of &#39;em. Great choice if you&#39;re going with a group of people because they offer so many different kinds of food...and it&#39;s all good.<br><br>The only thing about this location is the parking is kinda&#39; lame. It&#39;s a long walk from the parking garage to the restaurant. They are exact opposite ends. It&#39;s a brisk 5-10 minute walk to get there from the parking garage, I&#39;d guess it&#39;s close to 1/4 mile from the lot to the restaurant if you&#39;re near the back of the  parking garage.  I can&#39;t stand this parking garage. The spaces are super narrow. I guess they figure everyone is driving a golf cart or a clown car. <br><br>That&#39;s not the Cheesecake Factory&#39;s fault though. They validate 2 hours of parking. I missed it by 5 minutes and had to pay $1.
You guys need friendlier hostesses. The ones checking in people are awkward and rude!

Steven the manager is very rude!!  There are 5 empty tables and the workers are just standing around... I tell him we are waiting as well as others while there are empty tables and he tells me we were quoted 25 minutes and its only been 15... So why should the patrons wait when their is no need for it??!!?? Steven tells me that we need to wait because its first come first serve and that&#39;s how a restaurant works and there are other people waiting to be sat. <br>WTF?? The other manager Joey is a nice guy.
place couldn&#39;t handle a standard Monday night crowd. been waiting 30 min just to have water served. I&#39;m still waiting for make my order as of this post

The gap between when our order was taken and when the food arrived to our table was 57 minutes. They brought us wrong food. Our steak plate had only 2 pieces of dry nasty steak.our server did not show up to our table for an hour. Horrible experience

I came in to eat here with my family on Mother&#39;s Day. I knew the wait was going to be long. I still wanted to eat here. Jessica was our waitress . She was very nice and attentive. The food was delicious . I ordered the miso salmonmy favorite! The only bad part of my experience was the bathroom . It was really messy with trash all over. I think someone is suppose to be doing bathroom checks at least every 30 minutes. Other than that it was a great choice of place to eat .

This is a review of a specific dish at the Cheesecake Factory, not a review of the restaurant. <br><br>On a recent visit, my dining companion and I both ordered Shrimp with Angel Hair Pasta. The menu description is &#34;Large Shrimp Sauteed with Tomatoes, Lemon, Garlic, Herbs and Fresh Basil on Top of Angel Hair Pasta with a Touch of Marinara Sauce&#34;<br><br>Overall impression: lacking in flavor...we both thought the dish needed something to make it tastier..the server offered Parmesan cheese which helped a little, but the dish was just under flavored. Perhaps not enough garlic, basil and lemon. <br><br>The dish was basically a lot of fresh tomatoes with some shrimp and angel hair There were four or five medium to large sized shrimp on the dish.. However, they were a little tough and lacking in a lot of flavor. Frozen? perhaps...I&#39;m surprised given the volume of shrimp served at the Cheesecake Factory. <br><br>I would have to say that my rating for this dish barely gets to average. My advice is to pick something else unless you are really looking for a bland dish heavy on tomatoes. <br><br>In comparison, bang-bang chicken and shrimp, one of my favorite dishes on the menu is bursting with flavor and rates very high in my book. (Order it with angel hair instead of rice).<br><br>(The 2 star rating accompanying this review applies specifically to the Shrimp with Angel Hair dish.)
The baddest  place to eat. I bought cheesecake and I tried it and it was old I make cheesecake and it is amazing . I had a burger and they forgot the cheese and it was not so good .

The food is great here. There are so many choices and that&#39;s what I love about this place. <br><br>One problem is that this location gets absolutely packed for dinner. So, it&#39;s a good idea to eat here a little earlier. <br><br>Service is hit and miss, and that&#39;s why I don&#39;t drop a 5 star rating on this place. The last time we ate here before a movie and gave ourselves almost an hour and a half to get in and out. Service was really slow, took a long time to get drinks, and our waitress disappeared like Houdini. Very frustrating. So, we skipped the appetizers and gobbled down the grub. We almost didn&#39;t get out in time. <br><br>Overall, a quality joint. 4 stars.
The avocado rolls are one of the best I&#39;ve ever tasted in my life. Main dishes are good but nothing out of this world. The restaurant is clean and the staff is friendly.

What can you say, Cheesecake is the ultimate corporate restaurant. Top of the food chain. Haters will say what they want but it&#39;s still the best food and service out there. I think I&#39;ve tried almost everything on the menu and never have had a bad experience. I&#39;m the type of guy that feels that the more you pay for something, the more you should expect from the establishment that is charging you! Cheesecake always delivers a top rated experience for me and my family. There were three of us and the bill came out to about $65 which I gladly paid because it made me and my family happy to be there. If they&#39;re happy, I&#39;m happy!

Came in last night to get some food to go and got it quickly.  The bakery staff seemed a bit scattered but Emily the cashier was very sweet and got my order herself from the back, I felt like a VIP!  My costaletta was great as always.  Sometimes the sherman location is too crowded but I lucked out this time around.  Desserts still the best!

Just got out of there and I just couldn&#39;t let it slide, but horrible service.<br><br>The food was good but how the meal took over 2 hours was just ridiculous.<br><br>We had to constantly ask over and over for refills of water, bread, etc.<br><br>Don&#39;t know what was going on and maybe it wasn&#39;t all the server&#39;s fault.<br><br>If mgmt actually cares, here&#39;s a pic of the receipt to prove I&#39;m not just some hater with a fake review.
I&#39;ve come to this place 3 times already &amp; the restaurant is always clean.<br>The servers are pretty friendly.<br>The food was great as well.

This rating is on food. Their food is good. Normally I do order the Jambalaya, which comes with brown or white rice. This plate is huge, very hearty. Ask for extra bread for your Jambalaya.<br><br>Gumbo: hearty as well. A bit tangy.<br>Fettucini w/ or w/o chicken is great. Large serving size worth it&#39;s price. <br><br>Ambience is ok. Very crowded, very noisy at times. Wait time can range anywhere from 30mins to an hour. <br><br>If in large group expect to be seated outside.

Great location! Went recently for dessert and drinks. The service was fast and friendly. We realized a couple days later that there had been a mistake with our bill. The manager was extremely helpful and got it all sorted within minutes. Great staff!

This restaurant is unsanitary.  They always place the silverware directly on the table and they reuse one rag to wipe all the tables with.  When I asked the manager for wrapped silverware she sent me to the to go cashier who only had plastic dinnerware.  So my friend had the worst birthday ever eating her birthday cake with a plastic fork! This place is filthy and should be shut down for health code violations!!! One star!!!! :(
Brenna is amazing! Not only was my pick up on time but she remembered us! We had an issue with our order and when I called she made sure to fix everything! Great customer service!!

I came into this location, with some friends who were from out of town visiting from San Francisco. A party of 13 total. And they made us wait 2 hours and 45 mins for a table. It was unacceptable and we are never going back to that location.

Holy portion control, this place gives you so much food. Their menu can&#39;t really be beat, it&#39;s so extensive that there is always something for everyone. Always make sure to either same room, or get a piece of dessert to go. The key lime cheesecake is my all time favorite.

&#34;You burned your last friend here, lady&#34;<br>So it&#39;s Mother&#39;s Day and I thought &#34;hey! Let&#39;s take my mom for brunch&#34; worst decision ever. <br><br>I didn&#39;t know racism still existed this heavily at a restaurant that employees all races, sexes, and creeds. Guess that doesn&#39;t apply to how the people coming there are treated. <br><br>If I wanted to be served cold chicken, cold eggs, cold omelette, I would have gone to Marie Calenders or some sht. <br>And the waitress.(it was 1:45 pm shift outside patio, front patio- think her name was Lauren, she had long brunette hair and she was short 5&#39;6) comes over and is so disrespectful and condescending to my mother when she told her that she wasn&#39;t happy with the temperature of her food. She acted as if my mother was lying to her.... She didn&#39;t touch the food at all. We don&#39;t need to dine and dash lady. We have money. She made my mom feel like crap,  on Mother&#39;s Day. I asked for the manager. And the manager was pissed. Number one the waitress said &#34;we can just take it back and hear it right on up for you again&#34; that&#39;s against health code. You cannot/should not reheat eggs like that. Or raw chicken. I&#39;m sure it was raw cause it was cold. Worst. Experience. Ever. <br>Not only did this waitress become super condescending at the end, she tells another (black) waiter to come and I guess &#34;&#34;deal&#34;&#34; with us. What a way to ruin Mother&#39;s Day. The manager did the right thing and comped the meals that we didn&#39;t touch. They took them back after they touched it and it was ICE COLD. I wasn&#39;t paying for that crap. <br><br>I will never go back to this place. Plus note, we had a wonderful dinner at a BETTER non-racist restaurant. <br>Green apple China bistro. Much better. Their food was ACTUALLY HOT!! Lmao.

I&#39;d like to start this review off by saying that couples do fight at cheesecake. Now on to the review portion. I entered the Cheesecake Factory Sherman oaks location with extreme hopes of having my taste buds satisfied by their world renowned cheesecake, instead my expectations were exceeded beyond belief. My server Jacque was the sweetest and most helpful server. It is evident that she is a hard worker and truly makes an effort to make her guests comfortable.<br><br>I will be coming back. No doubt

My family and I go here every year to celebrate my birthday (a week or so after the day) which happened to fall on Fourth of July weekend this year.  Boy was it PACKED!  Our wait time was 40 minutes on Saturday evening.  Luckily, we perused the cheesecake selection, ordered a cocktail from the bar and took selfies by the outdoor fountain lol.<br><br>The salmon is farm raised but delicious, nonetheless!<br><br>The crab and artichoke appetizer is a must try!<br><br>We ordered 3-4 appetizers, and 3-4 plates.  I could not finish (or even start!) my meal.  STUFFED with delicious apps!
Great clean location with plenty of parking for cars <br>Or bikes.Great food and service.<br>Close to other stores.<br>One of our family favorite restaurants

Use to love Cheesecake Factory but had the worst experience and customer service here . My friends and I ordered the chicken tostada salad and it came out very bitter and sour and barely any chicken. We complained and switched to another dish instead and the wait time was ridiculous . Took forever we were about to walk out and when the food came it was just average nothing great and an expensive bill for poor quality food . The waitress did not apologize for our awful salads we received or the long wait Time . Not returning to this place only for the cheesecake to go .

We had great service, bread was stale (how hard is it to serve fresh bread?!) I ordered miso salmon- delicious! My boyfriend had the Ribeye steak requested it medium- got it cold and medium well... we didn&#39;t complain because we had a movie to catch... drinks were good!

The best restaurant.<br>The only problem you need to wait sometimes at the weekend a hour to sit.<br>The food is amazing and coming in big size.<br>The cakes also yummy.<br>It&#39;s great to go there for lunch or with family or on a date.

there is a running joke in my family that every time we get together for a celebration meal...i come back here and talk crap about the place.<br><br>well family - im sorry! i wish it would stop happening. i dont go out of my way to write less-than-stellar reviews. its been a disappointing coincidence :/<br><br>mediocre with a splash of insult pretty much sums it up. and maybe that should be the descriptor for most chain restaurants, to be honest, and expected. but with the cheesecake factory especially, ive continued to regret eating their non-dessert concoctions.<br><br>part of me realizes it was a bit silly to go and order a salad. but hey, specialty salads can be good! they have this delightful &#34;skinnylicious&#34; menu boasting low calories and a light meal was all i wanted. the tortilla chicken salad sounded perfect (especially since i--a simpliton---made a pretty bangin&#39; version).<br><br>hello giant pile of lettuce! hello sad 3 pieces of chicken hidden way below pile of lettuce (im not even lying...look at the pic of how ginormous it is with absolutely no substance). sad, flavorless, unappealing. and charged something like $12. quite possibly the worst and most insulting salad ive ever consumed. had potential if they hadnt cheaped out on the main ingredients. HEY HEARS A THOUGHT: instead of making the size absolutely ridiculously big with filler lettuce - make it NORMAL with a few more pieces of chicken. and while we are at it - take 2 bucks of the price to make it actually appropriate. because the price tag is inflated right along with the cheap iceburg lettuce. <br><br>oh but great play indeed finding the most effective way to profit off your menu items - in true chain restaurant form. im guessing this cost *maybe* $2 in ingredients since its made up of iceburg (the cheapest lettuce with zero nutrients) and tortilla strips.<br><br>come for the cheesecake, stay for the cheesecake. nothing else.

Been to Cheesecake Factory a few times and this past time was the best so far. It was a Monday afternoon so it wasn&#39;t crowded, only waited a couple minutes to be seated. Service was excellent! Our waitress was Angela and she was awesome! It takes me forever to decide what I want to eat and she was so patient and friendly. Their food is a bit pricey but worth it! The portions are huge! Enough to take home and save for later. The food is also super delicious!
I&#39;ve been coming to this Cheesecake Factory for years now; and it&#39;s customer service has gone from 10 to 0! It&#39;s unfortunate !

For some reason I used to think that Cheesecake Factory was something like Baskin Robbins LOL I was very surprised when I found out that they actually serve alcohol. Very nice place, will probably be one of my favorites now! Ice-cream servings are HUGE and very delicious)) <br>They validate 2 hours parking in the structure. Our server was super-nice even though he was very busy. Highly recommend this restaurant!

I&#39;ve been to this cheesecake at all hours of the day. Over all service is decent, food is good and prices are okay. I would never recommend to come here starving, you almost at all hours of the day have to wait anywhere from 10-45 minutes easy. Then you are seated and there goes another 10-25 minutes for waiting for food.<br><br>Breakfasts: Breakfasts are usually better then the dinner courses because they have to cook everything and most  breakfasts require eggs, fruit, and bread you can&#39;t go wrong with that.  <br><br>Lunch&#39;s: If you get a salad you usually can&#39;t go wrong, their salads are huge and taste fresh enough.<br><br>Dinner: Now dinner&#39;s I have had more bad dinners because of waiting time to eating food you can tell that it had been previously frozen then deep fried (more appetizer I&#39;ve experienced). I feel I&#39;m always hesitant to order pasta dishes or appetizers. I will say however their burger are very good.  <br><br>Bar: Drinking at the bar is fine, it&#39;s your typical bar but you can order food. <br><br>You also have about 2-3 other larger restaurants in this same plaza--sometimes its just worth going to the others and not battling the lines.

Very detailed decor. That&#39;s the first thing I notice when I walk into a Cheesecake Factory restaurant. It always catches my eye upon arrival. Considering that I have frequented this location more than two handful of times.<br><br>The food here is made to par. I have never had any bad plates brought to me. Presentation is great. Everything is always cooked to order and packed with flavor. <br><br>Normally when I come here, I always order the Miso Salmon. I have tried other entrees but this is my absolute favorite. The mash potatoes they accompany the salmon with is always creamy and smooth. The asparagus always melt in your mouth with just the right amount of crisp.<br><br>Of course you can&#39;t forget about the infamous cheesecake here. It&#39;s the main part of their brand. I have never been able to try anything outside of Dulce De Leche. It&#39;s my favorite here.<br><br>Staff members are always busy here. They always greet you with warmth and prompt service.<br><br>The strawberry lemonade is good as well. Like really really good :)<br><br>This location gets pretty busy because it&#39;s inside of the Sherman Oaks Galleria. Remember to get your parking validated. Saves you time and money to ensure you do.<br><br>This Cheesecake Factory is really one of my favorite restaurants to patron. A must try :-)

I haven&#39;t been to Cheesecake Factory much but this one is one of the best.  The staff is always amazing and the food is incredible...the cheesecake speaks for itself.  Had dinner here with some girlfriends and it was great to catch up, laugh, have some great food and even better conversation. It is spacious and there is great outdoor seating as well. They validate your parking tickets so it was great to not feel rushed because of parking or seating.<br><br>I had the garlic noodles and a side salad; the salad comes dressed in balsamic vinaigrette.  The pasta was light with asparagus, sun-dried tomatoes and mushrooms.  Didn&#39;t save room for cheesecake this round but the Oreo cheesecake is my favorite!

My boyfriend celebrated his birthday here tuesday evening. We were a group of 8 and got to cheesecake factory around 8pm. We waited for a table about an hour and got seated outside. It was a cold day but the heaters kept us comfortable. The lighting is terrible outside and we couldn&#39;t see out menus at all. We had to use our phones to see. Our server Danny was nice and friendly and greeted us right away. He told us there was no more wheat bread which was terrible news as I love that bread more than life. We all ordered drinks, appetizers and entrees pretty close to each other as it was late and we were hungry but Danny said he would put the appetizers in first so we would get it before our meals. I went to the restroom while waiting to eat. It was easy to find and not far but the water was way too hot! My hands turned red from it. I complained about it and was told that the water was approved by some company or something and that it couldn&#39;t be altered to a cooler temperature. I walked back to my table and noticed all the other tables had wheat bread and I was angry that we were told it was all gone. I found some ready to be served and grabbed it and took it to my table. When Danny later asked me about the bread asking where I got it I told him &#34;I found it.&#34; He laughed it off but didn&#39;t offer me any explanation. Our food arrived shortly after and I complained that we hadn&#39;t gotten our appetizers yet and told Danny to just forget bringing it as we were already served our meals. He told us he was sorry and offered them on the house. We all ate quickly as they were closing around 11 and we were the last ones there. <br>Overall Danny was kind and friendly and apologetic and I don&#39;t blame him at all. I just wish it was a better evening for us. The food was fantastic and the meals were all enjoyed. I hope this location can fix their issues so it&#39;s a more pleasant experience for their customers and guests.

Love the food but the wait is horrific. One star until they decide to respect customers and allow us to make dinner reservations.<br><br>The whole, &#34;Too many people don&#39;t show up for their reservation.&#34; excuse is bogus. If I don&#39;t show up after 15 minutes, I go to the end of the line. If I don&#39;t show up at all or cancel within 15 minutes, you charge my credit card $50. Very simple.<br><br>Haven&#39;t been there in over two years because of this silly policy. Life&#39;s too short.<br><br>Taking my business elsewhere-- AGAIN.

My friend brought me here on April 13 at lunchtime for my birthday. As we walked in we were greeted by the hostess. We asked for a table for two which my friend reserved. They sat us in less than 10 minutes.  They gave us a table that was very small. My friend noticed that there was a bench that was available. We went back to the front to ask if we can take that table. They denied our request stating that the table was for four people.  We asked for a table outside that was bigger but still they denied our request.  We had no choice but to sit down on the small table that was assigned to us.<br><br>The waitress took our drink order. She did not come back for a while. While we were waiting, we noticed that two people were sat on the bench that we requested for. We were wondering why they sat two people there when we were requesting for that in the first place. That is so unfair. Then, our waiter went to their table and took their drink orders and their food orders before us. They were served before us too. My friend called the waitress to ask if we can start ordering that is the only time she took our orders.<br><br>We weren&#39;t done ordering when she walked away and went to another table. At this time my friend and I were already upset.<br><br>I love cheesecake factory. But after this incident I do not want to go back to this restaurant at all. We felt discriminated.

Before I mention why I didn&#39;t have the best time, I will say Marisela our waitress, was great as far as customer service. With that said, the food was average, and to put the cherry on top a roach crawled across the table. When I told Marisela, she quickly removed it with a napkin. I could tell she was embarrassed, she said, &#34;if it helps, I&#39;ve never seen that happen before.&#34; I was embarrassed, for a moment I thought she was insinuating that we had something to do with it, but I&#39;d like to believe she was as embarrassed as we were. The manager came over and offered to seat us somewhere else, but we decided to stay because I didn&#39;t want to cause a commotion after all the place was really busy. We decided to get a desert after the meal, and Marisela, gave it us on the house which I really appreciated. Overall, the two stars are for Marisela, who really tried to make us feel comfortable.

This place was great.  The service was great, food, beverages, and when we asked to be put outside, they adhered to it and gave us a spot next to a patio heater which was nice. You have a great view of the city from the patio. Even though it was busy we were waited on very quickly. I had the Cuban sandwich and it was delicious. My dad had the Chicken Bellagio and I had a taste of it, it was so delicious and tasty. The coffee got a lot of praise from my best friend and it was very good. The restrooms were nice and clean and although it is a high volume restaurant, I&#39;m actually disappointed that they&#39;re not enough stalls. However, the experience and atmosphere was wonderful. Will definitely go again.

I had a great experience at your restaurant. I had a great waitress Christy that was attentive and got everything down pat. I really enjoyed my overall experience there a Cheesecake Factory Sherman Oaks. Then finish off with dessert with a strawberry cheesecake you can&#39;t go wrong with that and it was perfect.

I&#39;ve been here a couple of times with both my parents and my friends. The place is dimly lit and we&#39;ll decorated. The have an incredible amount of cheesecake selections and well as wines and other alcoholic beverages. The food is well made and large portions, honestly I feel the appetizers are more than enough. Haha. The only downside to this place is that you have to pay for parking and it&#39;s always packed. I usually have to wait around 15-30min each time I come. Other then that, this place is great

This is one of my favorite restaurant but today I was very disappointed because I found a half eaten chicken wing in my new order, seems like they serve leftovers as new and the manager Natascha Crouch didn&#39;t even discount my bill, I had to ask for it, worst customer service ever, never going back again
This place is great. Food is good, service is great, and I love the outside seating .. For the vegans out there, try the veggie burger it&#39;s awesome ..

Cheesecake Factory has been a long time favorite. When we were looking for a local spot to take our staff out to lunch to that would satisfy and give plenty of food options, Cheesecake Factory was the chosen popular choice by the group. They accommodated our big group and our waiter did a good job juggling all our drink, appetizer, entree and dessert orders even though it was his third day on the job :) Thank you boss for taking us out

I don&#39;t know why I haven&#39;t written about this good &#39;ol standby... but I guess it&#39;s because been there in awhile but since we were heading to a movie we decided to have some food.. <br><br>I have to say my most favorite thing is the fire grilled artichoke.. It&#39;s FABULOUS!! <br>I have to compliment them on their ability to handle such a huge menu.. and the consistency it remarkable because of that.. The only reason I&#39;m not giving a full 5 stars is more so because of the lack of management to take care of their bar employees<br><br>As we were sitting at the bar I see the gal behind (our bartender that night) with a big clear hose that she needed to use to clean the ice bins behind the bar. 1st it was about 2&#34; in diameter and a little distracting to see as you are eating.. but worse it was held together with tape.. <br><br>We joked to her about it but she informed us that was the only way to do what they needed to clean the ice bins.. I then commented that at least they (meaning the company) could get her a &#34;hose&#34; that wasn&#39;t held together with cheap tape.. she chuckled that they had told management that they needed a new one and this was what they returned...<br><br>Come ON Cheesecake Factory.. find a better way to do this AND don&#39;t be so cheap you can&#39;t get your hard working employees (who rocked by the way in service) a dang NEW HOSE!!!

My girlfriends and I thought to have a great lunch date however this did not occur. We arrived at at opening time 11:40 pm opening states 11:30. Clearly the staff was not organized and ready to go. As soon as we were seated we noticed the table was extremely sticky to the touch and the menus full of food as we opened them.  Pretty gross. The waitress, Ashely, apparently was not in the mood of giving any bit of customer service as she ignored our drink order and walked away. We advised her of the sticky table and she rolled her eyes and said would let someone know.  So then.. Here comes bad employ number 2. He snatched up all 3 silverware settings  and slamming the plates as he picked up.  Ridiculous attitude everywhere. This was enough we walked to the hostess and asked for the manager and was asked why. Overall, horrible experience!
The best cheesecake ever! Hands down no comparison! You cant beat the fresh whipped cream ....

The food was excellent as always, unfortunately I erred by not closely reviewing my receipt. Never again!<br><br>Our party of 7 (celebrating a birthday) was listed as a party of 8 and an extra meal was placed on our tab. Didn&#39;t realize until we got home. <br><br>This type of waitress error creates an atmosphere of mistrust that will make my future Galleria dinning choices more selective and obviously, I will be keeping a safe distance from the Cheesecake Factory. <br><br>0447 Table 705<br>Sadigatou D SvrCk: 4

What a horrible service they have here. They first called you and then they tell you that it was a test. I WILL NEVER COME BACK TO THIS LOCATIONS. They are RACIST with latinos here and just because you&#39;re not white they will try to put you a horrible location and they will ignore you too. PLEASE DO NOT COME HERE. HORRIBLE SERVICE. <br><br>*This place is RACIST as hell!!  specially Ben the greeter is very RUDE.

My guy took be for a birthday dinner last night drinks great app was wonderful dinner not so much, First our tray with entrees was dropped ok that happens. Brought comp salads. Nice but neither of us wanted them otherwise we would have ordered again trying to be nice. When our dinner arrived the salmon not cooked through and as server was placing the Sheppard pie it came so close to spilling on my guy that we both jumped. when it was severed it looked like slop like as they were remaking our food they just pushed it out. I picked the place. The server and some other guy there thought the ALMOST spill was funny I though the whole thing was terrible. Although we thought about sharing a piece of cheesecake (reason for going) we went to Ben and Jerry&#39;s and had ice cream we could not wait to leave. This one is off my list.

I come here pretty frequently after the movies. They are open late and we almost never have to wait longer than 10 minutes for a table. As far as cheesecake factories go, this one is standard. They don&#39;t push you off your table. Two large patios with heaters. Sometimes service can be a little slow. I don&#39;t think that&#39;s any fault of the servers... More so that management understaffs the floor. Over the last few years Cheesecake Factory has really expanded their skinnylicious menu which is great. It is now really easy to get a pretty guilt free yet delicious meal. This is probably the ONLY chain big box restaurant that I eat consistently at. Parking validation for dinner which makes parking cheap, If not free. The lot here in Sherman oaks can be a bit annoying. You may have to park a bit far away and walk. Remember to snap a photo of where you are so that you can find your car easily.

This is my first time eating at this location. I ordered to go so I could eat it on my lunch and have to say I was pretty disappointed. I ordered the Renee&#39;s lunch special: turkey sandwich, ranch dressing with the salad, soup, and complimentary bread. I also asked for a side of mayo. When I got my meal, it was the chicken salad sandwich, the salad had the wrong dressing, no bread, no mayo, and no spoon to eat my soup. I only have 30 mins for lunch so I couldn&#39;t go back and fix it. It takes a lot for me to write a bad review since I&#39;ve been a server for 7 years.... but this was just aaalll messed up. 3 stars because the soup I ate later when I got home was actually pretty good and the staff was friendly.

What happened here!? I used to choose this location over the one by Topanga for the better service, but I was really disappointed the other night. <br><br>It was a Monday, and they weren&#39;t empty, but the food came out ridiculously slow. What should have been about an hour and a half meal turned out to be two hours and 30 minutes. <br><br>The drink I ordered had no alcohol and I had to wait about 20 minutes to even have the waitress spare me a glance so I could flag her down and ask to have an extra shot put in. <br><br>And lastly it was my mom&#39;s birthday, and I told another server in secret (since ours disappeared for so long) and she forgot to tell ours so no candles or singing for us. This probably annoyed me the most.<br><br>Too many things went wrong for me to want to return anytime soon. The food is good, but so is the food at the other locations. Skip this one.
Had dinner with my bro and mom today it was amazing thank you for everything I actually gave them 55% tip well you have to have the drinks here omg the food is fab thanks god
Had a great time with my aunts when i came to dinner the other night. The food was amazing! had a buffalo Chicken Sandwhich and the Chicken was Really Big and filling.

I came here to enjoy a dinner out with my family. I was a little bit hesitant because of the three stars,  but we had a great dinner. Anna, our server was friendly and attentive. My kids all enjoyed their meals and I loved the chipotle pasta I ordered. I would definitely return.

I love Cheesecake Factory! And this is probably my favorite location. All the waiters/waitresses are super attentive and nice. My fav plate is the crispy chicken costelleta. But honestly all their food is great. <br><br>Oh if you haven&#39;t had their fried Mac and cheese try it!<br><br>Their margaritas and piña coladas are delicious .<br><br>:))

.. its been many years since ive come back to this place.. the last time i was here i forget what i ordered.. breaded chicken with pasta.. there was a hair deep inside under the breading.. maybe one of the chefs placed it there and was nor happy working for cheesecake factory.. tonight i decided to try their pizza.. their sausage and ricotta flatbreads were amazing.. however their margherita pizza was not as good as i expected it to be.. and for the price $15.. not worth it.. maybe they should steer away from making pizzas.. the cheese was not melted enough and it appears that everyone has their own version.. it was okay.. ive had better and at an affordable price.. i think ill stick with their flatbreads.. half the price and filling enough..

Probably the rudest bar staff and experience I have ever had. Bartenders talk openly about how bad their customers are, pour weak drinks and make strange comments to their customers. When did Cheesecake Factory start hiring McDonalds quality employees? Classless and we won&#39;t go to this location again.

First time comimg here... the wait was a little long but it was mother&#39;s day but it was worth the wait we had a great server named  Jeff.  Honestly it was the best serves i have ever received in a resturant. He was on top of everything despite it being full. He made mine and my families mother day a great one.. hope to see him move up. Will be coming back to this resturant.

The wait wasn&#39;t bad about 20 minutes, our server was great, and atmosphere was good but honestly the food quality is straight up disappointing. The raspberry lemonade was way too sweet, fried calamari tasted overly salty and the steak tacos were chewy. With the bill totaling $85 for two adults and a toddler, we could have had great sushi or new american food in the valley that would cost similar. I wouldn&#39;t go back anytime soon.
They treat you right here.  Good service and good food!  Lousy wait!  Plan on waiting 45 minutes during dinner time!

I&#39;ve only been to a Cheesecake Factory once many years ago, so this was a fresh experience for me. It was movie night with my girlfriend. We were dressed in unicorn onesies and just looking for a quick place to eat and drink while we waited to see a movie. The dining room was on a 20 minute wait but there was plenty of open seating at the bar. This was lucky for us as we met the best thing about the place, Erika from Colorado. I work hard n a bar so I notice the little things. She was mixing drinks for the entire dining room from cheese cake factory&#39;s infinitely cocktail menu, and she still had time to take care of the entire bar top while carrying on a casual cocktail conversation with us. I don&#39;t remember what I ate, or really how good it was, but I do remember how nice she was, even will a full restaurant to take care of.
I have been here twice to have lunch and there is always a long wait to be seated with many empty tables doesn&#39;t make sense hire more staff
Love this place. Looks beautiful at night. The pumpkin cheesecake is a must. And they have a great selection on the menu. Service is good. Great for a date night. Or really anytime.

Food is just toooooo good here. Can never go wrong. All I have to say is save your appetite meals are big. I only come to this restaurant once a year on my uncle B-DAY.  Be prepared to wait in the lobby for 40mins+ during Busy hours.

It&#39;s the CHEESECAKE FACTORY! How could it ever disappoint? Other than the fact that they do not take reservation and you would need to wait for some time on the weekends to be seated.<br><br>The menu is literally a book.. so you know you will find something that will satisfy your taste buds and stomach.

Visited here once. The first time... on a weeknight. It was super busy, which is great for business. Wait was about 30-35 minutes. Our waitress was great, attentive, friendly. The food was good. That&#39;s to be expected here. Didn&#39;t feel rushed. Enjoyed our time.

If you have Celiac don&#39;t go here. They say they have gluten free buns and you can order any hamburger gluten free. I did and it tasted wonderful. They just don&#39;t understand cross contamination and I was very sick. Just not worth eating here and being so sick after.

Consistently good and reliable. I&#39;ve been to this CF location multiple times, and service has always been great. I spotted Miley Cyrus here in the past (before she got huge), and it&#39;s a popular locale for the younger crowd. <br><br>My favorites are the Tex Mex Eggrolls &amp; Louisiana Chicken Pasta. Both dishes, full of flavor. <br><br>The restaurant is clean and spacious, and the wait can get long on weekend nights, but weekdays are usually fine. <br><br>Whenever I go to Sherman Oaks Galleria, CF is usually where I go for a meal. Bigger menu, more variety = better times.

Came in late night with the girlfriend for some appetizers and drinks. Was greeted by the host, Malachi, who was just an absolute pleasure and salvaged our night from our drab cocky server. Will literally return to this restaurant ONLY to see Malachi again. Excellent work.

Had lunch here and didn&#39;t have to wait longer than 10 minutes which was nice since it seemed busy during the lunch hour. The host called my name and then I was confused why other people were being sat before us and she had us just stand and wait still? I asked her if we were going to be seated and she said with a bit of attitude &#34;we&#39;re going down the list&#34;..okay then why did you call me over to have me just stand in everyone&#39;s way? By the way the service really sucks here! Couldn&#39;t flag down my waiter whatsoever for water so I was pretty surprised this location would be like this.

I was here on a Saturday (8/04/12) and the place was not super busy.  Still, service was kinda slow.  I had the BANG BANG CHICKEN &amp; SHRIMP.  It was a good mix of chicken and shrimp with a dash of thai  spice added to it.  It is not  too spicy. For desert I had the 30th Anniversary Cheesecake.  it is a big cake with layers of chocolate and cheesecake in between. Overall, I had a good time here.
Loveeee the food here !!! And the staff is prompt and attentive. When I got my food I noticed that it was too spicy and they took it back no problem and let me order another dish.

Sady was sooooooooo amaziiiiiinggggggg!!!!!! Whatever you want she gottttt itttttttt!!!!! Service was truly exceptional I was so nervous bringing my business partners over here and everything turned out better than good! We all had a great time and we were treated equally, we all felt welcomed and noticed. She recommended some off the chain dishes!! I couldn&#39;t believe I was eating so good ! If there was 100 stars she would get it ! All drinks were on point l!

I had an excellent experience at this location! I went on a Sunday evening and it was quite packed and we ended up waiting 25-30 min for a table but it was well worth it. Our waiter was Desmond (I believe that was the name). He was an excellent waiter! Refills on time. Everything brought out on time and the food was excellent! Everything was perfect that day! I would recommend this location highly. I guess it&#39;s so busy because they&#39;re just that good! Thanks for the great dinner!

Just what you&#39;d expect from TCF. Beautiful location, but parking is the pits. And this place is busy busy busy! Be prepared to wait. The food comes quickly, but placing your order does not. The last few times I&#39;ve been here, seems like it takes forever for our server to realize they have a new table.

Look, i love a little cheesecake as much as the next person, but, what i went through wasn&#39;t even worth it. We were two families the first family got there and were seated (normal). But, Because we (second family) were running late the cheesecake people refused to serve them (first family) unless the whole group was there (weird). After waiting the manager named Lacey rudely told them to wait at lobby for balance of party but that the table would be saved. When we got there we had to wait 15 min. For them to tell us they gave our table away (shocker). One server by the name of jennifer (black hair) was very kind and really tried to make us comfortable but sadly we were seated outside where it was cold. Thankfully our waiter, Brain and izzy, made the experience enjoyable which is why i&#39;m happy to give them one star. Brain, izzy, and Jennifer (black hair) are the only reason they even get a star.

I went there a couple years ago, I used to be a regular at cheesecake. Ever since visiting this branch I have never stepped foot in another cheesecake. I ordered a Cesar salad, didn&#39;t taste right i knew something was wrong with it. But I was too busy my attention was with the friends I was with. I took the rest Togo the next day when I  saw the sales in light I realized the lettuce was old and the Cesar dressing was covering up the taste just enough that I didn&#39;t check that night. Conclusion if they carry lettuce that is that old and still have it in Stock that means their food quality sucks it&#39;s been years I never stepped foot back into a cheesecake factory

We came to this restaurant for lunch and there were about 3 people in front of us.  We were not asked where we wanted to be seated so they gave us a small table in a  very crowded room that we did not like.  We then asked for a booth and they gave us a booth next to the bar. It was very noisy and it felt like we were in a casino. I spoke to the manager and she didn&#39;t seeing to care too much.  She asked us if we specified where we wanted to be seated.  I told her that her employees should be asking us.  This is what you call customer service?  We are very  disappointed with this restaurant and we do not recommend it.
The food is always good, but of course there&#39;s always a line.  They were very sweet about bringing out a set up for my toddler who wanted to eat and wear the pasta. Great service here.
Always great service and great food ! I&#39;ve had mistakes happen with my order and they fix it everytime ! Staff is always fantastic ! That&#39;s why I keep comming back !

The service is the slowest  I&#39;ve experienced. Waiter kept forgetting simple things like getting us our sparkling water. The bartender doesn&#39;t know any speciality cocktails besides generic cocktails. The food was not great. Overall, not a great experience. Cheese cake factory turned into a rushed BJs Brewhouse. Also, accidentally called to ask about my forgotten debit card. Two different hostesses told me to wait to have no response. I clicked and then called bank to block card.
Love this place! Everything on the menu is A1! There isn&#39;t one thing you get there and don&#39;t enjoy! One of my favorite sit down restaurant.

Best place for a quick lunch or happy hour is the bar area here! Fast service from our wonderful bartender, Brian. He was knowledgable, polite and funny. He and other staff were very busy, but the food came out quick and hot. Highly recommend!

So the last time I was here the service was not that great. I mean they did sat us in a reasonable time but when they did we sat and waited for like almost 30 minutes until out server showed up. I&#39;ve been to many cheese cake factory restaurants but this one has to be the one I didn&#39;t enjoy. Like don&#39;t get me wrong the food is good but the whole service needs some work.
Came for my boyfriends birthday dinner. Food was great and the service was even better :)

I used to go to here often for their appetizers. So naturally, after a long hiatus, I decided to order appetizers! I&#39;m not sure if they changed their recipe or if the chef makes it differently. But it has definitely changed. The ahi tuna tartare used to taste so fresh and this time around it just tasted differently. Instead of chunks of tuna, it was a clump. The fried zucchini had too much batter and tasted just that, batter. I hope they up their ante sooner than later.

Been coming to this location for years, one of my fav restaurants. This one is located in the galleria, right at the corner next to the fountain and Urban Home. I come here often before catching a movie upstairs. Never had to wait over 20 min. (and that&#39;s when it was PACKED).<br><br>Service is always prompt and nice. Last time I went my mom and I were rushing before a movie... although I hate when customers rush me, our waiter was so nice and understood and accommodated everything for us. <br><br>As far as food choices the menu is like 20 pages long. The bread they bring you (esp. the brown one) is delicious. I always ask for balsamic vinegar or vinegrette on the side and it&#39;s enough to hold you over before the food arrives. There are appetizers and small bites for less than 10$ to get you started as well. Some plates I usually get that are always good are the blackened chicken sandwich and the jambalaya pasta. Warning: the desserts are MASSIVE but also delicious. Cheesecake of course, is also great.<br><br>The decor is also unique and adds a lot of character. In my opinion it is one of the most recognizable and aesthetically pleasing features of the place.<br><br>Come here if you&#39;re looking for a nice restaurant that&#39;s more upscale than others yet has food options for all kinds of tastes.

I have been to this location at least 100 times in my life. The food here has never disappointed me. There are so many options that you can have whatever you are in the mood for and know that it be at the least, good, at best - you will have cravings later. I also have to give a shout out to the happy hour menu. To me, this is the kind of place you can never go wrong with. My faves: miso salmon, chicken bellio, chicken potstickers, the amazing bread basket, all the desserts. <br><br>Having been here so many times, I never thought to write a review, until my server on Friday night, Allen S. changed that. <br><br>Allen was that good. I was a little nervous when he never bothered to write any of our orders down - we were a party of 5 with drinks, appetizers, and 5 separate entrees. And I was a little bummed when our bread was served cold. (No, no, no - the butter has to be able to melt and drip out of the bread sandwich while you devour it.) But that was remedied pretty quickly. <br><br>Our orders came out perfectly, drinks were refilled, we were checked on and just enough times to make sure we were happy, and we were. But what took the cake was that Allen noticed, while carding my son for his alcoholic drink, that it was my son&#39;s birthday. We had not mentioned anything at all because it had been a rather solemn day for my son. However, when our server, Allen, noticed the date of birth on my son&#39;s ID and took the initiative and time to bring out the celebratory lit candle and song, it lifted everyone&#39;s spirits.  <br><br>On any given day, you never know what that stranger you just came across has been through. It is absolutely true that one act of kindness can help. Allen did that. That kind of initiative deserves praise and recognition.<br><br>The food would have kept me coming back. Servers like this one will make me happy about that.

Usually the service is good.  Last night our server Mimi K was horrible.  Ordered drinks, my husband ordered an iced tea she brought it after 10 min and said I&#39;m not sure I brought you the right one did you want passion or regular he said never mind bring me water, I had club soda which she never once asked to refill.  She said she would bring bread after 20 min had to remind her.  My son ordered an appetizer after 15 min we reminded her we wanted it before dinner she said I know let me check at the same time someone else brought us our dinners so my son said forget the appetizer. We ordered dessert again 20 min not served. Stopped her and her response was the bakery is busy again I think she forgot.  Unfortunately the service was reflected in her tip.<br>I also went to the ladies room and for a restaurant this size you need to have more than two working stalls and one was out of toilet paper.  Was not a good night  at the Cheesecake Factory.

I&#39;ve been to other cheesecake factories and this is just the same in terms of food as well as service. Luckily the place wasn&#39;t busy on a wednesday lunch so the group of 9 of us got seated right away. The service was alright. Nothing out of the ordinary. The waiter did take a while to fill up the glasses of water. She did seem to rush us towards the end.

Last week was my first time on this famous place.... and I&#39;m surprised : 1 The food... good but no so great, 2 The waitress so rude, the food runner.. rude rude rude...! No... I&#39;m not coming back.

If they did not serve free bread this place would get 1 star. The service has been terrible on multiple occasions and at multiple locations. I do not understand how it can be so consistently bad. Poor management and training is the only explanation. Some dishes are good but they do not make up for the service. Avoid

My food and my wife&#39;s meals were decent....and it stops there.<br><br>The waitress definitely did not want to be there. She took our drink order, food order, and all other requests while she was walking away from us and heading to another table. Not sure if she was in a rush, or if she just didn&#39;t care, but it was obvious (and really bad). Unfortunately, our daughter didn&#39;t want eat her food and we asked it to be boxed up. We ended up receiving HALF of the food that was on her plate in her to-go box. Not sure if that was incompetence, laziness, or what....but this place is definitely going downhill fast.

All of there food is good. It&#39;s a great place if you have a large party because of its wide range of options. I love the Mac n cheese balls, artichoke dip w/ extra chips, crispy crab wontons, BBQ chicken salad, shrimp scampi and most of all... Jamaican Black Pepper Shrimp. They have a chicken option also. Then top it off with banana creme ChesseCake!  I know the menu like the back of my hand. Ol&#39; high school fav.
Food is great the price is ok but the wait time was just a bit too much too be during a week day at 2pm thats why I will take a star away

Even during the busy holiday party season, this restaurant was able to accommodate our small baby shower. We arrived at opening with many customers ready as the doors were opened. We were sat immediately at a perfect table for our party. Server came by promptly and helped with appetizers and drinks. Excellent service by Matthew throughout our meal. Refills and meals came at a perfect pace for our celebration. The manager, Jen, stopped by twice to see how we were doing. Everyone was helpful and the food was delicious!

Amazing cheesecake &amp; their food is delicious. Great customer services &amp; very friendly staff. Absolutely recommend for fun weekend nights! Their drinks are always pretty good and the food portions are just right.

I went with my niece to Cheesecake factory at the Americana, Glendale, CA, we both chose a salad that was to come with caramelized pecans. They left out the pecans.  When we complained, the waiter came with a homeopathic amount in a little plastic cup and said the kitchen would not give more.  I was disappointed. What is happening to Cheesecake Factory??

We Love this place for the food and of course the cheesecake. So Yummy! We just recently went for my wife&#39;s birthday, and the guys that came out and sang happy birthday to her had the best A Capella singing voices I have ever heard at a restaurant. I know that&#39;s not saying much, but they were pretty good, and it made her night. The service staff are friendly and cordial, but very slow. It took about 20 minutes to get our drinks, and another 20 minutes for them to bring pepper to our table (the table only had salt, so we asked for pepper). All in all, we enjoyed our time here, just make sure you are not in a hurry.
Worse service.<br>Elizabeth the manager is very rude.<br>She shouldn&#39;t hold management position.

THE WORST COSTUMER SERVICE EVER: My friend and I went to this location today for lunch today. The wait was a bit long so we asked to sit in the bar area . We find a seat in the bar area and then a waiter by the name of Cynthia asked us &#34;did someone walk you here?&#34; I said excuse me... she repeated herself and said that if we weren&#39;t seated there, then we had to move. I guess we could only sit at the top tables. We go back to the entrance and tell the guy that was doing the seating about her attitude, she starts to make faces and laugh as we are talking. Never been so disrespected in my life. We just left because I would rather eat at a place that is respectful of all their customers and values their business.

We went there yesterday for desserts. This place is usually very busy but on a Tuesday it&#39;s pretty chill. We got seated right away and our waiter was very nice and friendly. I had the usual: Reese&#39;s pieces chocolate cheesecake! Loved it! it&#39;s truly a piece of art. Reese&#39;s crumbles on the side and a chocolate cheesecake filled with peanut butter. Delicious. You can&#39;t ask for anything better than that!!
