Watch out for a hostess named Ashely. Terrible attitude and she has no issue with  it at all. She likes to give you a snobby reply to any question and seems to have no brain. And not to mention on top of that, terrible customer service in general here. Good luck to you if you do go.

Cortney R is the best server ever. She was so attentive, genuinely cared about us having a great experience and was very welcoming and friendly. She went above and beyond to ensure we had a pleasant experience. We were incredibly bummed by Trump&#39;s projected victory and she came in and brightened our day. I only want to come when she&#39;s here. She needs a HUGE raise. Seriously. I&#39;m not joking!
Trash clam chowder had no clams. No good trash garbanzo took forever for my seat trash service.

I usually always go to this location because its right in the galleria and i can hit the movies after. I like this one its pretty cool, its not as good as the woodland hills location but its good.<br><br>Only problem i had the other day is for happy hour its suppose to be self seating but i guess they wanted to sit us? well they sat us at a table where either me or my boyfriend couldn&#39;t  watch the TV. (first football game) So we moved over to the table next to us so we can sit side by side. After 30 minutes sitting we got our food and the manager comes over and says hey guys i need you to move back to the table we sat you at we need to sit a party of four and walks off. were like okay maybe you guys could&#39;ve just told us that way before we ordered drinks and food and now you want me to pick up a hot plate and move back to the other table. like this is the only four top seat in the restaurant. i sat for a second and he comes back again and says hey i need you two to move now please. i kindly snapped back and said well we would like help moving our plates over because we don&#39;t work here. Overall, i feel like he did not need to do all that especially since we were in happy hour area and we were in the middle of eating.<br>The managers here seem to make poor decisions when it comes to satisfying customers. <br><br>Also, another time they allowed a homeless woman to sit down right near us in the bar area and she smelled horrid like urine really bad the couple next to us said they lost their appetite and so did my boyfriend. she was not buying anything and i don&#39;t discriminate but this is a restaurant and if she is filthy no telling what germs she could be bringing in while people are sitting right next to her eating. thats extremely unsanitary. <br><br>Overall i will go here again i just hope none of the managers makes dumb decisions.

I love the Cheesecake Factory! So this location doesn&#39;t differ from any other, in my opinion. Great decor, great food, great date place since i feel like this location has a good amount of tables for two. Lol<br><br>Sherman oaks galleria in general is a clean shopping/restaurant area, right next to the freeway. You can get parking validation at the Cheesecake Factory!

Yummy Yummy.....! For All the Cheesecakes here...! Its Cheesecake Heaven I would say... But for me though: Its the Fresh Strawberry Shortcake with a scoop of Vanilla Ice Cream.. I could come here just for that...! And my favorite dish for Dinner is: Terriaki Chicken. I try other dishes but that continues to be my Favorite..! My Favorite Drink is The Typhoon Punch, one of these and I am ready to have a blast...!<br>The Negative: Is that there is always an eternal wait to be seated...!

I have to say I have gone to many cheesecakes but the customer service was not the best at this location.  I ordered via postmates, the portions were almost for a toddler and they packed the wrong pasta, forgot the bread and I paid over 50.00 for the order. I called back and spoke with the Manager and he said, sorry they could not do anything and was very rude as it was ordered via postmates, You call postmates and they tell you its not their fault if cheesecake put the wrong portions and the wrong order.  I had my receipt, they could see the order, but all I wanted was to have what I paid for corrected.  I can say I no longer want to go to cheesecake or use postmates, horrible service

Great take out menu ! Really easy to order over the phone . Tina is awesome over the phone and when she greets you while you pick up your food . If you have any complaints about your food or order she never hesitates to make everything better !!! <br><br>Thursday soup of the day : tortilla soup is delicious . They&#39;ll always give you extra bread if you requested it . Stuffed mushrooms are amazing ! <br>Great customer service and fast service as well !!

Just finished having dinner with family, my drinks, food, and service was exceptional. My servers name was Oscar very polite and attentive which I dearly I appreciated since I know great service is key to a restaurant as prestigious as cheesecake. Haven&#39;t been to this location in a while and it never seems to disappoint!
This food here is definitely delicious beyond the cheesecake.  Its a definite place to return to. The wait can be a little long, however its well worth it.

To keep it short and simple, my party and I had to wait 15 minutes for appetizers and 20 minutes after that for our main course. It wasn&#39;t too busy when we went so I was surprised at how long we had to wait for our food. I ordered the shrimp scampi and steak Diane and it was alright, could&#39;ve been way better (at least for the mashed potatoes). I felt sick right after I ate that I didn&#39;t want to order dessert (I know, who doesn&#39;t order cheesecake at the Cheesecake Factory after their meal?). But if I did, I&#39;d probably wait another 20 minutes for that as well.

Long wait tonight but great service and food. Tonight one of the front host &#34;Malachi&#34; was a great help. He checked in multiple times with our party through out the wait, being empathetic to our hunger and having a over all pleasant and happy attitude and presence under the swarm of hungry people everywhere. Will be back agin and we defiantly appreciate the great costumer service.
Poor and unprofessional service.  Turned off by the wait staff, so bad we left.  Went to Glendale Cheesecake Factory and had a great time.

I love this Cheesecake Factory. Brian the bartender is one of the reasons I love this particular location. He is the best. The guy always has a smile on his face and treats everyone like he&#39;s excited they came. If you get a chance to come to this location make your way to the bar and get a drink from him you won&#39;t regret it. The parmesan chicken here is amazing too.

I&#39;m always torn between this location and the location at the Topanga Mall as i live right in the middle of the 2 i try to juggle between them so as to not get bored with one or the other. This location is great and they validate the parking which is awesome, and it is right by a movie theater so it can go from a dinner to a date night pretty easily. The food and service is always great and they deserve each of the 5 stars i am giving them. i will be back soon!

The service was not really good but seating did not take too long. Food also was brought out quickly,hot and it was supertasty!! I had the Sweet Tamales appetizer, Crab and cheese dip and Hibatchi steak. Everything was amazing, only thing was we asked for rare and it was well done but not chewy! I don&#39;t love chain places but I have to say in really enjoyed my meal here, more so than the one in woodland hills. Just a heads up that the Parking at this location is kind of a pain . Valet is the closest .Outdoor seating was really nice!
Came there to eat. Ordered pizza it wasn&#39;t that good. But overall experience is very nice. Service is good and fast. I liked the booths where you can get a sit. It was my first time there.

Came here after a long drive for some food, the food portions are very big and worth the $17 I spent on a pasta with shrimp. The beer on draft was amazing. The only thing was that I really didnt get any warm bread, it was all cold

WHY YOU GOTTA FIGHT WITH ME AT CHEESECAKE... You know I love to go there.. Cheesecake is a family favorite.We love everything at cheesecake.From the breads to the pasta to the actual cheesecake.You won&#39;t leave Cheesecake Factory hungry ever.My favorite item from here would be the lousiana fried chicken pasta.Its spicy and crisp. I&#39;ve been to Wallys and Il pastia and let me just say somethin...Those two restaurants are only good for the snapchat filter and geotag.You haven&#39;t had real pasta till you try the Fried Chicken Lousiana Pasta.The waiter was a cute blonde such a sweetheart.Your drinks will be refilled every second and you&#39;ll feel like a king dining.
I love this place great food not too pricey good service I&#39;ve been to this location only 2 times both were great

Ok, I have have never had such shoddy service at a Cheesecake Factory.  From the hostess station, to the bar, then our dinner.  It&#39;s as if these kids really, truly hate their jobs and have zero skills in customer service.  The hostess (I was there 2/7/18 @ 6 p.m.) was condescending, lazy and lacking in communication skills.  We requested a table outside, and were waiting for our 2 friends.  Mind you, this was a Wed. night, the restaurant was half empty.  She advised me she could only hold the table for 10 min., so I asked if we could go get a drink and come back.  She said yes, she took my name, (I thought she was saving our table).  We went to the bar which was another clusterf**k of a lazy server.  We finally got our drinks, 9 min. later (again, an empty bar), I left my husband there waiting to close out the bar tab so we would not miss our &#34;10 min.&#34; window).  When I got in front of the hostess, she could not remember me, nor did she take my name and save us a table.  So, in her power trip, she made me stand off to the side while she &#34;found&#34; us a table.  After a few min., the other hostess, who was very hostile, sat us down, in a table up against a wall off to the side, like we were in a timeout.  I requested a table more to the center of the patio so we could look for our friends.  She rolled her eyes at us, gave us a different table.  Never once did either of these so called HOSTESSES crack a smile.  The waiter seemed nice/happy, and we were relieved (Jared), to have a person who actually enjoys his job.  Although Jared was super friendly, he was not very attentive.  It took forever for him to take our order, we had to ask for bread 2x, we finally got our food, 25 min. after ordering (restaurant still half empty).  We ordered dessert.  We requested Jared remove our dinner plates.  He said &#34;sure, no problem&#34;, then walked past us 4 times glanced at our table full of empty dinner plates/glasses, kept going.  Finally I moved all our plates/glasses to the empty table next to us just as dessert arrived.  The plates/glasses sat at that table until we left.   What should have been a 1 1/2hrs dinner, turned into nearly 2 1/2hrs.  The only redeeming part of our dinner was that the food was as good as it always is.  Moral of the story, maybe Cheesecake should pay more attention to the people who interact with the public, it is just as important as the quality of the food.
It&#39;s just such a good place to go no matter what you are in the mood for. No matter what time a day they always have what your want. Love coming here!!! Sour apple martinis r sooooo good!!! Yum

By the line in front of The Cheese Cake Factory, it seems like this place is everyone&#39;s guilty pleasure in LA. What really made this over indulgent outing worth it, was our server&#39;s sense of humor and great knowledge of the menu. Antwyon is a great asset!

Had an amazing experience that definitely made up for our dreadful one across the way @ el torrito grill. BRUCE IS ONE OF THE BEST WAITERS!!  He made our visit beyond pleasant and memorable. However, the wait was a bit much and after our pager went off we still had to wait and almost got passed up by another,  equal numbered party until we brought it to their attention. Had it not been for that I would have rated the visit 5 stars. (was there yesterday night)

I&#39;ve been to many locations of Cheesecake Factory and this is by far my favorite. The servers are so kind and the food is delicious. I always get the Linda&#39;s fudge cake and my husband gets the recess cheesecake. So yummy!

I love the Cheesecake Factory! This certain location has such a sweet staff, my waitress was really sweet but at the same time seemed very inpatient with me and my boyfriend but with another couple next to us, she asked them if they need a few more minutes... yet when she asked us what we&#39;re having she just stood there. Another downside is that after they brought us our bread, when our food arrived they just left the plates and the bread basket there instead of taking it with them. I don&#39;t know if that is how this location works, but usually when my food arrives they take the appetizer plates with them and the bread basket, along with any trash. I wish I took a picture of our table when our food arrived, it was such a small table with such big plates for the food:( next time I&#39;ll ask for a booth.

Cheesecake factory is our favorite restaurant however this location is getting 1star because of its terrible manager. When I say horrible it&#39;s an understatement the MOST UNPROFFESSIONAL EVER.<br>We came in last week with a party of 12, we were quoted 45 minutes, well 1 hour and 45 minutes later we were finally seated, no apologies just terrible attitude from manager. <br>Now tonight SAME manager. Soon as we walked in to our our name down he with a horrible attitude said excuse me you will need to move and go stand in line ... there was no line for check in only for people who were called to be seated. When he noticed that still no apology, just took our name down. We are quoted 30-40 minutes, as we are waiting about 9 minutes in I see 2 parties that walked in after us seated first. So i question it to the manager and his response  you&#39;ve only been waiting 9 minutes ( yet I pointed out that they have been waiting for 1 minute and were seated.) he was basically if you don&#39;t like it too bad. This guy is either full of himself with his power trip or on something because normal people don&#39;t get close to your face like that and act that way.<br><br>Update add fuel to the fire, they sat us outside 90% of the heaters were not working, and the wind picked up. I asked how long now for an inside table they said we would need to start over, so another 40 min wth! We sat outside, and the manager comes over to say I don&#39;t understand why your upset you got a table! Ya in 50 degrees outside no heaters thanks <br><br>Update .... here we are 30 minutes after we ordered.... just got my iced tea and no food yet <br><br>WORST EXPERIENCE EVER !

I would never go back. The managers Elizabeth and JP were so unprofessional and rude to us. After waiting for two hours to be seated when we were supposed to be seated in one hour and 15 minutes, they refused to provide service to us because we questioned the long wait. We were embarrassed and ashamed and she destroyed our Saturday night . We left at 10 at night after two hours standing. Elizabeth should never work again at the establishment. Please contact me for details. Please review the video. Saturday night 8-10 pm January 28th at sherman oaks location. This is unacceptable

This place is a joke. There have been many robberies reported at this location. They don&#39;t have any security at all and they allow people to walk in to the restaurant, steal something and run out. The location is so awful that they allowed a person to run inside, grab a purse, and run out MULTIPLE times. Their response to the situation was ridiculous. They said &#34;We can&#39;t do anything about it.&#34; Absolutely ridiculous restaurant.

Let me say this, I am a huge fan of the cheese cake factory but I would love to get a realistic wait time. So after we were called up via buzzer, my party of 4 and I noticed about 15 other people&#39;s buzzers had gone off as well. Why buzz that many people at the same time ? So now wait another 15 to 20 minutes?  No thanks Sherman Oaks!!! I will go back to the Topanga cheesecake next time.

I used to like CKF, I really did. But that changed years ago. As the saying goes, &#34;jack of all trades, master of none&#34; - describes the current Cheesecake franchise perfectly. Just left from what I hope will be my final trip. $125 later, with a stomachache, I am sad to say that the CKF I used to love is dead, may she RIP. The current version is OK if you like overpaying for mediocre food. YMMV.
I ordered pasta and it tasted so good. We were   seated but it took them 5 minutes but they were so busy but at the end it was worth the wait.

As always, this restauraunt is a lovely place to go to if you are looking for a nice dining experience.  Not too fancy, but a lovely environment that is great for a night out with friends.<br><br>Like some of the other reviews said, this place can get PACKED!  I called ahead of time to make reservations, and they would not allow it.  Typically, if you have a party of under 3 people, they can seat you fast.  Otherwise, if you are coming during &#39;rush hour&#39;, plan on waiting a bit.  As with most places, outdoor seating is usually first available.  They have a heated patio on nights when it gets chilly, so if you bring a jacket, outside is usually quite lovely.<br><br>The only other reason this place is four stars instead of five is because of their pricing.  Not to say it&#39;s not totally worth it -- because lord knows their food and desserts are AMAZING -- but $3.50 for a coke is a bit silly in my eyes.<br><br>Overall, a nice place to go with friends!  Just make sure you come with some extra time, and a jacket!

My server Antoine was AMAZING! He knew what I was going to ask for before I even asked, he literally would bring whatever I was planning to ask for when he came around! Great customer service and a nice person! I&#39;ve never had such amazing service anywhere. I certainly wasn&#39;t expecting that from the Cheesecake Factory, I&#39;ve been there more times than I can think of and my service was no where near the norm! So thank you Antoine!!

The only reason I&#39;m giving 2 starts instead of zero is because our waitress was sweet.<br>The food, however, disgusting. <br>My friends pasta was undercooked and cold as ice.<br>Our lettuce wraps were a joke, soggy, with 1 little cube of chicken on each.<br>Flavorless, and 2 hairs on my food.<br>Gross
The food is good and cheesecake even better. Best services for both small and big group here
Louisiana Chicken Pasta (i always get that) = 10/10<br><br>Fried Mac &amp; Cheese balls = 9/10<br><br>Fried Calamari = 8.5/10<br><br>Buffalo sliders = 7/10<br><br>Staff = 9/10<br><br>Overall = 8.5/10

I would like to say THANK YOU KELLY for trying your BEST to be the BEST WAITRESS possible on a busy EASTER SUNDAY TODAY. I saw how hard you&#39;re trying to work handling 5 tables at a time and saw you&#39;ve been having difficulty dealing with 5 tables all at once. You&#39;ve been really attentive to us and we thank you.

So after my horrendous, horrible, awful, mind blowing experience I wrote to corporate. <br><br>About two weeks later I received a phone call and it was corporate. I cannot remember his name it believe it started with a J.... Anyways he was very nice and asked me to explain what had happened. Once again I relived THAT experience. (We will refer to him as J for future reference) &#34;J&#34; followed with many apologies and explained The Cheesecake Factories goal and customer outlook blah blah. <br><br>I appreciated the personal call because after two weeks I had assumed I wouldn&#39;t ever hear from them. &#34;J&#34; asked if it was okay to share what I had told him with the store in Sherman Oaks and I said that was fine. Then &#34;J&#34; offered to pay for my dry cleaning of the pants that were ruined and said he was going to be sending me a &#34;very generous&#34; gift card ($50 is what I received.) <br><br>The disappointment there is that $50 doesn&#39;t even pay for the two meals and drinks we had paid for the first time around. Oh well. Can&#39;t be to greedy. He told me to go back to the Sherman Oaks one and ask for the manager but to be honest I don&#39;t know if I will ever go to that place again without having my sense memory kick in with that horrible vomit smell. So I went to the one in the Marina and it was great. Thank god. Our server was attentive, had personality and boxed my food up for me to go. (The first place just put boxes in front of me) The view was fantastic we sat right on the edge of the patio overlooking the water. We ordered the crusted salmon (delicious!) and the chicken piccata (comes with noodles, which need a little more sauce but overall wonderful!)

I have changed my star rating based on how The Cheesecake factory responded to my complaint and quickly gave me an opportunity to revisit their restaurant, complements of The Cheesecake factory. I went to a different location but the service was much better!! I leave the rating in the middle due to our first experience, which is: <br>JAN/ 2017 First the wait was too long when they had multiple seats available on the patio. Our waitress seated us and brought us bread 3 times and then went on break. People seated 20 mins after us (3) different tables, received their food and finished before we got ours. Everyone at our table was fine with the food, however I ordered the Herb crusted Salmon dish with a lemon sauce and it was more like clarified butter with a squirt of lemon sauce. Never again, will we return here!! Customer service is key, and unfortunately this place lacks it!!
Fried Mac n cheese. Enough said.<br><br>Okay we could also say they have amazing bread and incredible cheesecake, obviously.

I took my two children here for an early dinner last night after they convinced me to sell one of my kidneys to be able to afford what the bill usually is, but kindly.. I obliged.<br><br>As usual our bill was basically the cost of a Disneyland admission and just about as disappointing as the overpriced food at a theme park too.<br><br>I ordered an appetizer and iced tea which was only refilled twice (apparently four tables was too much for our waitress to handle at 4pm) and my children had bow tie pasta off of the kids menu (which is the price of a Coach coin purse for the portion). <br>Now you would think, how does one screw up bow-tie pasta and butter, right? Well... apparently, Cheesecake Factory can and it&#39;s not a problem for their guy in the back at &#34;the pasta station&#34;. <br><br>My younger sons arrived and it looked like something Gizmo from the Gremlin&#39;s threw up. The noodles which should only consist of butter and Parmesan cheese arrived looking burnt and covered in brown snot. <br>My other son ordered the same thing, but asked for no cheese and when it arrived it was dry (no butter, nothing). My older son was so grossed out that he didn&#39;t even want to eat anything else once the waitress came back over (after looking for her for about ten minutes). My younger son added his own cold slice of butter (that originally came with the bread) and it just wasn&#39;t the same for him, so he didn&#39;t really eat it. <br>We ordered a slice of cheesecake to split and it arrived and wasn&#39;t the size of the millennium falcon as I remembered it to be and was $8 (which instead of the Cheesecake Factory staff throwing in for free due to our gremlin vomit that was served to us), they charged us for it and only removed the two child&#39;s entrees from our bill, but charged me for the &#34;free soda&#34; that came with my sons entree and charged my other son an adult price for his soda. <br><br>Our bill was about $29.00 for basically two kids drinks, 1 adult drink, cheesecake and an appetizer. <br><br>So if you&#39;re into paying for crappy service, getting whiplash from searching for a waiter, and playing a game of &#34;what the hell is that on my child&#39;s plate?&#34; then by all means, eat here. But be prepared for NO manager to come over an apologize for the mix up and also be prepared for the staff to penny pinch your tab instead of doing what&#39;s right and comping your meal. <br><br>I still can&#39;t get over that they charged me for the free drinks on the kids meals! Really!? <br>I didn&#39;t even fight the price of our final tab, because we had a movie to go to and our waitress was perhaps doing her make-up or taking a hot yoga class, but survey says we will not be returning to this Cheesecake Factory anytime soon. <br><br>Sincerely, <br><br>Greatly disappointed
I received a reply from someone named null, the respond written said to log in at the website and click on general information which cant be found. If you like to reach out call me 818 2208911.

Late Friday night,  Hunny called for a reservation and according to their policy, reservations are not allowed. We had a 30 min wait however we were sat in the middle of two parties. I personally didn&#39;t enjoy my dinner due to the woman who kept walking in and out from the long booth where we sat, I had to see her ugly butt almost knocking over my water.<br> Our waiter was great, I forgot his name but he came to our table very often to make sure everything was good and We do like that.

Just had THE WORST experience at the Ventura Blvd location. I ordered the &#34;slim Steak Medallion &#34; meal - one I&#39;ve had many times and they literally gave me 3(maybe 4) small pieces of steak with an even smaller amount of asparagus. What it did have most of was - potatoes. Because since it&#39;s measured on the weight according to the smug and incredibly in helpful manager (tall, blonde woman). All for the price of close to $20!!! Like most people, I want to get the most out of a meal for the best price and $20 for 3-4 chunks of beef is not. I will NEVER visit this location again. I&#39;m a responsible person who rarely writes negative reviews but being treated in such a dismissive manner after many years of patronage is a &#34;deal breaker!&#34; Go to another location - this one has HORRIBLE SERVICE and a horrible attitude. No attempt to rectify the situation was made by the manager and that was the most DISAPPOINTING part. Go somewhere else!

The general manager here, Rebecca Perkins, is rude, condescending, and gives an attitude instead of being useful in anyway at all. We had complained to her that we had been sitting for 30 minutes waiting for our food without being checked on at all. When my mother explained this and asked her to fix it Rebecca said &#34;well I can&#39;t do 6 different things at once&#34; which was shocking considering we didn&#39;t ask for 6 things. She then continued to give us attitude and condescending comments. Overall very terrible service but what else would you expect from a terrible manager.

The four stars is mainly for the impeccable service we got here. We had a large party of about 12 people for a friend&#39;s bday. Ryan, our server, was AWESOME!! Kudos to him for being so helpful and attentive and not letting such a big group overwhelm him. He brought us water along with our drinks without us even having to ask him and brought out a little sundae for the birthday boy without so much as a peep from us.<br><br>Located in the Sherman Oaks Galleria, so be prepared to wait. We had reservations and we still ended up waiting close to a half an hour. Keep in mind, they won&#39;t seat you until at least half of your party is there. They validate for parking.<br><br>Food<br>The food is ok here, nothing amazing in my opinion. I usually get the fried macaroni and cheese balls. They&#39;re the best thing I&#39;ve had on the menu. My boyfriend got the tuna tartare appetizer, which was pretty yummy too. <br><br>Drinks<br>The Georgia Peach was made to perfection. Not too sweet and just what I needed on a hot day. I definitely recommend it.
I like the location .Great food. Fast Service.  Love the cheesecakes and appetizers and seafood

This place is horrible waitress attention, I request change the waitres because she use the f word when she walk away, manager cool but need to teach customer service to they waitress she toll me stay and I won&#39;t pay for dinner is cool but the Nigth already done , I won&#39;t come back here I give the gift card away

Horrible experience.  <br>We were a party of eight on a Saturday at 4 pm.  Since we were out celebrating a birthday and playing mini golf nearby, we thought we&#39;d give this branch a try.  We phoned to get an idea of the wait time was.  The rep had no clue when I called.  The first call got &#34;disconnected&#34; apparently.  The second time I called, she placed me on hold to find out.  Three minutes went by without a response,  so I hung up.  <br><br>We drove there within 10 minutes and there wasn&#39;t even one person waiting in the lobby nor outside.  We were told it was going to be a 45-minute wait.  When we asked why since they were empty, the rude front desk girl said, &#34;Well, yes, people are waiting.&#34;  Really?  No one around and with many empty tables in the restaurant ???  We then asked to speak to a manager and with a rolling of the eyes, the front desk girl paged her.  <br><br>Stephanie the manager came out.  I explained the situation and asked why there would be a 45 min. wait when the restaurant was practically empty.  I even showed her my phone with the calls I had placed, and she saw that I was not lying.  She told me that she was going to accommodate us right away, that there were two empty tables and were going to wait for a third table to pay and leave so they could seat us.  To make a long story short, 25 minutes went by before I saw the manager again walking around.  I approached Stephanie again asking if she had forgotten about us.  She was shocked to see that we had not been seated.  At that point, we were seated right away.  <br><br>I ask myself, why are they so rude?  Who do they think they are?  People with higher class and education don&#39;t do that.  If the front desk people are not happy or hate their jobs, then they should leave!  But while they&#39;re there working and getting paid a salary that comes directly from customers&#39; money, then the least they should do is do their job in a decent manner.   <br><br>There was no reason to make us wait at all!!  We love Cheesecake Factory and love to take our kids&#39; friends there to eat as part of their birthday celebrations.  We now know never to step in the Sherman Oaks Cheesecake Factory ever again.
Love the restaurant. But the wait time is killing me every time we decide to eat there!!<br>Love the food, the service is good and quick,,,,,BUTTTTT....the wait....<br>Still going and eating there!

Food was as expected from Cheesecake Factory. I noticed while checking my bank statement that they overcharged me by about 50%. Luckily, my wonderful credit union dealt with it for me. This was my first visit at this location and if i do return I will make sure to pay cash.
Like this location in the sherman oaks, mall. Food is always so good here especially the vanilla cheesecake a must have after a meal here. Service also great here

I usually rave about the Cheesecake Factory food and service BUT tonight I had a very different experience . We had a lovely waitress but it took over an hour to get our food ...other tables were served as we still waited .After asking several times to our waitress and being told Kitchen was busy got lots of orders at the same time the manager Justin came . Justin had no personality and seemed not to care . He offered us at this point soup or salad ...really ! Another 5 minutes went by Justin delivered the food or should I say dropped it off and never came back to see if all was OK ... really and he is a manager !<br>The food was luke warm but at this point we were hungry after waiting an hour plus and also no one seemed to care ...Justin disappeared and left the waitress who felt so bad to deal with it ...Justin needs to be in another position till he learns to deal with customers and resolve the problem so the customer is happy and not telling all on yelp... thanks yelp for the platform to tell the story ... I do intend to tell friends and call there corporate offices in Calabasas CA...maybe this will make Justin rethink his attitude and actions ...I will think twice before returning

Great location to meet friends however, the food was nothing spectacular and they completely failed to meet our expectations when we had requested one meal be without garlic and onion due to allergic considerations.

Despite the fact that this restaurant is a chain, it seems to be a favorite for many cheesecake lovers. <br><br>A drink called chocolate monkey, the endive pecan salad, and pumpkin cheesecake made up for my less than perfect fettuccine with sun-dried tomatoes. Our waiter was friendly, and attentive, and it made for a perfect sunday-afternoon lunch with the girls. <br><br>It&#39;s not the best for a romantic dinner (all of them seem to be too noisy and crowded), but it&#39;s a nice place for family or friends to gather.

I had a horrible experience at this Cheesecake Factory. I went to the Cheesecake Factory with my family on a Saturday night. Our buzzard went off and we handed it to the hostess.  We waited for our name to be called and it never was. I approached the hostess and she admitted it was their mistake however they continued to seat other parties before sitting us. I approached her again and this time instead of apologizing, she rolled her eyes at me. I was then seated and noticed dirty utensils on the table. I returned them to the girl who was seating us and she too gave me a dirty look. Do they expect their customers to eat with dirty utensils?

Here for a relative&#39;s birthday dinner on Tuesday and Ricky is our waiter. He&#39;s fantastic! I have a dairy allergy and he went out of his way to make sure I had a dairy-free meal. He is attentive, prompt, and courteous; excellent service, especially considering that we were a party of 9. Thank you for making dinner great, Ricky!!!

Okay, I think it&#39;s unfair the wrap that the Cheesecake Factory Sherman Oaks location gets.  I hadn&#39;t been there in a year or two but fondly remember enjoying them.  A few friends and I went this past week though and I must say, I actually felt they kicked it up a notch.<br><br>Maybe I just get lucky when I go, maybe they recognize me, maybe they heard a &#34;yelper&#34; was in the building lol, I don&#39;t know...but the fact is, this time our service was extremely speedy, the food was great, &#34;I had a shrimp and bacon style sandwhich, something new on their menu, don&#39;t even know if it&#39;s a regular thing, but it tasted great&#34;, and was given extra bacon free of charge because I simply said when they asked how everything was, that it felt light on the bacon...2 minutes later, he came by with a plate with 6 strips of bacon...MORE than enough, and didn&#39;t tell me he was doing it :)<br><br>both myself and the girls I was with were extremely pleased with our meals.  The bill for all 3 of us combined with a few drinks, came out around $70, not bad at all.  Everything was clean, and it was speedy too &#34;granted it was 4:30pm on a tuesday.<br><br>My bottom line is I left extremely satisfied and definitely recommend this location.<br><br>I give The Sherman Oaks Cheesecake Factory 5/5 stars.

The best place to eat prior to seeing a movie at the ArcLight Sherman Oaks. Great menu with lot&#39;s of choices, but for me is a bit overwhelming! Still love the quality and taste of most all dishes. Always too stuffed to order cheesecake, but they reign supreme!

Waited 30 min for a table, would have been skipped if I hadn&#39;t asked the hostess about our table. Placed our orders and then waited 30 minutes to find out what my girlfriend ordered is unavailable. They brought my food two minutes later and my girlfriend was too kind to complain but it was not acceptable. To call their food and service mediocre is extremely generous.

The food here is always good. But why do I seem to get waiters in the midst of their shifts. Manager comes over to apologize for the long long wait. Whatever, there are other restaurants around in the galleria.

I&#39;ve been sitting here for 52 minutes since I ordered my food. The food is still not here. Every Cheesecake Factory has the same food and same menu. So the food will always be the same. The service at this location is horrible. It&#39;s not even busy here. There is no excuse for making me and my party wait this long for such a simple meal. I won&#39;t be back here.

Been to this Cheesecake several times. The location is great if you&#39;d like to have a drink or dine before a movie at the ArcLight. They also validate parking up to a couple of hours. However, the service isn&#39;t as great compared to other Cheesecake Factories, and the food is hit or miss depending on how crowded the restaurant is when you dine there. If you&#39;re looking for a good Cheesecake Factory experience I&#39;d recommend going to the one at the Topanga Mall or Americana in Glendale instead.

This is the third time this happened. My food has been at the table while I am still waiting on the food for the rest of my party. So far, I have waited twelve minutes. I&#39;m also still waiting for the soy sauce I asked for to go with dinner. I&#39;m going to have a cold dinner. (The rest of my party&#39;s food arrived seventeen minutes after mine).<br><br>I completely understand that mistakes happen. However, this was the third time this has happened to us in this location. That&#39;s a training issue, not a mistake. <br><br>Having said that, the food is consistent, once it gets to you. It&#39;s not food I rave about, but it&#39;s solid, good food. I would have probably gave them a five-star review if it had not been for the service.

PROS:<br><br>The food is always delicious and the portions are VERY generous. The waiters/waitresses are always very friendly and knowledgable of the menu. The decor is nice. Looks upscale enough for a date night, but comfortable enough for a family dinner. And the location is great, right on Ventura Blvd, next to the 405, and in the same mall as the Arclight Theatre. <br><br>CONS:<br><br>There is always a wait and never any places to sit while you wait for your table. The lobby is very small, making it difficult to push through the crowd of people once your table is finally called. The hosts are never particularly friendly. The entire restaurant has a dysfunctional floorplan, you constantly have to dodge people and waiters on your way to/from your table and the restroom, all while trying not to knock food/drinks off other guests tables.<br><br>OVERALL:<br><br>Food is great! Restaurant needs to be renovated for a more functional floorplan and larger waiting area.
True 3.5 star restaurant.  Happy hour is pretty good for drinks and appetizers.  Better non-corporate restaurants out there with less choices on the menu.

I always was a huge fan of the taste, but as of today, will not return...<br>Still taste good, but today I saw  the person at the balcony bare naked hands literally grabbing my cheesecake after cleaning stuff and I was shocked - when I complained about that, someone that looks to be manager or so came to me and said that they are no longer required to use gloves... in other words... they actually don&#39;t care... if the standard is low... let&#39;s keep... and keep charging high prices...<br>that&#39;s DISGUSTING!!!! I will definitely spread the word...
Unhealthy food, It even says on their menu that the food can get you sick. No quality in their food and it actually does make you sick .

Yes, even Yelpers go to chains like Cheesecake Factory sometimes! It&#39;s great for a mixed crowd with different tastes and price points. I actually wasn&#39;t too hungry and opted to order from the &#34;small plates&#34; section. I had the beet &amp; goat cheese arugula salad and a tuna tartare--served with wonton chips and sesame vinaigrette. Both were tasty and reasonably priced. <br>For dessert, the five of us were going to share the key lime cheesecake until the waiter told us about an off-menu mango key lime that would soon be out of the restaurant. I love mango and I already wanted key lime, so why not? It turned out to be a great suggestion, right amount of sweetness and tang! Overall a good experience at Cheesecake Factory.

I always try to order it from here. Wished they delivered as much as we order from here. I&#39;m upset they don&#39;t serve the popcorn shrimp anymore but the dynamite shrimp will do lol. I also like getting the crazy Craig carrot cake cheesecake.

One of the worst host ever. He had zero sort of empathy or customer service. I don&#39;t know if he is new to the restaurant industry but he doesn&#39;t being in it. The Cheesecake Factory has always been a classy place in my eyes and his skills are beneath that. He should go and work somewhere that accepts his horrible characteristics flaws.

The service here is really bad. The food here is really good.<br><br>When I came in there were a lot of people waiting for a table. I got a heated patio table pretty quick. The patio was flaming hot. My group just couldn&#39;t sit there. It took quite a while to get a table inside. When we did get a table we got our waters and waited and waited and waited. Finally the waiter came and we ordered appetizers. We got our appetizers(after a while) and ordered our food. You can probably guess how fast the food got to our table.<br><br>     The food was so good. My appetizer was the fried Mac n cheese. It is one of the best things I&#39;ve ever eaten. For my main course I ordered the fried shrimp platter. The shrimp was pretty good. The coleslaw was flavorless. My meal was pretty good.<br><br>       This restaurant is service hell mixed with food heaven.

Very disappointed with the service this time around. We ordered the Tuna tartare as an appetizer and got something else and came out with our main entree. My sons pasta was cold and overall refills on drinks were delayed. Please hire more people.

This is an easy choice after viewing a movie at the Arclight. It&#39;s best at an off-time to avoid crowds. We went at 4:00 on a Saturday and only waited a few minutes. The menu has enough to please everybody. I opted for the Pasta Carbonara, without chicken. They brought it with chicken anyway, which I don&#39;t like because then they get skimpy on the bacon. They graciously took it back and remade it with extra bacon. It was amazing! So even though they made a mistake, they made it right swiftly.

I came to the Cheesecake Factory tonight for the first time &amp; must say I was impressed.  I loved the decor of the restaurant, it really made the experience nice.  The menu was really full of tons of options.  I had the Chicken &amp; Biscuits &amp; wow it was delicious.  My wife had the Kobe Burger &amp; it was amazing!!  Pricing was a little steep, but you do get a lot of food for the price so it balances itself out.  Next time I come here it will definitely be a date night with the wife &amp; not with the kids.  <br><br>Parking is kind of a pain in the butt since you have to park in the parking garage &amp; you basically have 2 hours to be in &amp; out for your validation from the restaurant to count.  Otherwise being located in the Galleria is a real nice experience.  I enjoyed being in a place with so much going on.

This CF-dining is fastly becoming a ritual~!<br><br>Quick easy parking (free under 2 hours), the usual ridiculous-caloried food (but they offer lite dining w/ calorie count for those watching the waistline), and cheesecakes galore.<br><br>We heart grubbin&#39; here mainly for convenience + options&#39; (read: 10+ page menu) sake.

Calamari was good and so was the mojito. I ordered the herb something salmon it was over cooked. They were very polite about it and got me a new plate. It was good the second time around. This place was very good service and food.
Happy hour is good!! The food is good ! Great service ! Lots of parking just get it validated! Great location

What&#39;s going on cheesecake? I have visited this place a few times in the last couple of months and the service is getting worse by every visit. This last encounter, we weren&#39;t even greeted and our waters didn&#39;t come until our appetizers did. Also, I ordered a gluten free dish which didn&#39;t come out gluten free and the waitress tried to argue with us. Like really???? Honestly, with all the amazing restaurants nearby, I keep giving them another chance. I&#39;m okay with not coming here for a while. The calories, service and lack of attention is just not worth it.
Always great food and good service. My favorite is their Steak Diane and Chicken combo.<br>The only downside is the long walk to the car in cold weather. Otherwise highly recommended.

The fastest, and nicest staff. Always busy, but great atmosphere. We had a woman, Dianne, covering our section. She was above and beyond sweet, and patient, even with every table filled. A++ This place also validates for Sherman Oaks Galleria. Big open floor plan.
Was there for the first time today&#39;s eve! So crowdy but even with a waiting line of 10 people they were able to give us 4 a seat within 5 minutes! Salad and desert was amazing! Go there!
Great service, food came hot and fast. Our waiter was called Tom very nice guy that took his time with us ordering..

Excellent meal last night at the Cheesecake Factory.  Had the spicy cashew chicken over white rice.  I&#39;m not usually a fan of &#34;spicy&#34; but this had such great flavor, that I couldn&#39;t resist.  It was a large portion (I should have taken some of it home, but I ended up eating the whole thing while I was there).<br><br>Couldn&#39;t decide between the Chocolate Tuxedo Cheese Cake or the Dutch Apple Streusel Caramel Cheese Cake for dessert - so I got them both! ( I was with friends so we shared).  If I&#39;m going to have a heart attack, at least I&#39;ll go out smiling.<br><br>Great service from the waiter, and very reasonable price. Always love this place - never had a bad meal.
The server was knowledgeable of the very big menu &amp; offered a great red wine selection. The jambalaya pasta was amazing &amp; the entire experience was pleasant.

I&#39;ve been coming to The Cheesecake Factory  since the only ones around were in Beverly Hills and MarinaDell Rey. Always loved the experience but now every time I come here, I am aggravated by the time I get to my table and not much happier when I leave. The lack of customer service in this location is quite seeious. I had an18 person team dinner here and they were really awful. The manager was somewhat sassy. I let it go. Tonight I came back with my family and it hasn&#39;t chaged. The front desk is where the welcome should be warm and here it&#39;s cold, almost like they can&#39;t be bothered. I suggest they get an app to figure out how to be warm and courteous
I used to love this place. I still love food there. But I&#39;m not going to come back here just cause of bad service. Never come back!

I love this location! our server was amazing! The food was addicting and amazing! I had the catfish meal I later ordered it the next day to go. Thanks for perfection cheesecake factory Sherman Oaks. No complaints.
Came here for happy hour with family... Had great time.. Waiter was friendly and service was prompt

We came here to celebrate my wife&#39;s birthday. We were a party of 8. We chose to sit on the patio around 7 pm on a Thursday. They set up our table<br>Immediately and we were seated. We ordered drinks and appetizers, and then out main course. All of the dinners came out except for my wife&#39;s. The waiter explained that it has been sent to another table my mistake and he would expedite another order. 2 minutes later the manager came out and explained the same story and said it would be about 10 minutes and he was very sorry, and the entree was on him.<br>After it came out, the manager checked on us again and made sure everything was good. He offered to buy us desert as well.<br>5 stars for a manager who was asked care of his customers first.

I ordered my food to go I was a bit confused to where to go to order take out the lady at the counter picked up the phone as I entered an started pointing so I went to where she pointed. <br><br>The guy behind the counter sounded like he was on a personal call and the lady who came to take my order didn&#39;t know the menu well. I knew exactly what I wanted because I get it all the time but some locations add chives/parsley (I don&#39;t know what its called but I described it to her) in the order some don&#39;t I don&#39;t like chives/parsley so I asked her if they have it in the item and she said no but when I opened my food guess what was in it? I didn&#39;t complain I let it go.<br><br>While I was waiting for my food there was another worker there who was really nice and wanted to make sure I was taken care of, I should of got his name he was real nice and made sure I was a happy customer! The food was good but the peas were under cooked/hard. <br><br>I got the shrimp carbonara, red velvet cheesecake and a Shirley temple (was kinda sad this location didn&#39;t do crushed ice but I&#39;ll survive!).<br><br>No long lines, not to busy during lunch hour

I&#39;m definitely done with cheesecake factory. Tonight the chef claimed he made me a plate of steamed green beans.. Straight BS... I don&#39;t eat butter on a regular basis so I&#39;m very sensitive to it. I know what it taste like, ESPECIALLY on my vegetables. I brought it to the bartender&#39;s attention and he supposedly took them back. He came back with the same damn plate of &#34;steamed&#34; green beans... The chef took butter smothered green beans and dropped them in boiling water hoping the butter would rinse off.<br>It didn&#39;t completely and the oily residue on my hands and on my plate wasn&#39;t enough for them to be honest, so whatever. I&#39;m not coming back EVER. I plan to share this with my friends... This place uses about 20lbs of oil and butter on food anyway daily, so I expected them to be honest about their &#34;technique&#34; to make things healthier. I&#39;m a health professional so thank God I&#39;m now wise enough to not go back and caution my friends who aren&#39;t ignorant to what STEAMED vegetables actually taste like and make sure they are aware to avoid this place at all cost.

To the management: please don&#39;t make me wait 20 minutes for a table and then when you seat me, walk me by 3 sections of empty tables. It tells me you don&#39;t know how to manage your restaurant by having enough servers . And it&#39;s infuriating.

I am beyond frustrated by the way the manager at this location has treated by friends and I for my birthday.  I called in a week or two early and spoke to a manager on duty by the name of Brent or Brett. I seeked his advice on how to have my birthday dinner at the restaurant on March 9th at 7pm with about 30 people.  He advised me they do not take reservations, but to come in an hour earlier and put my name down, and since it was a Monday, it is there slowest day of the week so being seated with my group should not be a problem.  I arrived on March 9th at 6:15pm and the manager on duty, her name was Sara and she informed me she could seat my group immediately. I informed her I informed my group to arrive at 7pm but I am in early to put my name down as per the previous manager I spoke to.  The manager, Sara, was soo rude.  She informed me and my boyfriend that she has a server who will be holding the section off for 40 minutes so my party needed to arrive at 7p and at the latest 7:05p or else she will give up our table and the rest of my group will be seated elsewhere. The way she approached me and my boyfriend was very condescending, not accomodating in any way. She came back at 7:05p, huffing and puffing and said she has to give up our table or seat whoever is here. I informed her I was not going to have my friends who drive from Corona and the OC who was stuck in traffic for 2.5 hours to sit somewhere else when it was my birthday dinner. My friends tried to speak to her and she did not care. When my friend informed her that we would carry the group elsewhere her response to us was &#34;have a good night&#34;. We informed her that she lost a group of 30 people. She did not care. This place is rude, unprofessional, no sense of customer service whatsoever. I am appalled that Sara was the manager for a restaurant of a large food chain like this. Their corporate headquarters will definitely be hearing from me.

Appetizers 1)tuna tartar tastes fresh!!! 2)tex mex eggroll 3)lettuce wrap<br><br>Main Chicken Madiera can share btw 2 peeps (most tender n flavorful chicken with melting mozzarella, asparagus, n mashed potatoes) *Drool* <br><br>Dessert Any cheesecake<br><br>*May experience long wait~no reservations allowed (thumbs-down) BUT...gives you time to narrow down and select your food from the PAGESSSSSS of the menu they have*

We had dinner here last night, and Zander was our server. He was so nice, recommended wonderful appetizers to us (we are vegetarian, he recommended the stuffed mushrooms and fried cheese), and everything was really good. Zander gave such kind and excellent service. He made our night! We felt very welcome. And of course the red velvet cheesecake was amazing as always. We highly recommend this location!

Can&#39;t go wrong with Cheesecake Factory! service is always EXCELLENT &amp; Food is good..Only 4 stars at this one because whomever made my Cappucino...well it must have been their first time or tired! The Coffee was Lukewarm (old) and it looked like a Mess. But the server saw my displeasure and Whisked the offending cup away!!<br><br>The Hibachi steak was yumm

This used to be my favorite  Cheesecake Factory, but it has slid downhill.  I ordered a salad off the skinnylicious menu and added a chicken breast to my order.  The chicken breast had gristle around the outside edge and I had to spit it out at one point. It was a new low for this Sepulveda  restaurant.

After the wait, usually lengthy at the busy hours on Fri/Sat nights, the service has been generally good. TCF has the most diverse menu anywhere, all types of food. The appetizers are very good and I really enjoy the Thai Lettuce Wraps as a main course. Sometimes the pour on a glass of wine can be disappointing, but overall TCF  is a great place to dine and also share a dessert.

Cheesecake Factory is always a winner! :) Has something for every appetite.<br>Ask for a calorie menu...you&#39;ll fine hardly anything is under 1,000 but I guess that&#39;s what makes it so good. ;) <br>At this specific one, plan to park and walk a bit.

I come here often I like this one more than any other due to its location. I love sitting outside esp on weekends it&#39;s a good environment ,good feel esp since it&#39;s so*cal so its never that cold &amp; if it is they have heaters so no biggie. <br><br>It&#39;s  located in a galleria so it&#39;s usually busy. Overall the food is very good I&#39;ve tried almost everything &amp;I love the big portions, makes a great leftover :)

This has been my go to Cheesecake Factory for years. The staff is fantastic, the food is consistently delicious and the ambiance never gets old. <br><br>On my last visit, Steven, one of the managers, really went out of his way to make sure I was a happy customer. He is excellent at his job! <br><br>Will absolutely be back..especially if the blueberry cheesecake comes back!
Just like any other Cheesecake Factory in America. Good food. Big portions. Not bad prices. A good go-to chain restaurant!

I&#39;ve been to Cheesecake Factory a number of times at this location and tried quite a number of selections, including their cajun fried chicken, pasta da vinci, chicken marsala, chicken sesame, and pasta jumbalaya. In all, their food is pretty solid. But definitely not A league material. The problem is that some of their dishes are pretty great, while others are kind of lackluster in taste and/or quality. Actually, if I could give this restaurant a 3.5 rating, I would. But I guess the 3 will have to do.<br><br>In all, is this a restaurant I would recommend if you haven&#39;t tried it already? I wouldn&#39;t highly recommend it, yet I wouldn&#39;t discourage it either. The food will still be satisfactory for the most part, and it&#39;s great for large parties. The service is good as is the parking in the Sherman oaks location. But my 3 star rating goes to food taste/quality only.

Admittedly not a fan of chain food, but had enjoyed this place from time to time when in the area -- until our most recent visit, during which not only was one of our glasses (from the bar) dirty when it arrived with a drink in it, but so was every silverware roll-up at our table... Along with the four other roll-ups (silverware) we grabbed (trying to find clean ones) from another table. Insult to injury? Although the manager came by and apologized, we weren&#39;t comped anything. Don&#39;t get me wrong, we weren&#39;t looking for free food. But would it have hurt their budget to offer a piece of cheesecake or buy us a drink for good measure? Consistently dirty utensils (and glass) is disgusting.

Going away party for a friend where 8 of us got together on a Tuesday night. Our server Mary, was AMAZE-BALLS. Attentive, funny, informative.<br><br>Definitely recommend for large groups. Plenty of meal options and fast service. Great staff.

It was 3:34 on Monday 10/20/14.  It was not very busy in the restaurant.  We were seated in a booth by a Servers Station.  There was a Blond Female Server having a lengthy conversation with the booth of men seated behind us. After she finished speaking with them she then proceeded to join another female server at the station and proceed to have a lengthy conversation with her.  Meanwhile my companion and I were sitting, with menus closed clearly waiting to order, as we had more than enough time to make our selections. We waited and waited.  Finally I had to interrupt her personal conversation with her coworker and ask if one of the two was our server. She then replied that she was our server. I then had to request for her to take my drink and food order as I was thirsty and hungry equally.  <br><br>She took our order brought us our drinks and went back to the booth behind us to continue talking with the group of men sitting there.  We could not tell if she knew them but either way was overly attentive to them.  Again while having another lengthy conversation with them one of her other tables got up and reminded her she was waiting on her refill. Instead of immediately going to get her drink she told her &#34;just a minute&#34;. The lady walked back to her table. Server continued with her convo and then eventually went to get the ladies drink refill. She passed by our table several times but never offered to get us Iced Tea refills.  We, again had to bring to her attention that we needed refills.  I wish my party of two held the same attention for her as the booth of men behind us did for her.  I then believe we would have received the Quality of  service we should have received instead of what we got today.  I&#39;m very disappointed with my visit today at your location as I frequent your location, the Pasadena location and Rancho Cucamonga location and have never had to bring up the subject of Poor Service before this instance. FINALLY the Server who provided us with this bad experience was : &#34;Catherine C&#34; this how her name appears on our check. Check #0254

We got told its a 20-25 min wait. We went back inside to ask about our table and learned that the lady never put us on the waiting list. We were lucky and they had a table for us. I have been at the Cheesecake Factory in Santa Monica and Valencia multiple times but in this location I got very rudely told my ID, which is from Switzerland couldnt be accepted and they won&#39;t serve me alcohol. The waitress immediately took this to her supervisor which didn&#39;t have less of an attitude against me and even accused me of being lucky for &#34;getting away with this&#34; at other locations. I never heard of that policy that they only accept passports and never had an issue anywhere else. Definetly won&#39;t go back there!

I don&#39;t write too many reviews on yelp but I had to chime in on the disorganization of this Cheesecake Factory. I&#39;m a store manager at a retail store and understand how busy and crazy it can get in a customer service oriented environment. However, this restaurant and the communication between staff as well as communication from Customer to Employee is something I haven&#39;t seen in awhile. I gave my name at 7:05pm and was told it would be a 20-25 minute wait. I specifically wanted the patio area facing Ventura; we live in the area and usually grab to go. After waiting 35 minutes I went to check in. I gave it an extra 10 minutes bc I did see they were very busy. I came in and the hostess stated it would be another 10 minutes. We waited another 20 minutes and were called only to be taken to an inside seat. At this point, I had seen three couples who came in after us seated in the patio area. I explained the situation to one of the runners who was going to seat us at the table. She went to check with her supervisor, who based on her facial expression didn&#39;t really care. The hostess came back and said &#34;it would be another 10 minutes.&#34; We barely come in and eat here and now I know I never will. I compare it to my own retail store. For example, what if I rang up a customer all the way in the back and skipped a certain individual just because of poor communication or just plain bias. That&#39;s what it felt like and honestly that&#39;s what it was. As a professional in customer service for 10 years this particular establishment is not organized nor is it run smoothly. It operates on fake smiles and &#34;I&#39;m so sorry about that&#34; without meeting your eyes.

Always on point. Every CCF I&#39;ve been to, never disappoints. Food is ALWAYS consistently good. I often ask for special extras or deletions and my servers always meet and exceed my expectations. I find it fun to order something different, but I do have my favorites. Sweet Corn Tamalitas, Evelyn&#39;s Pasta w/ chicken, BBQ Chicken Chop Salad... And don&#39;t get me started with Cheesecake. But my true favorite dessert is the Lemoncello Cake.
Great cheesecake! I had salmon and broccoli and it was super delicious!! <br><br>Tuxedo cheesecake YUMM!!!!

Kim Cameron, Valencia, CA<br>This place is a family favorite!!! We go to Cheesecake Factory all the time for birthdays and special events. The Miso Salmon, Beet Salad (it&#39;s on the specials menu), and Fried Macaroni and Cheese are all amazing!! And the Cheesecake, yummmmmm... need I say more? My favorite: Strawberry Cheesecake!!!

I&#39;ve been eating here for years. Sometimes I order and park on the curb and go right in to get my food. Staff is always nice. Especially Cristina. She&#39;s always pleasant and goes above and beyond. I want to give them 5 stars but sometimes my phone orders turn our wrong.

Not so good anymore. The quality and cleanliness is at a zero! Idk what&#39;s going on with them but every time I end up going there it&#39;s either one. Today I had both issues with quality of food and cleanliness. The table was dirty, the floor as well, and the chairs had food crumbs and splatter all over. And when I ordered my plate the turkey smelled and tasted nasty! I&#39;m very disappointed. From now on is rather just order to go and not have to deal with the attitude the staff gave me.

Went here on Veterans Day.  Swamped with people, but no wait time.  The waitresses were running around out of control.   I think maybe they need more wait staff when they have a super busy day like they were having.  This location is really loud also with all the tables being filled.  I felt like I was reading the lips of the waitress since I couldn&#39;t hear what she was saying because of the loudness.  They brought a high chair, but the strap was broken.  They should invest in some new ones since it was also sticky.  (ick)  Food was good, hot and tasted fresh.  Our waitress was so busy, she never came to re-fill the waters, so I went and refilled them myself.  We gave her a break on the service since she was running around, taking orders and was really, really busy with no help at all!!!  We&#39;ll be back, but probably not on a holiday.

I don&#39;t get it. Why does this place only have 3.5 stars? I&#39;ve never had a bad experience here with the service or food and I&#39;ve been here so very many times(good place for a date). <br><br>Love love love the herb crusted salmon, steak and shrimp combo was my recent discovery and now it&#39;s my new fav. The only thing I&#39;ve had that&#39;s not so good is the jambalaya. Love all the cheesecake but my go to dessert choice is their warm pie and ice cream(forgot the name). It&#39;s huge and superbly satisfying for my sweet tooth

Love this location!<br>Usually get seated in a timely manner... The service is great... <br>Parking is good, nice little walk to the location. <br>Our waiter last night was very helpful, and he was friendly and funny. <br>Had the BBQ Chicken salad and it was really good. The portions are so big its amazing. There will always be left overs for tomorrow and the salad tastes even better the next day! <br>The Tiramisu is to die for... the cake not the cheesecake! <br>There is something for every taste bud on their menu. The menu is a whole book filled with yummy yummy food! <br><br>Will be back! =]

Had the most terrible experience today. After coming to the place and checked-in(there was a line of couple people waiting) was told that I will be seated in a few. I asked if there is a line and hosted replied that I&#39;m 3rd in line and it would be just a couple of minutes. I didn&#39;t count people waiting though...but after ten minutes waiting I noticed something weird different people standing near and looks like some just came in and was already seated. I decided to wait 5 more minutes. After coming back to front desk and asking what is my place in line hostess replied &#34;They&#39;re cleaning the tables and you will be seated shortly&#34;. She just told me this standard phrase and she didn&#39;t even bother to double check. I believed her and waited 15 more minutes. The situation was already ridiculous and I asked some other lady standing near the front desk. She checked my name in line and didn&#39;t find it. She asked the main hostess what&#39;s up, and she checked also and replied &#34;well it was there&#34;. After than I was seated. Sound like no big deal...well for me wait 30 or 40 minutes not a big deal. But the way this lady treat me is unacceptable. Excuse me, am I in McDonalds? What&#39;s more frustrating - this lady lied to me! She just lied, didn&#39;t bother to do her job and finally didn&#39;t even asked apology this? No seriously simple &#34;I&#39;m sorry I messed up with your place in line&#34; would do. But no...nothing. And you know why? Because she doesn&#39;t sorry. She doesn&#39;t care. She&#39;s there 10am to 6pm 5 days a week whatever. Paycheck is coming and that&#39;s it. No efforts to do her job properly. Poor customer service, disorganized staff. Worst experience ever.

Came here with my mother tonight to celebrate and had nothing but disrespect from an employee behind the bar. Our bartender Erica was splendid, however, her coworker Brian was extremely disrespectful and rude. He was chewing and chomping on a piece of gum while he was serving his guests and I confronted him about his sanitation violation. He immediately began to disrespect me with his sarcastic tone and<br>words. He spit it out in front of me and left the bar. After about 2/3 minutes, he returned and popped in another piece of gum and began to over exaggerate chewing that piece. He approached us and said &#34;wow thank you! I hope you come in every time I work just to keep me in line!&#34; And stormed off. My mother and I are both chefs and currently work in health and sanitation departments. What this employee was<br>doing was disgusting and against the health code. All I tried doing was help him save his job and the restaurants grade. <br><br>We ordered the Cuban rolls.... They were<br>Awful. However, the potato tots and the French country salad were nice. <br><br>We will eventually return and hopefully Brian will be gum-less.

My Girlfriend loves this place! Good and friendly customer service!<br><br>We always start with the guacamole and avocado egg rolls!!<br>Margarita is a must!!! Specially the strawberry one.<br><br>Try it! many plates to choose from and is not expensive at all! Good quality of food.
The menu is so huge so it makes it difficult to pick something, specially for first timers. Overall the food is great. The service is amazing. And there is not much of a wait time.

The girls at the front desk are horrible and I mean HORRIBLE. The waiter was nice the firecracker salmon was way to sweet. The steak I ordered medium rare was WELL DONE AND BURNED ON TOP.  Now I am alone in a table and I don&#39;t like acting like a bitch so i paid and left but this was completely horrible. I do not recommend this cheesecake factory at all.

The Peach Bellini will always satiate my alcoholic palate... As will the Asian Pear Martini and the house Cabernet Sauvignon. This is not to say that I am an alcoholic, but to simply put that I love CCF&#39;s beverage menu.  I always order a fish entree or the luau salad (no chicken and dressing on the side). Tonight I tried the Mediterranean Salmon. Deliciously delightful with a light EVOO sauce with bruschetta and capers, set on top of a nice mound of their famous red mashed potatoes.  I understand CCF will be changing their menu on 8/11, so I really hope this dish stays on the menu. <br><br>There were a couple of times we had to question where our server had gone, but every 15-20 minutes or so he&#39;d pop up again.  <br><br>P.S., the floor at this location is unbearably slippery. Make sure to wear your flats instead of super cute stiletto heels... You know what I mean.

Stopped in Cheesecake Factory for Happy Hour after the movie. The soup of the day was Creamy mushroom - and it had more than one time of mushroom in it. It was delicious. <br> I also got the Vietnamese Shrimp Egg Roll, which I kind of chopped up into a salad. There were noodles and veggies inside and it was also delicious.<br>And ant Happy hour prices you can&#39;t beat it.<br>My only complaint was when I first arrived there was a problem seating me. I wanted to sit in the bar area, but at a low table. I guess the waitress was trying to fill out the back section of the bar. And I bluntly said &#34;I am not sitting back here.&#34; She started to say something, and I repeated &#34;I am not sitting in the back section.&#34; And then I pointed to a table and said &#34;I want to sit there.&#34;, and she said there was no waiter for that area. So finally on my third try we found a table for me to sit. <br>I should have just taken the hostesses first seating choice, because it turned out that the women who came in later and sat next to me, had a cold and was coughing throughout her meal. I was sitting there wishing I had taken the hostesses for choice for a table and sat in the back.

this place is good the only reason why i am not giving them 5 stars is becasue they need to have the white chocolate rasberry truffle cheesecake for the one more star lol But i love this place unlike the location in glendale their table ware was CLEAN!!!!! I&#39;m actually gonna change my mind and give them 5 stars bc cleanliness is above all when it comes down to restaurants.. at least for me! :)

Amazing avocado rolls,best oreo cheesecake and the service was great.<br>the only bad thing is not being able to make a reservation and the wait time crazy but aside from that its by far my favorite restaurant

Took me wife here for a Mothers Day treat on Sat to avoid Sunday crowds to my surprise it was a 35 minute wait so we were handed a pager and to my surprise we only waited 5 minutes! <br>Next we were seated outdoors in a confortable small area next to singer Brandi! Pretty cool as I loved her music. Next we were greated by the sweetest waitress Kelly W. she was great her attitude was awesome even while she was responsible for caring for other patrons she made us feel as if we were the only ones. Refills were pletny and her concern over a little overcooked filet was awesome even after I assured her it was ok...Would I go back yes if my wallet was a little fuller and we could get  the same waitress. Way to go Cheesecake Factory I usually never give 5 stars!

The Ranch is the best you will ever find!  <br>This is a good location, good ambience and very good seating if you sit outside..<br>Their food is good and staff is very friendly here....<br>Will defiantly come back many times more hopefully!

OMG!!  Okay, the food is good, that&#39;s a given.  But, getting a table and being treated like a person ... that&#39;s another story!<br>got there at 3pm for early dinner.  Told it was a 20 minute wait.  after 35 minutes, I went up and asked them  They said that they had paged me (I was sitting nearly infront of them!).  I handed them the pager and said it&#39;s not working then!  Why didn&#39;t they call our name?  No answer, the girl took the pager, and handed it to another girl.  That was the last time anyone spoke to me!  I kept asking &#34;Can someone please acknowledge that I&#39;m standing here asking questions?&#34;  NO ONE DID.  I wasn&#39;t yelling, I was polite.  So after another 5 minutes, a man walked up and said we can sit you in the bar (which has open seating anyway).  I said, we&#39;ve been waiting for longer than promised and no one will tell me why they gave me a faulty pager? Or why I wasn&#39;t being addressed at all.  he apologized and then sat us outside which was fine.  We sat there waiting for someone to even bring us water.<br>Needless to say, there are other wonderful restaurants in the Los Angeles area.  I WILL NEVER EAT THERE AGAIN!  EVER!!!  I&#39;ve never felt so ignored and although our actual waitress was lovely (once she showed up), even the food came out wrong (sigh)!.<br>Oh, I did complain but nothing came of it.

I generally am a fan of cheesecake factory. This was located in Galleria I really like to setting very nice and clean. Our server was very nice and accommodating <br>Try the sliders they are very good and tasty.  <br>I ordered the tiramisu cheescake here and was very good. <br>Outdoor seating here is nice.

sadly, not their best service.<br><br>The food is not bad. Nothing special, but you do get lots of choices.<br>Came here for a birthday beginning of Dec.<br><br>The usual business.... parked in the structure, walked in, waited 25 minutes to be seated. Nothing I didn&#39;t expect.<br><br>Once seated our server came by. I felt like we didn&#39;t click right away...<br>She just seemed distant, only wanted to take the order and walk away.<br><br>We asked for bread several times. Had to wait for water refills.<br>but the thing that REALLY pissed me off was that she offered the table next to me fresh Parmesan cheese for their pasta... but I wasn&#39;t offered any (I ORDERED PASTA!) When I tried to get her attention, she ignored me...<br><br>Not cool...<br><br>Also, when I told her it was a birthday, she said we can either buy a slice of cheesecake OR get a small sundae on the house... I asked a reasonable question &#34;Can we get both?&#34;... which seemed to stump her. She left to go ask someone... It was the weirdest thing.<br><br>Long story short, there are way too many good restaurants in the valley to have to put up with places like this... I will not be back

I have been here a lot of times for the past 15 years ,different locations and the food is really good, I love their shrimp scampi always great. I eat outside a lot and this is the only place you can order anything out of the menu and at the least it will be good. Great place to come on any occasion. Will be back for sure!

I haven&#39;t been to The Cheesecake Factory in a really long time and I&#39;ve never been to this location. We did not have to wait for a table, which was really nice. It was decorated in the typical Cheesecake Factory way, dim lighting, lots of white. <br><br>The best part of The Cheesecake Factory is obviously their bread. Their bread is always delicious and wonderful. I don&#39;t know what it is, maybe they put crack in it, but it&#39;s hard to resist. <br><br>I ordered the chicken stuffed quesadillas which came with onions, cilantro, delicious cheese and chicken, it was really good. I wanted to eat the entire thing but I couldn&#39;t as I was so stuffed. <br><br>For dessert, I ordered the tiramisu cheesecake which was delicious! I fully enjoyed the full taste of tiramisu combined with the creaminess of the cheesecake. Their cheesecake is extremely rich which almost took away from the lightness of the tiramisu but it was interesting combining the two textures. <br><br>I would totally come back. They have this dish that comes with corn cakes that I want to try.

As usual, great food and awesome service from &#34;Zander&#34;. Came here to celebrate my son&#39;s BDay and truly enjoyed the event. The garlic noodles was great. Will always consider this restaurant for a good time especially for special occasions.

Went with the Mac &amp; Cheese burger and fries.  Total carb overload but it was great! Took home the 30th anniversary chocolate cake cheese cake which was all you can imagine it to be.  Wonderful b-day dinner with wonderful people.
Awesome menu and service! I like spring rolls and tasty grill salmon. Vanilla cheesecake is very tasty.

Ordered a veggie burger, being a vegetarian. Waitress even repeated my order. Was served a turkey burger. I was polite, but that&#39;s a pretty egregious error for a server. Sorry guys. They comped the dish, which was nice, but doesn&#39;t change the one star rating of a normally very buttoned up restaurant; one that my family and I have been going to since it opened years ago.

Our server was very attentive and the food was great . We didn&#39;t have to wait very long for the food to arrive. We ordered calamari and fried potato tots for appetizer.   My daughter ordered corn dog with a side of fruit instead of French fries.  Her plate arrived with 3 mini corn dogs and sliced fruit which she enjoyed.  My mother ordered the Salmon Thai glazed with brown rice lunch special . It was very delicious and the salmon was cooked a little crispy - but we like it that way. The brown rice was soaked in what tasted like coconut milk! Yum! My boyfriend and I shared the chicken Madeira. For desert we ordered a slice of Tiramisu cheesecake and Oreo cheesecake.  Both very delicious and the slices came in big portions so we were able to take the rest home ! I would go again if I were in the area.
