I don&#39;t think I will be going back to this location any more... a RESTAURANT LIKE CHEESECAKE FACTORY, deals with crowds all the time so to see this quality of food it was very disappointing. We spent close to 200.00 dollars...oh and by the time we got the cheesecake it should have been called cheese shake.

I just can&#39;t explain how fresh and how good the service is to their costumes are. The Cheesecake Factory is one of the most breath taking Restaurant in the world. It has so many options of what you can eat. I just can&#39;t think of a better place to eat. !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

What can I say? Huge menu, good food, amazing cheesecake and a full service bar. <br><br>I&#39;ve been here several times and the only thing I&#39;m weary of here is how crowded it gets. It really affects the service sometimes. Other than that it&#39;s a great Cheesecake Factory location!<br><br>My favs are the meatloaf, Evelyn&#39;s favorite pasta, corn cakes, and the cobb salad. I&#39;m sure there&#39;s more but I can&#39;t recall past that cause now I&#39;m hungry. lol
Cheesecake always has great food and service. This location is nice too right on the galleria. Sometimes it does get pretty busy though.

We always dine in this restaurant .the appetizers always good . Avocado eggroll so delicious.  My wife order the shrimp pasta wasn&#39;t thatt good this time .the shrimp feel like out of the freezer and not cooked well and the sauce not even creamy . This time NoNo  for the food .

Cheesecake Factory usually doesn&#39;t disappoint. Our waiter was awesome, super attentive, and the wait was only like 10 min(yay!). Also they have a skinny menu now, which is pretty cool if your watching your portion/calorie intake :)

Eating options are kinda limited at the Sherman oaks galleria, and my husband and I were going to see a movie there. We decided on Cheesecake Factory, even though my gut said not to. We got in quick, and the menu is giant! It&#39;s super crowded and you kinda feel like your a sardine in a very noisy can. Anyway our waiter comes gets us drinks says he&#39;ll be right back...20 mins later...entrees ordered, 30 mins later, no entree and empty drinks, have not seen our waiter to ask for refills. All the other waiters fly by as I try to flag one down. 10 more mins, ok food come, a different waiter spills hot grave on my husband, responds, &#34;oh I didn&#39;t know it was spilling.&#34; Cleans it up and scurried away before we could ask for refills or anything else. We are shoveling our food in our faces so we can get to our movie. Our waiter finally comes...to give the bill to the table next to us, without even looking at us, he turns away. I had to Flagg him down to ask for a refill and tobacco. Refills come 5mins later, no tobacco. At this point I just hand him my credit card and ask for the bill. The bill came back immediately. I still have him 20% tip even thought it was a horrible experience and a horrible server. I am sure he was just super busy, but for the price, cheap quality of the food, and the service...never again cheese cake factory. <br><br>On a side note: I saw something kinda gross, my they were clearing the table next to us, busser pulls a dirty rag out of his apron and wipes down the table, then puts clean silverware right on the surface of the table. How is that keeping the utensils clean? My suggestion is if you decide to go there, as for a new set, because it doesn&#39;t look like they really clean the table top from previous customers before they put the silverware you put in your mouth on it.

Oh where to begin, where to begin. Ok here, we&#39;ll start here. I was forced to eat here. It was a surprise going away gathering and I was responsible only for making sure that the guest of honor arrived on time and at the right location. The guest of honor asked me a few times where we were going and I had to keep telling them that it was a secret because if they knew we were going to Cheesecake Factory they would know something was up because they know me and they know I wouldn&#39;t pick this restaurant for the dining pleasures of the two of us. <br><br>The surprise went well, but that was really all that went well. The 20 minute wait turned into nearly an hour. Once the pager went off even the hostess tried to make a joke about the wait to lighten the mood and apologized. Appreciate the effort.<br><br>We were seated and spent almost exactly enough time to get situated and open our menu before the manager came over and asked the entire party of 6 to move from a table to a smaller booth. Really? We waited an hour for your hostess to put us at the &#39;wrong&#39; table? Thanks.<br><br>Now this next blip on the radar was out of the control of the restaurant because the fire alarm went off. No biggie, maybe a kid pulled it, maybe there&#39;s a fire, maybe it&#39;s a test. Maybe our server could have come by the table and told us what was going on, like if we needed to leave, or be worried, of if the restaurant turned into a strobe filled disco at 8:00. Nope, after enough time to get a headache from the noise and lights and ask each other questions like one of us was in on a prank we were able to flag down a server since ours was no where to be seen, maybe she evacuated, what was going on. At this point I was ready to leave and hadn&#39;t been for the group we would have.<br><br>So service gets a big fat ZERO.<br><br>Food, well the wheat bread was good, but that&#39;s easy to do. I&#39;ve had a few things at a few different CCF locations and I can never remember what I had the last time because I don&#39;t frequent the place often. I decided that Garlic Noodles sounded good. I was spoiled by the Garlic Noodles at Crustacean which are heaven, which I don&#39;t believe in, in a friggin bowl. The flavorless noodles at Cheesecake Factory are why I now believe in a hell.<br><br>My friend asked me the simple question, &#34;Did Crustacean ruin garlic noodles for you and are you being a food snob and not giving CheeseCake a fair chance because Crustacean has the best Garlic Noodles ever?&#34; My response was simple and honest. &#34;No! Crustacean did not ruin all other garlic noodles, CheeseCake Factory ruined theirs all by themselves.&#34;<br><br>I go to the ArcLight all the time and we pass CheeseCake Factory and in a pinch would have eaten there before a movie. That&#39;s no longer an option. <br><br>The only thing, ONLY thing I will enter this place for is a slice of cheesecake TOGO. So there&#39;s the positive in the review, I will eat their cheesecake and take it to go. The End.
I have visited the one on Ventura and the new one on Topanga Canyon on several occasions and both have been great. The one on Ventura is smaller. The food is great and big portions.

Great food. Great atmosphere. Great service. <br><br>Their menu makes War and Peace look like a doctor&#39;s office pamphlet. It&#39;s friggin HUGE!<br><br>My favorite items are: Avocado Spring Rolls. Mac and Cheese Balls. California Omelet. Gargantuan salads. Low Carb Cheesecake. They do great shakes too.<br><br>I know alot of foodies turn their noses up at corporate establishments like this but I like to judge food by what it tastes like and not where it comes from and the food here is routinely good to great.  <br><br>I come here a lot for lunch. Always have a happy experience. The tables in the bar area are first-come-first-serve so you don&#39;t have to wait to be seated.

I honestly don&#39;t mind this place haha. As long as I get the one thing I love. <br><br>1. Sun dried tomato pasta with chicken. NOM NOM NOM. it is soooo deliciously creamy and fatty with hunks of sun dried tomato throughout the pasta. I love this dish!! nom nom nom!!!

The first Cheesecake Factory I ever went to was in Beverly Hills--right before Cheesecake Factory exploded and became one of the more popular chain restaurants in the U.S.  I remember the large menu and the large portions.  Not much has changed.  Even though I felt their portions had actually gotten smaller a few years ago, that was definitely not the case at this very busy Cheesecake Factory located in the Sherman Oaks Galleria.<br><br>This Cheesecake Factory is similar to all the other ones in terms of atmosphere--big and very crowded with a more upscale decor than most family chain restaurants.<br><br>The complimentary bread was (as typically is the case) served warm.  There was a crusty French bread and a more hearty, flavorful and sweet pumpernickel bread.<br><br>I tried their crabcakes (from their appetizer menu).  The crabcakes had a crunchy, deep-fried outer shell.  The center of the crabcake was better than I expected--moist and warm with a good portion of crab meat.  The crabcake was garnished with a bold mustard sauce and a tartar sauce.<br><br>My entree was the Crusted Chicken Romano, which was kind of a play on Chicken Parmigiana.  The chicken breast was flattened and coated in a romano-parmesan crust.  Not really breaded like a chicken parmigiana--just a fried cheese crust.  The chicken was good.  Moist enough and a good flavor.<br><br>The chicken was served with a large portion of spaghetti in a tomato sauce.  The pasta was not swimming in tomato sauce like other places--really just lightly tossed in tomato sauce.  The spaghetti noodles were fine and cooked okay, but the sauce was quite salty.<br><br>For dessert, we tried the Chocolate Tuxedo Cream Cheesecake, which a Yelper recommended to me.  The cheesecake had a fudge cake base and was topped with chocolate cheesecake, a vanilla mascarpone mousse and a chocolate ganache top.  The cheesecake was garnished with whipped cream and an arty display of vanilla and chocolate sauces around the plate.<br><br>I prefer a lighter cheesecake to the dense cheesecakes found at The Cheesecake Factory.  This one was good though because the vanilla mascarpone was light and creamy and provided a good and needed contrast to the rich and chocolatey cheesecake.<br><br>Service was good.  The waitress was personable and food came out quickly.  Other servers were polite and helpful.<br><br>I hardly ever eat at Cheesecake Factory anymore, but this one seems like an okay version of it.  So if you are a Cheesecake Factory fan, this seems like a safe place to stop.<br><br>Parking is available in the paid structure adjacent to the Sherman Oaks Galleria.  Cheesecake Factory validates parking for 2 hours.

As always, fantastic restaurant that the whole family loves. Took our 4 yr old for his birthday upon request. We were going to go to the new one in Topanga Mall but the opening was delayed a few days. Sherman Oaks location is great though. Love the skinnylicious menu but dont like having to say the word skinnylicious.
Went for happy hour with the bub and shared an appetizer and cheesecake. The waitress made my first happy hour experience the best. Debbie was so nice and attentive. Definitely coming back.

Very professional place, great for families and celebration! It matters what waiter you get, but mostly they are informed about their food! Would definitely come back! The wait especially at night time, is crazy!! Reserve before you go!!!
Bad service and cold calamari. Waitress forgot to put our order in. Then blamed the kitchen when it took another twenty minutes. I normally like Cheesecake Factory but this location is the pits!!!

Ugh. I hate the Cheesecake Factory. <br><br>I hate the long waits. I hate the uninspired, fattening food. The best thing on the menu is the Pasta Divinci, but you really shouldn&#39;t eat that unless you want a cream induced heart attack. <br><br>Cheesecake factory decided to trim down the 140 page menu to 112 pages and some how decided to get rid of the Veggie Burger. <br><br>Let me repeat: They got rid of the VEGGIE BURGER. <br><br>W.T.F. <br><br>This is LA! How can you not have a f&#39;ing veggie burger? <br><br>Let me digress. <br><br>Cheesecake Factory is for people who are OK with the idea of consuming thousands of calories before their main course arrives in the form of fried macaroni and cheese balls, followed by 5 pounds of creamy pasta, and capped off by a 3,000 calorie slice of Snickers cheesecake. <br><br>I do not subscribe to this, and neither should you. <br><br>F this place.

This last experience I had a cheesecake was great! First of all, our server Chad was AWESOME!! He was super patient with us because it took forever to look over that extremely long menu. He was very attentive, funny, and made some great suggestions.<br><br>My brother had a hard time deciding what to get and asked the server about a dish. The server said absolutely not and recommended a similar kind of dish that he assured my bro he would like. So my brother went with his suggestion. He LOVED it!! He said the food was crazy good. <br><br>There are different things that can make an experience. At a chain like Cheesecake, service is a big factor. Our service was fantastic and the new food we tried because of the server was delicious. Good times

Alright, alright. I hate reviewing chain restaurants and i&#39;ve especially avoided reviewing Cheesecake just because it&#39;s such a cliche middle class fake upscale restaurant. But! It is delicious and i don&#39;t know anyone who will really deny that. And this is by farrrrrr my favorite location. And it deserves more than 3.5 stars in my opinion.<br>Most of the people who don&#39;t like coming here just don&#39;t like it because it&#39;s not what i&#39;d consider a &#39;bargain&#39; and looking through the menu is like reading a novel that you flip back and forth in to re-read some sections. Annoyinggg.<br>Not for me though. I have literally tried most of the menu and while everything is delicious, i stick to a few select things.<br>1. My favorite, the Herb Crusted Salmon Salad. Delicious.<br>2. Club Sandwhich. their applewood smoked bacon is the best in the world. i&#39;m positive.<br>3. Chinese Chicken Salad. the plum vinaigrette is so good.<br>4. Chicken Piccata.<br><br>the list sort of goes on, but it&#39;s much less extensive than their entire menu haha. their eggs benedict is actually pretty good, as are their omelettes. I wish they had hashbrowns though :[<br>But who can say no to the fresh baked wheat and sourdough bread they give you? I can say no to the sourdough, but definitely not the wheat. I could live off that shit.<br>their lemonade is also a must. It&#39;s too strong for some people, but i&#39;m not some people. I eat lemons by themselves all the time (i know, i know, it&#39;s bad for your teeth. I&#39;ve cut back, don&#39;t worry). But their lemonade is the closest thing to a lemon as it gets. Mmmmmm. :)<br>Anyway. I could probably write a couple pages about how i&#39;m always satisfied when i come here (which is every single Sunday of every single week. Never fails.) <br>I also met Steven Speilberg and the entire cast of House and Gossip girls, amongst others. Not that cool, but whatever. It&#39;s nice to see celebrities outside of a typical trendy Hollywood joint.<br>there is no way you can come here and not find something that you&#39;ll like.

This is our official meeting spot for ex coworkers every two months, came here on Sunday 1/18/2014, as usual we sat outside, it was a lovely day.  Last time I ordered the eggs benedict, this time I wanted to try something new so I ordered the Monte Cristo sandwich, which was divine.  I especially loved the French toast!  On our next visit I&#39;m ordering French toast only because I could imagine how delicious it tastes!  I had my brunch with a glass of chardonnay and that was yummy as well.  Staff is always friendly. I love coming here... again the potatoes were a tad over cooked, but I think because they are not cooked to order, they are probably sitting under a heating lamp waiting to be served, they were not as bad as last time though... whew!

My husband and I are not usual customers of The Cheesecake Factory, but we received a gift card, so we decided to go to the Sherman Oaks location.  We went on Saturday , February 18 around 6:45pm, and the place was packed with a lot of people waiting.  We were told that the wait would be one hour, but we ended up getting seated after 40 minutes.  While we were waiting, we browsed through their extensive menu; I read through it about four times before I decided what I wanted to try.<br><br>We got seated and our waiter was Ryan, who was very friendly and gave us great service   The bread basket had a French baguette and brown bread, which was delicious.  My husband and I shared the French Country Salad (mixed greens, grilled asparagus, fresh beets, goat cheese, candied pecans and vinaigrette.)  We loved this salad and would order this again!  My husband loves pizza, so he ordered the Spicy Meat Pizza (Italian sausage, prosciutto, pepperoni, spicy \salami, caramelized onions and tomato.) and I ordered the Cajun Jambalaya Pasta, their most popular pasta dish (shrimp and chicken sautéed with onions, tomato and peppers in a very spicy cajun sauce, all on top of fresh linguini.  I love spicy, so I loved the pasta; so did my husband.  The servings were large, we ended taking home leftovers of the salad, pizza, and pasta dishes.<br><br>We left room for dessert and shared a slice of Linda&#39;s Fudge Cake (layers of rich chocolate cake and fudge frosting with chocolate chips.  To the side was a generous serving of whip cream.  We took half of that home too.<br><br>Overall, we enjoyed our evening, and the restaurant had a nice ambience.  Parking with validation was only $1.00.  When we left around 8:30pm, the place was still packed with a lot of people waiting.  We&#39;re not sure if the food, along with the higher prices, is worth the wait.

What you need to know before eating here! This is from the persepective of someone who currently works there (unless someone from corporate reads this, gets their panties in a wad and makes my life difficult).<br><br>Just want to give some useful tips going in that might make your experience better. <br><br>1)There is almost always a wait at night, espeically on Friday and Saturdays. Please come prepared. You can always score a seat at the bar with no wait but that only pertains to the bar top itself and the high top tables in the bar (meaning the 5 tables in the middle of the bar that separate the bar from the half booths.) The high top tables will be dirty, so please be patient as it takes time to clean.<br><br>2) Some people aren&#39;t aware that you can substitute *certain* side dishes on your plate for other items at no additional charge.  Make sure you ask before, as one a few items cannot be done or carry a small additional charge. <br><br>3) Smoking is no longer allowed on the patio, state law. <br><br>4) Speaking of laws, you must have a current United States government issued I.D. to order alcoholic beverages. It&#39;s the law people, sorry. <br><br>5) If you have a movie to catch, make sure you tell your server as they will do their best to meet that need. <br><br>6) Parking is  validated but only a receipt can be given as proof you ate there if you left it in the car. <br><br>7) During lunch the validation is only 2 hours, meaning after that is up parking cost 1.20 every 15 minutes. <br><br>8) There is only one soup per day, don&#39;t think they hide others from ya.<br><br>9) Water is no longer automatic because of a new California state law. Simply ask. <br><br>10) There is no printed kids menu, but there are kids items. Just ask.<br><br>And those were 10 things!
The food is ok but the customer service is horrible. I just called and waited on hold for 15 minutes to place an order. The manager was rude and said she doesn&#39;t take food orders.

OMG I GAINED LIKE 5LBS IN 1 WEEK WHEN I LIVED NEXT DOOR TO THIS PLACE! <br><br>Cheesecakes<br>Tuxedo<br>banana cream<br>snickers<br><br>Food<br>Buffalo blast<br>artichoke<br>ahi tartare<br>spicy ahi tempura roll<br><br>salmon<br>portabella sandwich<br>chicken picatta<br>chicken madeira<br>pork chops<br><br>chopped salad<br><br>Those are my favs<br><br>I HATE there MEATLOAF!!!! so nasty!!!
I have been a fan since I was 16 years old. I will always be a fan of Sherman Oaks Cheesecake Factory I LOVE IT!!!

I don&#39;t usually review chain restaurants because if you&#39;ve been to one, you know what you&#39;re gonna get in terms of food. However, I felt the service was so exceptional at this particular Cheesecake Factory that I had to come on to Yelp and give it a shout out. Wish I could remember our servers&#39; names, but we were there last Saturday sometime between 2-4pm and we were seated very near the bar. (Mentioning that in case management checks their Yelp reviews.) Excellent job to both of them.
Great food and friendly employees, thank you very much.

I don&#39;t always love the food at Cheesecake (except for the wheat bread. I love the wheat bread!) but, they definitely won me over the other day!<br><br>Brought the baby with me out to eat again (I can&#39;t really escape that little guy).  Anyhow, the waitress was fabulous. She greeted him and immediately took off on us to go get him a plate of bananas and some bread.  I didn&#39;t even know cheesecake had bananas.  Who knew?<br><br>Anyone who has a baby knows what an ordeal taking one out can be.  So, if a service person makes that experience easier, they&#39;re a winner in my book!<br><br>BTW, did you know you can get a half glass of wine at Cheesecake?  Again, another great attribute since I don&#39;t want to drive drunk.<br><br>Thank you Cheesecake!

Left happy, no complaints - get cheesecake! the whole thing. This one of TCF&#39;s finer locations, the wait can be hefty if you have a big party. Give me some of that yummy brown grained bread and some butter any day!
had the four cheese pasta for lunch and the macaroni balls w my girlfriend and it was great. not busy during lunch hours

I took the family to the cheesecake factory for a special dinner. Only it wasn&#39;t so special! We had to wait 20 minutes to sit down which was okay, they hit it right at the 20 minutes. Has a great waiter who was generally responsive and took care of us. Ordered a Ribeye steak and Mac &amp; cheese. The steak took over 40 minutes to get and the mac &amp; cheese arrived 10 minutes after that. I waited a total of 50 minutes to fully receive my dinner. Waiter said kitchen problems. Have eaten in this place before but I think it is going down hill, Good food, service isn&#39;t.

This place gets packed at lunch time. Sit in the bar area for the fastest seating. Try the new Skinnylicious menu to cut calories. I ordered the Turkey Burger and side salad. Yum. The Patty was delicious and the smaller bun took away the guilt. <br><br>I also ordered Cheesecake to take home which I just remembered is still in the fridge!!!    Yikes...  I better go eat it!<br><br>Don&#39;t forget to have your parking validated and visit the Urban Home next store. Love their Home furnishings and stuff!  Hate the mall.

I walked over to this Cheesecake factory for lunch, as I wanted a salad. Fortunately, the server sent me to the lunch menu, then encouraged the lunch portion. Even so, the salads are really BIG!<br><br>Ambiance was that of an older CKF with a layer of the Valley dirt. Ok, not really that bad....but, not great. <br><br>Service was great and there was no wait. The mango iced tea is pretty good and the salad was very average.

For my Birthday in October my mom gave me a $50 gift card to The Cheesecake Factory.  I saved it for a special occasion.--- Our 11 month anniversary on 11/11/11 :)<br>We called the night before and requested a reservation.  We were told that that night (a Friday) would be walk in only, we also found out that they stop seating at 12:30 am, which we thought was really cool since we are night owls anyway.<br><br>We arrived at 9:30pm and were seated less than a minute later.  <br>Our booth was a 2 seater on a main isle but almost all seats in this venue somehow maintain an intimate feel no matter where they are.<br>My boyfriend was a bit indecisive about what drink to order and even though the waitress(Adriene) did seem busy at the time she was patient with him and was willing to explain the drinks to him.  <br><br>Drinks<br><br>Bf- Long Island Ice Tea (which he sent back after he had a few sips to add more soda because it was strong, not necessarily a bad thing ;)<br>Me- Bud Light w/lime.<br><br>Entree<br><br>Bf- The Old Fashioned Hamburger.  He substituted the fries for broccoli (no charge).<br>The runner brought the burger and said he would be right back with the broccoli.  He never returned.  Later when our waitress checked back with us we told her that the runner never came back with the broccoli.  She brought it to us soon after.<br>The burger was huge and the amount of broccoli that was on the side was a very big portion.<br><br>Me- A Factory Combination: Steak Diane(minus the mushrooms) &amp; Herb Crusted Salmon w/mashed potatoes which I substituted for asparagus ($1.00 charge)<br>I&#39;m used to huge portions at The Cheesecake Factory and that is what you always hear about the place but I do have to say the combination for $19.95 with 6 nuggets of Steak Diane was a bit lacking in the steak side than what I had expected, but I do have to say it was very flavorful and juicy with a few caramelized onions on top and sitting in tasty Au Jus.  The Salmon was an ok size considering it was part of a combination but would have definitely been too small if it was in a meal of its own.<br><br>All in all our experience was a good one.  Our server was attentive and had personality and patience to deal with me and my boyfriends requests, the food was very flavorful and our drinks were delivered promptly and met our expectations.  <br>Our bill came out to $49.43 so that was awesome aswell. We totaled out the card by leaving the left over cents on the tip line and left a $12 cash tip.  <br><br>It was a great topper to an awesome anniversary and I would love to go back some time, especially if I had another Gift Card ;)  LOL!

The boyfriend and I came here on a Friday night and the wait wasn&#39;t too bad, 20 minutes at most.  We requested first available and were given a table outside on the patio underneath heated lamps.  To be honest, the heated lamps didn&#39;t really help.<br><br>Our waiter was good, nothing out of the extraordinary or too bad, so very average.  He didn&#39;t bother us with a lot which was nice, and dinner went very smoothly.  <br><br>Food was good (again, everything about this dining experience was very average), however, I&#39;ve noticed lately (all) Cheesecake Factory&#39;s have been skimping out on pasta sauce and I always have to request for more.  Maybe it&#39;s just a coincidence, but this has happened the last 4 times I&#39;ve dined at CF (not particularly this location) - just saying though.
Business dinner last night. The food and service was great!! I could do without the screaming kids all over the restaurant, though.

I really want to hate cheesecake factory because of the whole chain restaurant thing, but the truth is I am yet to try a dish I don&#39;t like there.  Gosh darnit the food is just too good.<br>This location is definitely a good one and the service is really good.  They were nice enough to go out of their way to give me an all day validation card because I told them I lost mine and dreaded paying $20 for a lost ticket.  I guess the only downside to going here is the parking I hate pulling into that huge parking lot and seeing nothing but compact spots full of SUV&#39;s.  And there&#39;s this semi-awkward walk from the car to the restaurant because there&#39;s a 24 hour fitness in the same shopping center so as you&#39;re on your way to stuff your face, there are gym junkies coming right atcha subliminally reminding you what you should be doing instead.

Our God Son loves this place and therefore, we brave the experience every birthday.<br><br>Even though it is well priced, even though it is saturated with food choices, even though the service is well orchestrated  and the staff is contemporary, even though the tables are big and comfortable, I never enjoy the 15 minute wait turning into 45 minutes.  I especially don&#39;t enjoy the inevidable FOOD BLOAT that accompanies the bill.<br><br>But freakishly good Cheesecakes may be the ulitmate cause.
No matter when we go to this restaurant the food and service is consistently great! Alot of outdoor and bar seating choices keep the wait shorter. Only complaint - they don&#39;t take reservations.

Me and my wife really love this place and we usually go once a month. But last night it wasnt one of my best experiences. I order Orange Chicken with mush potatoes and the vegetables were burn and the food was cold. Plus the waitress came and gave us the check and we were still eating and keep on coming to out table until we payed. And once i payed she just took my wife plate away and she was still eating.

What do food poisoning, a horrible waiter, and crappy food all have in common?<br><br>CHEESECAKE FACTORY!!!<br><br>Now I&#39;m not actually saying that all Cheesecake Factories are bad. I&#39;ve actually been to a few that I really enjoyed. But the one in Sherman Oaks is the worst!<br><br>It began when I arrived with a group of about 8 and we had to wait 45 minutes for a table at 10pm at night. We finally sat down and when our waiter found out that two people in our party worked at a different CF he proceeded to ignore us the rest of the night (assuming that our friends would take over his duties).<br><br>When he was asked if we could get the employee discount he said he would check with his manager and let us know, but he said that it should be fine. He took our order and disappeared. Everyone&#39;s food came out at different times including a pizza that didn&#39;t arrive for almost 20 minutes past everyone else&#39;s food (which was now getting cold).<br><br>I ordered the hummus and it was horrible. Bits of raw garlic in there that gave it a pungent taste.<br><br>The waiter arrived at the very end to hand us our check and then informed us that we wouldn&#39;t be getting the discount. We figured out our bill, gave him our cards, and then waited 30 more minutes to get them back.<br><br>We signed (had to pay automatic gratuity even though the service was horrible) and got the hell out of there.<br><br>If you really love Cheesecake Factory food, then I suggest getting it to go and skip the hassle of crappy service.<br><br>Oh, and both of my roommates got food poisoning that night. Stay away from the pizza and popcorn shrimp ;).

I have always avoided this place, thinking it was just a low-end burger place with a limited menu.  But I went with a friend recently, and I was so wrong!   Now I go regularly before a movie at the Arclight.  The stuffed mushrooms, ahi, and mediterranean sandwich are so succulent.  Outstanding service every time, even when it&#39;s a full house.  Huge thumbs up.

I know why America is obese. Just look at the portions at CF. I&#39;m not complaining though. I come here because I expect to eat one meal and have enough to take home for lunch tomorrow. Whew (I&#39;m rubbing my distended belly.)<br><br>Cheesecake Factory has long been a dependable favorite. I have cravings for the sweet brown bread flecked with oat which I can only satisfy there. Today I was especially ravenous and inhaled 3 warm buttered slices. Mmmm so good.<br><br>I&#39;ve had quite a number of items from its extensive menu over my lifetime, and today I was yet again surprised by the new &#34;special menu.&#34; I thought I was going to order an oldy but goody, Cajun Jambalaya or the BBQ Chicken Salad, but the Chicken Bellagio pasta ($12.95) tempted me. Thin breaded chicken (so that it had a nice crisp when you bite it) sat atop basil pesto (redundant I know) spaghetti noodles. On top of the 2 large thin chicken patties was a sizable sheet of prosciutto with arugula leaves raining upon them all. Honestly, it was very good. It&#39;s not a difficult dish to make by any means, but it was hearty and filling, and the slight bitters complemented the salted meat and the tender chicken. I love the textures you get to experience. Mmmm. And of course, I had leftovers to enjoy the next day.<br><br>Since I felt like treating myself, I caved to a slice of cheesecake too. I was torn between the carrot cake (which I&#39;ve had and is very good) and a cheesecake of sorts (e.g. tiramisu, key lime). I came across a Carrot Cake Cheesecake... and I thought, it&#39;s perfectly meant for me! So I gave it a shot. It definitely is carrotcake swirled with cheesecake, cream cheese icing and patted down with almond slice. It was decadent. I liked it but I do think I will have to stick to one or the other going forward. <br><br>Now I am home and replete with food, and content knowing I have more of both entree and dessert just waiting for me in the fridge. Cheesecake Factory never disappoints.

Good  food!  Staff is  okay,  but needs to be more ATTENTIVE , so this restaurant can get Repeat Buisness!  Service and the hosts could  be  better.  This is where the weakness is, I will be back and see if my next visit  is better.

Good luck trying to get a table here during peak hours, you&#39;ll be waiting for an hour.  It&#39;s never a quick event, so plan accordingly.<br><br>The food is pretty good for a chain restaurant.  But the place is just too crowded and noisy for me.

My favorite thing about cheesecake factory is the basket of warm brown bread they serve for free!  The portion of the food is very generous and well worth the price.  And for dessert, I recommend the strawberry shortcake.<br><br>One drawback would be the wait time one will frequently encounter. But if you come for lunch, it should be fine.

I know. I know. This place is an average chain from Averageville. My foodie friends would scoff at the fact that Ive even been here.<br>But... I do love a good movie and when waiting for the Arclight theatre I needed some grub.<br>Ya, not impressed with the atmosphere but what did I expect?<br>I will say that the porkchops were actually very good, not overcooked and juicy,<br>The only entertaining factors: an ob-ho-noxious ADD bartender bounding of the walls and a gay one who told me I was pretty.<br>Aww.. shucks..

One of the better Cheesecake Factory chains I would say. As in, not a long 45 minute wait, decent service, and less than 2-3 issues with our orders. My boyfriend and I waited for about 15 minutes and scrolled through Urban Home until our buzzer went off. We we&#39;re seated outside and it was HOT. However, the outside chairs were so comfortable that we obliged and stayed, lol. Our server was chill. She wasn&#39;t overly friendly but she gave the perfect amount of attentiveness. We noticed both of our entrees were less salty than usual but we weren&#39;t complaining. Actually, this is good for our health since we like to pour hot sauce on everything. Who needs the extra salt? Not us! It could&#39;ve just been that night however if this is an issue for you, you can always just ask for salt! (Speaking of, why do they not keep salt + pepper on each table?) cmon son, this is standard. Anyway, we will be back when were suddenly craving jambalaya and a good shepherds pie without all the fuss.

I&#39;m a regular at the Cheesecake...  Which explains all those extra calories I can never burn off.<br><br>Last night, we walked in around 10:45 right on the heels of an 11pm closing time.  We did not get hassled and didn&#39;t get any weird looks.  It was almost like they were happy we were there! <br><br>I ordered the Luau salad for the first time to try it out as a light meal that late into the night.  It comes with grilled chicken breast and some won-tons(spelling??) - the won-tons have a mango glaze on them which is a little too sweet for my tooth.<br><br>Lastly, I tried their new Hershey&#39;s cheesecake.  Very chocolatey and very sweet - but very good!

I just wanted to say I have been other here a few times and, unlike other reviewers, had a great experience. My boyfriend and I were seated in a cozy private nook last time, and our waiters have always been very polite, extremely attentive and courteous. Didn&#39;t bother us too much, and checked-in just enough. We usually come when it&#39;s not too busy though, so perhaps that is the secret to having a good experience. Last time we went on a Monday.<br><br>I gotta say though, our Avocado Spring Rolls and Chocolate Sundae Cheesecake dessert were good, but my Santa Fe Salad was bleh. I have had good salads there before though and shall try again.

Great atmosphere always fast good service the food is pretty good the portions are very large and not cheap. Great for big groups and party&#39;s  full bar and Tvs amazing cheesecake and every flavor you could think of then some!!!

No reservations.<br><br>That&#39;s fine. Our party of 8 got there at 7 pm. They promised they&#39;d seat us as soon as possible. Lies. Instead of putting adjacent tables on hold when they cleared up, they kept seating smaller parties ahead of us. (Desperate, money-hungry liars!) 9:55 pm we were still waiting out in the cold. We finally left, but of course every other restaurant was closed so we just went back home and ate old cheese and condiments.<br><br>Hate you guys.

i should start by saying that I don&#39;t like chains and I don&#39;t like malls, okay, I hate malls, but I do like food. Nothing is worse than going to a movie and not having anything to eat nearby.<br><br>So when I find myself in this neighborhood and going to what is now the Arclight, I often duck into the bar at The Cheesecake Factory for a quick drink and a snack. <br><br>It would take an act of god for me to be here having dinner in all seriousness but the bar is fantastic. First, the people who work here are really nice. I usually sit at the bar but even at the tables, the service is great. The bartenders give you the full restaurant treatment.<br><br>Second, they have a decent beer selection complete with chilled glasses. The martinis are excellent too and reasonably priced. <br><br>Third, there&#39;s something for everyone or the bar menu. The Roadside Sliders and the Avocado Eggrolls are my go-to items but everything I&#39;ve had is tasty. But most importantly, apps come out fast and are consistently good. <br><br>In and out --a beer or a cocktail and a few apps-- in as little as 15 minutes. Longer if I have time to chill. Ahhhhh.

Poor customer service!!! We love cheesecake factory, but won&#39;t go back to this location! !! 3 of our plates came, we finished our meal and we asked waitress  what happened to  the 4th dish, she went to check on it after 20 min came with my daughters plate saying that  they were  busy and green beans take a long time to cook, we asked for manager and she wasn&#39;t any better, attitude  sucked!! She said she would comped her dish then when we got the bill they charged us for the  green beans! !

Food is delicious but disappointed in customer service. Tonight while celebrating my mother&#39;s birthday with 5 others the waiters collided next to our table and dropped trays of drinks all over the floor, wetting 2 of our guests. Wet and broken glass went on the table also. They offered us towels to clean up with, told us to bring back dry cleaning bills for reimbursement and 2 free desserts!  Our guests live 40+ miles away! Wet,sticky and disappointed with this offer, we had to request to speak with another higher manager before our meals were appropriately compensated. Didn&#39;t complete celebration plans as the guests were too uncomfortable to continue the plans for the evening.  When the manager came she said she saw everything when it happened! So why was the burden of proof on the guests and the sleazy compensation then offered? Just do the right thing the first time maybe we will return, but not now. Shouldn&#39;t have to do this!!

The cheesecake factory is really turned into a baseline franchise restaurant. When before it was theme based and added something special to the visit. I guess now that there are so many of them, it seems to have something lacking. <br><br>Don&#39;t get me wrong, the portions are good and the food remains decent but maybe it&#39;s the prices. $7 for a piece of cheesecake is getting to be a little high. (and I&#39;m not one to look at cost when it comes to that) but come on, with the economy getting worse you would think they would avoid adding cost. But they don&#39;t, and as long as you will pay it, they will charge it. Much like sporting events!!<br><br>Jeez, where dd I go with this review?? Just go, eat, have some cake and you&#39;ll like it. It&#39;s great for date night and couples nights out!

The best dish here is the &#34;Cajun Chicken Littles&#34;. I luv this dish with the succelent mashed potatoes and vegetables, yummy! My favorite cheesecake is....... I just can&#39;t pick one. The Orange Chicken is great too but a little too sweet for my taste. This is one of my beloved restaurants in Sherman Oaks!

This kind of restaurant for me is personally one I wouldn&#39;t normally choose, but me and a friend went to this on in Sherman Oaks about a week ago. The food was pretty awesome. What really made this experience great was the girl who was our server. Her name was Cara, or Kara...  My friend had some Portabella Mushroom Burger that they dont have on the menu anymore, but we asked Kara and she went to check in the kitchen if they still had the ingredients to make it, and they whipped it up for him. She was so incredibly nice and accommodating and just a really genuine person. We weren&#39;t sure if we were going to be having dessert, we asked some questions, she was happy to answer them, then we didn&#39;t even get any, she was great about it. Honestly this girl really made the entire experience exceptional.

I stopped by two weeks ago for a business lunch.  The food and service was very good, however the temperature was very low, It will have been more comfortable if the room was at a nicer temperature.  Yes will come here again.

Although I&#39;m not a big fan of franchise restaurants with menus the size of the holy bible, but surprisingly the food was very good. The service was better. Our server Jeff was very pleasant and caring, he was very knowledgeable of the menu and very efficient. The cheesecakes were awesome

They have great service and always very courteous. I highly recommend the gumbo it is very yummy. I go here often once your done eating they have a few great stores you can shop or go catch a movie. Enjoy!

I&#39;m trying to be objective here as I dislike chains.  But seriously, $16.95 for mediocre chicken pasta?  And the chicken wasn&#39;t even all white meat and to top it off, I didn&#39;t know it was going to be fried!  Oh, and not to mention there was very little of it (probably about 6 oz in comparison to the 3 pounds of pasta they served up).<br><br>I ordered the garlic noodles and there was NO garlic flavor to be found in the spaghettini which unfortunately, they gave me spaghetti.  Arrgh!  The asparagus and shitake mushrooms were okay in it.  <br><br>There is one appetizer I do like which is the avocado eggrolls.  Unfortunately, this CF didn&#39;t deep fry them enough so the wrapper was a bit on the raw side.  Ick.  <br><br>The Steakhouse salad (poorly named as it has no steak- but we knew this when we ordered it) was actually really good.  I would call it more of a caprese salad with extra lettuce (it reminded me a bit of how Casa Bianca in Eagle Rock serves theirs).  It was way garlic-y (good thing since my garlic noodles turned out to be ungarlicy!).<br><br>Someone please tell me what their CF favorites are because I&#39;m knocking the garlic noodles down.  Way down into the  &#34;best not go there again&#34; file.  Although, no, I pray I never have to go to a CF again.  Yes, that&#39;s it!
Again these young immature unreliable hostess don&#39;t know know how to organize the the seating. And what happened to manners with this new generation?

I used to freaking LOVE the Cheesecake Factory.  Then it happened one horrible day: they got rid of the veggie burger.  Not only was the veggie burger one of the best in LA, it was also purple from beets and served with fries and bomb special sauce.  Unfortunately their vegetarian options are somewhat limited now that they&#39;ve done away with my precious.<br><br>I&#39;ll still come here if I want amazing cheesecake or want too large portions and overpriced martinis.  Yes, their brown bread is good.  The decor is kind of McMansion chic and it is at the Galleria which I try to avoid now that I live 3 minutes away from the Arclight Hollywood.<br><br>BRING BACK THE VEGGIE BURGER AND I WILL INSTANTLY BUMP TCF TO 5 STARS!!!

Went here late at night with the boyfriend with a hankering for some good Ahi tuna ever since visiting the Elephant Bar with my sister yesterday in Burbank. So this is what we ordered Ahi carpaccio ( thin slivers of raw tuna; with sesame dipping sauce and some light amounts over sauce drizzled over it) For 12.00 you would expect a few thicker slices but eh...good things don&#39;t happen to everyone. The clam chowder was pretty good for being this late at night. We decided to share the Bistro shrimp pasta and at the moment we are waiting for it as I type on my Droid 2 phone. Overall the atmosphere is typical of all Cheesecake factories in this area. By the way we ate at this particular cheesecake fact restaurant due to the amount of reviews and star amounts. Happy eating!  BTW the pasta arrived as I finished this review! First bite was heaveeeen!
It&#39;s usually pretty busy whenever I come here.  It&#39;s a chain so they are all pretty much the same.  The service is fine.  The cheesecake is great.  The food is decent.

A group showed up at 12:30 for lunch. Got a buzzer then looked in bar where seats were available. Mgr told us we couldn&#39;t sit there. Had to wait 45 minutes. Waited a bit - still not seated so asked Mgr again, said no. So she let 8 people walk out. Been coming here 3x week for almost 10 years. Food &amp; management leave quite a bit to be desired! Not going back. Other places want our business.

I think their like seeing people staying outside.They had empty table but people are waiting ! We were there last Sunday July 27 and it was not good.Too much waiting and the service was not nice enough. The only reason we choose this restaurant were we knew the menu and we want to have all the friend nice time together but instead we just talked about why she is slow and how she forgot everything, even the coffee were cold!

terrible service!! do not go on busy days like Friday dinner. It is ridiculously crowded. Took us 1 hour to be seated, we had to wait standing near the front elbow to elbow with others. waiter was horrible, never came to check us or refill our drinks. the manager was great, only reason we stayed. Food took an hour, was yummy but not worth the wait. Do not go, opt for torito grill or nearby restaurants instead.

So yea yea the cheesecake factory is known for the long gruleing one hour wait but in the end the food isnt that good. They have a great selection of foods, from burgers to shrimp, they have everything but <br>a) Huuugee portions and we people in america need to learn to have smaller portions and b) the food has no taste. It&#39;s just a  bunch of ingredients mixed together for the heck of it.<br>The only thing that is good in this place is the warm bread basket , and the cheesecakes.. So for me its not worth waiting this long wait for tasteless food!!

Located inside of the Sherman Oaks Galleria, nice for family dinners and outings. Always loved Cheesecake Factory&#39;s mashed potatoes! Yum to perfection. I ordered the combination dish of steak and chicken, just the right amount of portions. Service is attentive and friendly. <br><br>I went here on a Saturday night and the wait was approximately 40 minutes so we went down to the Townhouse Kitchen &amp; Bar (couple stores down) to grab a few drinks while waiting for the beeper to go off. This way you can make good use of dead time.

Love the bread!<br><br>As much as I try to resist, the fresh pumpernickel &amp; sourdough bread call out my name. Followed by a cool refreshing passion iced tea. <br><br>The menu has a great variety of food an the prices are an average of $10-$20 per plate. <br><br>You can&#39;t visit the Cheesecake Factory without trying their famous CHEESECAKE! So many to choose from &amp; slices are big enough for two.<br><br>The restaurant can be very busy on Friday &amp; Saturday nights so be prepared to wait an hour. Staff is usually very friendly.<br><br>Thanks &amp; ENJOY!
Food at cheesecake is always great, the staff is usually very friendly and the bread yummy!  Plus the portion size wow. but sometimes there is a long wait.

I must say, the worst part about eating at the Cheesecake Factory (any location), is figuring out what to order. The menu is huge and the advertisements abundant. I&#39;m not sure if I should order the Navajo sandwich or a diamond watch!<br><br>In any event, I&#39;ve never had a bad meal here. The dinner bread they serve is delicious and usually steaming hot when it arrives to your table. The avocado egg rolls are by far the standard I compare all other restaurants too. <br><br>I&#39;ve had many entrees from the menu, but the the Chicken &amp; Biscuits has to be my favorite by far. The chicken is tender and moist while the biscuits are fluffy. However, the magic really happens when they dump gravy over the entire dish! Now we&#39;re talkin! <br><br>Now to the dessert...the item that gives this restaurant its name. The cheesecake here is so creamy and rich that you find yourself planning the rest of your meal around having room for dessert. Although most of the time, my eyes are bigger than my stomach and I end up taking the cheesecake to go -- makes an excellent breakfast too FYI.
they don&#39;t take dinner reservations!!! i just called on 12/29/14 and they are walk in only!!!
I have always had a good experience at this restaurant.  The last time I went the service was prompt and friendly and the food was very good.

My family loves going here for birthday/anniversary events. So I&#39;ve been here many times. The food quality is always great. Large portions. Service is great. If there are any delays we always get free desert. The only problem is that this place doesn&#39;t accept reservations.

&#34;Yay! I&#39;m a fan.&#34;  No joke.  <br><br>When I have the money I love going here.  I haven&#39;t been here for a while, but when I do go in, it&#39;s like I never left.  Good date place before or after the Arclight.

I really like The Cheesecake Factory. They have an extensive menu, so there is something there for everyone. This sometimes makes it hard to decide what you want to eat! I really like the Chipotle Chicken Pasta and of course love the cheesecakes! I LOVE cheesecake =) I&#39;ve tried a few appetizers from here and they are just OK. I&#39;m not a fan of the spinach and cheese dip (In my opinion CPK has a much better one). <br>On the weekends its packed! The good thing about this location is that there are shops you can browse in to kill time. <br>Remember to get your parking ticket validated.

Love Cheesecake Factory. Its foods are elegant, well priced, huge, and delicious. This one is no different. It&#39;s in a great spot in an outdoor mall in Sherman Oaks. Great date place.<br><br>Their burgers are excellent, the Renee&#39;s Special is a lotta different food for a little $, their steaks, pastas, salads, soups are all well done.<br><br>The cheesecake slices are from the heavens. I can really only eat a bite (not much of a sweet tooth), but it&#39;s quality stuff and can probably get you some good payback from your date. Their drinks are excellent and their strawberry lemonade is my personal favorite.

This place is great when you want to go to the restaurant and when you don&#39;t really know what to eat. The selection is vast and there&#39;s basically something for everyone. Its good, staff is friendly and pro. The only downside is that this place is most of the time full so you&#39;ll have to wait a bit to get your order.

Have been here probably at least 100 times and always had great experience. Today however, walked in and run into the hostess that was extremely rude. When I told her how rude she was, she actually got more rude. The food was great as usual.
Long wait to be seated at 830pm on Saturday night to be expected. Great service. Great food once inside. Crusted chicken parmesan and the Chinese chicken salad are my faves!
One of my favorite Cheesecake Factories ever. Outstanding food quality and amazing service. Never disappoints!

The Cheesecake Factory is the best place to get an amazing meal and awesome service. When we got here the wait time was only about 2 minutes! Then we sat down, the waitress was fast and gave us our drinks and bread in no time! The food was incredible, the proportion was ginormous, and was very reasonably priced! It was my dads birthday so they sang a fun and energizing birthday song with the whole crowd getting in! The dessert was great and simple! Overall the best place to get an amazing meal after a movie!!

This is the closest Cheesecake Factory to my house.  While it&#39;s not my favorite location, it&#39;s good.  I have had some bad experiences, but everyone is allowed an off day.<br><br>The food is consistently good like the other locations.  The other awesome thing about this locale--FREE PARKING w/ validation.  I don&#39;t know of any other location around here that offers that and I really hate paying for parking!
Food was standard. Service was okay. I&#39;d return, but not in a rush.

It&#39;s sad that I have to say that this place has some of the most tastiest food that is at the same time some of the most unhealthily food EVER! <br><br>The service is nice, I&#39;ve been here a couple times and caught a nice waiter or two which always seemed like happy-go-lucky people which made my experience all the more better.<br><br>The food tastes great, it really does. A lot of rich and decadent flavors that really make you want to go back to this place again. However I can&#39;t go back there after finding out a single meal from their menu consists of more calories then a humans necessary daily intake.

I ordered the chipotle chicken pasta and was really impressed. The service was great and the manager even stopped by to see how things were. Everyone else in my. Party loved their meals and the leftovers were just as good.

I might be a bit biased on this one because i&#39;m a regular here; but that alone should say plenty shouldn&#39;t it? The food is always up to par and the drinks, well, they&#39;re usually A-ok. I always sit at the bar, just because I feel like that&#39;s where I get the best service. If you&#39;re going to try the red velvet cheesecake, however, i&#39;d recommend that you skip it - i&#39;ve had better elsewhere.

Have been to many cheesecake factories but this one definitely takes the cake. Great service all the time. I ordered a steak cooked medium... And it came well done (first time that&#39;s every happened) and they insisted on bringing me an entirely new steak grilled to perfection with a free dessert on top of that. Service that actually cares about their clientele is rare in LA.

Love Cheesecake Factory but I&#39;m giving them 1 star because of the horrible service. If you get a waiter by the name of Christian ask to be seated somewhere else. He absolutely had no manners and was totally rude!!  This guy ruined my lunch and will not be returning here. He&#39;s a total EFFIN douch!!!

It&#39;s hard not to come here when there&#39;s a group of people.  Everyone gets what they want and there&#39;s rarely any issues with the food.<br><br>Staples:<br>Jamaican black pepper shrink (w/extra mango salsa)<br>Avocado egg rolls<br>Lettuce wraps<br>Red velvet cheesecake<br><br>Tonight was a change from the norm.  Orange chicken and sesame chicken.  Not bad at all.<br><br>Great service in Sherman Oaks.<br> <br>Beverly Hills seems to take twice as long for service, but food is consistently good.
Great service. Great for large groups &amp; first dates! Plus you can go to a movie after :)

I like Cheesecake Factory.  Have you ever tried the BUFFALO BLASTS?  If you haven&#39;t, stop wasting your time ordering the cream cheese wontons or the macaroni balls, and try a Buffalo blast.   We all know the Chinese Chicken Salad here is unbeatable.  I&#39;ve ordered their Orange Chicken, Bang-bang chicken and shrimp, steak, fettucine alfredo, and all of them have proved to be great choices.   It&#39;s not the best restaurant in California, but they have great dishes overall.

Never has a restaurant proven the point more succinctly that we as Americans eat TOO DAMN MUCH than The Cheesecake Factory. Don&#39;t get me wrong, I love me some CF, but Good Lawd, these plates are HUUUGE. <br><br>Even on my hungriest day I&#39;ve never been able to finish one and since I am not a fan of leftovers, I wish they offered half sizes as it seems like such a waste and people are starving in...Canoga Park.<br><br>With that said, order the FULL appetizer sized ORDER of Mac n Cheese BALLS with Marinara dipping sauce. My oh my oh my, can you say guilty pleasure. Their Philly Cheesesteak (Nowhere near authentic) is tasty along with most of their gynormous salads. Then there is the namesake. And that cheesecake does not disappoint. Almost makes me with I had a bigger sweet toof.<br><br>As far as this location goes, it&#39;s just like any other CF I&#39;ve been to. Corporate and the same meal every time, which sometimes is a nice backup plan for this lil foodie girl as you can only subject yourself to so many Iffy places in a week&#39;s time.

I usually come here for dinner but wind up drunk. Their food is always yummy. Lately I&#39;ve been getting the chicken Caesar. I used to get the Louisiana chicken pasta but due to my carb addiction I must stay away now. Both are really good choices though, very large portions.<br><br>Their drinks are hella strong. The Mai tais are deadly strong for some reason. I love their long islands better. If only their drinks were cheaper but you get what you pay for.<br><br>It can get crowded so just be patient. Maybe check out the cheesecakes as you wait for your thingy to glow/buzz. The fresh strawberry cheesecake is my favorite. The pumpkin cheesecake is also really good. I love carrot cake but their carrot cake cheesecake isn&#39;t too great.

Any time I could sneak away from work for a long lunch, I&#39;d come here.  The reason for the long lunch was the wait at this location.  Woo it&#39;s something else all right!  Food is good though, and the servers are super nice.<br><br>P.S.  If you can, ask you friend to get there before you and put your name in!

I haven&#39;t been to a Cheesecake Factory in a while, so my husband and I decided to eat there with some friends because we can walk there from our home.<br><br>Well, now I remembered why I haven&#39;t eaten there in a while..long wait for a table.  We got there at 6:30 and waited there for about 45 minutes.  Once, we sat down, we didn&#39;t see a waiter for about 5 minutes.  That&#39;s okay though because it takes 10 minutes to go through their menu.  It&#39;s like a book.<br><br>We all know the food is just okay and you&#39;ll have leftovers to take home for lunch.  The Vanilla Bean cheesecake was absolutely delicious, but I couldn&#39;t finish that either.<br><br>It&#39;s a great place to eat with friends and you don&#39;t want to spend much money.  If you&#39;re a big eater and I noticed several of them, then you&#39;ll be in heaven.<br><br>Be ready to wait for a table unless you get there really early.

Every other Cheesecake Factory I&#39;ve been to would probably get a 3-4 star review.<br><br>My visit to this location wasn&#39;t very good. We went there on a Sunday afternoon. There was food in my seat when I sat down (obvious enough that i can&#39;t believe the person who seated us didn&#39;t see it). I ordered pasta marinara and it was disgusting (worlds easiest dish?). It took a billion years to get our bill. My husbands food was pretty good but that&#39;s about it. I love Cheescake Factory in general but not this location.

This particular Cheesecake Factory has the best service amongst the rest. If you are ever in the area stop by. If you&#39;ve never been to Cheesecake Factory, make sure to order the firecracker salmon rolls as appetizer. Their orange chicken entrée plate is also amazing.

If you were a foreigner, you&#39;d never know Cheesecake Factory was a chain restaurant. <br><br>The wait is ridiculous..I&#39;ve waited like an hour and a half before I got to sit down. And then the food takes forevuhhhh. but it just might be worth it.<br><br>The bread here is unbeatable. Its whole wheat with grains. Its served WARM and its really good. Its very similar to the bread they serve at Outback Steakhouse. <br><br>Appetizer you must get is the tuna roll. Its 12 bucks but its flavored sooooooooooooooooooo well. I died.<br><br>The chinese chicken salad is reallllyyyyy good too. Very impressive. But I&#39;ve had some less impressive things here, which I think is a problem. The restaurant seems to not specialize in anything, so some dishes just plain suck.<br><br>But the cheesecake does not. Fatty-friendly.

Horrible Corporate Food. Had to wait so long at the table for service. the server was busy with  &#39; a large party&#39; complainted to the manager Steve, but he did nothing. he didn&#39;t even refill our empty drinks. just let us wait. Food came and the order was wrong

The food&#39;s fine - nothing spectacular. But tasty. The only thing I dislike is that the restaurant&#39;s patrons are PIGS. Real pigs. Somewhat, they feel like leaving a gigantic mess behind them and they dirty the bathrooms are well. I guess this is acceptable wherever they&#39;re from. Not cool, people. Let&#39;s respect our surroundings. Really.<br><br>Watch out, Cheesecake Factory, if you continue letting in dirty people in your joint, El Torito and PF Changs will take all your clientele.

The food at Cheesecake is just remarkable. There service can&#39;t be matched!, I mean one time we went and our table was late so the manager came up and escorted us to our table and gave us free appetizers!<br><br>Now that the nutritional information is out about Cheesecake, it is shocking to me how fattening their dishes are. BUT IS THAT GOING TO STOP ME? Never. I will not eat for a week just to I can have dinner there!<br><br>recommended dishes!<br>. pasta da vinci-pasta in wine sauce, with mushrooms! yum<br>.lousiana pasta chicken-crusted chicken breasts with pasta and peppers<br>.buffalo blasts!-chicken pieces with cheese, hot sauce!<br>.avocado egg rolls!

Only been a few times, but CF always treats us right. <br><br>I fully recommend coming here for fun cocktail drinks (or beers) and 3 appetizers to share between 2 people, and a honkin&#39; slice of cheesecake to follow. <br><br>Their main dishes are great but have tremendous portions, so if you&#39;re going to see a movie immediately following, apps are the way to go - no takehome boxes. Very nice waitstaff too.<br><br>Also their outdoor seating is great, the heatlamps are perfect and the glass walls help to keep it quiet.

I live around the corner, so I&#39;ve been here a few times. The service and food has always been great, except the hostesses always seem disinterested. I have to mention though - Alex D was our server, and he was wonderful!!

Another great experience. I love this location. The front desk experience is just getting better every time. They used to put these young girls at the counter with a bad attitude, however this location has changed a lot. The service is always nice, never a long wait (except holidays). I had another wonderful brunch this mother&#39;s day. I just can&#39;t stay away from their eggs benedict and waffles. The breakfast menu is absolutely amazing, but the lunch is equally great. If you are around please try a godiva or tuxedo chocolate cake. Congrats on the new skinnylicius menu by the way, for those of us who can&#39;t eat half a horse.
I come here twice a week for the sear tuna steak and Broccoli  good stuff . Like the service and the green ice tea.

Anticipate the long lines and they do not take reservations over the phone unless you are a regular with a black card. I was lucky enough to have a friend that did this for my party of 20  once .   but i was here the other night just left the arclight movie theater upstairs and walked into a 1 hr wait needless to say i did not wait.

This place has gone to hell recently. I have been experiencing worse and worse service and worse and worse food everyday. Today must be my last time to come to this place. Today&#39;s story started with my waiter bringing regular mojito when I ordered for passion fruit mojito. When I said that I asked for passion fruit mojito, he said, &#34;This is passion fruit mojito&#34;. Really??? The passion fruit mojito has a different color than regular mojito, for God&#39;s sake. Then, my appetizer came exactly at the same time as my entree and the pasta in my entree was half cooked. When I asked the waiter to get the manager, he didn&#39;t. I asked another waiter to get the manager. After around 20 minutes, the waiter came. When I told him the issue, he didn&#39;t even say sorry a single time and simply took my appetizer and mojito away. And the best of all...they charge for all of these. Well, this is the last time they got my momey...<br>It used to be a nice place, Alas...I will miss it.

Yummy, Good company, good food and good service.  This place is just a nice place to hangout.  I had avocado eggroll appetizer things, yum.<br><br>Went back and got like 6 pieces of cheesecake, all different kinds for only 3 people, hah, anyway, they all rocked.<br><br>Yum.

You know the deal... you&#39;ve read plenty of reviews about CF.<br><br>I&#39;ve been to multiple locations. I like this one because of its outdoor seating in the galleria courtyard. <br><br>LOVE the Sauvignon Blanc from New Zealand. For ~8 dollars a glass, just go for the bottle ($30)

***How CAN you screw up bread and a salad, really?***<br><br>The first round of bread was so bad, the table was completely covered with crumbles, which wouldn&#39;t happen if you don&#39;t over re-bake the bread. Evidently in an attempt to re-heat it and make it seem as if it just came fresh out of the oven, they ended up toasting the bread too much. That&#39;s bad for a first. But when you order a 2nd round of bread and get the same, you realize someone doesn&#39;t feel like working tonight!<br><br>Oh, and the salad. I get it: this is not supposed to be high cuisine. Cheesecake Factory is like any other average restaurant chain. But for heaven&#39;s sake, I&#39;m ordering a salad. You don&#39;t even have to cook it. Just make sure the ingredients are fresh, because that&#39;s the whole point of salad: light and fresh. I ordered the tuna tataki salad with avocado, tomatoes and wasabi. Unlike other Cheesecake Factories where I&#39;ve had it and licked my fingers afterwards, the salad in this particular restaurant was NOT fresh at all.<br><br>They got the cheesecake (seasonal Pumpkin) right, though. But then again, they better if their name is The Cheesecake Factory!<br><br>Granted, I should know better than to try and have dinner an hour before closing time. But in fair theory, since they don&#39;t lower their prices an hour to closing, the service and quality shouldn&#39;t vary either!

I&#39;m up and down on this CF. Location is convenient for me when attending meetings, but it&#39;s a little cookie-cutter. Always crowded, always noisy but always good food. It&#39;s a give and take.<br><br>As with all CF&#39;s, food is good, portions are large and cheesecakes are yummy.
Everything I have ever had here tastes great. The atmosphere is detailed and complete. I have never been disappointed with this place in the slightest bit. try the samosas or the avocado eggrolls.

Cheesecake factory is up and down. I guess it all boils down to your server. There are some places where you don&#39;t really need to care for the waiter, like Claim Jumper. Why? I don&#39;t know. But this place, you need to depend on your waiter because of the bread. You need them to fill up your bread when it is depleted and your energy source has vanished in the span of 3 seconds. The pastas are okay, but the orange chicken is great. It is quite Americanized but who cares? It tastes good. <br><br>I give it a three star because no matter how bad the food was, you know that the cheesecake will always be there to make you feel better.

The long wait is annoying, particularly when there&#39;s 15 people standing in their lobby and another 15 standing right outside.  The best part is the yummy yummy bread and butter. After that, it doesn&#39;t get any better for me. <br><br>Our waitress was nice and professional. The variety of food was endless. However, it took a long time for it to arrive. In the middle of dinner, a new waitress came and let us know that she would be our waitress for the rest of the night. She seemed pretty busy and we did not see her much. She only refilled our drinks when we were already almost done with the food. Then when we were about to pay, she brought us one bill for three people. We specifically asked the first waitress to separate the orders into three different bills. We explained this to the 2nd waitress and she just rolled her eyes. All of us apologized to her for the inconvenience and acknowledged that it wasn&#39;t her fault, but she just interrupted us with &#34;Are you all paying with diferent credit cards then?&#34; Very unprofessional and rude. <br><br>This was my first visit to the restaurant and because the food didn&#39;t stand out and especially because of the service we received, I don&#39;t think I would come back.

I mean honestly, what&#39;s not to like. They have a huge menu, tons of drinks at the full bar and a WIDE array of cheesecake. Came here for my boyfriend&#39;s friend&#39;s birthday and they have everything down streamlined. The service and food is always good. The portions are HUGE. <br><br>And the Arclight is close by.<br><br>What more could you want? (Well, I wish there was still a Tower Records in there)
Appetizers are fine, nothing spectacular.  When nothing else is open on the Holidays it&#39;s easy enough to find a seat but other than that I would avoid.
Good food but every other visit we bump into a rude CC employee... so with so many other choices CC will not be missed.

i admit, I haven&#39;t been to a Cheesecake Factory in a long time. I always really liked the food, and I knew there was usually a solid wait for a table, but when we finally went to this location last week (our first time at this location) it was to order carry out. So I didn&#39;t anticipate that from the time we pulled into the garage to the time we pulled back out with our order, a full hour might pass. Granted, the Galleria is so oddly laid out that it took several minutes to get from our parking space to the restaurant. But the wait inside was needlessly long, too. We finally got home with our food, most of which was good, but we ordered one of the beef dip sandwiches and requested the horseradish sauce on the side. we got that. and nothing else. they gave us a plain beef sandwich with no cheese, onions, OR DIP! It&#39;s a beef DIP sandwich. In what world does asking for one condiment on the side equal leave every single thing off? We&#39;re lucky we got beef and not just a plain roll, I guess. And the beef was so fatty and grisly I couldn&#39;t even chew half of it. What a disappointment. We&#39;ll stick to just getting cheesecake here and go elsewhere for meals.

2 stars is generous.<br><br>I had lunch with one of my friends there and wow talk about the snobby Hollywood cliches!<br><br>One of the servers was sporting his sunglasses AND eating and drinking as he was serving food! I couldn&#39;t believe my eyes. He had a mouth full of food, chewing obnoxiously as he was setting plates down in front of customers. If you ask me, I would NEVER allow my employees to &#34;sport sunglasses&#34; in the patio area of a restaurant. If he had sensitive eyes...he should have been working INSIDE!<br><br>Not to mention MY server...we were one of the first customers on the patio for lunch (we stood outside the doors waiting for them to open mind you) and my half salad and small cup of soup took forever! And because I have eyes and ears everywhere...I overheard the server tell one of her other customers...&#34;Your Arnold Palmer is coming out right now.&#34; 3 times! Let me translate for those of you who have never been a food server...<br><br>&#34;Holy shit, I totally forgot your stupid lemonade/iced tea! I&#39;ll bring it out in the next few rounds.&#34;<br><br>I&#39;m not even a fan of this place, but we are all entitled to mistakes sometimes...

My last reviews were because I went on crowded nights and the service just is not as great! Neither is the wait. This time I went on a Sunday evening, my birthday no less.<br><br>Our party of four was seated immediately. Our server was friendly and attentive and I couldn&#39;t have asked for more.<br><br>I ordered the Firecracker Salmon Rolls. ABSOLUTELY AMAZING. <br><br>My drink could have been refilled a little quicker, but I wasn&#39;t dying or anything.<br><br>Strawberry Shortcake with Candles and singing? Priceless. <br><br>Couldn&#39;t have asked for more.

It&#39;s worth driving to Sherman Oaks for good Cheesecake Factory food. By far my favorite Cheesecake establishment, and it&#39;s all to do with the food. I don&#39;t know who the head chef is here, but they have a really great pallet. My favorite delectable items are the lentil soup and Seared Tuna Tataki Salad. The raw fish is always fresh and has just the right amount of sear to it. Excellent!<br><br>Admittedly the service has room to improve - the quality of the people are great. This location just tends to get SUPER BUSY. Be prepared to pay extra at the parking structure. Still worth the wait in my opinion because the food is that much better. If I&#39;m going to drop $16 at any Cheesecake Factory for my favorite dish, I&#39;d rather spend my money here for the quality.

One of my favorite chain places! Most of the menu items are quite tasty and the cheesecakes are incredible. The portions are rather large too... always a full feeling afterward =)<br><br>Some of my favorites are the angel hair pasta with shrimp, combination of steak and chicken/salmon, or the shepherd&#39;s pie. The main downside is that there are SO many calories in each entree... so it&#39;s not a place I can visit too often.

Well, aside from THAT bread they put down that is so good and fresh, there really isn&#39;t anything I couldn&#39;t recommend over the years that I have tasted.  <br><br>So many things to choose from. Service is usually decent - the last server we had was beyond excellent. The kitchen screwed up the timing of our order and the salad came after the entree - they took the entree back and made a new one.  The last visit I had Chicken Enchiladas and they were very tasty. Portions of everything are always enough to take home. If you didn&#39;t you would never have room for cheesecake!

I took my little cousins and girlfriend to cheesecake factory Sunday brunch.  <br>I had gone before and loved it. <br>This time I was a little annoyed at first <br>The hostess and host couldn&#39;t decide where to seat us, and the place had just opened and was empty. After a few minutes they decided. Thankfully !!!<br>Then they told my girl that they could make her specialty coffee drink. Always a disappointment , and I think the bartender was probably just too lazy. <br>After that our server brought our drinks and took our order. The food came in three installments , instead of , all at once , so we had to watch some of out food get cold. The food was delicious though, so most was forgiven. And the server was really nice.

So here we go, order five waters and a bottle of wine. The water comes and one glass has filth inside and we had to ask the server take it back. Order appetizers and all comes as ordered. The entrees comes out and my meatloaf was a little black on the edges and the vegetables ice cold. My daughter&#39;s salad was supposed to be Falafel salad and turned out to be ice cold fried crab mixture balls so we sent that back to be remade. So we ask for the two salads we had ordered to be boxed and the server asked if we wanted the meatloaf boxed and we said no. Out comes two bags one with one salad and the other with the meatloaf. Okay, dessert should be a no brainier. Order three cheesecakes and out comes two of the three we ordered and third was wrong.

Me and some friends when to the Apple Store at the grove to purchase an Apple Watch so when we got finished we decide to go to the cheesecake factory at the grove went inside the hostesses were very inattentive she was drinking a soda at the hostess stand so we decide to go to the bar because the restaurant was full we decided also to have dinner there at the bottom found the table we order drinks when my drink I ordered attend the raise seven I was drinking it out of a straw and then I was talking and I started feeling around the rim of the glass and it was broken we call the server over he said the manager over and I told him that you know if she should check with the bartender because us direct result of the bartender using the glass to  scoop ice she said no no no no no it was not that so in the meantime we had already ordered our dinner my friend had ordered a salad garlic ranch on it so while she was there talking to is the waiter came over and he had huge salad vinaigrette this was after he had sent it back and said he want to ranch I while we waited again the waiter came back with his salad againafter dinner was served and said here&#39;s your salad vinaigrette still up we decided that will just settle for he asked me if I want another drink in as a guest but<br>not in real glass they plastic glasses for water and ice it asked if I could have my drink and a plastic Glass he never brought me another drink the salad friend never got a chance to read a salad because dinner was served the food was all wrong and what we decide to leave the waiter came over and was trying to talk to us and my friend said would you just go away  the waiter he got in his face and said what you mean I&#39;m not to be a good waiter he was very belligerent he gave us the wrong check we paid it on the way out he come rushing I&#39;m so I gave you the wrong check so you have to pay this we did let my friend went back to speak to another manager she said there was nothing she could do she already took the meal off of my meal which I do need anyway it was one of the worst times that I spent at a restaurant and spent quite a bit of money still $70 for the bill and all they take took off with my got a drink and we got a chance to eat nobody ever gave me any type of satisfaction so I am noticed at these upscale restaurants us at the mall at the grove especially at the cheesecake factory which supposedly have a good reputation they really didn&#39;t care about the satisfaction of me and my guest very disappointed
